description:
If you are craving a juicy burger then this is your place! There should be more reviews for this restaurant. The atmosphere is great, it's a very modern inside and there is a large amount of seating. You walk in and order at the register and then sit down. The food came out quickly and was amazing. The burgers were cooked perfect and you can taste the quality of the meat. We also got a side of sweet potato fries and these were delicious! 

Would definitely come back here for a tasty burger.
author: G G.

description:
$50 for two burgers and a glass of Rose. Eek, I'm just not so sure about that cost, especially when this is the kind of joint where you go up to order a burger, it's brought to your table and then you don't see a server again. We came in because we wanted a quick bite as we needed to head to the airport to catch a flight and had been told about this burger concept and gave it a shot. They had burger concoction suggestions for you and then you also had the option to build your own. Additionally they had salads if you chose not to get a burger. My boyfriend order their classic burger with french fries and I built my own. Being that it was my first time here, I started throwing out things I wanted; chose the veggie burger with lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions and got sweet potatoes on the side. Again, with an added glass of Rose this all came to $50. I was pretty shocked to hear the total to be honest. We were given a number to put on our table indicating which order number we were so the people running the food knew where to go.

Just as I sat down at a table outside I realize I never told the woman what kind of bun I wanted (she also never asked.) I'm gluten free so I ran back to change my bun, which she very easily changed for me and that was an additional $1.50 (expected for the bun change but dang this is an expensive quick burger) Anyways, you could choose a variety of dipping sauces for no additional charge, we just stuck with regular ketchup and mustard and picked a whole grain mustard as well. You grab your silverware and napkins on a little counter and then go to your table. It happened to be a hot day out and I could not rest my arms down on the table it was so hot. The material of the surface of the tables was all wrong for an outside table that will be hit with any sort of sunlight. I literally took napkins to put underneath my elbows and even the heat coming from the table through the napkins was too painful I had to keep my arms down. Honestly, any baby or young child who doesn't know better would have burned themselves on these tables, they really need to be swapped for a different kind of material. It was painful and uncomfortable sitting out there especially with a chair that was so wobbly it wouldn't stay in one position.

The food took forever to come out, we actually couldn't believe how long. Eventually they came out and we scarfed them down in fear we were going to miss our flight. The burger was interesting; the vegetable patty was not a patty but more mush. It was difficult to eat and I ended up using a fork for the majority of it. The vegetable burger was made with quinoa and onions and it just wasn't molded and fell apart. The sweet potato fries were delicious. We left super full and satisfied. The food tasted fresh and there was good flavor, but it was expensive, took a long time to come out and it wasn't comfortable sitting outside.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Roam Burgers used to my favorite burger joint in SF. Unfortunately, I haven't returned for a long time. I don't know if they had made improvements, but from a certain point of time their patties began to smell. Indicating that the meat was not fresh, and it was drenched in a heavy sauce so it was difficult to distinguish the freshness of the meat. 

No complaints with the sides. The fry-fecta (russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack) were visually pleasing and simply delicious. The chocolate and Stumptown coffee shakes were satisfying as well, but the added bruléed marshmallow was completely scotched.

I don't know if I will return for another bite in the near future.
author: Andrew J.

description:
As Pearl's Deluxe Burgers is my favorite burger place in the City (and quite frankly, the world), I never bothered to try Roam. But I've given it two shots now! And I'm pretty set on saying that Roam is closer to solid than spectacular.

I originally withheld my thoughts on Roam because I wasn't a huge fan of the Pacific Blue (definitely the wrong order!) and wanted to try something less adventurous with The Classic before rendering my final verdict. The ingredients are fresh and the flavor is solid. It's a well-made product. But their burgers are just missing that extra something. I think after two turns, it's safe to make this call. They do have some good truffle parmesan fries though, I will give them that. And having gluten-free buns is the reason my girlfriend really likes this place, since she needs to have gluten-free buns.

Staff here has always been very friendly and accommodating in the two times I've been here. The one thing I can't complain about is service here.

Overall, I will definitely come back. Just not my top pick in the City.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Felt like a burger night so we gave Roam a second try. I think the best way is to order a classic burger, which was exactly what I did this time. Lesson learnt from last visit (greasy feeling). Without all the extra condiments and toppings I was hoping to taste the real flavor of the beef patty. 

Our verdict is that the patty itself is already tasty. The fact its grass fed makes the meat different. My fiancé ordered Tejana (with avocado and white corn strips). He loves the hot sauce more than ketchup. Make sure to try it. 

Great customer service. Lots of take out orders.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
Best veggie burger in SF! The patty is made of quinoa so it's full of flavor. You are able to choose a specialty burger some of which include French fries or caramelized onions (yum) OR you can choose exactly what you'd like on it. And they have a ton of options.

Don't forget to get a side of either fries or sweet potato fries.
author: Sydney G.

description:
No surprise the burgers were great. In San Francisco fashion, they post exactly where the meats come from, the cows' names, roommates and their favorite Netflix show. They make their buns with wheat watered only with Boss, Evian or Fiji water (I'm kidding, not really).

We had the Tejano and Classic Burgers. The corn chips, avocado and herb ranch provided the crunch, texture and flavor to make me recommend the Tejano burger over the Classic burger. The Classic burger wasn't anything extraordinary, just a well made burger.

The two big surprises of the dinner were the Farmers Market Salad and Zucchini onion haystack. Each ingredient in the Farmers Market Salad delivered a specific purpose like the crunch from snap peas, the body and texture of butter lettuce, the sweetness of the tangerines, richness of the avocado and the bite of the radishes. 

The zucchini are spiralized thinly and I think tossed with a light coating of flour or cornstarch before frying. It was not oily at all and seasoned well. I can eat a whole plate of the zucchini onion haystack on its own.
author: Rey L.

description:
Albeit, I was pretty hungry, the food here is pretty tasty! I ordered the Heritage - one of their speciality burgers, which has applewood smoked bacon and fontina cheese with lettuce, tomato + caramelized onions and herb mayo. Delicious! All the flavors blend perfectly together. You don't feel overly stuffed after eating the burger; right portion size and very fresh ingredients! Not too oily. I also ordered the sweet potato fries, which I probably would skip next time, and the zucchini onion haystack, which I recommend trying, it's thinly sliced zucchini with a light and crispy crunch too it. Plus you feel like you're eating somewhat healthy although fried. 

If you're willing to splurge a little more - the place is a bit pricey (~12 for a burger excluding sides) - order one of their house-made sodas. I really enjoyed the the caramelized pineapple. Tastes like sweeter carbonated water and serves as a nice drink to wash down the meat. Will come here again to try their other burgers. My cousin recommends the BBQ Burger.
author: Kristy L.

description:
Finally tried the veggie burger. It's so amazing. Sort of a creamy texture like medium rare beef or tuna tartare (if you're a meat eater). Not sure if it's mushroom or tempeh/seitan based. I had it as a chalet with watercress, Swiss, mushrooms and BBQ sauce. Yum. 

Try the seasonal veggies. Right now it's squash and cherry heirloom tomatoes. So good!
author: Tim P.

description: Pretty solid burger. I had this spot bookmarked for sometime now so was glad I had a chance to check it out during Jazz Fest. We dropped in for a late lunch at around 3pm and luckily it wasn't too crowded at that time... it was very crowded right about the time we were finished eating. My beef French & Fries burger cooked medium with truffle Parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado, & caramelized onions was delicious! I'd be curious to try their bison burger which seems to be very popular. Their milkshakes looked good as well so there will definitely be a next time.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I really enjoyed the burger and fries here, but -1 star for the service and cleanliness.

After coming to this location and the new Oakland location back to back, I much prefer the Oakland location. 

The seating arrangement here is atrocious. Everyone bumps into each other because of the poor table arrangement. I was sitting at the bar and got bumped into so many times because of the communal table in the center. Also, the employees here were obviously having a hard time getting around the restaurant while carrying everyone's food so it's probably time for a change.

Other than that, food here is definitely tasty - I highly recommend getting the heritage burger and fry-fecta!
author: Shirley H.

description: SO AMAZING. I've been wanting to try this place for years. Got the trifecta of fries and my favorite is definitely the sweet potatoes, on the unique side would be the zucchini and onion mix (which was good too!!) If i'm going to a burger spot it most likely has to be bison or elk. they had both! but with the burger i chose, it was recommended I get the bison. next time i'll get the elk. everything was perfectly made and full of flavor. The boyfriend even contemplated on ordering a second, haha. it was reallllly everything I had imagined it to be. completely more than satisfied!
author: Audrey K.

description:
Okay look--if you want a burger in this area, don't skip over Roam. We walked to the restaurant and the line was out the door, so I knew it would be good. 

I got the beef Heritage because bacon. You can't really decide on medium well and the various ranges, it's either pink or no pink. I went with no pink because I wasn't sure if they would pull it off. The burger was everything. I couldn't finish and let my sister eat the rest, but the caramelized onions were perfect! I should have got bbq sauce but used ranch as a dipping sauce instead. 

I had the regular fries while my friend got the truffle ones, which I thought were salty. I wish fries came with the burger as opposed to having to order them because they aren't a ton of fries and makes the overall meal more expensive. But the cows and other animals that died for these burgers had a good life and you can tell during the meal! I wasn't a fan of their hot sauce, but maybe that's a preference thing.
author: Brenda A.

description: Burgers so so. Shakes pretty good. Marshmallow's ? Don't know they wanted $1.14 cents. Just ask them I'm not kidding. Girl at the cash register sense of humor?? Definitely not!
author: Jason M.

description:
Hmm. Hard to really determine what is good value in SF because of the high cost of living there but for me, it wasn't worth it. Got a classic burger with cheese and avocado, order of fries and vanilla bean shake for a total of $26.

The burger was okay but just in to go bag for 10 minutes and it was soggy. The party was interesting as I am not sure what kind of beef it was. Saltier in some bites than others. Overall quality and taste not worth.

Fries nice and fresh with the more natural potato taste. A bit more dry than I'd like.

The shake was the best thing but I thought 12 oz was bigger than what I had and I clearly got the smaller of the two sizes. 

If you're thinking you will get great quality for the price, it's not what I had in mind. Wouldn't come again based on my experience. I also had to ask where my shake was and it was delayed.
author: Nolan B.

description: My friend and I decided to come to Roam burgers as he was craving a burger and he had been to their East Bay location and loved it. I ended up ordering their BBQ burger with the veggie patty and we got their fry-fecta as well. He ordered their heritage burger with the beef patty and loved it as usual. I thought my veggie burger was meh as I've had much better veggie burger patties elsewhere. I enjoyed the sweet potato fries but hated the zucchini and onion fries as they were too greasy. Tip - ask for herb mayo on the side for the sweet potato fries. Super good!
author: Mira B.

description:
We came here after perusing yelp for fries in pac heights. I was really excited when I saw that they sold gluten free buns with their burgers. So I made a game time decision and decided to split with my partner a turkey burger and fries.

We got the heritage turkey burger ( bacon, fontina,lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions, and herb mayo) on gf bread and a side of russet fries. First issue I had was that whole order came up to $18... like burger and fries and that's it. It seemed a little pricey. I also get annoyed when places charge me an extra dollar for gf bread... it isn't as special as avocado:p.

Second was that the best thing about my burger was the bacon, that's really it. Otherwise, it was pretty average. The fries was my biggest disappointment.. it was almost $4 for not very much fries and they were also mediocre. Additionally, we tried the season thai sauce and I was so glad that I didn't get it... it tasted like nothing I would want to cover my fries in.

I'm not sure if I really want to give this place another try, but the onion and zucchini haystack looked interesting and the shakes looked like something I would enjoy.
author: Gita r.

description: Roam burger is just so damn good. Also the veggie burger is the best veggie burger I have ever had, it's not dry at all which tends to happen when eating a alternative patty. I would definitely say this place is worth a visit.
author: Dalia Y.

description:
Visited Roam Burger in Pac Heights after running a 15K race prior (9.3 miles for you non-runners), so you know this earthling was hangry AF!

It's tradition for me to engulf a meaty burger after every race. Naturally that's what my body craves after putting it through long distance cardio. I was hungry and so I Yelped burgers. This was the chosen one.

Roam had just opened its doors when we arrived. Perfect timing! I needed fuel after that fire I had put my body through. 

Ordered the Sunny Side with beef (you get to choose your protein of choice). The burger comes with a fried egg, although it was fully cooked and not as runny as I'd like. Also tried the truffle parmesan cheese fries.

The burger itself was delicious! Hearty and filling without being overly gluttonous with beef. The egg was a nice protein addition and the saucy stuff they put inside complemented the inside components really well.

As for the fries... they were delicious but didn't exactly light my world on fire. It just tasted like regular thick fries with a heaping dose of parm. The truffle flavor was hardly there. I would pass on the fries if I were you and maybe replace those calories with some bacon addition to your burger!!

Overall I had a positive experience here and would come back. At around $12 a pop for a solid burger in the city, this place is worth a second visit for me! (And no, this wasn't just my post-race appetite speaking)
author: Connie M.

description:
$10 for a classic cheese burger with house made pickles and house sauce along with the usual lettuce, tomato, and onions.  For $1 more you could pick from 7 other burgers.  Meat choices are beef, turkey, bison, and veggie. For bread there's sesame, whole grain or gluten free for $1 more.  I got mine protein style in a lettuce wrap.  I was still hungry.  

Fries are $3.99 (russet, sweet potato, & zucchini onion haystack).  Zucchini onion haystack is my favorite. Super thin and crunchy.  Nice crunch and flavor to add to your burger.  

Nice selection of artisanal sodas and a selection of microbrews.  Shakes $6.49 for 12oz or $7.99 for 16oz.  

I still think Roam Burgers is just okay.  It's the closest decent burger joint for us although a little pricey, I like the sustainable quality ingredients.
author: Naty D.

description:
Ordered 

Zucchini Onion Haystack: pretty oily for my liking ...it's good for a one time ...feels pretty heavy

Veggie (well done) BBQ burger. Tasted ok. Needs more crunchy texture. The bread gets soft after sometime.

Vanilla Strawberry shake: pretty descent but pricey.

Over all a one time visit. Not worth of the hype.
author: Prateek R.

description:
Not a big burger fan but came here to feel the hipster vibes. We were pretty disappointed with the buns and small size of the burger. The Brussels sprouts were really good but everything else was just ok. Zucchini and sweet potato fries both could have been much warmer.

Ambiance is pretty nice. It's a order/take a number and sit down-kinda place. Friendly staff!
:)
author: Juliana P.

description:
We went here on a Tuesday night at around 9pm and the place had plenty of space with no waiting time. Roam has a varied selection of burgers that I appreciated, and I was most intrigued by the fries burger, which I decided to go with.

The pros of this place was the burger was cooked really well, the cashier was kind and there was plenty of available seating. 

The cons of this place was the pricing for all burgers were around 12 dollars when you factor in tax. The burger, as you can see in my image, is fairly small and there are no side fries that come with the burger. 

My recommendation to the owner is add side fries as potatoes aren't too expensive.

If you're looking for a higher end burger joint that doesn't quite fill you up this is your spot, otherwise, I'd suggest different options if you're looking for a better value, when hungry.
author: John A.

description: It's great! But when I first started coming  here I have always got the same thing since 2014 at first it was just $14 for my burger and $6 for my fries now it's $23 for my burger and $9 for my fries smh. I use to come every week but now after spending $59 for 2 burgers 1 fries... good luck!
author: JB M.

description:
This palace is legit she. It comes to organic and clean eating.  There's a multitude of choices if you like beef, poultry or vegetable on your burger.  

We ordered from each spectrum in our group and from what I saw Nd heard everyone loved their food.  

Out the door for 5 ppl it was $69. And it was with alcohol and fries.  
I had the sunny side burger and it was delicious. I also ordered the zucchini onion haystack and a bit on the oily side but delicious.  

I would recommend their juicy burgers to anyone and will go again when I am back in this area.
author: Rocky S.

description:
Feelin' bougie and want to indulge in a fatty high caloric meal? Well, Roam is the place to go. 

Tbh, the bison burger was alright. It was a super small portion for a hefty price. The taste of the burger didn't impress me at all. I've had bison burgers elsewhere and have tasted a lot better than the one I ordered from here. However, the truffle parmesan fries were down right bomb! It was so good that we ordered another helping! Lastly, their hazelnut shake tasted just like those small golden wrapped chocolates called ferrero rocher. It was so darn good and I honestly would come back just to order this again. 

The reasoning behind this three star rating was because the burger fell short of satisfying. For a joint specializing in burgers given the name, Roam Artisan Burgers, I was expecting so much more of a quality burger. It was a disappointment, but thank goodness for the fries and shake that saved the day!
author: Briana H.

description:
This is the only place I'll order a burger at! My favorite thing about Roam is how there is something for everyone (carnivores, herbivores, vegans), and not in the "I guess I'll order some fries because there's nothing else to eat" kind of way - every option is great quality! They have a selection of interesting burgers, including a seasonal variety, and you can choose your meat/non-meat + bun. 

I love getting the seasonal burger because they're such unique combinations (the last one had chimichurri, mozzarella, tomato, and arugula). I always get the turkey patty with the whole wheat bun. The quality of the ingredients are always very fresh, and the whole meal leaves me feeling satisfied but not gross (like after a fast food restaurant).
The zucchini onion haystack is delicious; they're really thinly sliced and gently fried and seasoned. 

Only complaint is that it takes a while to get your food. Good thing they have coloring books and crayons!
author: Denise L.

description:
My go to for burgers! Well, other than In n Out - but that's different.

I always get the Tejano with sweet potato fries!

Perfection! And what's great is.. it's the perfect size for me.

Service is efficient and foods comes out quick.
author: L F.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite burger joins in the city!

It's one of the few burgers you eat and don't feel completely gross afterwards. The sauces and everything was absolutely delicious. I got theh beef burger but some of my friends tried the bison and elk (although they said that all 3 meats tasted the same) as well as fries and sweet potato fries. I would say that the fries had a little bit too much salt on them but were still delicious.

Love the overall atmosphere and vibe of the place - will definitely come back!
author: Cassie Z.

description:
We were in the mood for burgers, so my sister suggested we check out Roam. I went with the heritage burger (+runny egg) and some regular fries on the side. I understand a good burger at most places in SF can be a little pricey, but I was a bit surprised that this almost came out to $20 for the two items. I was expecting an amazing burger and fries at that price, but sadly it didn't really deliver. 

The bacon inside the burger was amazing, but the runny egg was over cooked and the patty was too (asked for medium rare). I thought the fries were just okay, but maybe I should have asked for the truffle fries instead. Not sure if I'd come back, unless they had a burger that was just stacked with their bacon. Their milkshakes and sodas looked pretty good, though.
author: Jay R.

description:
Fancy burgs. I'm not a burger gal but was really craving one this one week. I hate ground beef but other versions. I got the turkey burger and it satisfies the craving. 

It's just walk up to the counter so it comes out pretty fast but they often have a line.
author: Kelly G.

description:
A cool spot for gourmet burgers.  The restaurant also has Bison patty's.  The bison patty ($4 extra) is pretty good; it's lean and not oily.  If you are in the mood try it, but I'm not sure it's worth the heft price tag.  

Tejano - $11 - Decent - 3/5, $15 w/ Bison patty
Pepper jack, jalapeno, avocado burger.  I opted to get the bison patty.  The burger is enjoyable.  It tasted fresh and the ingredients were yummy.  The burger was pretty good although it's kind of small.  

Overall I liked my experience here.  It was cool to try the bison patty but I'd probably just get it once and that's it.  The bill was larger than I thought it'd be because of the bison patty; I'm down to come back again although next time I'd probably just get a regular burger to save on cash.  

TIPS:
-Can get crowded.  It's common for a line to flow out the door.
author: Mike T.

description: Pretty good burgers but the price is quite high and it took a while to come out. Seating is also first come first serve and you bus it yourself, so when it's busy, the place is pretty chaotic.
author: RachEl L.

description: I tried the bison burger, zucchini and onion haystack, and gingerberry kombucha. 1. The bison burger was on a whole grain bun with lettuce, tomato, caramelized onion, house sauce, bacon, avocado and grueyer cheese. It was honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had. 2. The zucchini and onion haystack is a major pass. It's hard to eat because the slices are paper thin. They should make thicker slices which would be especially easier to dip. Also the taste reminded me of like bad calamari. 3. Gingerberry kombucha was yummy and not too sweet but for the price I thought they should have served a 16oz glass not a 12oz. That was disappointing. Overall I'll definitely be back when I need a good burger and to try the sweet potato fries (which looked very tasty)!
author: Christopher J.

description:
They have somehow lost their spirit in the past two years. I was there in 2015, and the burgers were simply fantastic. Now the burerz are kind of dry, without soul. I don't know what happened, probably they have lowered the quality of the main ingredients.
This is definitely not a must go anymore
author: Alex G.

description:
Go to union street location . 
I have been eating the blue cheese burger for ever and here at Filmore they di t know the difference !
author: Caffe C.

description: Great burgers and fries. Nice place to get food and a beer.  Will be back soon and a bison burger and a beer.  Definitely recommend this place, atmosphere is great service is good and the food was on my table in less than 10 minutes.  What's not to like.
author: p l.

description: The burgers come with your choice of beef, turkey, bison, or elk meat. Along with the fried sides that are really tasty, there's a small selection of brews on tap.
author: Rob K.

description:
My friend and I wanted to try a new burger place and decided to give this place a try. However, upon arrival, we both realized we had burgers from this place before! Lol 

I remember liking the food but didn't like the long line and the sitting situation. Second time around, it only reenforced my dislikes...

On a Friday at around 7:25pm, the line was out of the door. I would really suggest either getting to-go or have one of your friends find a table and let another friend do the ordering. Otherwise, it's kinda chaotic to try to look for a table after placing the order. They also have tables outside with heat lamps but it is still gets pretty cold. 

My friend had the Classic with Beef patty ($8.99). It came with lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles and house sauce. I had a Sunny Side with Turkey patty ($10.99). It came with a fried egg, fontina, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, and chili sauce. I said no to onions and sauce on the side, which they forgot so I'm not sure what it tastes like. We also shared an order of Sweet Potato Fries ($3.99).

Although the line was long, our order came quickly. The burger was a good size. My turkey patty was lean and seasoned. I wish the egg was less over cooked though. Since they forgot my sauce, I ate mine with ketchup and it was pretty tasty. The Sweet Potato Fries on the other hand was a bit disappointing. I was hoping they would arrive pipping hot but they were lukewarm and looked kinda sad. 

You have the choice of beef, turkey, bison, or veggie patty. Types of buns are also available. There are many different add-ons as well. 

I enjoyed my meal here and would go back if suggested by friends.
author: Alice L.

description: I've been wanting to try Roam Artisan Burgers for quite some time now. FINALLY, I had the chance to come with my family. I liked the burger patties much better here than at Super Duper, because imo, they were juicier and heartier. I also appreciated that when I ordered my patty lettuce-wrapped, they use butter lettuce leaves, which means the burger stays together, so I can actually eat my order as a burger, rather than with a fork and spoon. However, similar to Super Duper, I thought the customer service could be better. When I made my order at the register and specified that I wanted my BBQ sauce on the side, I made sure to confirm with the cashier that the sauce would be on the side. However, when all our entrees were delivered to our table, there was no BBQ sauce! It was also hard to track down someone to grab some from the kitchen for me, as no one came to check that our orders were delivered correctly. So despite the better-tasting burger here, I'm not sure if I'd make a second trip back.
author: Connie X.

description: Honestly, I love this place. Came here for the second time this Friday, and it was packed, so clearly the city agrees with me. Last time, I got the tejano burger with a veggie patty, which was actually the best veggie patty I think I've had. I've been recommending it to all my vegetarian friends. This time, I wanted to try something new, so I got the sunny-side up turkey burger and added jalapeño relish, and it was amazing as well! My only issue was that I wanted to substitute the cheese for the equally priced mushrooms because I have a dairy allergy, and they wouldn't make the sub without an added fee, which didn't make a lot of sense to me and felt kind of rude since this was a dietary restriction not a personal preference. We also ordered the fry-fecta to split at the table, and we all agreed that the zucchini fries were the hit and truly unique to Roam. Would definitely order those again!
author: Sonia S.

description:
This place is always a hit or miss. Management should get together with the chefs to make sure the consistency is there. On a good day, though, this is my favorite spot to grab a burger. I usually get the tejano double elk burger. The burger is massive but I am a big eater so it's not a problem for me to finish it in one sitting. I love how the spices just meshes well with the elk. Super tender and juicy with a nice crunch from the tortilla chips.

If you are up for it, pair your burger with one of their many milkshakes. Thick and creamy is how I like it. Be careful for you will have major food coma after. 

There is indoor and outdoor seating so you can pick and choose where you sit after you order. Service is quick and the workers here are always very friendly.
author: Ada H.

description: My new favorite burger place in town!! I've tried three different burgers so far -  heritage, tejano, French and fries. If you like bacon, you will love heritage!! Their fries are very good too especially the zucchini one! If you ask them to cut the burger in half, they will!
author: Theresa H.

description:
The burger is good, but damn... that milkshake! We got the mint chip milkshake and it was delicious! It was a good thickness and a nice mint flavor with delicious shavings of chocolate. I totally recommend it!

For our meal, we got the French and Fries burger with fries in it! It also come with other delicious items like Gruyere cheese, avocado and caramelized onions. They were nice and cut it in half for us since we weren't super hungry. The burger was good, but I could barely taste the truffle.

Overall though, I would totally come back for more burgers and shakes.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Visiting SF for our anniversary! 

Ordered:
Veggie bbq, classic beef, trifecta 

Pros: this place is located on a street with other fun things to check out! The atmosphere is rustic and warm mixed with some metal accents. They take pride in using quality ingredients and in house recipes. The service was friendly and fast, both burgers had delicious flavor, balanced. The trifecta was amazing, savory seasoning. Huge table for groups.

Cons: I appreciate quality and I understand it cost more, but they were way overpriced. About 10.50 without fries. And the size was not even big. Veggie patty had a lot of quinoa and was mushy.
author: Ceci F.

description:
Overwhelmed by the vast options that The Counter has to offer? Come here instead! The quality is just as good and you can be lazy and order from one of the pre-set burger creations instead! If you like, you can customize as well -- and they have an option The Counter doesn't have -- wild boar! pretty awesome 

I have tried:
-The Heritage -- comes with apple smoked bacon, fontina, lettuce, caramelized onions, herb mayo. This has a very meaty flavor and I feel like the bacon really takes over and can't taste the meat and herb mayo as much. definitely one if you're looking for a very savory taste 
-The Chalet -- I personally got this because I love mushrooms. This comes with cremini mushrooms, watercress, Swiss, tomato and house sauce. This tastes like a 'healthy' burger, if there ever was one. I believe its because of the toppings that mellows out the flavor from the patty. Something to get if you want a burger but don't want it too over the top! 
-The Fry-Fecta: I only got this because I was interested in trying the zucchini onion haystack but my friend wanted to actually eat fries. PASS. the zucchini onion is cool after like 3 bites and then falls apart pretty easily. Better off getting one of the actual fries 

Parking is literally the biggest waste of time. please just park very far away and walk here to burn off the calories
The wait to order can be long, depending what time you get there. the line goes out the out the door and there isn't much of a waiting area. 
There is a self-help area for water, plates, napkins and utensils. There is no waitstaff to help you clean your shit up 

overall, 3.5 stars. Their burgers are juicy with quality ingredients. If the situation was circumstantial, like I was craving a burger, in the area, better parking --- I would come here ....but I've had better burgers for less
author: Vivian H.

description: I like food that makes me feel happy and full and the French and fry burger did that! It had delicious avocado and truffle fries on the inside which was unique and filling. The sweet potato fries had a tasty dose of cilantro and the blackberry soda was a nice sweet touch. Bring a friend so you guys can talk about how great your food is!
author: Melissa M.

description: Quick and casual burger joint with delicious food! The homemade veggie patty seemed to be mostly made a quinoa and was super good and fresh! I got the seasonal burger with Brie onions and arugula. The pumpkin spread was a little too sweet for me and would probably ask to have that removed if I were to order again. But other than that 10/10!!
author: Rachel K.

description:
This place is probably one of my favorite burger restaurants in San Francisco. Every time I come here, the burger just tastes better and better.

The prices are a little high, but I think you definitely pay for what you get. You also get your money's worth.

I always order the Classic burger since I'm a pretty picky eater. The bun is toasty. The meat is not overcooked and it is juicy and tender. Their fries are also pretty crunchy yet soft.

You just need to go here and try it for yourself. You won't regret it.
author: Allyson L.

description: Big splurge for me for lunch. Went to the Fillmore St. location ( there's one in Lafayette, too) in SF.  Line out the door!  But it moved pretty quickly. Had a lettuce wrapped bison burger with tomato, caramelized onions, & barbecue sauce.  Delish!  Burger came wrapped in large, tender leaves of butter lettuce. Lest you think I was sanctimonious, I also had an order of fries....yummy and not greasy at all. Portion was probably large enough to share, but I managed it myself. Large variety of options: customize your own or order one of their suggestions.
author: Sherry S.

description:
One word: yum.

Thanks, Roam. Xoxo

Well, looks like yelp won't consider such a short review an actual review so maybe this extra long run on sentence that I'm adding right now will help.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
The bun was amazing so if you like a great bun then definitely I would recommend this place.......but that's about it. 

Not sure what all the hype is about, seems as tho they focus on the food being very aesthetic but not as much in the flavor. Pretty much a hipster instagram burger joint. Lol. The saying never judge a book by its cover goes both ways just because it's pretty doesn't mean it's tasty. 
Don't get me wrong it didn't taste horrible but it also didn't taste great. 

For 2 drinks 2 fries and burgers ending around $40 totally could go to a little burger shack for less and end up more satisfied. But if you do give it a shot try their caramelized pineapple soda pretty tasty.
author: Adam F.

description:
Food: 3/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3.5/5
Overall: standard burger but definitely more pricy for a meal for a burger

The extended review:

Food:

Bison burger - pretty standard for a burger.  Not bad but wasn't the most awesome burger I've had. 

Fries - can't say no to fries.  Pretty good.  

Service: friendly waitstaff.

Ambiance: very casual and pretty dimmly lit.  Good place for a quick bite.
author: Spencer Q.

description: Delicious! I really enjoyed my Heritage Burger. It was as good or better than my birth get at home!!! Yummy
author: Sue J.

description: Tried the veggie burger - Tejana style. It was a bit on dry side. The avocados were super hard meaning not ripe enough. We made a to go order and there was no ketchup or sauce with it which made it a bit bland. The vanilla milkshake was just awesome along with the Fry-fecto.
author: Sudha R.

description: I have tried a lot of burgers in the past but this one is definitely the best. I can't even explain how good these burgers are. You have to try it for yourself to understand. Just try it, you won't be disappointed.
author: Sean S.

description:
Good, juicy, flavorful burgers. They give you the option of how you want your beef cooked. Surprisingly not many burger places offer that. 

I'm never disappointed when I come here. Many pre-made choices to choose from or you can build your own. They also have the option for bison, turkey (if I'm not mistaken), and veggie burgers. Bison is extra. 

The fry fecta is a must have when coming here. Sweet potato fries, fried zucchini, and regular russet. Definitely a share size portion. 

My favorite thing was probably the banana walnut shake. It's season, but it's creamy and delicious. First time I've tried that combination. 

4 stars because it can get a bit pricy and they can get tooo busy for good service. Burger, fry fecta, and a shake for $25.
author: Sanz E.

description: This place is super solid! It's a great spot to grab a casual and quick, hearty bite to eat. I'm not a big burger fan but man are their burgers juicy and delicious! I ordered the turkey burger Chalet style (Swiss cheese, cremini mushrooms, and house sauce) and it was fantastic for $12! We also got some of the Russet fries which were pretty good! My mom usually orders the veggie burger and absolutely loves it.
author: Sabina S.

description: One of my boyfriend's patients recommended this burger spot and it is my new GO-TO. It is an absolute must if you're looking for hipster burger joints that don't disappoint. You basically build your own burger by selecting the patty first (turkey, veggie, or beef), then choosing the style. I forgot which style I chose but it had jalapeño relish and avocado on it and it really brought out the flavor in the turkey patty. First bite and I was in love! Definitely coming back here and will continue to rave about it until the end of time.
author: Taylor N.

description:
I like burgers! And I love Roam Artisan Burgers! Also, I'm in trouble. Because they are like 5 minutes from my house. There goes the beach body. But Roam is well worth it. A great selection to choose from makes it hard to decide, I finally went with the seasonal burger: Chimichurri. Together with some sweet potato truffle parmesan fries and a Ginger Lime soda. I truly enjoyed every bite of it and loved the fries. They could have been a little crispier and definitely more truffle-y for my liking, but I won't complain. Still very good. I loved the Chimichurri sauce (which I fail miserably when trying to make my own). For the burger, fries and soda I paid around $20 which I think is a great deal (still getting used to SF pricing). 

And by now, you know how to make me really happy: don't let me stand in line. Roam didn't let me down here, so we quickly ordered and found a table for two without any problems. We didn't have to wait long for the food either, so that makes a very happy me. I'll be back. Of course I will.
author: Katja S.

description: My favorite burger place in the City.  I get the BBQ burger with the Tri-fecta and a milkshake - I don't mess around when I'm here.  It's pricey (the meal I just described is almost $40!) but worth it if you go now and then.
author: Bleu L.

description:
The burgers here are exceptionally juicy.

Every single item on Roam's menu looks and sounds amazing. I've only ever had their classic, because I'm a simple gal. The fries make a good pairing to the burger. Don't forget to get a milkshake!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Great spot to grab the classic "Burger, Fries, & shake" combo.

Lots of choices and with a vast amount of organic ingredients you can't go wrong or feel too guilty about your meal.

-Food
*Fry-Fecta - No brainer. Definitely had to get this. 3 types of friese and all were great. My personal favorite was the sweet potato fries. 
*Heritage Burger - The caramelized onions was the star for me in this burger. All their burgers are cooked medium, I chose to get the beef which was pretty tasty. The avocado was a nice touch.
*Strawberry/Vanilla Shake - asked to combine too flavors topped over with the toasted marshmallow which is a must.

I think the price here are fair. If you've had shake shack, or Gotts Roadside, against their prices you get more bang for your buck and for organic ingredients as well. The service was good, it was quick. Parking can be difficult to snag around this parts. While Roam Burger isn't the best burger around by any means it's solid!
author: Arron E.

description:
Oh my gawd. This place is amazing. 

I had the heritage burger and 24 hours later, I can't stop thinking about it. Even cooked well-done, the burger was juicy, flavorful and just absolutely delicious. 

Along with my burger, I had a side of sweet potato fries. Again, these were amazing. I don't like my sweet potato fries too sweet and these were the perfect combination of sweet and salty.

I only had two concerns about this place. First was the price tag. My burger and fries cost me over $18. But then again, that's San Francisco for you.

The other drawback was the limited seating. I should say that there were a large number of tables and chairs but this place is so popular, you have to wait around for someone to leave before you can snag a table.

That being said, I will most definitely be back!
author: Sarah A.

description: Wanted to try something different so we went to Roam for lunch.  I ordered the Pacific blue cheese burger and sweet potato fries and my husband got a bison burger.  I must say the price for my burger $11.99 was not a good value as the burger was so small!  The child's burger next to me looked larger and she got the fries and a drink for $10.99.  What is that about?  And there was only a faint hint of blue cheese, more of a mayonnaise taste.  I guess that is because its a blue cheese spread and not real blue cheese.  The fries were good but I had a distinct after grease taste when finished.  For over $30 for the two of us with no drinks, there are definitely better values out there for burgers.  A one time visit for us.
author: Nickie M.

description:
SO ... i'm slightly torn about this review as I ordered to-go and we all know that the quality of food suffers the moment you bag it up, and even more so when you walk for an additional 10 minutes home to gorge yourself in the privacy of your home (... but i digress!). the veggie burger is in fact, quite delicious, but I think where I was just a touch bummed out was with the french fries. don't get me wrong, a fry is a fry and even crappy ones are pretty damn tasty, but i ordered the seasonal topping (dill malt vinegar) and was just hoping for .. well.. more! it was tangy but just needed more drizzle.

i think the price is fair given the area (a tad higher than i'd expect, but it's fillmore street) and I wouldn't say no if a buddy was craving a burger and we were nearby, but just not a spot I'd make a special trip for.

still, a solid dinner option!
author: Vicki L.

description:
Whenever my friends and I are craving a burger, Roam is our go-to spot. 

The meat is high quality and the options are endless. You can choose a suggested style or customize your own. There's even variety in the buns you can order (from traditional sesame seed to whole grain to gluten-free). I usually create my own with grass-fed beef, mushrooms, and avocado and it's always delicious. The beef is especially juicy and tender so I usually opt for it. I'd also suggest trying the sweet potato fries - so good! 

I recently went with my cousins on a Tuesday night and we easily found a table for four. The food came out quickly and it was a great spot to hang out and enjoy dinner as the atmosphere is laid back and casual. 

In warmer weather, the shakes are also tasty. There's a seasonal hazelnut one that I love. Can't wait to go back again soon.
author: Shira W.

description: My family was here during a recent trip to visit our son who lives in San Francisco, so he recommended Roam for a late Sunday lunch.  First of all Fillmore Street is one my favorite streets in the city.  So many cafe's, clothing stores, and every mix imaginable of other stores.  The burger's were amazing.  The fries, look out McDonalds.  Everybody in my group ordered a different burger, different toppings and sauces.  I, because I was trying to lose weight ordered the bowl of vegetable.  It was brussels sprouts and very good.  The burgers were better though, next time.  I had a taste of my husbands burger and did steal some fries.  Another benefit is they have gluten free buns.  They also have wine and beer which the burger was calling out for.  Next time, burger and a drink.
author: Diane V.

description:
I remember it being better, and I've been several times over the years. But it's been a while and I was disappointed. 

The meat options are always a draw and the zucchini onion fries are a nice alternative to fries. In theory.

The zucchini onion fries are sooooo salty, and I love salt, but they were almost inedible.

The bison burger was dry, probably bc it was over cooked.

The burger to everything else ratio was off, not enough burger and too much bun. And the bun was too gluten-y. I get that you're going for soft chewy bun, but it sticks to your teeth and takes over your palate in a bad way.

And finally...those metal chairs. When will that trend die already? Nothing like wanting a juicy comfort food and eating it on an icy metal chair. 

This isn't the only humanly sourced burger spot. Native burger is way better for example. 

Sorry guys, I won't be back.
author: Aristocles P.

description: Pretty good burgers with warm, chewy buns and thic juicy patties. Nothing to complain about here, pretty good eats all around. Portions are kind of petite, and this place is definitely a joint you'd go if you're kind of feeling like getting a bite but aren't on the brink of starvation, like how I always feel when I go out to eat. The place also has a nice bustling get-together vibe like those in sports bar.
author: David Y.

description:
This place was amazing for burgers!!! Definitely a must re-visit. It's in a very cute area of San Francisco and it's walking distance to everything, it has a lot of cool places nearby.

The place itself is very casual, you order at the counter and then you get your order at the table. They do not serve Coca Cola or Pepsi products, they service a more natural cane cola with brown sugar which I was not a fan of but it's a healthier alternative. I ordered the French and fries burger with an order of garlic fries. The burger was delicious. It was not a heavy greasy burger, it was just right. It had gruyere cheese and a mustard sauce which was totally different from all the burgers I've had. The patty was cooked well and tasted just as good. They have beef, bison, turkey and veggie choices. The fries were also fried how I like them. Definitely try out this place if you like burgers.

Service was very good, the guy who took out order was friendly and attentive.
author: Rosio G.

description: Got delivery to the hospital and the food was amazing some of the best burgers I have ever had. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a good burger. Only criticism and minor was the fries were soggy which some of our party didn't mind I just prefer my fries crisp.
author: Duane C.

description: I'm always on the search for a great burger and Roam certainly hit the spot. We came with friends on a Saturday night and the line was out the door but moved quickly. We waited a while for seating but the timing actually worked out great with when they brought out food. The French and Fries burger was so good (minus the mustard). They ask if you want your burger well-cooked or a little pink and it came out a perfect amount of pink. Hubby got the Classic and was happy with his. We also ordered the Fry-fecta to share with the group. The Zucchini Onion Haystack was everyone's favorite but could use some work on the zucchini to onion ratio (more zucchini please). A bit pricey for a fast casual restaurant but worth it for the quality of food.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
Zucchini haystack 5 star
Banana shake and mint chip shake: 5 star
Strawberry shake: 4.5 star
Coffee shake: 4 star
Sweet potato fries: 4 star
author: Pamela Y.

description: Wow. This place keeps getting worse. I ordered a six dollar side of veggies and this is what i got. What a rip off.  It looks like i got someones leftovers. I could eat this in a cpl bites!! This place is lucky their staff and management is so wonderful and accommodating. If you cant give a big portion for cost then you shouldn't carry it! This is a rip off and a joke.
author: Megan M.

description:
My friend was craving french fries (hey, i knew i liked you for a reason!) so we decided to venture out of FiDi and head to Fillmore for the famous fryfecta.  The fryfecta is a dream come true for fry lovers.  This is the only menage a trois I will ever engage in.  

Fryfecta - russet, sweet, zucchini onion haystack fries. Each has its own personality; Russet is the laid back cool type.  Sweet is innocent but playful. Zucchini onion is the international feisty type.  Each one is good on its own or stuff them all in your mouth for a fun party.

Classic burger - simple but good.  perfectly cooked with the right amount of flavor

Fryfecta, good at anytime of the day.
author: Linda N.

description:
A busy, artisan burger restaurant on Fillmore, Roam offers up quite a few unusual selections that are all executed so well and make for a great lunch stop. I came here for lunch on a Sunday and there was a short line even though we arrived shortly after opening--by the time we left, the line was even longer and all the tables full. You order at the counter and the food is brought out--there was nothing special about the service, but the decor was clean and modern, and the food was high-quality and tasty!

I created my own bison burger and topped it off with lettuce, onion, tomato, pickles, cremini mushrooms, and watercress--the burger itself was nice and juicy, and the bison had a beefier-than-beef meaty flavor. The veggies were all so fresh tasty and added a nice crunch--the chipotle hot sauce here added the perfect amount of kick to every bite. I also got to try the elk burger, which was a little bit lean/dry (but still tasty) and the parmesan truffle fries and tandoori fries with yogurt sauce. The fries were the most underwhelming part of the meal, as they were limp and soggy--these can definitely be skipped. Overall, this was a great place for a quick lunch; though the price point is high, it was definitely worth it for the quality of the ingredients.
author: David K.

description: I've been to one of these chain locations in Lafayette and I was just as satisfied here as I was at that location. The burgers here are really good and so are the fries. The only thing I didn't like was the milkshakes here, they lacked so much flavor. The customer service here is also really good and rather quick - even when it is busy. Only thing is, the seating can be a problem here. Their locations are super tiny which isn't good when you are trying to sit and have a nice meal. You can also order your stuff to go though! Parking at this SF location is annoying as any other parking situation in SF. But the tasty food here is so worth it!
author: Anne R.

description:
Extra money for a pretty average burger.

There are a lot of places where you can get a great burger in the bay area, even more so in San Francisco. However, I think that burgers should be simple, fast and cheap. This place is none of that. Every time I pay more than $10 for a burger, I feel like I just played myself.

Don't get me wrong - Roam's food is decent. I'm not a huge fan of the fries (slightly too thick and not crispy enough) and the burger (French and Fries) was good. But because it's in SF, it costs three times as much as In N Out, but only slightly fancier. The location and ambiance is nice, so it does have that going for it, and the beer selection is ok. Don't hype this place up, it's not anything spectacular. 

Also, burgers without the bun (lettuce wrapped) are extra? What is the meaning of this?
author: Albert C.

description:
Came here around 2pm on a Sunday and it was pretty busy. Luckily, we were able to snag a table after ordering at the counter. The employees here are all so friendly, especially the cashiers. I also noticed that the busboys were very quick to clear tables for other patrons. 

I ordered the Tejano burger with bacon and the Fry-Fecta: zucchini fries, sweet potato fries, and regular fries. Food came out fast and hot! The burger was delicious! All of the ingredients were fresh and top notch. The bacon was thick, the avocados were firm, and the addition of crunchy tortilla strips was the perfect touch. The fries fell short for me, however. They were a bit too salty and they weren't crispy. The prices here are pretty high, but the quality of the burger ingredients reflect the price tag. I would definitely stop here again for a burger if I were ever in the area.
author: Liana B.

description:
Tasty burgers with good-quality ingredients. The beef sunny-side burger (organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, chili sauce) was quite solid, albeit over a bit quickly given the $10.99 price. Fries (or a zucchini onion haystack) are an extra $3.99, so with a drink (fortunately, they have a decent draft beer selection) the whole affair will easily run you $20-25. 

Service is fairly casual - you order at the register and then find a seat at the bar or at communal tables. The overall vibe is quite pub-like. A decent, if a bit spendy, experience.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I have not been to this location before! This place hits the spot, one of my favorite gourmet burger places to hit up.

The Fri-Fecta is a MUST order - fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini fries! My go to burger is the Tejano Elk/beef. The burgers are pretty big too.

They now have shakes! I should have ordered one, next time I will. 

They also offer a variety of beers!
author: Elijah B.

description: Wasn't as impressed as the Lafayette location. Seems like the burgers have gotten smaller and the special toppings on each aren't as extravagant. Was left with a plain burger, and although it was good, it was just a burger. All 4 of us weren't super impressed after hyping it up from the previous time I had it over a year ago. The fry-feccta was very good, the zucchini ribbons were amazing.
author: Brielle W.

description: The food was good but my group of friends and I could not get past the fact that whoever labels the food put a "vegetarian" sticker on the "pink beef burger." My friend has been a vegetarian for 10 years and this is the first time she's taken a bite of meat and she's devastated. A nice Friday afternoon was ruined for her because of someone's negligence here. This should never happen... in San Francisco of all places. Don't come here if you're a vegetarian.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Roam was never really on my radar before in terms of burger joints in SF.  It wasn't until I saw Food Network's "Best. Burger. Ever." where Chef Marcel Vigneron showcased Roam and talked about their French & Fry Turkey Burger.  It looked so good on TV that I knew I had to try it out someday.

It took a while for me to visit but I eventually came by on a weekend for lunch.  

Turkey French and Fry Burger -- http://bit.ly/2bBvHeM
truffle parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, piquant sauce, whole grain mustard.
Oh yeah, it was just as good as Chef Marcel explained it on the TV show.  For a turkey burger, my mind was blown because I never thought I'd enjoy it so much especially with this unique combination of toppings.  First off, the truffle fries IN the burger is always a good thing.  Then all the other toppings make the burger rich and exquisite with a little bit of zest from the mustard.  I loved it!

Of course after enjoying that burger on that first visit, it didn't take me long to go back again just a few weeks later.  And this time, I came in really hungry.  So hungry that I once again ordered the French & Fry Turkey Burger and another burger as well, but this burger I decided to create my own (http://bit.ly/2egI4Ar)

My Create Your Own Burger -- http://bit.ly/2dHpoX5
with beef, white cheddar, caramelized onions and house sauce.
As simple as this burger sounds, this is actually my favorite burger topping combination with any restaurant.  And Roam's version delivers on every note.  The beef patty was juicy and the cheese, caramelized onions, and house sauce all came together nicely to make this a perfect burger.

While the menu does have some mainstay items, it does have menu specials depending on what's available during the season (http://bit.ly/2bKpsJd) as well as crafting their own sodas (http://bit.ly/2bBvf0n).  All the more reason to come back for future visits.

I also like how the restaurant has an open air look to it where it almost feels like your eating on a patio but still indoors.  It always has a welcoming vibe whenever I visit.

Roam has definitely created a great impression on me with their burgers, which I think are some of the best in San Francisco in general.  I put them along the same lines as Pearl's where every time I visit, the burgers get better and better.  Though with Roam, I feel like I'm getting a lot more not just with food, but the whole atmosphere in general.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Wow wow wow it was sooooo great here!!
Best food ever!!
I loved it and if I could I would give them 100000 stars
author: Michelle M.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to come to Roam to try their gourmet burgers. I'm not really a burger type of gal, but I actually really enjoyed the burger I ordered! 
I ordered the Turkey Sunny Side Burger which comes with caramelized onions, a sunny side up egg, greens and I forgot what type of cheese. I also added avocado and mushrooms for an additional $1.25. I got it with the house sauce and yellow mustard on the side. Overall, it was pretty tasty and the parm. cheese truffle fries was a great compliment to my burger :)
author: Savanna L.

description:
My first time here was back in 2013, and I was very impressed with the quality of their food. I finally made another trip back here for some comfort food. Their chalet burger with bison meat was delicious. Very juicy. The fry-fecta (all three types of fries) was good too. 

However, the quality of the service leaves a bit to be desired. My friend and I grabbed an open seat, but the table remained unwiped for a while. We had to call someone over to clean the table. We had asked for some items on the side, but the server seemingly forgot to bring us the side items. For a gourmet burger place where one is paying $20/person for burgers, fries, and drinks, I hoped for better service (minus one star).

Still, maybe the staff just had a long day. I'd still be inclined to go back at some point given the quality of the food.
author: Willk W.

description:
Came here for brunch with my girlfriends and was not disappointed.

I ordered: 
- French & Fries (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Whole Grain Mustard, Piquant Sauce)
- Asparagus with lemon, garlic, Manchego cheese, and crispy shallots (seasonal veggie selection)
- asked for a wine recommendation because it was a rough fucking week. Wine was good but easily forgettable.

It's pricey but what on this street isn't? 

Still coming back.
author: Aivy C.

description: This is one of my favorite farm to plate burgers! You order at the cashier, they hand you a number, and then you seat yourself at any open tables, indoors or outdoors. I got the Heritage burger with bison meat. It comes with bacon, cheese, herb mayo, and vegetables. The bison meat is top notch. I'm used to bison being pretty chewy, but this one is so tender and juicy!! The price is right too. It's $10.99 for signature burgers and $8.99 for a plain burger. It's additional cost for bison or wild boar. Sure, it's a little more expensive than say, going to Red Robin, where you can spend the same amount of money for both a burger AND fries, but it's totally worth it knowing the meat is pasture raised. Plus, the quality is so much better! It's also nice that even though this place is in the city, there plenty of free street parking around.
author: Lexi R.

description: Roam is one of my favorite burger spots in SF. If you're looking for something a little more premium than Superduper, Roam is a great spot. Not only do they have an extensive menu, they offer different types of meat including bison! My go to has been the French & Fries burger, it's stuffed with truffle fries. The onion zucchini hay stack was pretty unique. It appears light in its thin layers but they're pretty greasy. They also have free wifi so that's a plus!
author: Virginia Y.

description: Not worth it! I spent $65 on 2 burgers, 1 kid burger, 1 fry, 1 kids shake, 1 wine & 1 beer. What a disappointment. It's greasy & way too hipster-ish (not in a good way). I will NOT be returning.
author: R E.

description:
I've been to their other location, which is also fantastic, but the completist in me wanted to try all their locations. 

We came on a Wednesday afternoon so it wasn't that busy, which was perfect. Plenty of seating and quick and nice service. Double points! The burgers aren't super expensive, but they aren't cheap either. However, the trifectca of fries is a steal. You get to try three different types of fries in a huge bowl. 

Their burgers are amazing. Not the best in SF, but pretty close. Umami's still holds the title after all these years. They do have a decent selection of beer and wine. This is a pretty chill place in a great location. Thumbs up.
author: Benny H.

description:
Good selection of burgers.
They offer four proteins: Beef, Turkey, Bison, and Veggie

Excellent fried Zucchini Onion Haystack ($3.99).

Our daughter loved their kids Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Fries ($7.99). The kids combo also offers side of carrots and cucumbers, but today was a good day.

BBQ Burger comes with white cheddar, BBQ sauce, caramelized onions, jalapeño relish, and slaw (on the burger) served on Pacific Coast Bakery Sesame Bun ($10.49). Burger was good but overcooked. We said yes to having some pink in the meat, but was still overdone. It would have been too dry if it didn't have the sauce and slaw.

We'll be back to try other burger styles/options.
They serve Allagash Ale on tap. 
Order at the counter, get a number, sit down.
author: Zoran L.

description: Cannot stress how amazing these burgers are- custom built or off there incredibly curated burger styles, it will be delicious! SO JUICY!! Any of the fries are great, but the zuchini are the best in my opinion,
author: Alex A.

description:
I was first initiated  with Roam when I frequented their union street location several years ago. I was really happy and impressed with that experience.

This location is equally as good. Parking may be a tad bit more challenging but the overall experience is great.

SF magazine rated their veggie burger the best of the bay so I had to entertain the notion ( as two of my family members are full on vegetarians...thank god not vegan) and have them experience it.

Whilst the veggie burger was okay...as in thank god I eat meat. The star of the show are still the dead animal on a bun selections. Their buns are great. Their condiments are great. Their meats are great!

As many others have attested to....their fry-frecta is a must get ( three types of fries).

Having Alagash white ale on tap is stellar.

Excellent prices for superb quality.

If you have not tried a Roam burger ( pick your meat) definitely  give them a try.
author: David G.

description: What a treat to find this little gem. They have gluten free buns and fries but are not a gf dedicated facility. My gf hamburger order was delicious while my husband found his to be a bit on the dry side. But still, the fries are delicious!
author: Graciela P.

description: One of my favorite burgers in town. Great beer selection: I appreciate any IPA besides lagunitas. Kombucha on tap, sweet potato fries. Kids meals and ask for he vegetarian burger well done.
author: paul k.

description:
Best vanilla milkshake I've had in a while. Strauss ice cream. 12 oz $5.49 in sf isn't a terrible price. I mean Mel's diner is over $8, but I guess if you eat in they give you the extra in the metal cup. But anyway this one is so tasty - thick and flavorful and man they make it fast. 

Sunny side burger - was good burger but the chili sauce was too sweet for me. Messy but that's cuz they do the egg perfectly. I didn't care for the arugula and chili sauce combo but might try something similar next time 

Heritage burger - now that's my burger with some bacon and fontina cheese. The herb mayo is tasty without being too overpowering. Basic but juicy and tasty burger. I scarfed it all!

It's not like Spruce's burger but it's also half the price but more than half the enjoyment so I think totally worth the visit. 

Few outdoor tables that are small but if it's a nice day you can sit out on filmore and watch people go by. There's tables in front and on side of restaurant. And then there's a long communal table down the middle of restaurant next to the bar. Oh yeah there's a bar that serves. 

Two unisex bathrooms in the back. 

Stand in line to order and get your number on a stand. Find a table and then they'll bring your order to the table. 

They play music and the restaurant is fairly noisy (like white noisy) so perfect for kids too ;-). Don't go here if you want to eat in silence.
author: Traci H.

description:
This is literally the best classic burger you'll ever eat. The toasted sesame bun, coupled with a fresh patty of grilled grass-fed beef, housemade pickles, special sauce, lettuce, onion, and tomato make each bite of this burger taste like a piece of heaven. (Heaven to me would obviously be my eating endless Roam burgers). My BF got the classic burger with a GF bun + avocado and a fried egg... why not? Paired with french fries and a local beer, we were happy. I say go for the classic because why would you mess with a good thing. But you can also build your own, or try one of their pre-outlined burger topping options to mix it up.

Anytime my boyfriend can get something gluten free that actually tastes good is an additional win, so for those with a gluten intolerance, enjoy this burger on a GF bun and smile like you're eating real bread once again.

It's an order at the counter place. There was a line when we got there on weeknight around 7-8pm, but it went fast and we had no problem grabbing a seat inside. People flowed in and out at a decent pace so don't worry about having to take your food to go if you wanted to sit and eat. 

I will be back next trip to SF. See you in August, Roam.
author: Breanna B.

description: It took me having a really bad burger to appreciate Roam a burgers. A regular order with my boyfriend is a mushroom char with the trifecta. Love this Place. Plus, the people that work there really nice to. Portions are perfect. Definitely try this place if you're in the area.
author: Sasha M.

description: This place has the best turkey burger I have ever eaten. It's literally put them on tv which I didn't know until after I started raving to my friends about how delicious it was. I cannot wait to get back to the city and get another one. Love it!! And the artisan blood orange soda was wonderful as well!!
author: Heather D.

description:
My fiancé and I ate here on a Wednesday evening at the recommendation of our hotel.  I ordered the Pacific Blue burger and a bottled soda, while my fiancé ordered the BBQ burger, which came to a total of around $29 with tax.

The burgers were small-but-good, although not good enough to merit their cost of around $12 each, especially considering that we had to find additional food elsewhere to fill us up afterward.  

What Roam got right:

The sesame bun was really delicious, and my toppings (blue cheese, tomato, caramelized onion, and steak sauce) all tasted really fresh.  We both ordered our burgers well-done, and they were still very juicy. 

Where they went wrong:

We waited a long time for our burgers, and the restaurant only had one other diner in there at the time.  Shortly after we'd ordered and sat down, we watched him send whatever he got back to the chef on account of being too slimy/rubbery (which the server was great about, from what we could see), and I assume the wait was because they were fixing his order, which came out again at the same time as ours.

As mentioned, the burgers were paltry in size and weren't filling.  The toppings on my burger were unevenly spread, with tomato shoved to one side and a small dollop of blue cheese relegated to the other side. The menu lists watercress as a topping, but it was missing from my burger, which I discovered when I opened my burger to spread the toppings around.  Would it have been too much to spread the toppings around so I didn't have to open up my burger and do it myself? Also, if you're going to call it a "Pacific Blue" burger -- assuming that the "Blue" part refers to the blue cheese spread, shouldn't you have more than just a nickel-sized dab of blue cheese on it? 

At the end of the day, our burgers weren't anything special, and in a city that's such a foodie-haven, I'm sure there's a lot better out there.  For the amount of time and money we spent on these average burgers, I think our night and cash would've been better spent elsewhere.
author: Katelyn R.

description: Probably one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. I'm not even vegetarian! Sweet potato fries were also great. Overall great service and food!
author: Humberto B.

description: So nice, I came back twice! My first visit to Roam Burger on Filmore Street was so magically tasty, I had to come back and bring the wife. I'm willing to say that Roam Burger may possibly be the BEST BURGER in San Francisco. I'm a huge fan of the Heritage Burger and the Sweet Potato Fries! Now, I like my Heritage Burger with turkey on a lettuce wrap or gluten free bun! The smoker applewood bacon, caramelized onions and other delicious toppings make it my favorite. Everyone should try Roam Burger! My wife approves!!
author: Rhett B.

description: The food there is really good. Their vegetarian hamburger is a bomb. Their home kombucha is excellent. The service was impeccable and quick, no words.
author: Asa H.

description:
I've previously given Roam a 1 star review, due to the atrocious service at the time. Since then, I've been back quite a few times and I must say, everything has been great.

The staff at Roam is very friendly, and accommodating. Ive probably ordered every type of burger that they offer, and they're all top notch, including the vegetarian option.
For anyone that has not been here, the kombucha on tap is a must. The quality of their ingredients is off the charts, which doesn't make people feel too guilty of eating out.

Roam, I'll see you soon!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I want to give a shoutout to Fabian! I had an issue with a delivery and he was beyond helpful and pleasant when I spoke with him on the phone.  I was so pleased to be greeted by a friendly and pleasant individual when I called. Thank you, Fabian, for providing such exceptional service.
author: Briana J.

description: We almost didn't stay because the line was out the door, it's a pretty small space, and there was very limited seating. I'm definitely glad we did stay though because everything was top notch. I had the French and fries and my husband had the Tejano. We both ordered the grass-fed beef. The quality and freshness of the ingredients definitely justified the price. For desert, I ordered the seasonal banana, chocolate, walnut shake which was absolutely fantastic. We weren't fans of the artisan sodas and would have been fine with a simple coke. For someone looking for a simple burger, this isn't your place. If you are a fan of unique gourmet toppings Roam Burger will be your favorite spot. I'd come back when in the SF area.
author: Rashea G.

description:
Bison burger to die for!!

I ordered the lettuce-wrapped bison burger, and it was simply divine.. a real feast of savory meat and wonderful sauce.  My daughter ordered the gluten-free beef burger, and it was good as well. 

The line was long, but in the end, we only waited about 20 minutes between arrival to being served.  Highly recommended
author: Laura S.

description:
1st visit to Roam...
Heather was our cashier and she took our order and provided solid recommendations from the large menu. Our Meals arrived quickly & presented well.
Very Clean & welcoming restaurant.

Price, was way too high. 3 Burgers, 2 fries, 1 draft beer, 2 wines came out to $90! I understand SF is expensive, but nearly $100 for burgers is unreasonable. I Would rate higher, 4-5 stars if their menu was more affordable.

Burgers are slightly too small, I had to order a second after finishing 1st. It was good, but bottom bun was too soggy, I recommend toasting the bun to avoid this.
Fries were ho-hum average.

Restaurant offers Multiple beers & neat old style hand made sodas/phosphates.
author: Mj L.

description:
Well.... The patty was not the best I've had. 

I had the French & fried. French fries in a burger. Ooh wow. 

I liked the bun the most. Nothing else about the burger was significant or memorable....
author: Michelle C.

description:
We enjoyed delicious burgers.  I had a bison burger with bacon wrapped in lettuce.  YJ had the beef burger tejano style on the traditional sesame seed bun.  We both liked our burgers very much and the truffle fries we ordered on the side.

My glass of zin was inoffensive.  I didn't expect a stunning wine list. Inoffensive seems a fair thing in a glass of wine from a burger joint, even a good one.

Ketchup, mustard, and house hot sauce all tasted good.  Again, what can one expect from these three go-to condiments?  Roam reminds me a bit of The Grove: clean, simple, good food at fair prices: nothing fancy, nothing amiss.  Great place to meet a friend for lunch or bring your family for what passes for an affordable meal in SF.
author: Scott C.

description: The quinoa burgers are insanely good. I especially like the coffee milkshake a lot. Fries were amazing as well. It's tough to choose, really!
author: Namrata J.

description:
It's expensive for a simple burger. I went to this place expecting a great burger but it is just a good one, not a awesome one. 
Nice place, pretty busy. They are very clean!!! Overall I liked.
author: Kleiton S.

description: Amazing gluten free bun, was soft and stayed together, but the veggie burger was crumbly and fell apart while I was eating it. Their pickles were great I recommend addicting pickles so any burger you get. I ordered caramelized onions on my burger but didn't get much while my friend got too much on her burger.
author: Arrieyana C.

description:
Roam is a great little burger joint that kind of reminds me of Shake Shack in New York with a better selection and your choice of patty. I got a classic beef burger with the fri-fecta and they were both great! And quite filling. It was such a juicy burger with great flavor. How can you beat that?
I also ordered a kid's shake that was salted caramel flavor and it was like drinking sweet sweet ice cream. Mmm. Definitely a great burger place to hit up in the SF area. And at a fair price for a restaurant burger. Perfect!
author: Jenn T.

description: We walked about 40 minutes from our hotel to come and try this place out, the line was out the door! So I may be basing my review a little to heavy on the expectations I had, but the burgers weren't anything special in my opinion  I wouldn't walk 40 minutes again haha...
author: Chase H.

description: Good food. Pricey. Noisy. One person serving at register during rush hours means long lines and long waits!
author: Tilly D.

description:
Hands down the best burger place I have ever tried in SF! I love burgers and fries as much as the next person. Try to beat the lunch/dinner rush because finding seats can be tough. 

The Sunny Side has: organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, and sweet chili sauce. The burger is delicious! There are many styles to choose from so don't be afraid to try something new. And if those aren't what you're looking for, you can always create your own. 

A burger meal isn't complete without fries right?! I recommend getting The Fry-Fecta, which is a combination of Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and Zucchini Onion Haystack - if it's your first time! This will allow you to have a little taste of each type. However, if you wanted to save a little, I'd say go for the Zucchini Onion Haystack because it is something different and fun! 

Go try this place now!
author: Breanna N.

description: Excellent every time.  Absolutely love their flavored sodas, veggie burgers and fries.
author: Laura C.

description:
Visiting San Francisco for work and found Roam on one of the blogs I follow. Holy yum, this burger was amazing. Seriously one of the best I've had.... and it's not just because I hadn't eaten in 8 hours. I ordered a winter special bison burger wrapped in lettuce and sweet potato fries. The winter special included arugula, quince spread, Brie and smoked bacon. 

I'll definitely try to come back again before I leave town!
