author: Samantha S.

description: I am in utter disbelief over how phenomenal the "French and Fries" burger is here. As a burger lover it's hard to really say there is one burger that's the best but this might really be it. I'm already dreaming of going back. Also all our food was delivered really quickly despite the place being absolutely packed. This place is run well!!!
author: Rachel P.

description: I've been to Roam a few times. I normally am not a huge fan of burgers - but when I crave them I gotta go to a great place; especially when I'm looking for interesting burger meats. When I heard my brother's were gonna come here to break their vegetarian diets I knew the experience was gonna slap. We ate hear around lunch time on Sunday on Pride weekend. I ordered the Sunny Side with Durham Ranch Elk meat and we shared a Farmers market Salad for the table. The salad was a great, refreshing start to the meal. Maybe a teeny but too much dressing for me, but for most people I think it would be fine. I also had a bite of the Seasonal Veggies which had a nice hearbal and salty flavor, more salt than I'd put into it, but still tasty. My first bite of the Elk burger was epic. The runny egg was messy and delightful and the meat was cooked exactly how I asked. The burger was a little small, but super delicious. I had a bite of my brother's Bison Tejano burger - very full of flavor, but my palate for bison is not super sophisticated so I don't really know how to assess how good it is. Anyway, I probably won't be back for a while - but if you are craving some tasty burgers in a spot with a good vibe. Come through.
author: Ibs A.

description:
Dear Roam's Kitchen Manager at the Fillmore Street location:

I support your sustainable food philosophy. I like your veggie burgers. I don't need to eat a big burger. But, I am frustrated with the same repeated mistake with takeaway orders. 

Most recent order: 

I ordered a veggie classic. 
I confirmed when the nice cashier read back the order. 
I made sure by checking the Square receipt.
I checked the sticker on the wrapped burger: Veggie Classic. 
I left the restaurant with takeaway in hand.

Later:  When I unwrapped the package, I got a beef burger. It went right into the compost because I don't eat beef. 

Two stars: One star for mixing up my order for the THIRD time for the same order at the same Fillmore location for takeaway: a beef burger in place of a veggie burger. Add one star for getting my spouse's turkey burger right and for Roam's philosophy of sustainable foods.

I got a refund after calling the restaurant; it sounds like you are used to mix-ups in the kitchen. Also, the fries were limp, a consistent problem likely with your fryer. I'm never going back to this Fillmore location again. Good luck, Roam enterprise, with the expansion.
author: M.D. L.

description:
Stopped by Roam on a Saturday night about 30 minutes before closing. The workers there were incredibly nice and patient. I seriously spent 20 minutes trying to decide what to eat and even though they were about to close, they let me stay and pick and helped while I bounced ideas off them (yeah I'm picky, I know). In my opinion, this place is a solid 4 stars. 

I ended up picking the French and Fries and the Tejano along with the Fry-fecta. The French and Fries has truffle parmesan fries inside the burger along with gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress and Dijon mustard. At Roam, they also have a variety of beers on tap and different meats, such as bison, beef and turkey. We went with the beef, medium rare, for the French and Fries and turkey for the other. 

The French and Fries was definitely the perfect burger for me. I love having avocado in my burger and I love anything truffle or parmesan flavored. The meat was cooked perfectly as well - I just love it when restaurants get the medium rare right. The only thing I would note is that the mustard flavor is definitely strong here. In my opinion, it doesn't compliment the rest of the flavor of the burger well and it is a contrast on the savory taste (in a bad way). I don't typically like mustard but I find that when the flavor is used correctly with the other flavors in the dish, I have no complaints. Besides the mustard, I would say the French and Fries was out of this world delicious.

The Tejano is definitely a Mexican inspired burger. It has pepper jack cheese, jalapeno relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips (kind of like tortilla chips) and herb ranch. This was totally my boyfriend's burger. I didn't get to try the japaeno relish since I'm pretty bad with spicy and especially hate jalapenos. The rest of the burger was pretty good. I definitely recommend this burger if you're into the Mexican flavor. The chips compliment the burger nicely and have a satisfying crunch as you bite into them. I wasn't incredibly impressed by the turkey meat, mostly neutral about it. From what I could taste, there was no extremely special flavor about it and I could have gone with beef instead. 

I can't end this review without putting a word in for the Fry-fecta. Man, I hate zucchini but those zucchini onion rings were out of this world. The flavor and breading was just fantastic. It really melted in your mouth and wasn't too oily and just perfect. (Dying just thinking about it.) The sweet potato fries were my second favorite in the trifecta of fries. The traditional russet french fries were my least favorite simply because they were a bit too salty. Overall, definitely would recommend getting the fry trio on your first time and seeing which one you like best. Roam is a great burger joint in San Francisco. It's not a formal sit-down restaurant. There's actually a counter where you order and you get a number so definitely recommend coming here after work or bringing some friends to grab a beer, watch the game and enjoy some damn good burgers.
author: Nancy T.

description: We really wanted to like this place, but we were so disappointed.  The burgers are mediocre, and the fries were over cooked.  Not to mention it's super over priced, long waits for a table, and parking is a nightmare.
author: Mariah And Myles ..

description: Overall pretty good burgers. I'm not going to say they are exceptional but you get good value for the money and my friends from out of the country really LOVED this place, if it was up to them we would eat here every day.
author: Gil S.

description:
Love Roam Burger! Definitely one of my favorite burger spots. 

I went all out and ordered their Sunny Side burger (fried egg, white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens and tomato), substituted herb mayo (instead of sweet chili sauce) and added bacon (extra $1). My burger was so flavorful and the patty was juicy. I was happy with the size of my burger and I was more than full. Their prices are reasonable - all specialty burgers are under $10 and add ons are $1.75 and under. I love that they offer several sauces and they're all free. Ask for the herb ranch with your fries.

Although the location is small and not ideal for large parties, I like that you order and pay at the register so you don't have to split the tab. The food comes out quickly and they quickly bus tables as well. Everyone I've encountered here is super friendly too. 

I've tried Roam a few years ago, but haven't revisited until recently. How did I forget how good Roam is? Parking isn't ideal and I don't frequently go to the city, but Roam makes a burger worth venturing out for.
author: Charlene E.

description: Overpriced burgers (2 for over $30) with small tasteless patties in soggy buns.  To top it off they nickel and dime you with that bogus "sf mandate" fee as if the fufu type restaurant they aspire to be.  More women then men here.  This is not a place for true burger afficiondos, more of a place for the trendy who like to think they are getting something good if they spend a lot.
author: Gibo M.

description: Best Burger in SF. Hands down. The bacon on my burger was perfect, thick and smokey.  Bun was fresh and beef patty was cooked perfect medium rare.  You will not be disappointed!!!
author: Tom G.

description:
This place is amazing! I'm glad I met up with my officemate to have early dinner/late lunch. She was raving about the gluten-free buns; I just needed a good burger! So happy we were able to share cos I also wanted to try their salad! We went with a simple burger for my first time: beef burger with bacon, white cheddar, and avocado (you can make your own burger). The meat was tender and very flavorful! It was juicy but not too oily. The bacon was perfectly cooked, not too salty or crispy, and the ratio of cheese to meat was on point. The burger was also the perfect size (well, we did half it. So, there was enough space for the other dishes.) Overall, the burger was probably one of the best "artisanal" burgers I have ever had!

We also ordered a side of the Fry-Fecta and a Market Salad (at this point in the trip, I needed all the veggies I could get!). The Fry-Fecta is a MUST EAT when you are at Roam! It's a combo of russet potatoes, sweet potatoes and zucchini all fried up to perfection with the right amount of salt and an awesome aoili dip. My gawd! Sooo GOOOD! The Market Salad was a mix of the fresh veggies they got that morning and it was HUGE! That was the very first time I ate raw radish and it was very sweet! The salad was tossed in a miso dressing which was perfect with the burger.

I never thought I would be able to go there since it is quite far from where I was staying. But, seriously, if you can, go here! The neighborhood is chill and I liked the vibe of this Roam branch! EAT HERE!
author: Joey R.

description: Very little wait on a Sunday night.  I really enjoyed my summertime burger! The ricotta was a really interesting addition that surprisingly worked well. It was the perfect size and after I finished, I didn't feel like I had grease clogging my arteries and coming out of my pores like I normally do after eating burgers. The zucchini fries were also pretty tasty. I thought they'd be "healthier" than the other two fries options but they're pretty similar to fried onion strings and the zucchini taste isn't that obvious. The burgers are kind of expensive for their size, but I almost don't mind because 1) this is SF and everything is overpriced, 2) it was the perfect size for me to feel full but not gross, and 3) we didn't have to wait 2 hours in line to eat!
author: Stephany L.

description: Hands down my all-time favorite burger place. I get the sunny side burger with bacon and it knocks my socks off every. single. time. The patty is perfect and juicy, cheese is melty, bacon is crispy, and top that with a nice sunny side up egg....*droool*! I have yet to find another place that does burgers as well as Roam does, and to be honest, I don't want to because every time I want an artisan burger, I will come to Roam. I even double posted a picture of my burger on Instagram, that's when you know I'm serious. The truffle fries are good also and pair perfectly with the burger. The location on Fillmore is nice and there's a cool, moderately hipster kind of vibe here. It's open and airy, perfect on a sunny day!
author: Cecille W.

description:
Mr & I just walked out of Kabuki & wanted to grab a quick something to  bring home - thankfully Roam was within easy walking distance

French & Fries Veggie Burgers - liked the combo of the mustard & the truffle flavor...even though it was light on the truffle.  Also, not a lot of avocado or discernible onions, but it was still an overall flavorful burger.  Seemed like the patty was homemade from a variety of veggies like beets, mushrooms, grains (maybe bulgur?)  Hard to tell since it was so nicely mashed together & this is a veggie burger you can eat with your hands or knife & fork.

Truffle Parm Fries - these fries got cold awfully quickly & even reheating them could not maintain the quickly escaping heat.  These smelled wonderfully truffly but was not so in flavor.  Maybe if we ate them right out of the fryer?

Pumpkin Spice Shakes - OMG were these shakes the bomb!  Super-dense, super-intense pumpkin flavor - super-yummy!!!

And let's just say that for 2 burgers, 2 fries & 2 shakes = $48 ( before tip ).......and for fast food, while I'm a fan, I just can't say that's as good as it gets
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I loved this place!

I got the burger with egg in it. It was so good. I like that they dont use iceberg lettuce but rather the leafy greens in salads. So many flavors pouring through the burger. Sister got the mushroom burger which was good. The fries are delicious too.

It was pretty packed and we (sister, corgi and i) managed to get seats outside.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I really enjoyed my meal at Roam. I ordered the classic beef burger and the seasonal vegetable which was brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious. The burger was juicy and I really liked the home made pickle that was on the burger. The Brussels sprouts were cooked nicely and very flavorful.
I like that the beef is pasture raised. The line to order was pretty long but it went quickly and we got our food a lot faster than I expected. 
We went here for dinner before catching a show at the Fillmore and it was a great choice. It's close, and the food is very good. They also serve craft beers and wine. Overall it was a good experience and I'm glad we chose this place to have dinner.
author: Patti M.

description: Fry fecta was the best thing I had that day. Burgers were perfectly seasoned and cooked through out evenly. Great place, will visit again
author: Daniel A.

description: Great burgers, great draft beer selections. It can be extremely busy here so if you're bringing kids along try to aim for off-peak meal times.
author: Joshua S.

description: Can't say the burgers are extraordinary in any way, but they do certainly hit the spot if you have a craving.
author: Howe L.

description: Roam holds a special place in my heart - the burgers (including the veggie burgers) are incredible, the service is fast and friendly, and the rest of the food and drinks are solid (including the house-made shakes and sodas! ). Absolutely love going here any time I want an amazing burger fast and without having to put on makeup or nice clothes (think: post-yoga burgers). The fries are the only thing I could do without (wish they were crunchier), but the custom seasonings make me come back for more every time regardless!
author: Claire S.

description: Amazing! Fresh ingredients! Definitely will be back. Enjoyed a gluten-free bun with my bison burger! Hubby had a sesame seed bun on his BBQ beef burger. And we shared the fries. Small dining area, but no problem getting our food or finding a seat to eat.
author: Rebekah R.

description:
Get the truffle fries ($4) here! They actually have a strong truffle flavor and are super addicting.

You order/pay at the counter and they deliver your food to you. The place itself is popular and gets crowded pretty quickly so you might have to wait for a table sometimes.

I ordered the sunny side beef burger ($10). It comes with a gooey egg, white cheddar, and caramelized onions. The egg was soo good with the beef. My boyfriend got the French and Fries ($10) which has truffle parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado, and caramelized onions. It was tasty but we both liked the sunny side a lot more!
author: Linda X.

description: I'm actually surprised with all the good reviews. Paying $17 for a regular burger and small shake I expect to be blown away. When I got my order I couldn't believe what I was looking at. A very small ass burger, thin patty and it looked like it had been smashed!!! Never ever again will I step foot in this place again. I would have been better off going to Burger King down the street! Also no flavor at all!
author: RD R.

description: It's not really what I was expecting. I do like that they have gluten free options! It's didn't quite hit the spot, but the staff was prompt and welcoming.
author: Candace K.

description: My favorite burger place in the city. The buns are so tasty and the flavor of the patty is so unique. No other burger places beat their gourmet burgers!
author: Clara L.

description:
As someone with celiac disease, I really appreciated the gluten-free burger bun Roam offered. Gluten-free buns are seldom sold at burger places and I am very buoyant whenever I find a place that has them. 

It is relatively casual and small. The restaurant is very clean and welcoming and I definitely recommend it. The burgers are always cooked the way you ask and they are never way undercooked or overcooked. They serve a lot of different kinds of meats (bison, beef, turkey, and veggie). I cannot speak for the bison, turkey, or veggie burger but the beef burger was simply delicious. 

Perhaps I'm being frugal, but the prices for this place are a bit exorbitant. The amount they charge for a burger is way too much. Even though the burgers are very palatable, it is not fully worth its price. 

Overall, I rate it 4 stars because it is a very good restaurant and it would be five if the price wasn't so extravagant.
author: Matias G.

description:
It has been 5 years since my last visit so I thought I'd re-review this place.

The standout item (and my husband agreed) was the veggie burger. The house made patty was made with quinoa, beets and some other goodies. It was just super tasty, especially when done in the Classic way (Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Onions, House-Made Pickles, House Sauce).

His beef burger (done Chalet) was pretty plain. None of the ingredients stood out and the patty wasn't juicy. For the price, Super Duper can do the beef patty better.

The price adds up FAST here. Classic burgers start at $8.49 but if want to get a certain style then it goes up to $10.49. If you want to add extra ingredients, it'll run you $1-1.75 each. Fries start at $3.49 but if you want to add things like truffle/parmesan, chipotle maple or dill malt vinegar, it's an extra $.75. You get the point. The only thing that's free are the sauces!

The Coconut Lime house made soda was soooo good though. I'd get this over the milkshake because you can get a good milkshake almost anywhere, but you can't get uniquely flavored sodas made in house! The fries were good too.

It gets busy here even on weeknights but the line moves fast and it's not hard to find a seat. Loud ambiance with a TV playing sports.
author: Shannon L.

description: It takes a lot to impress me with a burger but these guys are on point.  Everyone's food looked great and we all ordered something different.  Yes it's pricey but the quality is there and worth it
author: Dan Y.

description: First time visit but instantly one our favorite burger joints. We had the Tejano and the French and Fries. Our server told us they were her favorite two and we were very happy with our choices. Fries and sweet potato fries were also excellent.  You know how sweet potato fries seem to go soggy really quickly?  Not these. The chipotle hot pepper sauce they offer as a condiment was really good. Unfortunately I'd run out of fries by then so I just drank it out of the bottle.
author: Mat W.

description:
Expensive for what you get. 
A double patty burger can reach nearly $20 with all the fixings.

Quality can be inconsistent at times with cold fried onion/zucchini strings.
author: Evan W.

description:
My cousin usually has terrible taste, but these burgers were an excellent choice on his part. 

I got the French and fries burger and it was fantastic! Caramelized onions, truffle parm fries, avocado and gruyere?! Soooooo good. 
My only wish was that you could get bigger burgers! I came in starving, left a little hungry, but I didn't get any sides or anything.
author: Dillon G.

description: Exactly what the perfect burger & fries should be: fresh, tasty and clean! Great atmosphere - family friendly, casual and plenty of elbow room! The prices fit their  portions & yumminess perfectly!
author: Nick S.

description: We ordered 1 regular and 1 bison burgers, truffle fries and split a chocolate shake. It was good, and the shake was delicious but be ready for almost a $50 lunch. We arrived when it first opened so it was quick, and not too busy. I recommend getting there earlier because there is not a lot of tables. You walk up, order and take a seat (there are a few tables outside as well.) I would only come here on occasion because of the price-- you can find a good burger for less somewhere else.
author: Jen L.

description:
My family wandered in here very hungry and we were quite impressed by the variety of burger options. I liked that all ingredients are locally sourced, including the meat. The fries were light and perfectly salted with a dusting of herbs. There were a few quality beers on tap as well, but we opted for the shakes which were delicious! 
I liked the modern ambiance, and we quickly got seats at the bar- the food came in just about 5 minutes as they knew we were in a hurry. All staff was helpful and friendly. Overall it was a very nice experience!
author: Whitney B.

description: Welllllll, service is fast and friendly. The only downside is how loud it gets, because of small space. I mean what do I expect? It's San Francisco. Food is tasty.
author: Natalie B.

description: Small little place it's hard to find seating. The food is very good. It is over priced. That area is expensive but this place is pretty over the top price wise. We ordered 2 bison burgers, 2 fries, and 2 beers it came to $58. Glad I went but I won't go back.
author: Joe J.

description:
Wasn't very impressed. For the price I was expecting more but it just doesn't deliver on quantity or quality.

I got the Tejano burger with fries and a shake and if there was any saving grace, it was the milkshake.

The burger was forgettable at best and the chips inside it (it comes with fried tortilla strips inside) just made it feel really awkward to eat.

Fries were decent, but they're overhyped in my opinion.

The shake was really good though. Do yourself a favor and order a Salted Caramel milkshake, it's the only thing I'd go back for.

I dunno, for 20 dollars I expected better. I think I'll stick with In-N-Out.
author: Chris O.

description:
Been here twice now.  First time got the sunnyside burger with bison.

Bison was cooked a little drier than I usually like but still pretty flavorful. The truffles fries were too salty.  Other than that,  it wasn't too memorable.

This time was actually more disappointing than last time, ordered the Pacific blue burger with beef and asked for it medium rare. The person up front told me it wouldn't be red but would be more pink on the inside. She honestly seemed annoyed at all the patrons which didn't give off a good vibe. My burger came and it was completely well done and very dry this time. I had a bite of my girlfriend's bison autumn burger and it was decent but also a bit bland and very overcooked it also lacked pumpkin spread. The only upside was that the amount of cheese was decent on both burgers and the pumpkin pie shake was pretty tasty. 

I don't think I would come here again unless I was desperate.
author: Nat N.

description: Good burgers. Fast service. I had the egg on my burger and it was easy to eat and yummy! Washed it down with a drakes ipa and I was off onto my next task of the day. Plus on nice days you can sit outside.
author: Carly A.

description: The burger was good. I like the opinion they offer, but the employees are so rude and jerks. Especially the cashiers. I get that its busy but being rude doesn't make it better. The guy with the long man bun was a complete jerk. If you hate your job, customer service isn't the best for you. His service made the experience uncomfortable and rushed.
author: Ree G.

description:
Roam is the perfect place when you want a gourmet burger with a bunch of toppings for a decent price! I came here with my girl friend for a catch up dinner after work, and I ordered the sunny side burger with beef and a whole grain bun ($9.99). My friend and I also shared the fry-fecta ($6.75), which includes the zucchini onion strings, sweet potato fries, and russet fries.

You order, pay, they give you a number, and then you find a table. Luckily there were a few seats open at the bar, so we were able to find a table right after ordering! We got our burgers in a few minutes. The sunny side burger comes with a sunny side up egg, white cheddar, caramalized onions, greens, tomatoes, and a sweet chili sauce. When I took my first bite, I was in heaven!! The meat was juicy and I don't know if it tasted "grass fed" (i'm sure it was, I just don't know how that tastes haha), but I do know that it tasted DAMN GOOD! Loved the egg and the onions. One complaint I have though, is that there was not enough sweet chili sauce! I barely tasted it and I wish I tasted more... Sigh. That would bump this place up to 5 stars for me.

The fries were delicious as well. We loved the zucchini and onion strnigs, and even started adding it to our burgers for a nice crunch! The sweet potato fries were better than I expected. Very crunchy and not too sweet. The russet fries were okay and a little softer than the sweet potato. I like my fries crunchy so the russet fries were my least favorite. I heard if you add the truffle parmesan seasoning (extra $0.75), they're really good!

Service was friendly, and parking was not too difficult (or maybe we just got really lucky). I want to come back to try more of their burgers! All of them have such good sounding toppings!
author: Tara A.

description: Yum yum yum. Also, pasture raised beef? THANK YOU! Fries and drinks were great. Only bad thing is lack of seating.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
If you saw a girl walking around San Francisco proclaiming 'You have to try The Fry-Fecta', it was me. I've been craving Roam Artisan Burgers for approximately 365 days since my last visit to the US for two reasons: excellent gluten-free buns, and the chance to say 'Fry-Fecta' because who doesn't love a good food pun that also tastes good?

Roam Artisan Burgers on Fillmore Street is a welcoming place with cheery waitstaff, indoor and outdoor seating, and a kick ass burger menu.  You can choose from 100% grass-fed beef, free-range turkey, all-natural bison and a superiorly scrumptious veggie patty (beetroot, quinoa, herbs) which started this reviewer's Roam Burger cravings a year ago. 

The holy grail of the burger experience is the 'I can't believe it's not gluten' GF bun and of course The Fry-Fecta (russet, sweet potato and zucchini onion fries!) which will have you singing potato sonnets. We ordered the Market Salad which was a HUGE serving of seasonal produce like lettuce, radish, tomatoes, seeds and a zingy ginger miso dressing that balanced the burger deliciousness perfectly. 

Basically if you see a Roam Artisan Burgers, proceed to call it a meal time (I mean it's lunch somewhere in the world, right?) and indulge in crazy good burgers and fries!
author: Andjelka J.

description:
My life crossed paths with Roam on a weekend not too long ago. It was a serendipitous event as I unseemingly, unknowingly happened upon the burger joint. I won't bore you with the details, but basically I unexpectedly sat my hungry self down in their restaurant.

Yes, the burger menu looked great, but truthfully I can't remember what was on it. (Google it.) I wavered between a classic burger and one that was a bit more sexy like a cheddar, bacon, fried onion type of number and decided that conservative was the way to go. Simple is often times better. I nudged my co-worker in the arm and asked if he'd like to share some fries to which he said to me "oh I'm ordering one just for myself. I'll eat all of it." Just as well. He had his thick cut fries and I got my own order of sweet potato fries and the rest was history.

The meat was probably the best part of the burger. Buns are always of utmost importance, but all I can recall about that burger was how flavorful and moist it was from the juicy patty. I had the beef one, and the best way I can explain it is by saying how "loose" the meat was as opposed to the meat being super packed and dry. I'm not even all that big of a carnivore, but the quality was noticeable. Then of course there were the fries. I ordered them "extra crispy" so that I got the crunchy exterior with the hot, smooth interior. The fries were seasoned with what must have been simple salt and pepper and a touch of something else. Whatever it was, it was good.
author: Cici T.

description: This place was amazing! I definitely recommend the burger with the egg. I loved every bite. I tried the "Boylan Cane Cola" and it kind of tasted like what mens hair paste smells like, But the burger definitely made up for it. The lemon ginger drink was much better. The fries were really good as well.
author: Oscar M.

description:
Was in the Fillmore area and I had to check out Roam so that I could cross it off my burger joint "to try" list.  Upon entering, their menu board is on the wall and you place and pay for your order and then grab a table. There are tables looking out to Fillmore St., bar seats and tables and a large communal table on the left side of the dining room.

After a short wait, our order was brought to our table.

Chalet - Swiss, Crimini mushrooms, watercress, tomatoes, house sauce. Ordered medium, the 100% grass fed beef burger was juicy and very tasty.  The ingredients were very fresh. 

Sweet potato fries - not overly crispy and they were nicely seasoned.

Banana walnut shake - the shake made from organic ice cream was rich and thick.  Very good. 

Now that I've tried Roam, it is one of the better gourmet burgers that I've tried.  Checked off and on to the next burger to try.
author: Al L.

description: This is probably the best vegetarian burger that I've ever had! All of the ingredients were really fresh. Ordered with a side of truffle fries and blood orange soda. Highly recommend!
author: Maya M.

description:
12:00 p.m. - 4 People

1. Ambiance: Rustic casual with wooden tables and metal seats. The bar is vast with a full selection of drinks to choose from. There is an elongate community table that is set in the middle of this restaurant. Moreover, there are a few tables that are set against the wall. The seatings here are an abundance. It has a casual feel and very relaxed. 

2. Food: We ordered the Beef Tejano, Fry-Fecta (Sweet potatoes, parmesan fries, string fries), Beef Heritage, Turkey Heritage. The meat were so juicy and fresh. A lot of places struggle with creating a perfect turkey burger, but this was perfect. It was not dry at all and full of flavors. The Heritage consists of bacons that are extra crispy and thick. The Beef Tejano had a crunch to it because of the chips. It was delicious with great combinations. 

3. Service: Service was fast and friendly. Caroline was very patient with us of our orders as we have never been here before.  You order your meat and the different styles of burgers. The styles are listed via the board on the right side before the checkout counter. 

4. Costs: The Fry-Fecta was $6.75 and the burgers were $9.99. The portions were fulfilling and so worth every penny.

5. Overall Experience: I am in love with this burger joint. I had Umami and Gott's before and this is hands down, a winner from the pack. It is delicious and has a lot of fresh ingredients. I love their burger joint concepts/set ups. I had a great experience at Roam and will definitely come back. 

Side Notes: n/a
author: Chau P.

description: Omg this place is AMAZING. My husband and I are visiting San Francisco for the first time and were craving burgers. The staff here were super friendly, the food came fast and it was delicious, especially the burger and mint shake. Wish they had these in Southern California!
author: Riley M.

description:
Pretty darn good burger place on Fillmore. Most notable thing is the value - for about $10 you get a very decent burger plus fries. Deal! Also, it's a small local chain with stores on Fillmore, on Union, and now in Lafayette. Go locals!

The concept is simple: you choose your burger style (meat - style - sauce), grab a seat, and get the order right to the table. Similar to Smashburger and others.

Their styles are unique though: I especially enjoyed my TEJANO (pepper jack, jalapeño relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, herb ranch, $10)), since I like things on the spicier side. 

Second favorite must be the HERITAGE (applewood smoked bacon, fontina, butter lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions, herb mayo, $10).

The TRUFFLE FRIES were nicely salted and easy to grab.

The food came fast; water and ketchup is available for free.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Still good and decent. 

They have a simple kids menu (plain burger or grilled cheese) with a drink and an option of carrots and cucumber sticks as a side. Cucumber sticks! There were a lot of other families when we arrived, so it was nice to know we weren't the only ones not giving our kid a home cooked dinner that night.

Lettuce wrapped burgers are an option if you want to skip buns. Or you can just dissect it slowly while telling your friend how full you are, like the chicks at the table behind me did. (Utensils available at the help-yourself area)

Still great curated beer selection. 

They clean the tables rather quickly after people finish, so even if it looks super busy, a free and clean table doesn't require a massive and awkward wait.
author: Loli L.

description: Go-to neighborhood burger joint. For a healthy option - My boyfriend and I like the house market salad, turkey burgers, & the vinaigrette. Big portion sizes, love the radishes and nuts included.
author: Rashi K.

description:
After reading all the great reviews, I had to try Roam... And I'm so glad I did! 

Hubby & I went for lunch I had the Heritage with Bison and he got the Pacific also with bison. Both burgers were cooked perfectly. There's nothing bad I could say about both of these burgers. From the bun to the toppings to the meat, everything was oh so delicious! 

We also shared the Fry-fecta which was the perfect side "fries". I'm usually not a fan of sweet potatoes but these were well seasoned and absolutely tasty! 

We can't wait to come back soon!
author: Tamara S.

description:
i just ate an artisan burger at roam and i'm STARVING.  you know what it reminds me of?  when i used to live in LA and i'd order a bagel and cream cheese.  there was such a teensy amount of cream cheese you could still see the bagel.  i'd be like "what am i on a diet or something?"  

that burger was the size of what you'd get at mcdonalds.  and let me tell you, i'm petite.  it's unheard of for me to finish a meal at a restaurant.  yeah, i was hungry but it wasn't like i hadn't eaten all day.  after i finished my burger at roam, i was thinking about getting a slice of pizza.....except the whole idea  of having a burger and pizza for dinner is just absurd.

that being said, the burger tasted good....even though they forgot my gruyere cheese.  i don't know, maybe they gave me a kids burger even though i asked for a grown up burger.  regardless i will never eat there again.  that tiny burger broke my heart.
author: lori s.

description:
Overall, this place serves a decent burger, only the bun was lacking in quality.

This place gets busy fast so you know it provides a great meal. There are a lot of preconfigured burger choices and failing that you can always build your own.

I got the classic burger with swiss cheese which tasted really good. My only complaint was I would have preferred a higher quality bun. The bun is the backbone of a burger and the standard plain white sesame seed bun just doesn't cut it. It would be great if they could offer a choice of buns to suit a wider variety of tastes.

When I go back next time I want to try one of their milkshakes!
author: Thewanderingmutt B.

description:
I've gone here a few times, and they've been sporadic visits, so I've forgotten what I had gotten the past couple times! Recently, I went with my sister on a Thursday evening (6pm-ish?) and it was super crowded. 

FOOD: I opted for a sunny side on turkey and it was good, but it wasn't the greatest I've had. The fry-fecta (russet fries, sweet potato fries, + zucchini/onion strings) is something I always get to share with my party and it's just enough (if not too much), which is great.
I've had their passion fruit shake (summer 2015 seasonal shake) which was so good I got another one before leaving, and recently tried their raspberry soda (summer 2016 seasonal soda)! The latter was tangy, sweet, extremely carbonated, and topped off with a slice of lemon (yum). 

SERVICE: Servers are always nice here, I don't know why people give them a hard time (or anybody that has to work with serving others). They're the sweetest peas, very accommodating, and always take the time to make sure that your (my) meals are up to satisfaction before leaving me to gobble it all down. 

MISC: Street parking is always an ail. Be prepared to have to take your food to-go, or wait an ample amount of time for a table to clear!! 

TLDR: YES, GOOD STUFF. ALSO, BE NICE TO THE SERVERS THEY'RE JUST PEOPLE JEEZ !!!11
author: Jennifer T.

description: Oh so good! The classic veggie burger was just perfect! The pickles are just the right amount of sour and sweet and balance perfectly with the house sauce which is vegan! The veggie patty is super yummy, not that gross fake meat tasting. The servers are super friendly and accommodating too!
author: Bonito B.

description:
This burger place has been on my list for a while so glad I finally got to try. The burger was pretty good but it's not so good that I wanna go back. My natural  inclination is to compare this place to Unami Burger.. And I definitely like Umami better! Its just so much more satisfying to me (specifically the Truffle Burger). 

The salted caramel shake here is bomb! I'd come back just to get this shake to-go!
author: Oanh L.

description:
These burgers are straight up solid. The staff is usually friendly and they have great options for burger substitutions. Plus they even have vegetables and meat patty on the salad options. Very San Francisco.

The reason I go for the 4 star in stead of 5 is the price and speed. It takes quite a while for food to come out, and it's just a bit too pricey for what you get. Especially if you order just a patty.
author: Marie M.

description: Really loved this spot! Not sure how I had never been here before. After a lot of back and forth, I finally decided to order the Sunny Side burger with beef and it was so freaking flavorful, juicy, and delicious, with so many toppings! Plus my friend and I were indecisive about the fries too, but not to worry! This restaurant is an indecisive person's dream AKA the fry-fecta (russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack). Top it all off with a glass of cab and I was in heaven.
author: Ilana B.

description: Cool atmosphere and great burgers! Got a show at the Fillmore? Enjoy the short walk to Roam. It was super busy. The line was almost out the door but that proves you're about to embark on something really special right?!
author: Corey S.

description:
We walked in and I was overwhelmed by the amount of people in the place. I just knew it was going to be fantastic. And it was exactly that. 

We got the Chalet Bison burger to share. They offered to cut the burger in half for us. Not many places will offer that for us. I appreciate it every time. The burger was cooked perfectly and the mushrooms were a great texture. I do wish the Swiss cheese was a bit more melted. 

We splurged and opted for the Fry-Fecta. This came with a decent size of their sweet potato fry, russet potato fry, and zucchini. Zach, not being a zucchini lover, said the zucchini fry was his favorite. 

We got our food in wicked fast time and we were greeted with a smile. If I lived in San Francisco, I'd come here on a regular basis!
author: Erin D.

description: i knew this place was gonna be a dime before i even ate here cuz it charge me half a dime when i came w my pops and if it wasn't poppin i was gonna have to sue so imma end up good either way. luckily, i ain't had to get the lawyers involved cuz this goddam burger might have saved my fkn life. so u know, i was looking a lil hungry after church today i said "ahhh lemme get sum breakfast" so i'm come thru to cop a burger. same old. so u know i get them regular fries, lemonade on the rocks no fizzle (cuz i ain't 21), and a french fries bison burger (i recommend getting beef not bison). muthfkr said $25. i almost asked if i could pay in tears btch WTF.. but we ain't broke out here since i left my ex btch so it's more for me feel me i copped that order so fast. i sat, homie politely brings it over. i commence. i'm done now. would come again
author: Jose S.

description: Expensive.  Burger was bland, fries were soggy.  Not terrible but not quite worth the price.  Service was good, people were nice.
author: Raul D.

description: This place is great but one time they got my order wrong and sometimes I see people get the order wrong and the wait is long and the drinks are so expensive
author: Madeline X.

description:
Probably one of the best burgers I have ever had. 
I know it may be a little hyperbolic, but I could not stress enough how amazing this burger was. You can tell that cow was a happy cow just by how fresh the meat tasted. I believe I ordered one of their originals, the name has slipped my mind, but the cashier did say it was featured on Food Network - so you know it's gotta be good. 
The seating is a little scarce, and hard to find, but when you do find seating be prepared to be nice and cozy with your neighbor. It is a pretty compact location. My friend and I actually relinquished part of our table to another couple since there really was nowhere for people to sit. We did have the pleasure of being diagonal from an adorable little girl though, so it wasn't all too bad.
Also: BE PREPARED FOR A LONG LINE - but don't be discouraged, it's worth the wait.
author: Zeaba S.

description:
First off, I don't eat meat.

I had the veggie burger and it was amazinnnnggg. The red color threw me off but don't let it - it was delicious.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
If you are the search for the best burger in the Bay Area, your journey must bring you here at least once. 

It's a relatively small joint, order at the register, grab a number, place on your table-type of establishment. Get your own water, utensils... No frills, get er' done. 

We had two burgers (both beef, which I would argue that there is not other way). Chalet and Tejano.

Chalet - The burger itself was cooked to a medium-medium well. Great meat quality and seasoned well. Definitely NOT a dry meatloaf. The toppings: mushroom, swiss cheese, tomato, house sauce - all very good. However, not executed perfectly, and in fact, in combination, left me wanted more in my burger. Which brings me to....

Tejano - AWESOME. Much better then the chalet. Beef cooked similar, which is top-notch. The combo of the Pepper Jack cheese, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch melded together in a wonderful harmony. Just enough crunch from the corn strips to let you know there is substance, and enough moisture to say, "Hey, I'm a juicy burger." Loved it.

Can't forget the Fry-Fecta. Chose the Truffle Parmesan for the russet fries, probably best decision made that day. Total truffle umami heaven. Zucchini stack was delicious. Could do without the sweet potato fries - they were forgettable. 

Will try this place again in a heart beat if I want a burger. Do you have any other burger places that are must haves in the Bay Areas? Let me know.
author: Edward L.

description:
What fantastic burgers! The whole concept--open seating, order at the counter--reminded me a lot of Greenburgers, which was in Lower Haight, but I liked Roam's burgers way better.

THE WAIT: At about 2:30pm on a Sunday, they had a line from the counter to the front door, but it moved fast (under 5 minutes). We easily found a table for 2 afterwards. It's busy here but the turnover is fast.

THE COST: $37.13 for 2 burgers, a small shake, & a large side. Pricey for a burger spot, but worth it.

* Bison Sunny Side (bison. $12.24) - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA#z6dpjwbSuZuI4zlPnzho5w
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA#iyQCoCannuXu6Ut9_N7qGg
YUM. Can't summarize it better than that. The bun: lightly toasted, chewy on the inside, fresh. The patty: medium-rare to perfection, tender. The egg! Oh that oozing, dripping egg yolk over my burger... it was all fantastic.

* Pacific Blue (beef. $9.25) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA#jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA
Also fantastic, perfect for my boyfriend, the blue-cheese-burger-lover. The caramelized onions are a big part of the fixings, so make sure you like that in a burger if you order this!

* Coconut Shake (12 oz. $5.95) - 3.5 stars
You could barely, barely taste the coconut. Mostly this tasted like a vanilla shake. A good vanilla shake, thick and dense, but we didn't get the enjoyment from the unique coconut we were hoping for.

* Fry-Fecta ($6.25) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA#9xrPnfAUykbAIYM_ZFOcWQ
I loved that there was an option to try all 3 sides! But this is pretty huge; almost too much for two of us. I surprised myself by liking the fried onions the best; these were mostly crisp but just worked really well. The sweet potato & garlic fries could've used more crisp.

Our receipt: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=jZU7e8byuQD_4m17hyCSJA#9D8NtER3XyqqVzHB7E-NgA
author: Ziyan C.

description: Not coming here sooner was my biggest mistake. Friendly service, you can choose the type of meat and the cook you want on it, and the sides are phenomenal. I had the pacific blue burger and we split the zucchini hatstack which SHOULD NOT be missed. Should have not split it. Will be back decidedly soon.
author: David K.

description: I love this place. Ive probably eaten here 30 times. Amazing Bison burgers.
author: Ryan P.

description: I tried this spot a couple days ago. I had the veggie burger(French and Fry style) with a side of regular fries. It was definitely one of the best veggie burgers I have had in a long time.  I feel like this place is basically Farmburger from Berkeley. My friends all had meat based burgers that they enjoyed. Still on the hunt for a ridiculously good veggie burger. The search continues...
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Oh my goodness!!!!!!!! 
This place is amazing! All the cool kids in town come to this spot which explains why seating is always tight but it is well worth it! They even allow you to create your own burgers.
author: Mel L.

description: BEST BURGERS EVER FORREAL. AND FRIES. WOWIEEEE. What's even more exciting is they have gluten free buns!! That taste good!!!!!! Definitely stop here if you have a chance. Service is super fast and staff is awesome.
author: Paige D.

description: Got a beef Classic burger and tri-fecta of fries.  Sweet potatoes fries were good but the regular fries and the zucchini fries were meh.  The burger itself was also meh. I personally would not come back here again even though the prices were reasonable and place were nice.
author: Mark K.

description:
I came to Roam Artisan Burgers before, and did not have a good experience unfortunately. After seeing amazing things about it on Instagram and Yelp, I was expecting more. However, my boyfriend and I decided to give it another try, and this time, I had an AMAZING experience.

I got the sunny side burger, and oh my gosh. No words. I was just in love with every single bite, and when it was gone, I seriously wanted another one. Last time I got an egg, the egg was so fried and left an oily residue in my mouth. The turkey patty was also more on the dry side, and everything kept falling apart. I think I just got unlucky though, because this time, the egg wasn't super fried. It was just ready to pop! Just the way I like it! The turkey burger was more juicy this time for sure. 

The staff my last visit and this visit were nice, so that didn't change. But that's a good thing because I already always feel taken care of and important to the staff.

My boyfriend had a good experience both times we went though, so I was just an unlucky customer that one day, I guess. I would come here again though, and would definitely recommend Roam to my friends. 

Oh and the fries were so good too. Super fresh, and lots of flavor for such simple garnishes.

Love it! Can't wait to come back.
author: Hana B.

description: Amazing burgers and my husband doesn't even eat beef. Personal shout out to Fabian who is always so friendly and welcoming. Don't think I've ever been to another burger place as friendly as this. Service on point, food on point. Always recommend this place to friends. Thanks Fabian!!
author: N C.

description: These are the best burgers in San Francisco and possibly California. The staff is friendly and prompt, the drinks are great and the food is amazing. They have options for all people whether you are vegan or a meat lover.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Don't get too crazy on your order, friend ordered Elk Blue Cheese burger and couldn't eat it (too much, too gamey). 
Stuck to my egg fried turkey burger and was not disappointed.
author: Kerry G.

description:
I recently came here with a few friends for dinner on a Saturday night. It's fairly small, but we were able to get a table right away after ordering at the counter.

I ended up getting the veggie burger version of the French and Fries - gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, dijon mustard, and... truffle parmesan fries! Yum! I was lured in both by the fries and the avocado, and was not disappointed. The veggie burger itself was also really good - definitely not just a frozen patty. It was a little hard to really taste the fries once they were mixed in with all the other ingredients, so I'm willing to try another burger next time I come. My friend and I also split a chocolate hazelnut shake (the monthly special), which was delicious.

All in all, this is a solid choice for a fancier burger joint. A bit pricy, but to be expected in the city. It definitely doesn't break the bank, especially for dinner.
author: Dylan C.

description: Overpriced. Patty was minuscule and overall just not that tasty. Spent $20 something for a burger, fries and soda.
author: Stephen H.

description: Delicious burgers (and more) in a great location. The burger and ingredient quality at Roam is really top notch. You can order one of the pre-made options or create your own. You might think you don't need to order the fry-fecta, but you'd be wrong. My friend also raves about the chocolate shakes, so you might as well order one of those too!
author: Emily F.

description: Came here because it's close to my office and I have to say, they're burgers are pretty good. Very juicy burger and the fries were great just extremely salty hence took a star off and also the fact that they have their own coke and soda which is never good. Other than that everything else was great. Wonderful service and the burger came super fast.
author: Shanzay H.

description: Came here with my 8 year old son and we both agreed this is our favorite burger place ever! I'm gluten free and they catered for my needs extremely well. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Come try it!
author: Nuria K.

description:
This place was just ok,

Definitely a good burger, but it wasn't anything had me in awe. Ordered the "french and fries" style burger, which includes gruyere cheese, dijon mustard, and grilled onions. 

The zucchini onion haystack is worth a try, if you're tired of the run of the mill french fries and sweet potato fries.

The "seasonal" milkshake was the hazelnut chocolate (wasn't expecting a large to cost just under $7).

Wood-happy interior design, very sexy. 
Overall, I'd describe this to be a pricier/stylishly up-to-date Johnny Rockets.
author: Aaron C.

description: One of the worst burgers you can probably get in a very uncomfortable place. I tried the beef sunny side and the wild boar pacific blue. The meat had very little seasoning, the caramelized onions were boiled and not caramelized, the egg was overcooked and both burgers were very greasy and soggy. The shake was actually an icecream.
author: Andrei M.

description:
Everyone here is super friendly and the service is great. So far, these are my fav burgers in SF. I love the variety and quality. (Also a fan of their Barbera. Nothing beats a glass of red wine paired with a medium rare burger!)
Veggie burger is surprisingly good as well, just don't unwrap it. It will fall apart without the paper around! 
Did I mention they have a burger with truffle and brie cheese? Amazing.
author: Emily H.

description:
I came for the fries: FRY FECTA ($6.25)
-Russet potato fries
-Sweet potato fries
-Zucchini onion haystack 

LOVED IT!!!! Didn't taste salty or greasy at all. We finished the whole thing (duh). I thought it was going to be bigger than it was, but I suppose they portioned it well because we really only came for a snack because we had 5 hours to kill before dinner lol..... but then my boyfriend's humongous ass had to order a burger. 

He ordered the sunny side turkey burger ($9.25). I wasn't in the mood to try it since I didn't want to be too full, but here's his take on it: the first turkey burger I've ever had and it was awesome. 

^ lmao, ok. Anyways, the place is pretty tiny and the line was out the door. Really crowded because there was a handful of small families with strollers and tiny people. Thankfully, one of my special skills came in handy (I don't have many) and we found a place to sit right away! Otherwise, we would've just taken it to go. 

The food came out in about 10-15 minutes!
author: Leana E.

description:
I've lived right near Roam for a little while now, from the outside there was just never anything that made me want to go in. 

First I had a mint chocolate shake. It was pretty good. Lots of chocolate chunks and it left me refreshed. If recommend stopping by to grab one. 

The second time I got the Farmer Market sales, which rotates in season. It had nice chunks of avocado on it and a ton of really dark greens (which I much prefer to iceberg lettuce). Overall it was a good salad. Another member of my party got a burger. It didn't look like anything special, but I'm picky with burgers.
author: Matt F.

description: Delicious tejano burger with big avocado and tasty jalapeño relish. The fries are fantastic and the ginger lime drink was so much better than I had expected
author: Audis V.

description: My absolute favorite burger place in San Francisco.  A must try if you are in the area
author: Deanna J.

description: I love simple and tasty burgers and this place delivers. The burgers themselves were delicious and the fries didn't disappoint either. The service was impeccable particularly since they were super busy (lines out the door and I can see why). Worth lining up for, delicious!
author: Kath L.

description:
Yummy! I like this trendy spot.

I like that you can pick from different kinds of meat and style. I like all the different options. It just taste really fresh. I got the burger with the mushrooms and then the fries platter to share.

The burger didn't look that big but it was really filling. It's not too much but not too little either. It's just right. I didn't feel like a grease ball after eating it.

Great spot if you want a quality burger with lots of options.
author: Jessica S.

description: Nothing really amazing about this place . Taste like an expensive Carl's or Burger King burger . Services is good and customer services . Good burgers just to pricey and nothing different then going to a regular place u can walk in or drive thru
author: Ivan M.

description:
My friend and I decided to try this place out. We got here around 5 for and early 4th of July dinner. The venue is a little small with limited seating but them ambience was uplifting and bright.
I ordered the vegan burger Tejano style with a gluten free bun, a side of the Fry-Frecta, and their seasonal Banana Walnut chocolate Chip shake.

 The banana walnut chocolate chip shake was thick and creamy! The taste of the banana was strong and there were bits of walnut in the shake, but I taste much of the chocolate chips even though there were some bits of it in there.

My friend and I split the Fry-Frecta and it was amazing. It came with regular seasoned fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini fries. My favorite out of the three was the zucchini, it was light and seasoned perfectly.

The vegan burger Tejano style with a gluten free bun was really unique. The protein they used was seasone quinoa which I found had a very interesting texture. I was impressed with their gluten free bun, it was thick and soft and kept the toppings in place. The Tejano style came with avocado, pepper jack, jalapeño relish, tomato, white corn strip, and herb ranch. I liked the white corn strip gave it a little crunch and their jalapeño relish mixed in a kick of spice. 

Overall this place is great if you're looking for a new burger joint to try out! Will be coming back here again!
author: Michele W.

description: The turkey burgers here are pretty decent. I loved the sweet potato fries! It was pretty packed when I went, and it seems like they always are so good luck finding a seat! I wish they offered a special sauce for the sweet potatoes fries. I would like to come back and try the regular hamburgers in the future.
author: Auriyon J.

description: Wow! Burgers were AMAZINGLY GOOD! It was so hard choosing one, they all sounded good! i went with the French and Fries burger, bomb.com! Service was great and fast. The cashier was very nice. Next time i am in SF i will most def make it back here!
author: Cristina L.

description:
MY FAVORITE BURGER SPOT IN THE CITY. No lie.

My first time coming here was for my birthday and ever since then, this place has  earned my pedestal for top burger in the city. 

My go to meal combination is the following:

TEJANO BURGER (Medium):
Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch. BOOM. For me, it's balanced in fixins offered, taste, and texture. Some places add a lot of stuff...you get distracted with all the bells and whistles, but this offers a well balanced experience with a crunch (literally). You know it's good when you don't need to add or alter anything. No ketchup needed.

Russet Fries w/ Truffle Parmesan:
I've tried all three sides and this takes the cake for being the best pairing for me - taste and ease (that zucchini onion haystack, but difficult to eat with just fingers). If you are indecisive, the fry-fecta allows to have the best of all worlds.

The cherry on top and last element to complete the meal is that they serve Allagash White on tap.

Thinking about it now...I'm salivating. Until next time, Roam. I'll be back!
author: Vincent L.

description:
I had heard so much about this place, and the "good for vegetarians" rating on Yelp prompted me to try it out. It has a very casual ambiance, they have some tables set up for outdoors and have open seating. You order first and take a table as soon as one opens up. They bring your order to you when it is ready. By the looks of it, it felt like a cool funky burger joint.

The food, turns out, is not that great. I tried the classic burger with a vegetarian patty, the patty was quite bland and tasteless. I took some jalapeno relish as a side (they have a great collection dips and sauces), that was delicious. My partner got a heritage burger which he did not finish coz it was bland too. We got a strawberry milkshake and sweet potato fries with herbs - both were perfect. They have a small selection of wines and beers.
author: Reema B.

description:
Visiting my friends in SF and went here after Sunday service. Pretty upbeat vibe. Person taking your order at the register was also very cheerful. I ordered an original (?) burger with Gruyere cheese and sweet potato fries! Once you place your order they give you a number and bring out your food. There were no individual tables free, so my friends and I sat at the community table. 

I must say this was one of the best burgers I have had! And it's not overwhelming - so no food coma after. Sweet potato fries were good as well. Nothing out of the ordinary with that. But the burgers - legit!!!
author: Esther K.

description:
I love the zucchini fries here. The zucchinis are cut so thin that you can't really taste it - you taste more of the batter instead, and I'm not complaining. It's delicious! 

All the burgers I've ordered were a hit - sunny side, chalet, tejano. Nothing to complain about. 

The farmer's market salad was okay. It wasn't memorable but it wasn't bad. I probably wouldn't order it again. 

The zucchini fries are what keeps me coming back and the fact that the burgers are great too make this a good place to go to whenever I'm feeling for something unhealthy.
author: Michelle T.

description: It was fine. I had a grilled cheese with onions, the parmesan fries, the onion/zucchini frizzles and a house made soda. The zucchini was by far the best thing I ate, everything else was only fine.
author: Colleen R.

description:
What a great local burger joint in this neighborhood. Gourmet burgers made with perfect flavor combinations. Each was unique and authentic. You order and they bring them to you. The cashier was super patient explaining all my questions and even made some suggestions.

Truffle parmesan fries, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, Dijon mustard for a burger? Yep, everything in the French & Fry burger which the Mister ordered. My older son played it safe and ordered the Classic while my younger son chose Heritage for the bacon. I went for the Chalet since I'm a mushroom lover. Everything was made fresh. Everyone pretty much demolished his/her burger in a quick minute. We shared a bowl of Tri-Frecta since we couldn't decide what fries to order. All three: regular french fries, sweet potato fries, and fried zucchini strings - were very good.

Who puts french fries and avocado in burgers? Roam does. Are they yummy? You bet, unhealthy but delicious!
author: Em T.

description: Absolutely phenomenal. I was craving a burger, so we popped in for dinner. We've walked by this place so many times, and never knew what we were missing. Delicious. The bison burger is fabulous. The sweet potato fries are divine. Highly recommended. Be prepared for many options.
author: Erin D.

description:
This is a casual dining spot for interesting burgers, salad and fries with several beer and wine options on tap. The venue is stylish with wood accents throughout and a large amount of seating. When I arrived, I ordered my meal at the counter and was given a number to put on the table of my choice. 

I got the bison "French and fries" burger which was topped with Gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions and truffle fries. The burger was cooked perfectly with good flavor! I got the seasonal vegetables on the side- squash, kale, hazelnuts with a tahini sauce. It was delicious but such a tiny plate for over $5! 

The meal was amazing but quite costly at $20 for a burger and a tiny cup of veggies. I would definitely go back again but not frequently because I doubt my wallet could handle that!
author: Charlotte A.

description:
Situation 
- Lunch with a friend on a Saturday
- Ordered the Turkey Heritage Burger

Pros
- They take credit cards
- The burger was really good. 
- Friendly staff
- Some really good beers on tap

Cons
- There can be a lot of people and it can seem a bit chaotic
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Their burgers hit the spot!

Wow such high grade quality meat. I swear every bite I took was smooth and delicious. From the soft sesame buns, fresh dark green butterhead lettuce, sweet & crisp applewood Bacon, and juicy beef Patty, this place made my trip out to sf. Definitely worthy of at least 4/5 stars. 

It's a pretty popular place too with lines out the door. Over here water is self served, and tables are up for grabs. If you can find an empty seat for yourself, take it. Although, I really do wish they would seat you instead. I came in around 8pm on a Friday, and it's still packed.

I got the Heritage Burger. 

Honestly I came for the French and Fries Burger, but the ingredients in this burger sounded way too good to pass up. I was not disappointed.  A bit oily for a burger, but still a really good burger.

Best decision of the night.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Food:
Tried the Tejano beef burger. We had such high hopes for this place but there simply wasn't that much flavor. The burger seemed of good quality, but considering all the toppings and the cost of this burger sans fries, it really was not worth it.

Service: 
This is probably the worst part. I wouldn't have thought that we'd have an issue from a place where you order at the counter, but we did. Two of us arrived and sat at a table for four while we waited for the other two in our party. After sitting for just a few minutes, a staff member came over and rudely said, "If you don't order something, we're going to make you leave." Granted, I completely understand that they didn't want someone taking up a table for nothing. And as a paying customer, I appreciate that they don't let people loiter or save a table for an extended period of time without ordering anything. However, we truly had only been there a few minutes (obviously I was watching the time because we were waiting for two others in the group) and we weren't just looking for a place to hang out or study--we were there to dine.

Ambiance:
The design of this place is pretty cool and casual. They have a nice open window area in the front without any glass so it feels like you're dining outside.
author: Susan G.

description:
Businesses seem to go through a common cycle.  At first, when the new venture is opened, they can't thank you enough for your patronage.  As the business builds, however, the 'thank-you' sincerity wanes and eventually, like today, the young man who took our order accepted payment and was barely able to bring himself to speak - so instead of 'thank you' it was simply, "Fifteen minutes".  Upon which, I had no further value to him.  No thank-you, no smile, not even the remotest polite expression.  Just 'fifteen minutes' with body language saying, "I'm through with you now, move away from me".   The burgers aren't cheap, are good but are not  award winners, and the members of the staff aren't showing much appreciation for their customers' patronage- especially this guy on this day.  


Update:  went back today.  The snooty guy  I complained about previously wasn't there but the young woman who was could not have been nicer.  I think these folks do care about their customers but must have had a guy working that day who was too good for the job.  We'll be going back for the good burgers.
author: Joe M.

description: Overpriced but tasty. The lady at the front seemed annoyed by everyone, or something like that. The food and the people going around cleaning were super nice.
author: Paulo R.

description: Wow! Fantastic tasting burgers and fries. Different kind of meat to choose from. I had the wild boar burger. The chipotle maple sweet potato fries were out of this world, thin and the perfect crispness.
author: Janelle F.

description: I ordered the French and Fries with sweat potato fries. Burger was over-seasoned and the fries were a bit undercooked but it was okay. At least they had a burger with fries already in it which is what I normally do anyway. They have a few beers on tap and more bottled options. The staff was very nice.
author: Ramon F.

description:
Lunch here is worth finding a place to stash your car in this difficult to park neighborhood.

This is a gluten sensitive and vegan friendly place, which is a huge bonus ( yes, you pain in the neck friends, we can go out for dinner!)

Atmosphere: So yeah, there are some screaming kids, and a bunch of hipsters, but there are normal people too. There is communal seating, bar seating, and also two and four tops. The bathrooms are clean and modern. Music is 90's top 40s which works for me.

Service: Order at the counter and they'll bring you food. Everybody is pretty friendly, and helpful if you have questions.

Food:  Yum. Really. I like the giant salad, the fry-fecta ( regular fries, sweet potato, and zucchini shoe strings) and all of the burgers. I've had the burger with bacon, the blue cheese one, and the basic. They are all good. One warning-if you get a gluten-free bun eat fast cuz it's gross when it sogs out.
author: El B.

description: Heaven on a bun!!!  These burgers are simply to die for with the perfect blend of comfort food and over the top indulgence with the gourmet toppings.  The "fry-fecta" is a must- three of the tastiest sides (sweet potato fries, regular fries, and zucchini curls).  I wish I didn't have to drive all the way to The City for one of these babies, but the hour-plus drive from the South Bay is worth it!!  So good!
author: Annette A.

description: We got the beef Tejano burger and the beef Heritage burger with russet fries. Good ingredients, but prefer the moist meatiness of Super Duper double patty burgers. The thick buns took flavor away from the ingredients. The fries weren't super crispy, again better at Super Duper. The meal here did not hit the spot :(
author: Olivia A.

description: I went to this place so many times that I feel bad for not leaving a review for this place. I absolutely love the sweet potato fried here. I initially ordered the bucket fries having French fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini fries. I realized that all I ate was sweet potato fries, zucchini fries were way too oily for me and French fries they are okay. I tried sunny side up and Tejano, tejano is my all time favorite. And how can I forget the ginger lime soda. Great food , great beer .
author: Sailaja B.

description:
Roam Burgers is amazing. It gave me the same vibe that I got at Super Duper Burger but I think that Roam is a couple notches higher and I prefer it over Super--it didn't feel as touristy. I got a bison burger with some fries and beer. Everything was very tasty and the service was smooth. This place makes the Fillmore area the great place it is. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.

My friends and I were doing an Escape Room down the street in Japantown so this was a good place to rally for some team-building before the room since it has bench style seating and easily accommodates groups.

Don't skip out on a good burger at Roam!
author: Marlon T.

description: Thus far one of my favorite places to grab a burger. Granted I do have to go out of my way, and it is pricier than your average burger joints but that's just it. It is not the average burger joint! Great, quality tasting food!! Love the fries! Love the pickles!! I've tried Elk and Bison and so far Bison is my favorite. Definitely worth the trip on any day.
author: Alex F.

description:
What I got:
French and Fries burger

What I thought:
Roam's is a pretty neat burger spot. A cool place to grab a delicious burger with a side of beer and catch the game.

The French and fries burger was pretty darn good. The truffle fries definitely shined with every bite I took -- who wouldn't love fries in in a burger!? Excellent combo.

The only downside for me is that I felt like the burger was too pricey for its size. When it came out I was literally thinking to myself "Is that it?!" Although pretty tasty, it's not very filling. 

One cool thing is that there are a lot of great meats to choose from -- from beef to turkey to bison to elk. Can't wait to come back to try the others!
author: Tony V.

description: Best burgers and fries in SF ! I crave it when I'm not in town. Looking forward to my next roam burger
author: Kiran M.

description:
So I had 3 teenagers with me in tow on a Saturday night.  San Francisco had a free concert in the park so every local joint on the Western half of the city was packed.  Not to mention that the Giants were locked in what would be a historic (note I did not use the hipster term "epic") playoff game battle on a Saturday night so pizzerias and even some local establishments had long waiting lists at 8:30pm.

Moved East to Fillmore and settled in Roam where we could watch the end of the game.  the artisanal burgers are very gourmet and organic.  As this is San Francisco of course they have gluten free buns for an extra dollar.  Usually you order from the very exotic looking burger menu and pay, and then they give you a number and then you hunt for a table in the cramped space.  As is usually the case there are people left standing around stalking diners who look almost finished. 

Of note is that other than the community table, there are only maybe 4 tables that can accommodate a group of 4. I stood there for about 10 minutes with my eye on a large table with three girls who were done and sipping water.  At this point there were more people standing than sitting.  These gals seemed oblivious.  I decided to be smart and ask if I could just place my number on their table until our food was ready. The women looked at me as if I was the rudest person ever.  They looked at me and said, "whatever".  

Then this girl comes up to me and says, "You can't do that.  You have to wait."  I would have educated her in the fact that we had been waiting longer than anyone and passed at the smaller tables because we were a group of 4, but I could barely understand her and I'm not sure the sensible    complicated answer would have gotten past her scowl.  I just held up 2 fingers to indicate that she was only a group of 2 and pointed to 2 open seats at the community table which she obviously didn't want.

Eventually our drinks came and the three girls who were warming our seats got the signal to leave from the busboy.  I should mention in a previous visit a homeless lady went around asking people for money and food.  When I told the bartender, he looked at me as if I was an unsympathetic fool.  Look dude!  If I'm going to pay $9.50 for your burger, I don't need to smell people who smell like pee. 

Anyway the food came.  They have nice little milkshakes and fries. Burgers are nice and moist.  I get the Tejana burger with tortilla chips, avocado and a spicy salsa.   We also got the garlic fries and the zucchini onion stack. All colas are artisanal as well made with cane sugar.   

Did I mention the ball game was on TV and given the dramatic finish only 2 other tables clapped at the finish!  You could hear louder cheers from the fancy restaurants down the street.  And as soon as the game was over they changed the station to a mixed martial arts match.  Didn't even wait for the postgame interviews.

Overall the burgers are great.  The process and vibe is just not friendly or comfortable given the price you pay.  Our kids go to school in the area and say people everyone prefers the other lunch options on the street.  

Unfortunately the restaurants on the street are becoming more for the dating crowd and  are becoming less family friendly.  My score has less to do with the food but more to do with the inconsistent experience.

For hipsters this is your place, but I think true natives will tell you there are other good similar burger options that provide a better experience.
author: Erik H.

description:
Roam is officially my favorite burger joint in SF. It definitely beats out Super Duper, Gott's, and Umami. The Fillmore location is a casual, family-friendly spot - order at the counter and the staff will bring your food out to you.

The burgers are all really delicious and juicy, with pastured beef and fresh ingredients. I've tried the Heritage (my fave), the Sunnyside, and the French and Fries burger. They also have gluten-free and lettuce wrap options. 

I love their Fry-fecta! A nice trio of fries - the zucchini and onion haystack are super addictive.

Bonus, they have Allagash White on tap!
author: Vivian H.

description:
It was just one of those nights... and a medium rare grass fed beef bacon aged white cheddar cheese burger on a sesame bun from Roam hit the spot just right.

The ingredients here are fresh, service is good, and hazelnut chocolate milkshake and fries (regular, zucchini, and sweet potato -- these fries stole the show) are above average. There's communal and separate seating; even though it was packed both nights I came here (once on a weekday and once on a Sunday night), my plus one and I were able to find seating.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I have been to Roam a couple times and am just not impressed. It is overpriced and the food is just not that great. Portions for their fries are skimpy and service can be atrocious. If something is wrong with your order the person serving you will not fix it for you, you have to go back to the cashier. Bad setup kids. 
I would rather go to Umami a million times over before I come back here.
author: Angela D.

description: Pretty busy and cramped, but was able to find a spot to sit. Found some seats at the bar which is great cause I had access to watch the basketball game. Food Wise, the burgers was AMAZING!!! I ordered the sunny side up and fry-fritas and it was the best decision ever! A bit of every option for fries along with ranch made it even better. You could tell the meat was pretty fresh and not frozen. I would definitely come back. I wanted to try their shakes, but the price of it made me say no
author: Danika P.

description: Go to burger spot and one of the best in the city. I would rank this higher than super duper. Umami burger is great but very rich as well. This strikes a good balance of nice flavors but not overpowering. I've tried all the burgers and don't think there's a bad one. My favorite is the Tejano.
author: Myron N.

description:
We came here Sunday for lunch and luckily, there was no line!! These burgers may not be the best in sf, but still very delicious, filling and juicccy-- rightfully called artisan burgers. 

We ordered Sunny Side, Heritage, and Fry-Fecta (all 3 fries). Sunny Side is a must if you love eggs. Heritage was a good balance between sweet and salty. I think they cooked the meat and buns perfectly. Fries are delish-- get them if you are craving for some yummy carbs. 

I can't speak for consistency because this was my first time here, but it sure made a good first impression. The lines are often long, so it's best to come during off-peak hours. Also, they're a couple dollars cheaper than Umami burgers-- another plus!
author: Connie L.

description:
This place is awesome! I found it while using a gluten free restaurant locator app. They offer incredible organic grass fed beef. The  locally sourced ingredients which are described on the back of the menu. There pickles are delish and are house made. The fries really stand out here, fried in rice bran oil they have a crispness that is unmatched! Plus that makes them gluten free! They offer gluten free buns, which I recommend not having heated on the grill because they grill regular bread on it. ( according to gluten free reviews) The food was incredible!!
