I live in the Central Valley and can not wait to come back to the city to eat here again! 
My only recommendation is to have the cashiers a little more friendlier, but other than that 5 stars all the way
author: Jamie E.

description:
Heard so much about Roam and had them bookmarked for awhile, so I was glad that Janice C chose this place for a meet up lunch.  Already around 1 on a Saturday the place was packed but we were able to get 6 seats at the big communal table.  I wish they had a few more non-communal table.  

He and I always end up sharing what we get so we always order something that appeals to both of us.  He got the Heritage ($10) and I got the French & Fries ($10), since the French & Fries only come with like two truffle fries in the burger, we also got an order of the truffle fries.  It was a pricey lunch indeed for about a Super Duper sized burger.  I was stupid and didn't notice that my French & Fries came with dijon mustard.  The only mustard I can tolerate is honey mustard.  It also came with gruyere, watercress, caramelized onions, and avocado.   So needless to say, I didn't enjoy mine as much, and made him take more bites of mine.  I'm not sure why they would want to overpower the cheese and truffle fries with something so strong as dijon.  I liked his Heritage more, which was a little gourmet twist on a good classic burger filled with butter lettuce, fontina, caramelized onions, bacon and herb mayo.  Truffle fries were perfectly crisp, dusted with cheese and had enough of a truffle flavor.  Peter L. ordered the Trifecta for the whole table to share as well.  It consisted of regular fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini strings.  I definitely loved the sweet potato fries and zucchini strings.  

Would I go back to Roam?  For sure if I was craving a burger and in the area.  I still like Super Duper more for simple "quicker service" burgers that's not McDonald's, Jack In The Box or the like.  I feel though however if I'm throwing down $10 for a burger here, I may as well pay a little more and go to Umami or NOPA though.  3.5ish stars.
author: Cat C.

description:
Roam Artisan Burgers isn't your usual classic burger place. They take their burgers to a whole new level by using different meat (ie: bison and elk). However, for my first visit, I stuck with a traditional beef patty.

A friend and I shared the "Sunny Side" and "French and Fries" style burgers, as well as the Fry-Fecta and a hazelnut chocolate (seasonal) milkshake. A complete meal, full of grease and deliciousness, satisfied the both of us.

Be sure to grab plenty of napkins, as Roam's burgers are very messy to eat. The beef patties on both our burgers were cooked to a nice and juicy medium. The Sunny Side burger was a slight disappointment, mainly because the egg was cooked thoroughly, thus lacking the beauty of a runny, gooey yolk. But the juicy caramelized onions made up for it. The French and Fries burger was salty from the Parmesan fries, and rich from the gruyere cheese and avocado. The dijon mustard spread was a little too much, because a strong vinegary flavor was all I could taste in some bites.

For first-timers at Roam, I recommend the Fry-Fecta, which is a reasonable portion of all three of Roam's fries: classic medium/thick-cut russet potato, sweet potato, and zucchini onion haystack. And if you have a sweet-tooth, order a milkshake as well. They're thick, creamy, and so good! You're likely to be given your milkshake first, so try to avoid the immediate sugar rush by drinking all of the shake before your burger arrives at your table.

Service was friendly, and food took a reasonable amount of time to prepare after ordering, especially given how crowded the restaurant was on a weekend at noon. If the weather is nice, sit outside or at least near the open windows. The place is a little rustic with wooden tables and metal chairs, yet still retain a homey-feel. Roam also has an online-ordering system, for those who prefer to take their food to-go or to avoid the crowds.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Cute burger joint in the marina, outdoor seating, fresh eats.

These things make me happy. 

They offer sweet potato fries, wine, a farmer's market salad with ranch I've enjoyed a coupla' times, and a pretty bad*** veggie burger.

Yes, I said veggie burger. A Tejano veggie burger.

The bun was a monster, the patty was made of beets and other vegetarian wonders, was hooked up with cheese, blessed with tomato and avocado, and get ready.....someone thought adding fritolikechips to finish it off was a good idea.

You know I agree.

My burger made out with the ketchup for dayz.

And just like that, I became a fan.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Delicious vegan and gluten free options! The menu is huge + has so many options, and the staff are patient and helpful! A little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for, and I will be back next time I'm in SF
author: Lynn A.

description:
I know a lot of people like Roam but I had a pretty bad experience. I feel bad about giving a bad score because I typically weight my score heavily on the level of customer service I received. Roam had great customer service but there were a number of things that happened at dinner that gave me a bad experience:
1. I decided to be adventurous and got their autumn burger. It wasn't very good :/  they didn't even ask me how I like my meat. :( so my meat wasn't juicy but on top of that I just didn't like the taste 
2. They didn't have a blue moon and then offered me something else saying it tasted like blue moon and it SUPER didn't. 
3. This wasn't a big deal but I will have to mention that it was really crowded and I had no where to put my purse. I tried to put it on my chair but since the back was rounded- my purse wouldn't stay. I ended up having to put my $400 purse on the floor :( 
**dont judge me for my purse! We are in SF! That is normal purse cost. And price is relative! My $400 purse is someone else's $1000 purse or someone else $100 purse!
author: Julianna I.

description:
A quick look at the menu and I knew that this would be a fun time to try something different - so elk it was. 

When in Roam, right?

I actually had no idea how the burger would turn out really, but I was pleasantly surprised. The elk burger was notably leaner than a regular beef burger, but it tasted great and was very clean, not gamey.

I had the burger Sunny Side style because eggs on burgers are like benedicts at Sunday brunch - my favorite things. It comes with caramelized onions and greens, which also add a sweet bite to the burger. My friends and I paired our burgers with the Fry-Fecta and it really made the meal. My favorite was definitely the sweet potato fries and the russets were my second fave. I'm not really sure about that haystack though - straight up zucchini fries or onion-rings would have been more in my boat.

All in all, great meal. Atmosphere was lively and fun and it wasn't a wallet buster either. I'd definitely come back to try more fun combinations.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This place is AMAZING. I don't think I've ever had a better veggie burger. Also, their salads are so good, and their sweet potato fries are up there. The food is really fresh and so flavorful. Can't go wrong here!
author: Madeleine M.

description: We are vegetarian and we love the Roam veggie burger! We usually get the French and Fries or the Tejano burger as both are excellent and have avocado. Also love that they have a whole grain bun. Mostly just writing the review as a reminder to ourselves that we vastly prefer their sweet potato fries. Their russet fries don't hit the spot for us the way that those from Souvla or even Blue Barn do.
author: T K.

description:
Great place!  You've got to try the Bison burger!  I ordered something and asked to return it for another item and they couldn't have been nicer to me.  I so appreciate getting great customer service service and Roam has it in spades.  Michelle made me a second milk shake and couldn't have smiled more as she did.  

"Smiles may be free, but their priceless to me".  :-)

Victoria was the MOD (Manager On Duty) and she was also extremely gracious.  I had asked her to come to my table so I could compliment Michelle's service.  And she was all smiles as well.  

Do yourself a favor and give this place a chance!
author: Randall S. B.

description:
After walking around Japantown for a while, my boyfriend and I were STARVING for some good food. We just couldn't decide what to eat and we ended up walking off and finding this place! 

The line was short and moved pretty fast so I didn't have much time to decide on an order. Their menu is HUGE! I ended up ordering a prickly pear soda and the Heritage burger. I shared the fryfecta with my boyfriend. 

Prickly Pear Soda ($2.99) - Very pretty, vibrant, and colorful. The taste is very sweet and syrupy but I'm told that this is one of their less sweet choices. I would have wanted a bigger glass with more soda in it. 

Heritage Burger ($8.50) - The beef of their patty is tender and juicy but not exactly flavorful. The flavors are from the toppings in the burger. The bacon they use is thick and smoky (I got 4 decent sized pieces). Butter lettuce was a nice tender touch though the herb mayo they use didn't impress me as much as I wanted it to. The bun they use is very buttery and soft. I enjoyed it but with a burger, I would have wanted a slightly sturdier bun. 

Fryfecta - I don't recall the price of this one but I think it's around $6ish. You get three kinds of fries: sweet potato, regular potato, skinny zucchini-onion haystack. While impressive to look at, it lacked flavors. I think that's where the added toppings for fries come in. The haystack was my favorite but it also had the most oil. 

Overall, pretty good experience but pricey and was a little disappointed in some things.
author: Sofia R.

description: Their burger is awesome. The only reason why I have them 4 stars is their drinks are pretty limited. They don't have regular sprit/7up
author: Lucinda L.

description:
Years ago, my friend introduced me to Roam Burger and I've been hooked on it ever since. I love love Roam Burger. One of my top 5 burger places to go to.

I think I'm addicted to the chipotle habanero sauce. It's my kryptonite. With that sauce on any of the burger I get, I'm in heaven. All the burgers I've ordered here has been cooked to perfection. More on the medium rare. Never had any problem with that. Usually, I'm happy and content with a burger. My two favorite burgers are the sunny side elk burger and the pacific blue burger.

On some days, I like to binge eat. Which is a terrible thing for my tum tum and my petite figure which I'm trying to keep. Today was the day to binge eat, I tried the side salad and it was unbelievable. Most times, I don't like eating salad with any dressing because it is either too salty or overpowering. But this salad, the leaves were fresh and crunchy. Drizzled dressing on the salad made it a perfect combination in my mouth. Getting a side salad and burger is enough for lunch. Maybe getting a drink or a beer to wash it down it with.

I always look out for the season soda. My favorite was the Blood Orange, however the new soda was Raspberry. It was delicious and refreshing, but not quite as good as the Blood Orange. I caved in today and finally got a shake. I was torn between Vanilla and Hazelnut. I should've got the Hazelnut because tons of people around me ordered that and my friend was raving about it. Instead, I got the Vanilla. It was still very yummy and satisfying. Pretty creamy and soft served and tasted like eating ice cream! 

The downside of Roam Burger to me is finding seating. It is super hard during around lunch hours/dinner hours during the weekdays and brunch/lunch hours during the weekend.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Oh hell yes. I can't tell you how surprisingly hard it is to find a decent turkey burger but Roam has come through. Love that they have options for lettuce wrap or gluten free buns and other patty options like bison, elk, and veggie. My husband rolled his eyes at the kombucha on tap, but I happily ordered myself a glass. They have a nice selection of beers too if you're not being a huge SF hippie like I was with my wine glass of kombucha and lettuce wrapped turkey burger.

The husband enjoyed the French and Fries burger (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard) while I went healthy so as to enjoy a zucchini onion haystack (aka fried deliciousness).

Order first and then grab a seat. If it's a nice day score a patio seat or one by the open windows.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Artisan burgers with beer on tap, freshly tossed up seasonal salads and gourmet fries!  What a yummy meal!  Add on the shakes, if you have room for a cold sweet!

Their Zucchini Haystack, caught me off guard with its thinly sliced texture and special flavor.  Its thinness and hint of savory-ness, made me keep munching on them and to latch on for more of its tasty goodness!

I ordered up their Pacific Blue Burger aka blue cheese burger and the blue cheese was mightily present.  Opt for medium rare burgers, since it is a gourmet burger place after all.  It would be a shame to cook it well and have the meaty flavor dry out.

You Roam around and seat yourself!  Having no one to wait on you and having a speakeasy decor, makes this burger spot hip, while serving up quality burgers!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
If you wander around San Francisco, you will more than likely stumble upon a gourmet, but fairly priced burger joint without looking very hard. I've been to quite a few myself and most of them don't differ much from one another. However, Roam Artisan Burgers stands out. Why? Because they are effective at keeping things simple yet delicious. Ultra fresh ingredients, quick execution of well conceived flavor combinations, and a menu that is easy to order from. 

Burger wise, they offer five proteins to use as your base (beef, turkey, bison, elk, and veggie), eight pre-constructed topping combinations, and the option to build your own. My favorite is the French and Fries with a ground beef patty, which comes with gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, and truffled parmesan fries tucked inside the bun. An undeniably tasty burger, cooked to medium rare. In my opinion, the portion size is just right. With all the toppings, it makes for a solid meal, but isn't so filling that you'll want to skip your next meal or undo the top button on your pants to breathe after ingesting it.

For non-French fry purists, the fryfecta (a crispy combination of russet potatoes, sweet potatoes, and crispy zucchini ribbons) is the way to go. While I'm not typically an avid consumer of truffled fries, theirs are flavorful and subtle, generously topped with parmesan. Wash it down with a Strauss milkshake and you'll be bringing on the itis in no time. If you're trying to be mindful of the calories, the Farmer's market salad with red wine vinaigrette is tasty and you can add on a skewer of mini burgers of your choosing (my pick is turkey). You can also have any of their burgers wrapped in lettuce or a gluten free bun. Talk about accommodating! 

Each time I've dropped by, they have been doing good business. The environment is clean, sleek, and casual with shiny dark wooden tables, dim lighting, and industrial metal chairs. You place your order at the front, get your number, and your order will hit your table in good time. Even when there is heavy foot traffic, you're likely to get a table because it's more of a destination for a quick bite than a hang out. Because I like a little more light when I eat, I gravitate towards the seating near the window. They also have limited outdoor seating, which is perfect for the warmer months.  If you're dining alone, they have bar seating with a flat screen in view. If you are thinking of bringing kids along, know that they are welcomed warmly.

When seeking a non-fussy, but satisfying burger, keep Roam Artisan Burgers in mind. I'm keeping my fingers crossed for an East Bay location!
author: Ruby G.

description:
Delicious burgers. Enough said.

My friends and I came here after a nice walk/hike earlier in the day at Lands End. It was my first time, but two of my friends had previously been and were so excited, so I knew we were in for something good. Saw a burger with egg and I can't pass on egg in my burger, so I ordered the Sunny Side with beef patty! While it is slightly messy to eat, it had a lot of flavors. We also shared the Fry-Fecta, which was a nice addition, and my favorite of the 3 was the zucchini onion haystack. Never had zucchini like that before. Because I felt like it was a cheat day (and we did exercise beforehand!), I topped that by getting a hazelnut chocolate shake with marshmallow and it was definitely worth it. 

FYI, the place does get packed at dinnertime and it's not a huge space, so you probably don't want to come with a huge party. For groups of around 4, though, orders came out fast and people rotated in and out pretty quickly, so you should be able to find a seat!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
The expectations were high. That's always the problem. When that happens, it just sets things up to not go the vision that you had intended. I had the fry-fecta because everyone said it would be awesome and it was a great pair with beer and an unhealthy conscience. I also had the French and Fry burger and ordered it medium-rare; but you only have two options: pink or no pink. Why is everyone so afraid of food poisoning? I call that a free diet...(juuuuuuust kidding!) 

I did like the truffle oil on the fries. 

I would like to come back and try the sunny side and the burger with the jalepeno relish. Those looked good. 

How do people get on the Food Network anyway nowadays? I guess I just had envisioned my socks getting knocked off. Again... those pesky high expectations... 

But I'm still coming back! Maybe I just need another burger!
author: Leena B.

description:
In my opinion Roam might just be the best burger place in San Francisco. From their excellent customer service to their food whats not to love? 

To give an example of their customer service, I'm gluten free and so the gluten free bun is a very important part of the meal. However, I am also dairy intolerant and many gluten free buns have dairy. When I asked about it when ordering, the waiter took out their binder and went through all the ingredients, and when there was something he didn't understand, he referred to me, which I appreciated. 


And again, the quality of their burgers are great, and their fries are also quite good. Not to mention the location.
author: Humza I.

description:
Amazing burger joint!
Came here for a late dinner on a Tuesday with my daughter and sister. Seriously, we could smell the food as soon as we crossed the street to get there! Already a good sign. We quickly checked out the menu and ordered.
The burgers were great... the fries were amazing! Drinks excellent and the milkshake I ordered for my daughter was SO delicious, my sister and I ended up ordering one each to go!
Great gem in SF!
author: Erika C.

description: Delicious burgers, friendly atmosphere. Our table even got an extra order parmesan fries on the house because, why not...
author: Tony M.

description: Delicious for sure. It was a tasty burger and the fries were good too. The shake looked amazing but I did not try it. Maybe next time. Definitely recommend it.
author: Eiman J.

description: Busy place on a Saturday night but the food was great! We got the French fries burger, the Autumn burger and the trio of sides (French fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini fries). Everything was great so we'll come back to test more burgers.
author: Coralie S.

description: My favorite!  Burger was delicious, as was the blood orange soda that they prepared.  Gorgeous and yummy!
author: kim B.

description:
Went with a classic burger (beef) and added cheddar and smoked bacon. Placed the order and it arrived promptly at my table within 8 minutes. It was very juicy and flavorful. I ordered a side of fries. They were average. 

Bill came to about $16 which seems in the high end for a burger and fries but this is SF. Overall, not a bad spot for a good burger without the wait.
author: Mike O.

description: Cozy place to drop in for a great burger and a beer. Staff is extremely kind and efficient. Fast Casual so no reservations but they'll let you sit down & hold a table while you wait for your friends. Don't miss out on the Truffle Parmesan fry option. Its damn good.
author: Abigail S.

description: I'm almost unhappy that I discovered this place, since I live so close and might be tempted to stop here more often than my diet suggests. With that said, their burgers are quite high quality and the fries crispy and flavorful. I got the French style burger which has delicious bacon within. The atmosphere is casual yet still classy, which makes it the perfect spot for a weekday or weekend lunch.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Roam makes great burgers consistently. 

The spiel: 

Pick your patty - beef, bison, turkey or veggie 
Pick the style - they have a whole bunch to choose from 

My go to - Turkey with French and Fries , no mustard (I m not a fan of mustard) 
The patty isn't very oily compared to other burger spots. The fries are with truffle and are heavenly and they add the perfect kick to the burger. 

I also tried their berries and cream seasonal shake which is made with ice cream and its amazing. Not too sweet and perfect on a warm afternoon in SF. 

I highly recommend Roam !
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Roam is poppin' like Pop Rocks on Friday nights in the Fillmore. Top 40 is playing in the background just loud enough to feel the vibe, but not so loud where it gets everyone going like they just drank Krunk Juice. 

The vibe had me feelin' good 'bout myself, so I decided to splurge on a Bison French Fries Burger, a side of fries, and a Pale Ale for good measures. That cost me over $20 at the cash register. Damn, better check in on Yelp right quick and tell errrrrbody i'm a straight baller

Quick-Tip: 'Ya-huh. You stay on that Burger King while i shell out $20 for a burger. #ConspicuousConsumption'

The noise of 500 people chitchatting meshed brilliantly with Ke$ha's Timber. Both sounded coarse and random lol. A lot of people were trying to talk with Parmesan Fries stuffed in their mouths. I actually respect that, it just makes it harder to eavesdrop. Anyways, to the eavesdropping!

So this one hipster was raving about his burger:
"This is good. Mmm-hmm, you can really taste all the fresh ingredients. This is what organic is about. This is why I shop at Whole Food's."
(lol i love hipsters and the things they say)

There was this one lady reflecting on her most recent bite:
"The caramelized onion on this French Fries Burger adds a nice sweet touch. I can't complain about how juicy the meat is, either. I wish the buns were toasted because the bread is getting all starchy in my mouth and that's no bueno."
(wow...well said. She's probably a Yelp Elite)

And there was this valley girl with make up on her face that's thicker than deep-dish pizza:
"I only got 10 likes in the last 5 minutes. Do you think I should take it down? Let me take another selfie selfie selfie."
(whoops, nvm. That was just the Chainsmokers playing on my iPod.)

Well, to summarize what my eavesdropee have to say, it looks as if $20 will buy you a good time and a high quality burger. However, not toasting the bun kinda killed the party. Overall, Roam is not a bad place to spend a Friday night if you're on that Andrew Jackson budget.
author: Ringo M.

description: Veggie burger had me going back- enjoyable fast casual spot that is comfortable and nice space to sit in for a high quality but casual and quick meal!
author: J K.

description:
We came here on Columbus Day at around 4pm. My boyfriend was craving the Tejano Bison Burger, and I'd never tried the spot before. Apparently, there's also a location in the Marina? We meant to go there, but found this location by mistake! Fortunately, the boy says it's just as delicious as the Union Street location!

I ordered the turkey chalet burger, he got his usual Tejano bison burger, and we added a side of haystack zucchini and onion "fries".

The burgers = freaking delicious. Juicy, tender, flavorful, mmmm!

The haystack fries = Uhm... This was more like a $4 topping than it was a "side". They were SUPER thin and tiny. Not substantial enough to hold in two fingers. It's kind of like getting to the last few crumbs of Doritos at the bottom of a chip bag -- tastes good, but you may as well pour it in your mouth or toss it out. Pretty ridiculous. Go with sweet potato fries or the russet fries instead, unless you're okay with paying $4 for a silly topping. :P

Nice neighborhood, average noise level, really fun people watching. Delicious food. Worth the trip for tasty burgers! :)
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
Just give me the French and Fries and I am a happy girl! Totally recommend this spot when you're craving a good quality burger. I've converted many into Roam believers that thought Umami or Super Duper was the best burger in the city. Because they don't come close.
Roam is so consistent, uses fresh ingredients and the burgers are always perfectly cooked and flavorful. Seasonal sodas or the shakes are always a perfect way to round out your meal. I'm a sucker for the Blue Bottle Coffee Shake. And do yourself a favor and get the Fry-fecta. 
Be wary though this location is packed during peak lunch hours and on the weekend. Seating is limited so I wouldn't recommend a group more than 4 because you likely won't get a seat. Also, pricing is a bit steep but the quality is there. Overall this is my favorite burger joint in the city and I dare any challengers that say different.
author: Victoria T.

description:
We visited Roam on a Sunday morning, after a very late Saturday chock-full of hijinks and tomfoolery.  I felt great, but the rest of my party? Not so much. You know what always helps in that situation? An order of French fries. Or, how about an order of truffle Parmesan French fries? 

Look, you will need those (strictly construe the word "need" please, I'm not messing around). Those fries were mighty tasty, flavorful and perfect for sharing. I didn't notice that they had chipotle maple fries, or I would have ordered those as well. So good, and you know you need a lot of grease when you aren't feeling the best ever.

I ordered the Heritage Burger with a (grass-fed) beef patty.  You have several options for meat at Roam, however: bison, elk or turkey (they have veggie burgers as well, for the meat adverse).  I'm not ashamed to say that I feel uncomfortable ordering elk or bison--because elks and bisons are pretty cute, even if they do taste good. I know cows are just as cute, but I feel less bad about ordering a beef burger--don't blame me, blame Texas. I'm told the bison burger is much better, but I'll just take my friends' word for it.  Bypass. 

At any rate, Roam's Heritage burger was bananas. It had bacon, caramelized onion, fontina cheese, herb mayo (I'll allow it ONLY because it's flavored), butter lettuce and tomato. It was gargantuan, such that I could only eat one half, but my friends demolished theirs.  Not diet. 

Roam makes their own sodas. I ordered an orange one--it was not too sweet yet refreshing and satisfying. My friend ordered the Tahitian vanilla bean shake, child's sized. It was also yummy.  I was going to pick an argument with her about why she ordered the mushroom burger (because I obviously can't taste it since I hate mushrooms with a purple passion), but that's not nice when your friends don't feel good. Next time she does that, however, it's definitely go time.  

Roam wasn't too crowded for Sunday lunch, but I suspect it was because of that fateful Sunday football line-up (the outcomes of which need not be mentioned here). 

The service was fine.  For my burger, fries, and soda, it was about $16. Not a surprise in the Fillmore. 

Roam if you want to.  It's well worth it.
author: Sunny S.

description:
I have been here 3 times in a week. Mate & I discovered it randomly on our way home one night. This place has the tastiest burgers, fries, shakes.... God even their salad is yummy. 

The farmers market salad I have had twice because it's huge and has fresh crisp spring greens and lovely light dressing. It just tastes fresh and how veggies SHOULD taste. 

The sunny side burger is delicious. Mate ordered this initially and got me fixated on it the next day.....so I went back for lunch! It's juicy and not greasy and that sweet chili sauce. It compliments the burger and overall savory/saltiness so well. 

Truffle fries were recommended as one of my friends' faaaaavorite fries ever. & holy crap, they are good. Just try em, you won't be disappointed.  

Milk shake! Wasnt too rich & I actually really enjoyed the berry flavor. Tasted very natural, not artificial.
author: Lisa K.

description: This is my first time for coming lunch. It is the good food and nice casual lunch place. Fresh ingredients and nice taste! I will come back again!
author: Kiyoko M.

description: I bought the Tahano burger which came with pepper jack, jalapeño relish,  relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, and herb ranch. You get to choose your choice of meat. I chose the turkey. Other options include bison, beef, veggie, and wild bore. Turkey was awesome. The white corn strips were basically chips, kinda like Fritos, which added a nice crunch. The burger was juicy like a watermelon! Yum! Plenty of free parking which is a plus since it's in the city. There is also, great dessert places nearby and plenty of coffee close for you coffee lovers out there ;). The gender neutral bathroom is nice and clean and they have a great interior. It's also one of those places where you need to order at the cashier and they bring you your food. You also need to seat yourself.
author: R.J. A.

description:
It was busy AF but the staff were positive, welcoming, and friendly.  After a brutal morning at the Cherry Blossom Festival, I was looking forward to being ANYWHERE but there.  None of us had breakfast so past 1PM, we were hungry as hell.  

- daughter had the kid's cheeseburger meal 
- I ordered the bison sunny side burger (add $3 for bison)
- a side of sweet potato fries 

A fairly pricey lunch but it was worth it.  We almost decided to eat on the sidewalk but the guy said he can clear a table for us so that won me over in regards to service and going above and beyond.  There was a sea of people waiting to order and waiting for their orders but they really do follow the first come, first serve practice. 

The fries were seasoned perfectly and I loved that each one is crispy yet none were burnt or too crispy.  The highlight of my meal was in fact my burger.  Thanks to the fitness chick that I follow on IG, I was introduced to bison and sincerely love it.  It's just expensive but I order it whenever I get the chance.  My burger was juicy and delicious.  I simply wish I have one in front of me now.
author: Tram N.

description:
An update: They reached out and apologized about not packing ketchup with our large order, and sounds like they will review their condiment packing procedures.  I appreciate that they didn't ignore my comment. 

To be fair, I would say the food deserves at least a 4 if it had come with ketchup.  I was impressed that the buns maintained its firm yet soft consistency when it arrived on delivery.
author: Daniel C.

description: My review of Roam is based solely on the veggie burger. It is house made and stand-out excellent. Nice to find a burger-and-fries joint where the veggie burger isn't treated like a necessary evil.
author: Benjamin L.

description: Pretty good! Came here one afternoon for lunch and got the Heritage burger with truffle fries. The meat in the burger was flavorful and the fries were delicious. Nice workers here too so that's a plus. I'll be back
author: Cee H.

description:
Can I make a bad joke? I finally roamed over to Roam! Haha I'm so funny right? Guys? Anyone? Sigh, just the crickets as usual I see.

Roam was frickin awesome. I'm glad I finally came here. Pictures of their burgers have been haunting me on Instagram for far too long. You can't go around looking that delicious without me there. I ended up getting myself the French and Fries burger, because I can't say no to truffle fries. It's my one true weakness. This burger, was fantastic. I swear I could have gobbled it down quicker than silver. Their fries are like a holy trinity of awesome. Like, they give you an option to combine all three styles of fries into one. Is that not cool or what?

Really, the only place where it gets a little sketchy is with how busy it gets. First come first served and you seat yourself. If people didn't linger like cranberries, then it'd be much easier to get seats here, but it's a heavy combination of both busy and small which makes seating tough. 

Other than that though, it's a fantastic spot to grab a meal. Now, I always say I'll be back to whatever restaurant I review. That usually a lie. But with Roam, I'll definitely be back. I got that truffle burger craving in the back of my head that'll be too hard to ignore soon enough!
author: Sean H.

description: I like the option of gluten free buns. Their burgers are pretty hefty, you would definitely get full, even without sides. I do think the prices can really add up though. Spent $20 on a custom burger and fries. That's way too much in my opinion... There wasn't a long wait the two times I've been there.
author: Alice S.

description:
I am a man.
That means TELL me what you want for your birthday.

I don't do the post-it hints hidden around the apt x indecipherably vague clues in random convo hoopla. #please #aintnobodygottimefuhdat
No, woman. Just shove the SkyMall catalog in my face and show a brotha exactly which item #s you want and in which colors.

Otherwise, I won't know up from down.
Just like I can't tell the diff among the Marlon Brando x Matthew Broderick roadkill on the burg menu.

Well, I can. A little.
-----
WHERESTHEBEEF(BETWEENYOTEEF): You can get beef anywhere, including Hunters Point in your Seahawks jersey.

TURKEYISTANBULANDCONSTANTINOPLE: Another ubiquitously everywhere* option.

M. BISON: Are M. Bison and M. Buffalo really that diff? I can get Yuff any day from Yuff Yurg #[Bu]ffalo[Bu]rger #jesseweneedtoeat

VEGGIE: wtf "Do you even eat, bro?" jk oai

ELK: Bullwinkle** is left as the only "adventurous" and unique choice.
-----
So I only ever get elk. And I always #twerkit #twerkit #twerkit #twerkit by clicking like all the topping entries.

I like how the burgs get on the Super Giordano Kart Double Dash (review http://www.yelp.com/biz/giordano-bros-san-francisco#hrid:0iWibPbBe53GAXhn1FmpfA) #gangstalean by shoving fries, corn chips, etc. inside. Takes you by surprise #cisco if you're a man like me and don't pay full attention to the menu descrips.


*Yeah, I know. I know.
**I know.
author: Dan B.

description: Wow.  Total foodgasm.  The classic burger was over the top.  The veggie burger sunny side style was amazing (add mayo).  But the best and most unique thing we enjoyed was the zucchini onion haystack. Perfectly thin bits of fried amazingness.  We will definitely be back.
author: Adrianne C.

description: This is one of my go to restaurants in SF. I always get the turkey classic with avocado. I have started ordering the market salad recently, and that's phenomenal. The burger is great and has lots of veggies. Everything is super fresh and tasty. I don't eat beef, but the boar burger is great as well. The service is great, and they are always super quick. I have never had a bad burger! This place is very consistent overall. They have a bomb strawberry milkshake as well which is made with Straus Ice Cream. I highly recommend it, but be ready to wait in line if you are eating there.
author: Conor H.

description: Good burgers, fries and atmosphere. I like their veggie patty too. Get the burger with the egg - you won't regret it. A little pricey but the ingredients are fresh and the workers aren't pretentious so I don't mind paying a little more. And the chocolate hazelnut milkshake is so gooooood. Two thumbs up for that alone.
author: Caitlin G.

description:
As much as I hate to say it, this place just keeps on declining. I live down in Southern California. Whenever I come up to San Francisco, I make it my paramount goal, to save some room in my stomach for their burgers, fries, and weird seltzer soda things. 

I really, truly, do.

In fact, I flew up here two days ago for my twenty-first birthday just to have what I deemed as "The Best Burger Joint" in California, fries and burger, both taken into consideration. Oh and trust me, I've eaten my fair share of burgers. 

Upon biting into my burger, I found they had messed up my order once again, similar to my last visit. I let it slide last time and didn't bother to flag down one of the employees, but this was my birthday, for crying out loud. If I wanted avocado, then I would have my avocado, no ifs, ands or buts.

It got up and approached one of the workers and told them of their wrongdoing. They returned with a condiment sized cup with sliced avocado in it. Umm, thanks?

I also noticed a difference in their fries. Not only had they dramatically decreased in size since last summer, but they tasted very mediocre. They were once in steel or iron buckets, but were now being served in little cups, maybe a dramatic 50% decrease of their once portion size. This coupled with the lack of taste, made for a sour experience, which I won't go out of my way (purchase a fifty minute airplane ticket) to have again.
author: Nadir G.

description:
At the end of the day, if your burgers are overlooked, tough and flavorless, why bother. I've been to Roam a number of times and every time I eat here I'm reminded that their burgers just aren't that good. 

Take my advice and go to In and Out Burger and save your money.
author: Perry V.

description: The best burgers ever! Awesome customer service.. Very well priced! No complains , food is made fresh and people are very friendly.
author: Nancy R.

description:
If I'm in the mood for a burger, I will go to Roam especially for their Sunny Side Burger, my ultimate favorite. The burger comes with.. you guessed it... Eggs, caramelized onions, white cheddar, and a sweet chili sauce that sends fireworks off in my mouth. The burgers are always perfectly cooked and fully of savory juices that dribble down the corners of your mouth. Other burgers are also good here, but heart still rests with the Sunny Side. I've tried the brussel sprouts dish which was savory, but a little too salty for my taste. The fries and shakes are also mouth watering and delicious, especially the Salted Caramel shake, yum!

The place can get crowded at its peak hours and its sometimes hard to find a table. However, the line moves thanks to two cashiers and the tables clear up quickly. Service is always on point and attentive.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Tip I wrote after I got my take out order:
1st they forgot my shake. Then they forgot to add bacon to my burgers. What a waste of $3. Make sure ur order is right before u leave. Already had to drive back for the shake. Didn't want to go back for bacon. Ugh!

Since yelp is putting my tips automatically in my review drafts, why not include them?! 

So I am known to enjoy a nice juicy burger with a bunch of toppings. To me sometimes, the more the merrier! I don't normally eat the bun, so I'm making up for it?! Anyways, this is one of the reasons I wanted to check out Roam. I could add a bunch of toppings. I got the Tejano (no bun) with egg and bacon. (As indicated in my tip, they forgot the bacon.) My burger was nice and juicy, but was it worth $13.25 when they forgot the bacon?! Methinks not! My friend got the Sunny side. Again with forgotten bacon. Let me tell you, this burger is messy, so eat it fast before everything slips out of the bun. It was like a race against the clock! Lol!

For the price and the actual burgers, I would have given this place a 3 stars. But since they forgot my bacon AND I had to go to the back to get my shake. I'm giving them 2 stars.

Another note: The website says you can skip the line if you place and pay for it on the site. But since they had one line and one cashier, it really feels awkward cutting to the front, so I just waited in line. I did try to signal the cashier when I came back the 2nd time to grab my shake, but she was busy helping the customers in line. I think if their site says you don't need to wait, there should be another system in place.
author: Elena N.

description:
Roam makes one hell of a burger, and I'm not hyperbolizing when I say I'm not easy to impress when it comes to this Americana staple!

The menu is small but mighty. You can pick from a collection of specialty burgers, or you can opt to make your own by starting with a protein of your choosing: 100% grass-fed beef, free-range turkey, all-natural bison, a housemade organic patty, or all-natural elk. You can also elect to forgo wheat and go with a gluten-free bun.

I decided to try the Tejano as I was craving something zesty on this particular Sunday afternoon. Cooked per my request to medium rare and then topped with pepper jack, jalapeño relish, avocado, tomato, and white corn strips (I skipped the herb ranch), this burger was truly melt-in-your-mouth perfection. I didn't want it to end!

Luckily, the Roam show wasn't over just yet. The sticky, slightly sweet chipotle maple fries take the fried potato to brand new heights. Salty-and-sweet may be an age-old combination, but these flavors essentially formed a culinary coup.

I've also tried the Tahitian vanilla bean shake on a previous visit (no, really). Protip: get it topped with bruléed marshmallow for just $1 more! If there's a better shake out there, I want to know.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Great burgers! I ordered the Heritage burger: bacon, caramelized onions, fontina, herb mayo, and lettuce & tomato. It was DELICIOUS. Juicy, tasty, and just an overall great balance of everything. My friends really enjoyed the French & Fries burger (french fries INSIDE the burger...yes, I know) and the Sunny-Side: burger with an egg. We were all satisfied! 

Make sure you order the Fry-fecta! It's a trio of fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini strings. SO GOOD! Great for sharing.

This place is casual. You order up front and they give you a number. I came for an early lunch on Friday and it wasn't crowded yet, but the line got a lot longer as we were leaving. Seating might be hard to find, and parking is a bit difficult as well. It's a great place if you plan on walking around and checking out the other shops. It's a cute little area w/ fun stores. Overall, really great place with delicious burgers!
author: Kirby P.

description: I always get the vegetarian burger with the gluten free bun! So good and amazing customer service!
author: Aleena N.

description:
Love their housemade sodas--prickly pear is particularly sweet and tasty.  Sunny side bison is also fantastic.

This is an order-at-the-counter place, with a nice bar to sit at and really good food.  Great place to watch the World Cup, too--much less crowded than Harry's Bar up the street.  Actually, writing and thinking about how tasty this place is, I'm bumping to 5 stars.  If you want a good juicy burger with a tasty variety of fries and a fantastic non-alcoholic drink selection, this is your place!
author: Vanessa O.

description: I like Roam burgers because of the heritage it has tasty bacon and fontina cheese. Then you should get an order of the really tasty zucchini onion haystack. There milkshakes are delicious too.
author: Nick Y.

description: The fries in this place are amazing. I would recommend getting the fry-fecta which comes with regular fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini/onion fries. As for the burgers, I got the veggie one (i think it has beets and quinoa). It was a good burger but wish it had more flavor. My friend got the turkey burger and it was very good. Would DEFINITELY go back just for the fries though
author: Isabella C.

description:
OMG I CRY.

I want this burger again. The Heritage.
& their seasonal home-made Blood Orange soda. 

I like burgers. I'll eat it. It makes me happy.
But ROAM burgers... DEVOURED. 

I've never devoured a burger like that before. 

I will surely have quite the dilemma when going back to this street- Woodhouse Fish Co. right across the street? My favorite seafood place & my fave burger joint. What to doooo?
author: Andra C.

description:
My friend heard a bunch of great things about this place so we decided to try it!

Got really lucky with parking and didn't have to circle around at all & to our surprise, no line to order either! I ordered the BBQ burger and omg it was so tasty! I was hesitant at first cause all the other BBQ burgers I've tried - they've been drenched in sauce but this one had the perfect amount! I would definitely come back to get it again after I try the rest of them!

We also got the fry-fecta and MMMM, doesn't disappoint. The zucchini onion strings were hard to grab so I decided to add a little crunch to my burger and throw some in there - needless to say, best. decision. ever. It's also a very generous portion, so be sure to split with a friend... or 2!
author: Carrie L.

description: Bison, where do I start. The Bison French and Fries, Great Range All-Natural, Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Whole Grain Mustard, Piquant Sauce on a traditional sesame seed bun, need I say more? Add to that for free: Butter Lettuce, tomato, house-made pickles, and onion. I added a River City Root Beer as they only offer bottled sodas. The bison is so tender to the point of falling apart if you are not monitoring your sandwich correctly with your face lookers. The wonderful oils and juices all coalesced into a meaty (bison tastes a little more concentrated, more densely beefy if that makes sense), cheesy, avocadoey, sandwich steaming meaty essential truffle oils into my nose. We grabbed a little table overlooking the street through the glass windows and made a small quaint meal out of it. Not a bad way to end the day, and we swung by afterwards to pick up Hong Kong milk teas in Chinatown. What a culinary adventure!
author: Chris S.

description:
I'm a to-go orderer so my review is based on accuracy of order and having it ready when I get there - 5 stars!!!

I make requests to my order to have things on the side so they aren't soggy when I get home - done. 

My husband loves their shakes and it's still frozen/fresh when I pick up. 

Their homemade veggie burger is divine!

He's the meat eater and gobbles down every last bite. 

The seasonal veggie was asparagus with lemon, manchego and these little fried shallot shavings - OMG - delish. 

Plus, they are responsible as a business - sourcing quality humane meats. 

Go, enjoy Roam!
author: Christine V.

description:
Yum so delicious! Basically you get a very unique burger for $10, which I think is pretty good considering that this is SF. I ordered the mushroom burger and really enjoyed it. We also got some sweet potato fries. The fries were average.

It gets pretty crowded during dinner time and self seating, so it's a bit inconvenient to come in a large group. That said,our group managed to nab seats without too long of a wait, so maybe it's not that bad. Overall, I would come back to try some of their other burgers. My sister gets the egg one every time and loves it, so that's probably next on my list!
author: Sophia H.

description: Got the winter burger. Arugula, bacon, Brie, quince sauce, mayo. Pretty good. Got fries with truffles and Parmesan. Also good but a lot. Wish I shared it with someone else.
author: Liana H.

description:
Average. 

When I want a burger, I want it all! Tasty, fatty, beefy goodness. 

I liked that the basic burger is priced right at $6.50 (add ons are $1. hey, this is Pac Heights after all!) and it comes with a delicious soft sesame bun, super fresh butter lettuce and tomato but the beef patty is waaaay too thin. I need more heft to my burger! Kudos for getting grass fed beef from Pacific Farms.

The fry fecta ain't all that. I found the zucchini-onion haystack too bothersome to eat, I mean, when was the last time I ate my "fries" with a fork?!? It was hard to pick these up by hand.  The regular fries need salting, but the sweet potato version is done right. 

Next time, I'll head down the hill to the Marina and stick with Umami burger instead.
author: Janice C.

description: Deelish! I ordered the beef heritage burger with fries and the veggies. The burger was juicy and perfectly seasoned, the bun was awesome and perfect for the burger. The fries were nice and crispy but nothing too special. What surprised me was the asparagus (the veggies that day) it was so damn good! I'll be back!
author: Matt M.

description: We go there every week. Food is very good. Staff are welcoming/ nice. Reasonable eat out place plus kids friendly.
author: PerK N.

description:
I haven't had a burger in quite a while and this place has been on my burger bucketlist. I've only heard good things. I checked this place out with my friend on a Monday. We got here around 1:15PM. There were just a few people in line in front of us. You basically order and pay first and then you sit. I opted for the Bison party, which is an extra $3.00. I got the sunny side burger, which has a sunny side egg in it. I also got a side of sweet potato fries. That set me back almost  $20.00. Be sure to add tip! We sat at the bar, which was torture when they were mixing all their drinks in front of us. They looked soooo good. 

Holy moly... that was one delicious burger.  It was maaaasssive! I could barely fit the whole thing in my mouth. The egg was a perfect touch and the sauce was amazing! The sweet potato fries were also great! Very crispy and perfectly seasoned! I'm going to back at least another three times to try the three other burgers I was debating over: French and fry, tejano and heritage. I'd also wanna try out their shakes and the fry fecta! I might even try out their elk burger.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
I've been to Roam Artisan Burgers a few times before, and while their burgers are good, I really want to rave over their fry-fecta, which is a combination of sweet potato fries, russet potato fries, and zucchini and onion shoestrings. I love the combination and there's so much of it that I feel that it can be a meal of its own. Which is what I did this time. 

The russet potato fries are good, but there's nothing really amazing about them. I love sweet potato fries, and I thought these were amazing. It's crispy on the outside and soft on the inside just the way I like them. The zucchini and onion shoestrings are also very delicious. They have been cut into thin shoestring size and are very flavorful. I decided to add in sweet chipotle maple seasoning to all my fries which gives an extra something to the russet potato fries. It makes the fries slightly sweet.

I also ordered a vanilla milkshake. These are also very good, but because it's rich and sweet, I wouldn't recommend getting a large size.

As for burgers, while I didn't get them this time, I do recommend the Tejano veggie burger. The veggie patty is different than what I'm used to when I think of veggie burgers. The patty is a red color because it contains beets. I highly recommend it. 

If you're interested in unique burger patties, you can also try the bison or elk patties.

Definitely try this place if you're looking for a good burgers and fries place.
author: Andrea G.

description:
Great burgers! I love the one with caramelized onions, arugula, and the fried egg.  I asked for the sweet chilli sauce on the side so I could dip my burger in the sauce.  Absolutely amazing.  We also got the trio of sweet potato fries, regular fries, and fried onions.  The sweet potato fries were the best, both sweet and savory, and with the sweet chilli sauce... it's like an explosion in your mouth!

They also have heated outdoor seating!  You can sit outside and people watch.
author: Edward N.

description:
While the circumstances that brought me here weren't ideal (a visit to the CPMC ER), I'm glad I finally got to cross this off my unending list of bookmarks! Being one of the few places I see that offers options other than veggie and beef, I opted to try their Sunny Side with bison.

A short while later, they bring out my burger, simply wrapped, on a small plate. Digging in, I was pleasantly surprised that the sesame bun I initially feared was some cheap generic bulk store variety was, in fact, not, and actually much tastier and fluffier. And, while the burger as a whole was quite delicious, I found that this particular burger was a bit on the sweet side, probably due to the combination of caramelized onions and sweet chili sauce, and that the bison patty didn't impart a drastically different flavor than a beef patty would.

So, until next time, I'm leaving them with a solid 3.5 stars.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Half of the seating here is lounge/sofa seating that runs along the length of one wall, which is most likely inaccessible for most folks. Of the rest, there are only really two or three spots that may be slightly inaccessible, being nestled a bit further in, past other tables.

Bathroom - Didn't try, so no comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I'm so envious of people that live in bougie areas of San Francisco like Pac Heights and the Marina. Not only do some cougars have perky boobies at age 50 (courtesy of Mr. Botox Me, Botox Me Not), they have a lot of healthy food options readily available to them like Lite Bite, Pluto's, The Plant Café Organic and Blue Barn. If I want something healthy in my hood, I have Subway. Whoopty do. 

As much as I love burgers, I always feel guilty eating them. Fat (beef patty) topped with cholesterol (cheese) between two buns of carbs. Of course, you need a side of hypertension (salty fries) along with that burger. Thankfully, places like Roam Artisan Burgers make eating burgers less guilt-free with top-notch, healthy options like low fat bison (2 grams of fat for 4 oz) and elk (1.5 grams of fat for 4 oz) along with a whole grain bun and a lettuce wrap option. Not to mention most of their burger creations don't have mayo on it. 

I wasn't fond of their original location in the Marina since they overcooked my elk patty (to a well-done) the first time around but I thought I would give their second location a try. I opted for the Tejano Burger w/ Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch ($8.25) on a whole grain bun again but this time with a bison patty (+$2.99) and bacon (+$2). We also ordered the MUST GET Fry-Fecta, a trio of fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack ($5.49). Hey, don't judge...it's cooked in rice bran oil so it's healthy ok? I washed everything down with their house-made Prickly Pear Soda ($2.49) which is sweetened with low-glycemic agave nectar. 

Our order took a quick 10 minutes to arrive despite it being busy for a Friday afternoon. Sadly, my Tejano Bison Burger: http://bit.ly/105chUK was just as disappointing as my elk one at their Marina location. Having high-quality ingredients is worthless if you can't properly cook it. And, a good burger is not a "good" burger without a good patty right?

On the menu, it's stated that all burgers are cooked "medium" unless told otherwise. Because of its low fat content, you CANNOT cook bison or elk the same way as you do beef. Once you overcook it, game over. Apparently, this location doesn't get it either as my bison patty was overcooked to a well-done NOT medium as stated on the menu. It was DRY so definitely request medium-rare if you order the bison or the elk here. I was hoping that the jalapeno relish and herb ranch sauce would give it some moisture but it got lost in the accouterments. I love the white corn trips though as it gave a delightful crunchy texture contrast. Adding the bacon saved the Tejano Burger as it added a rich, smoky layer. 

Mr. NSS got the French and Fries Burger w/ Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard. He said it was mediocre and just ate half. Now when have you ever seen a guy just eat half of his burger?

The best part of the meal was the Fry-Fecta:  http://bit.ly/1472UTM. I didn't touch the fries and sweet potatoes this time around but went savage status on the zucchini onion haystack. Deliciously crisp with a salty sweetness, the haystack was purely addicting. 

$13 for on overcooked bougie burger? No thanks...I rather save that money and put that in my Mr. Botox Me, Botox Me Not fund.

P.S. - The BEST bougie burger in SF is at Spruce. It comes with duck fat fries for ONLY $16!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: After reading their menu I had really build myself up for an amazing burger, was not as amazing as I was hoping it would be. The burger was OK but nothing out of this world and the fries and zucchini rings were pretty bland. I did enjoy their house made sodas. It was an okay burger but not as good as it looked on their website. Also got a big crowded at around six.
author: Yasmin B.

description: I love this place.   The Sweet Potato Fries go great with extra salt, self-made black pepper & habanero sauce mixed together and ketchup.  I still need to try the sauces on the menu board.  The Zucchini Onion Haystack was good, but a touch too much batter and fried-goodness for me.  I ended up sprinkling them on my burger for an extra crunch.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Like Marshall in that episode of How I Met Your Mother, I've been on a quest of sorts to find the best burgers SF has to offer.  Unlike Marshall though, I really don't have a problem trying so many places along the way.  After all, part of the fun is the journey.  A journey that just so happens to involve some tasty burgers!

Compared to SF's other popular burger joints (Umami, Super Duper, and Pearl's), Roam ranks near the top in almost every respect.  Not only is the vibe quite lively, but the menu is awesome.  Beyond the seven or eight pre-set burger combinations to choose from, you have the option of customizing a burger of your own (toppings vary from free to $1.50).  In addition, regardless of the burger you choose, you also pick the type of patty you want - beef, turkey, bison (A.Q.), or veggie.  Not bad!

- HERITAGE BURGER (with Beef) - Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, and Herb Mayo...$8.25
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=rKsqVQXcTKySvoNQw26oaA#TBBxeJk8QrLkqE1wIBNbCA)
It's a little more "classic" than others, but a solid, solid burger.  The bacon, fontina, and onions were just about perfect and I really liked the bun they use.  It was a little oily/greasy overall, but not surprising given the bacon and how juicy the beef was.

- FRY-FECTA - Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and Zucchini Onion Haystack...$5.49
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=rKsqVQXcTKySvoNQw26oaA#z2vm16qNebpH089c0k18VA)
Essentially a smorgasbord of fried sides, but it's a pretty tasty smorgasbord!  The russet and sweet potato fries were nicely crispy, but the haystack was my favorite - similar to onion strings, but thinner, better, and not all that heavy.

To help wash down their delicious burgers, Roam also offers a bunch of specialty drinks, like unique house sodas and milkshake concoctions.  However, after trying their pear soda (which didn't impress), the milkshakes might be the way to go based on what I saw other people getting and what other Yelpers have said.

Overall, while I can't say Roam is the best burger I've tried so far in SF, they're definitely up there and ahead of their aforementioned competitors (though I think those three are pretty darn good as well).  I'll most definitely be back for more, even as my search continues!
author: Mike L.

description: I got the fry fecta with autumn bison burger and kombucha on tap.  The autumn bison Burger is quite unique.  It has pumpkin spread, watercress, melted brie...mmm, Apple smoked bacon...thicker cut so super juicy and medium bison patty.  I don't know why more places don't have brie on burger...they go so well together.  This burger is well made and even though the ingredients aren't typically found in burgers, they work well together. The zucchini chip/fries in the frig fecta was the highlight. The regular fries and sweet potato fries are done well...but it's all about the zucchini =).  Kombucha is tasty. Not as strong as I'm used to, but more on the refreshing side.  Slothe corner: bbq burger is good.
author: Kathy C.

description:
Definitely better than Umami Burger hands down!  Let me tell you the reasons why, when I am craving for a burger I go to Roam. Best part is you can choose your burger from bison, turkey, beef, veggie even elk. You can also choose your bun ...sesame seed bun, whole grain bun, gluten-free bun even lettuce wrap for an additional dollar. 

I always get the Fry Fecta which is a trio of the Zuchinni Haystack, Sweet Potato Fries and the Rusett Fries.  Crispy oily simply perfect fries to go with your burger.  The organic ketchup was icing on the cake.  I couldn't get enough.  

Best burgers to get:
~ Pacific Bleu Burger is my favorite, I love how the bleu cheese gave it that kick. The caramelized onions balanced out the zestiness of the cheese. The burger was juicy, oozing with flavor in every bite.  

~ BBQ burger with aged white cheddar and bbq sauce, be sure to add the applewood bacon, smoky and sweet flavor with the Jalapeño Relish, Oil & Vinegar Slaw giving it a unique flavor.

~ Heritage Burger with the applewood smoked bacon, fontina chees, caramelized onions and the mild but tangy herb mayo

The burgers are just right, not to big and not too small.  Service is fast and the cozy laid back ambiance of the restaurant makes it a good place to eat with family and friends. They have good shakes,the ones worthy of me packing on more pounds are the salted caramel shake and the Blue Bottle coffee shake!

Food coma! Good night!
author: Maria M.

description:
I've been eating at Roam for over three years now, and I've somehow never gotten around to writing a review. This is likely due to the fact that the food is consistently delicious and I'm in such a food coma afterwards that I forget to write one!

The interior has plenty of seating, food doesn't take too long to arrive at your table, and sustainable products are used in their dishes. My favorite burger to order is their classic beef burger on a whole wheat bun. If I'm watching the carbs, I'll get it in a lettuce wrap. Their turkey burgers are juicy and flavorful, and on a recent visit I ordered their seasonal special: the Springtime burger that was absolutely scrumptious. You have your choice of protein and bun (or lettuce wrap) topped with Chimichurri, buffalo mozzarella, tomato, herb mayo, and arugula. Get it while they have it!

The sides are pretty tasty too. I usually split a side of sweet potato fries, and the only thing I wouldn't recommend here is the zucchini and onion haystack. The pieces aren't very easy to pick up (sliced SUPER thin) and they'd do better on top of a burger than as a side.

They have a nice selection of wines, beers, Boylan sodas, and house-specialty flavored sodas. They even have milkshakes if you want to make this an Americana-style diner experience (but with fresher ingredients!).

If you're craving a burger, veggie or otherwise, and find yourself on Fillmore definitely give Roam a go.
author: Liz G.

description:
BUFFALO burgers are here! That's pretty much all I need to know, but perhaps some of you need more.

This is place straddles bougie (food quality) and casual (ambiance). I think it's a great.

You have the option to build your own burger--which I don't usually like. So many choices can be crippling, or a disaster when you're greedy and want it all. But they also have a set menu so that you don't have to hide the mini-panic attack you're battling while trying to make decisions in a long, but quick moving line. Fries are cut to the perfect thickness with the just the right amount of seasoning.

Totally worth $10+ IMO.
author: Kristine W.

description: The Tejano burger and the pacific blue burgers are on point! The truffle Parmesan fries are good, but could be served a little bit crispier. And I believe you can request for it, but they may and may not be able to accommodate because they make the fries in "batches" so that is bummer. But aside from that food is really good. Clean and friendly, fast service! Meaning you are not waiting all day for your burger. It comes out hot and perfect every time!
author: Miguel Y.

description: Absolutely loved this place! I heard about this place bc my bf works for postmates from time to time and he had to pick up an order from here once. It looked like a really nice place to eat so I looked it up on Yelp and booked marked it! We finally had some time to go back and try it today.  It was my first time there today and I was just amazed. Customer service was phenomenal very friendly and welcoming staff, I told the cashier it was our first time here and she guided us through the menu. Our food came in pretty fast and everything was so delicious! Hands down one of the best burgers I've had and my bf also loved it. Will definitely be coming here again! Great job to all the workers there!
author: Karen V.

description: My bison heritage burger was everything I could wish for! Juicy, with a good amount of bacon and cheese. The fry-fecta totally topped off the dinner. If I had room for more, I would've tried the pumpkin pie milkshake. Woot!
author: Anne L.

description: Seriously yummylicious burgers and sweet potato fries, but I always come here for the hazelnut (Nutella?) chocolate shake. Perfect way to kill that burger aftertaste and enter a food coma.
author: Dejana B.

description:
Pastured meat and awareness of food sensitivities is a definite plus. 

I eat AIP paleo and was able to find a dish here. I ordered a grass-fed beef burger, no seasoning, wrapped in lettuce and topped with raw onion and avocado. 

I docked a star because they were very sparse with the onion and avocado, but I appreciate their willingness to make modifications for food sensitivities.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Friend was in town searching for a Bison burger. Came across this place on yelp and saw decent reviews. Unfortunately, this place just isn't that amazing, or my expectations were too high.

We split a sunny side elk* burger , a tejano bison burger + egg, and a side of truffle parmesan fries.

*elk is a special, I assume its not always on the menu.

Each burger was decent. The elk burger was cooked perfectly, but the sunny side flavours just didn't all mesh nicely together. The bison burger was a bit overcooked, and was a messy burger.

You know how in a good burger, the ingredients complement the meat and it unites in your mouth as a glob of heavenly goodness? It just didn't really click here. 

The fries were pretty good. Smaller portion, but definitely pretty good.

The price per value isn't quite there for a burger of this nature. Drop the prices a dollar, and I'd a little bit more okay with this. Not much else to say. I"m not sure I"ll be coming back, and I have a very neutral recommendation for this place. It's not bad, but it's not great. Maybe just skip it.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Roam deserves 4 stars alone for cooking up grass fed beef burgers without costing you an arm and a leg. I've ordered the Heritage burger three times now and haven't been disappointed. It has thick slices of bacon and sweet caramelized onions. Between bites i like sneaking in their regular french fries with truffle parmesan. 

Reminds me of The Counter. Customize your burger and side dishes the way you want it. Whole wheat bun or gluten free? Elk or bison patty? Sweet potato or zucchini onion fries? Going paleo and instead want to order mini patties on a salad? Options are plentiful enough to have something for everyone yet simple enough that Roam is able to execute a really good meal.

Their milkshakes are crack. The salted caramel shake came before my actual meal. I didn't want to enjoy dessert before my burger but one curious sip led to an empty cup in 5 minutes. A 12 oz is almost the price of their classic burger and so worth it considering the burgers are less than $10 each. I felt bad that i wanted to save room to go to Fraiche for froyo across the street. I felt NO desire after my Straus shake. Yum!
author: Samantha L.

description:
My family and I decided to try Roam Artisan Burger while on vacation in San Francisco after my dad saw it featured on the Food Network.  It was located about 30 minutes from our hotel, and I wasn't sure if it would be worth the trek up and down the hilly streets of San Fran in 30 degree weather - but I was pleasantly surprised. 

You get to choose from 4 patties - beef, turkey, bison or veggie.  You also get a choice of whole wheat, traditional sesame or gluten-free bun (or a lettuce wrap). You can build your own burger from a list of toppings or choose from a list of about 8 burgers. I chose the "French and Fry" beef burger on a traditional bun. The patty was topped with Gruyère, caramelized onion, avocado, watercress and french fries. It was nothing short of amazing. The beef patty was juicy and cooked to perfection! The avocado added a creamy texture and the cheese and caramelized onion added a punch of flavour.  

You can also choose from side salads or fries (we went with the fries - obvs).  We actually tried what they call the "fry-fecta", which is a mix of Parmesan truffle oil fries (drool), sweet potato fries and zucchini fries (shredded zucchini that is deep fried - salty deliciousness). 

The service was pretty quick (you order at the cash and they bring it to your table).  Although we were there around 4, as we hadn't yet adjusted to PST. 

To top it all off, this place is reasonably priced! $9.99 for the burger and $6.95 for the "fry-fecta" (which can definitely be shared between 2 - 3 people). 

If I'm ever in San Fran again, I will definitely return to Roam.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Best veggie burger I've ever had! I have no clue what they put in here besides quinoa but it was absolutely delicious. It looked like raw beef but on a closer look you could tell there's quinoa in there. The special sauce they had on it was also very good. The flavors in this burger are amazing, filling, and didn't leave my stomach feeling too heavy. The sweet potato fries were only ok which is why I give this place 4 stars. The veggie burger is 5 stars though.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I love this place. 

I always thought I was weird for stuffing my sandwiches or burgers with chips but the Tejano burger does just this. The Tejano burger has tortilla chips for a lil crunch, creamy avo, jalapeño relish for a lil kick, and the beef patty and bun are amazing as is. 

The shakes here are to die for. I love that there's a ton of rich creamy flavor but most or all I love the consistency of the shake itself. Not too thick and not too watery.

Definitely worth a "cheat day" to come here and stuff your face!
author: Grace Y.

description: Whenever I am craving for Burger I go to this place. Roam is one of the restaurants that handmade with love to nourish. Everything is tasty and quality. Besides that, The service is great.
author: Ana A.

description: Burgers are juicy and well prepared. The classic has always been a go to for me! Service is outstanding. They don't have any brand name sodas so be prepared! Their fries are delicious!
author: Francois C.

description: Yummm!!! Great artisan burgers!! I think they did an excellent job on the burgers and also the fries. I hate when one or the other sucks. So many fancy burgers to choose from. I got the one with the pepperjack cheese. I chose the bison patty and got a gluten free bun (Celiac). The bun was good! And all of the fries are gluten free (including the zuccini ones) because they don't have breaded things in the fryers! Woot!! The dipping sauces are also tasty. They do serve alcohol and have great homemade sodas. Definitely a winner here...check it out!
author: Christina C.

description: Absolutely love this place! It had one of the best veggie burgers, I have had ever! The taste of the burger was amazing. We had the trio sides with sweet potato fries, French fries, and zucchini ones, which were really good. Loved the fast service of the place & enjoyed the burger to the fullest!
author: Anisha S.

description: I really enjoy the burgers here, with a good assortment of toppings. Fries taste fresh cut. Burgers are juicy, with tasty buns, cheeses, mushrooms, grilled onions. Good soda options. Excellent veggie burger, one of my favorites in the city.
author: Sue D.

description: Came here for the first time this weekend before heading to the marina to see the Blue Angels.  Burgers, zucchini and onion haystack, sweet potato fries and French fries were all excellent.  The fries may be on the slightly saltier side but the burgers were delicious without relying on all the grease that seems to soak most burgers.  We tried the Chalet and Pacific Blue.  Caramelized pineapple soda was nothing special.  Service was quick and super friendly.  Bathroom was super clean
author: Jenn L.

description: I suppose if one knows nothing about cooking and wanted to focus instead on the crowd, it might be ok.  The food, however, is not worth the time or the money.  Leave it to the undiscriminating millennial crowd.
author: mandel b.

description:
Nice location with some convenient tables right outside (especially if you have a dog) but the burgers were just okay in my opinion.

I ordered the Sunny side (8.25) and the fry fecta (5.49).

The Sunny side had a reasonably tasty patty that was nicely medium and relatively juicy. However, I just wasn't that psyched with the garnishes. The sweet chilli sauce sounds interesting, but in reality just overpowered all the other ingredients in flavor. The sauce also wilted the greens which was a little gross. The Sunny side egg was overcooked with a solid yolk. Overall the burger felt a little small.

The fry fecta was okay as well. The sweet potatoes were good, the zucchini onions were okay, and the russets tasted a little off. Overall this was also a bit of a stingy portion. 

In general, convenient place for a burger, but maybe over exercising artistic license  on their "artisan" burgers.
author: Daffodil L.

description:
The best burger in town!
Highly recommended.. The atmosphere was great and the device is awesome ! Go and try!
author: Michael J.

description: Literally had the best veggie burger of my life from here! Although I'm not exactly sure what they put in the patty, I know that it's vegan and beet/quinoa based. Was absolutely amazing, and unlike any other that I've had. I was able to add a few toppings and a special sauce of my choice, which really capped off the experience. The fries were perfect, too. Homerun delivery place for me from now on! I can't speak about the regular burgers, but the veggie burger is highly recommended.
author: Suri A.

description: The concept of this place is great but the burgers were pretty bland. The best part was the bun and the fries.
author: Laura H.

description:
This place is a solid go-to for us. It's casual, it's clean and the food is good. I usually get the market salad with a side of the 3 mini turkey burger patties. Every single ingredient in the salad is fresh and highlights in-season ingredients. They rotate in-season ingredients that can range from heirloom tomatoes, pomegranate seeds, apple to persimmon pieces etc. I usually mooch off of my boyfriends herb dusted fries, they are tasty as well. I also love their Kombucha that is on tap and the occasional seasonal flavor. They always have the black currant which is a great juicy flavor but my fav is the seasonal coconut, sooo good. 
If you are looking for a delicious quick bite with a casual pay-ahead-and-grab-your-number-and-sit vibe, this is your place!
author: Sarah M.

description: I went to Roam today for dinner since I work at a neighboring business and I hate that I have to write this but I feel I should since I paid $16 for my order to be wrong twice. I ordered the bison which don't get me wrong was good but they got my order wrong the first time and I had no time to enjoy it on my break since I had to return it and leave back for work. They were nice enough to deliver it to my job which was great and convenient since it came up in conversation but the second burger I got was also wrong since it was still missing avocado that I had paid extra for. The girls were really nice but not worth the trouble for a $16 burger when I should have gotten burger king compared. But you live and you learn.
author: Michael E.

description:
A very big fan of the place, been here dozens of times during the last several years both here and on Union. Have a huge complaint on inconsistency. At first every time was 5+ stars. Now it's 1 star every second time and 4 stars every other time. Today I've got a super-wet and tasteless undercooked burger (my fav, Tejano beef) and wet zuccini. Left half of it on the plate, ao bad it was.

Also, since I hope this review will be seen by the management. What's wrong with the idea of selling hot drinks? Every time I have to go around the corner to Boulangerie to get my drip, how can you sell just lemonade and beer? Coffee + burger is the standard combo, no? Even your own folks suggest to buy coffee somewhere else so it seems I'm not the only one who asks for it.

Will give it one more try and if the same, switching to Super Duper. At least they have consistent 4+ stuff.
author: Mikhail L.

description:
Came here for dinner after craving a burger. Usually opt for Fritjz in the Mission but thankful to try something just as delicious. The family and I were impressed with the burgers. I had the Heritage Burger with beef while others in my group opted for Bison. We also shared the trio of shaved zucchini, sweet potato and French fries, which was the perfect size for 4. No complaints! We will definitely be back.

Highlights include:

- $7 red wine
- Fried trio
- Hazelnut shake 
- Pineapple lemonade 
- seasonal kombucha
- BURGERS!
author: Isidro M.

description: 3.5 stars for roam burgers. The service was fast and friendly and the burger was tasty but it wasn't anything special. We also had the trio of fries but I would just stick with the regular fries, the sweet potato fries were soggy and the weird courgette and onion fries were just too much work. I would stick with super duper burger, roam just didn't quite live up to expectations.
author: Allie S.

description:
You may roam if you want to, but don't do it would an Artisan Burger.

Tejano elk pink. Translates into a Durham Ranch all-natural Elk patty cooked medium rare with pepper jack cheese, a jalapeño sause, some avocado and herbed ranch.
