All you need to know is it's delicious! Throw in a mix of fries or the every faithful truffle fries and you're good to go. Don't do wheat? Not a prob with Gluten free buns for the asking. 

Cool vibe on the inside with high ceiling and plenty of natural light form the front but this joint disappoints the beer lover with 3 on tap and a handful of ok bottles. At least there's no crappy domestic.  

Order at the counter, you're number's up! No kick back and let your mouth roam.
author: Mark F.

description:
SHOUT OUT TO THE GIRL WITH THE REALLY SHORT HAIR. She was a sweetheart and patient with my indecisive ass, and was SOLID when she gave me a recommendation on ordering less fries by getting it in the kids size. As an industry person myself, I frequently tell guests at my restaurant how to order less and not get jipped or waste food, so I super appreciate her doing this. I wish I could have tipped you more then the petty cash I had; trust when I come back I will!

This review is long overdue because I go to ROAM at least once or twice a month. If you're a vegetarian its a MUST GO, as they make the best veggie burger I've ever had in my life. Not a typical garden burger frozen patty that you see at some burger joints trying to quickly throw in a meatless option (cough cough, looking at you super duper). Nope. Roam's stuff is top of the line, hand made patty. Premium produce. High quality buns. I can't speak for the meat stuff but just knowing that they even sell Bison and elk as options says to me they know what they're doing .

Consistently good quality. Amazing fries (all seasonings are delicious). I don't recommend the fry fecta though unless you're with a friend, or two, because it's gigantic!

Love this place. I wish there were more but I guess it's one of those gems that makes SF so special
author: Savanna W.

description: Always a hip & happening place for Monday Night football, or just to eat b-u-r-g-e-r-s. Yum yum...all American food with an organic bent.
author: Joanna T.

description:
Outstanding burger with and fast accurate service.
The girls at the checkout counter were very friendly and explained what the options are to this first time Roam-er!

Had the Heritage burger and it was flawless!
author: Ashish P.

description: Really a terrific experience here.  Burgers were very good.  Got Gluten Free bun and fries and they were very good.  A little pricey, but, I'll go back again.
author: Rich H.

description:
Best turkey burger in the US? That's what the Food Network had to say about Roam...best? No...great? Yes! 

My fiancé and I walked 2 miles from our hotel up hill, the entire way to have lunch here after we watched the food network feature their burgers. He ordered the turkey burger with an egg, and I had their veggie burger. I loved that you could have your burger in any of their styles with just a change of the patty, makes being a vegetarian so much easier. 

Roam burger is almost chain like with a gastro edge...super hip, super busy, and super tasty. Definitely give this place a try, you'll thank me for it later.
author: Judy C.

description:
How have I not reviewed Roam yet? This is my favorite burger place in SF so far. But wait - before you jump to conclusions - I would never categorize it as "a burger joint." 

This is a really nice place to hang out, with modern rustic decor (think: long wood tables, hanging lights). It's counter-service, but that's exactly fitting for the food and the atmosphere. And service has always been good. The only tricky thing is finding a seat on a busy night - it's a fend for yourself kind of place.

First things first, the burgers are A-MAZING. You can choose your protein (beef, bison, elk, and I think turkey, salmon, veggie as well) and then select from a menu of suggested combinations - or build your own. You can pick from three different kinds of fries (or get all three in the "fry-fecta"). I've gotten the 'French and Fry' with bison both times, which has avocado, gruyere, dijon, fries, and I believe arugula. I got it on a lettuce wrap instead of a bun, and the burger was SO GOOD that I didn't miss it one bit. Everyone else got different burgers and loved theirs, too. No complaints from anyone - and no leftovers either!

The fries are good - I liked them all. I do wish there was another dipping sauce option besides ketchup, but that didn't seem to stop me from eating them. I've also ordered the daily veggie special both times, and the lemon/garlic brussels sprouts were HANDS DOWN the best brussels to ever grace my face. Even my veggie-hating guy friends were fighting over them!

Milkshakes are great. Every flavor we've tried has been a winner, and I LOVE that you can get just a small size if you're feeling like having 'a taste' (or a medium, or a large...). 

SO pleased to have a good burger go-to in SF.
author: Catie F.

description:
They do it right! 

Addicted to their classic turkey burger, easy on the sauce, extra onions, sweet potatoe fries, hold the salt. 

Kudos to the sweetest team,  seamingly unphased by the endless lines of the clueless and indecisive. 

Occasionally it is so backed up I order on line while waiting at the location.
author: Wendyrama X.

description:
We tried this place last night for the first time and it was very good.  We both had classic beef burgers, though they accidentally swapped my medium patty with Kelle's well-done, but we were able to fix that ourselves without too much trouble.  The burgers were very tasty, as were the toppings.  We also got the Fri-Fecta - russet fries, sweet potato fries, and fried zucchini strings - and all were very good.

Kelle got the blood orange soda, which she loved, and I got the black currant kombucha, which I though was delicious.

Overall a great dining experience that didn't break the bank.  Will definitely go back.
author: Kevin K.

description: Oh man- this veggie burger is BOMB. It's my favorite veggie burger in the city. You can get it in about 5 different ways... I usually go for the one with the tortilla strips and avocado in it. It's large and super filling. Get it with a side of maple sweet potato fries and you will be in heaven. If you REALLY want to go all out, order a shake too!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Surprisingly, there are not too many good burger places along the Pacific Height-radius of Fillmore Street. Sure, there are Johnny Rocket's, Burger King and McDonald's near Japantown. As we know, they are diners and fast-food establishments. Those three abovementioned businesses do not blend well in the area. 

But the local Roam Burger Company has opened their second location on busy and family-friendly part of Fillmore Street. And Roam is the first gourmet burger business in that area. 

For my debut of the new second location, I ordered the BBQ Bison Burger for $11.50. The BBQ burger is regularly cost $8.50. But the lean Bison meat costs an additional $3.00. The featured gourmet burger comprised the lean buffalo meat with melted white cheddar, caramelized onions, tangy BBQ Sauce and a hint of vinegar slaw in a puffy sesame bun. The Bison meat is very lean and a better alternative to my usual beef. I like!

There are no combo meals here and every item is sold separately. So I ordered a side of shredded zucchini and onion Haystack fries for $3.50. And I also ordered an iced-cold bottle of Scrimshaw Pale Ale for $5.00. My unorthodox-style continues when I inserted a handful of the shredded side into my burger. "We eat like PIGS from where we're from!"

As I was "woofing down" my burger like the Tazmanian Devil, I was browsing the busy streets of Fillmore Street. It was such a great view it was with many people walking up and down that busy street. 

I enjoyed the burgers and beverages from the original Union Street location very much. And congratulation to the owner for opening a second location, which happen to be a HUGE success. I hope the success will bring more locations in the future. I'll be there and support them for damn sure, when that happens.

Oh yeah, my meal: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4eaK2-Q0dEXWMr5SOoV_Sg?select=zUvktUZbaV7YA52pxVQerA#rKsqVQXcTKySvoNQw26oaA
author: Matt G.

description:
Roam is everything you could possibly imagine and more.  The intimate decor brings you inside to a bustling crowd that spills out into the streets.  The open windows and quaint curbside offers the people watching you crave.  Oh and the burgers are good too.

I always opt for the original beef patty with everything but onion. It is probably one of the juiciest without being bloody burgers out there.  I have yet to try another famous hot-spot (Starts with "U") but I must say that they have a lot to contend with.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Fri-Fecta!?!? you Betcha!

Thanks to my wife for finding this place for my B-Day last year, it ended up as my birthday dinner.

You choose to create your own burger: meat,style,sauces,toppings.
Here was my creation:

Step 1: Beef
Step 2: Tejano: Pepper Jack, Jalapeno Relish,Avocado,Tomato, White Corn Strips and Herb Ranch
Step 3: Truffle Parmesan Fries and Caramelized Onions
Step 4: Devouring the Burger, the ground beef tasted kinda grassy but I've over came it, but the toppings made the the overall burger good.

The Fri-Fecta was my favorite here it has:
 
Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and Zucchini Onion Haystack in a bowl. All three were tasty,crispy and was fun to eat.

Make sure you add some of that Organic Chipotle Habanero Pepper sauce for your burger and Fri-Fecta to some kick. You will find a bottle of that at the condiments booth.

Their Blood Orange Soda went with my meal too and completed my experience.
author: Jon B.

description:
My boyfriend and I absolutely love Roam. It's such a delicious, reasonably priced, and convenient place to satisfy that burger craving. 

The fri-fecta is my favorite side and the milkshakes are also extremely creamy and filling. My first choice burger is the sunny side (fried egg!) 

For this particular location, it is really cozy and about half the size of the one in the Marina. However, when my boyfriend had a large group dinner here for a casual birthday get-together, the manager did everything in his power to get us seated at a reasonable time, even though the tables are all first-come first serve. This is no easy feat for a group of 10+ so it was really appreciated.
author: Jenny M.

description: This burger was good. We came here for my Birthday. I only eat a couple burgers a year, so I try to pick a good place. They offer all kinds of fries which are hand cut, and organic milk shakes to top it off. The grassfed burgers are flavorful, and the style at the restaurant is unpretentious. My only complaint is I really like a good toasted bun, and this bun was a bit soggy. Not sure if they always do it like that, or if I just happened to get a soggy bun. All in all, I've had better, but I would come back.
author: Sara V.

description:
The burger was good but it would've been amazing if it has a bit more flavoring. I love the setting of the restaurant and how big their food portions are. Lastly, it's a nice place to just sit and hang out with friends.

Ps: must get there sweet potato fries
author: Mindy P.

description: I liked this place! The burger I had was delicious and full of toppings. I also ordered a kombucha, and it was so refreshing. The atmosphere of the place was also pretty chill. Seating can be a little tight, so you might have trouble if you're with a large (5+) group. There's one large table, but it might be full if you go at a busy time.
author: Jen A.

description: This place is dope. There's a wide array of vegetarian/vegan burgers you can get here. Personally, I go for the Sunny Side burger: egg, white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, and sweet chili sauce. It's a winning formula. Their fries are pretty standard, which is good. (As long as they're not ridiculously salty, I'm sold.) They've also got some artisan sodas here that are pretty good. It's a solid choice if you're a vegetarian or vegan who has the munchies. I'm trying the Tejano burger or Heritage burger next. I'll be back again and again!
author: Ashish B.

description:
Here's how it works

1. You pick a meat (I got Bison)
2. You pick a style of burger (I got French and Fries)
3. Profit

I would say the Bison meat was extremely juicy and lean (good alternative to beef for those of y'all who want a "healthier" option), however the French and Fries is a tad bit on the salty side. I would attribute it to Roam's Fries, they are a little bit too salty. I also got to try the other fried pickings which included sweet potato fries (good) and the zucchni rings (great). 

Not 5/5 because the French and Fries burger had it's salty moments and the regular fries were also too salty for my liking. Very nice vibe and great to explore pac heights and Japantown after!
author: Sean S.

description: Amazing! !  As mentioned in other reviews, a very wide selection. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The food is very consistent. There usually is a line, but moves quickly. Today my girlfriend tried one of the salads...it looked and tasted wonderful!  Try and take home their hot sauce as well. A must visit!
author: Joe G.

description:
Why can't you exist in SoCal as well?

Their burgers were fantastic, the sweet potato fries were epic. and I love their patio out front that allowed me to people watch in the city while I enjoyed a delicious meal. I'd visit again often if I lived in the Bay Area.
author: Cristina B.

description:
Came into Roam because it was a little different then the rest of the food in the area. The place had a great vibe, very old fashioned bar look. Felt like I had stepped back in time, till I saw the flat screens.

We went with a Bison burger, chalet style on a sesame seed bun. Burger came out quick and was a perfect medium. The toppings were fresh and well prepared. Also ordered the Fry-fecta, a combo of russet, sweet potato fries, and fried zucchini and onion straws. All three types were good but the russet leaned towards the bland side. Zucchini straws were delicious and I'm normally not a fan. Topped it off with a house made Blackberry Soda which was super flavorful and a little tart. Very nice in my opinion.

All in all very satisfied. Wish they were near my home.
author: Zachary H.

description:
Since moving from Portland, OR I've had a hell of a time finding a good burger.. Mostly restaurants here serve just a meat/bun and call it gourmet. That's bull-shit. 
Not only was there lettuce/tomato on Roam's burger but it was cooked to perfection, saucy and delicious! Holding back 1 star for the seating set-up. Adding anxiety of where to sit isn't good for the digestion. I will definitely be going back for that perfect PMS treat.
author: Kristine P.

description: I just ate the Wild Boar Burger. It was juicy and succulent with the jalapeno relish.
author: Michael K.

description: They charge you $3 extra for a bison burger. The meat was dry and the broccolini vegetable was a very small portion and very plain and dry as well. The milkshake was good, but small. It's hard to find a good burger and with the price of $30 for a burger, vegetable, and fries it was very expensive. I don't understand why this place is so popular now that I've tried it I think it is overrated.
author: Jackie H.

description:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon after hearing recommendations from my friends about this place for burgers and I have to say it's as good as it gets in the japantown area! Got here around 12:30pm and it was PACKED. I was lucky and the minute we finished ordering our food, I found open seats at the bar to sit and eat.

I got the Heritage burger and it was delicious. They messed up my order in the beginning but they quickly fixed it and even though it is super crowded they were very patient and polite with all the customers. The burger itself was juicy and HUGE. I had a hard time fitting the entire burger into my mouth to take a bite but the flavors were great and melts into your mouth. I also had the russet fries and we shared that between the three of us but that little container is deceiving. We kept thinking we were at the bottom but it never ended.

I would definitely recommend everyone to try this place out and get their milkshakes and drinks as well. It seemed like everyone was getting it.
author: Angela S.

description: Best artisan burger place in SF. (if you want a basic burger - go to super duper or in n out). But if you want flavor and richness go to Roam. I've brought my dad here twice (who is super picky about burgers since he considers his own the best) and my mom here as well (who is vegan) and they both even raved about it. My favorite is the heritage burger because i love the cheese and bacon, but I think at the end of the day, I would enjoy any burger from here. The wait is never even that bad which is exceptional considering how long the line can appear at peak hours. They are also dog friendly (on the patio) which is always a plus in my book
author: McKenzie D.

description:
Two stars from me and four stars from my husband.  Here's the difference in experience:

Bison burger, classic: He downed this burger, and the comment I got was that "it tasted more like beef than beef."  Not sure what that means, but he said it was lean, juicy and delicious... and he ate it pretty fast.  If you're a meat eater, you're looking out for your health and you won't sacrifice taste, go for the bison burger.

Veggie burger, bbq: the quinoa/rice/beans/beets patty was not good.  Even the bbq sauce and condiments couldn't hide the fact that this veggie patty has a bad taste and texture.  Every bite was like biting into... only beets.  It tries hard and fails harder.  Reformulation!  This thing, compared to Houston's Hickory Burger (w/housemade veggie patty) is just no comparison at all.  I encourage you to give Houston's a try (Hickory style) and drop me a note.  Also, the fry bowl/basket thing with the three different fry types (sweet potato, haystack and russet) was blah as well.  Normally, I'm really into fries, but the russet fries were way too plain and the haystack fries are a joke.  They're like that stuff from a can that your friend from Iowa puts on top of his homemade green-bean casserole.  Bad idea - they have no place as a side, they should be piled on someone's burger only.

Other things: it's a decent atmosphere, the people who work here are friendly and it's in a good area (Fillmore) with lots of shops, cafés and people watching.  Parking is sparse, but it's there -- you can take the 38 bus and walk north on Fillmore.
author: Coleen C.

description: This review was just for the beef burger.  It was OK; nothing special and not worth the price (I understand that they have to charge these prices to cover the exorbitant Fillmore Street rent).  The fries are good.  Very nice atmosphere, location, and service.  You won't leave here disappointed; you just won't be wowed.  I'll try a different type of burger next time and update my review accordingly.
author: JJ M.

description:
Food came out fast. Highest note of the visit cuz I was starving. 

Got the veggie burger and it left me full and feeling light, not weighed down like how I usually feel if I eat red meat.

Fries were a little salty.
author: Julie L.

description:
We came here around 11:30 AM on a weekday, it was my first time here and loved the atmosphere. It was definitely busy but not crowded or slow and there were enough tables open for easy sitting. The restaurant and bathrooms were both clean and bright!

We ordered their seasonal Strauss Family Creamery Shake - the Hazelnut Chocolate. It was DELICIOUS. Expensive ($5.25) but worth it! We ordered the 12 oz for two and it was plenty. Definitely rich so I suggest sharing it and drinking water with your burger as well.

I ordered the Turkey BBQ Burger and I would definitely order it again. I was worried because there were a few wet ingredients (slaw, oil, vinegar), but the bun was toasted and strong enough to withhold all of it. Also, the burger was a good size so that it wasn't too difficult to eat.

My friend enjoyed her Turkey Heritage Burger as well! 

I can't wait to return and try more of the menu.
author: Laura C.

description:
First off, the veggie burger is tasteless. I got the tejano, and my boy friend got the bbq one. The bbq sauce is more of an a1 steak sauce and tasted like vinegar. BOTH were literally tasteless, no flavor, had to drown our 40 $ meal in hot sauce. The veggie patty is
Made from beets making it look PINK. I DONT WANT TO EAT A VEGGIE PATTY THAT RESEMBLES UNCOOKED RAW MEAT. 

Fries were soggy and average. Meh 

THE CHOCOLATE MILK SHAKE was the best part of the meal, which is the only reason for getting 3 stars. 
I wish I could rewind my life and have never came here.
author: Jaymee W.

description:
This is our favorite burger in the city. All of their fries are fantastic, with the sweet potato fries being our personal favorite. We are partial to the Pacific blue burger - go with beef with a bit of pink - but have also enjoyed pretty much everything on the menu.

While always crowded, the line tends to move fairly quickly.
author: William W.

description:
Options. Oodles and oodles of options.

Roam isn't the best burger joint for indecisive individuals whose appetites roam all over the place. You have to choose your meat (they have elk and bison whaaaa), your rarity (default to medium-rare, of course), your style, your bun (even lettuce for the carb conscious), and potentially your cheese. Make it a double for $3.25 more. The power is yours.

First was the $6.50 ($6.25 when I went last year) BEEF CLASSIC, with butter lettuce, tomato, onions, house-made pickles, and house sauce. Cheese is an extra buck.

Next was the $8.50 ($8.25 when I went last year) BEEF TEJANO with pepper jack, jalapeño relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, and herb ranch.

We finished with the $5.99 ($5.49 when I went last year) FRY-FECTA with the trio of russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack fries.

Goodness, the combination of ingredients melded just right. The medium-rare was on-point, making for a hearty&juicy patty, and the bun was crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside. You can't go wrong with the classic. The tejano was rich and savory.

Oh, do yourself a favor by stuffing the zucchini onion haystack fries in your burger. That should be mandatory.
author: Adele F.

description:
Disappointing experience!
First time there, noone could offer a suggestion or even mention that I may want to order fries with my burger as it was so small?
Also, isn't is the norm to ask how the customer wants the burger cooked? The attitude almost made me leave right away.

They were overstaffed but none were helpful, I had to ask for napkins then wait 10 minutes for my check. Not once was I asked if I liked the burger or if I wanted another drink; the hiring manager seriously needs to pay attention to staff!

As for the burger, the meat was under seasoned, there was barely any flavor & it fell apart upon taking a bite, very unusual for elk.
The bun was OK, a little dry & did not seem fresh.
The homemade pickles were good, I would have ordered a side of fried pickles if they had them, I don't know as I wasn't asked a single question or comment by staff in the 40 minutes I was there.

If you want a quick burger & drink, in the area, there are better places available, this place has good potential but is very laxidasical about customer service so I probably will not return, unless just for drinks.
author: Ro B.

description: After hearing friends rave about this place for months I finally had a chance to go. In a word... Underwhelming. On the bright side, the fry-fecta was a thing of beauty. The zucchini and onion crisps were perfectly seasoned and we happily went to town on the French and sweet potato fries. With this said, my sister and I both got the tejano burger and I'm so confused as to how something covered in pepper jack and jalapeño relish could be so tasteless. My turkey burger was mediocre at best and I ended up adding hot sauce to each bite to boost flavor and moisture. My sister loved her veggie patty (they use beets and quinoa and it's really nicely done) but hated how bland the burger toppings were. I'd go back but I'd stay far away from the tejano.
author: Araba A.

description: Ordered online at 7:00. It said pick-up at 7:30. I arrived on time and was handed my burger by a friendly lady. The burger was cooked to perfection medium rare and was super tasty. I customized it with cheese and bacon. What more could one ask for in a neighborhood burger place?
author: Jordan C.

description: Love this place.  friendly staff and amazing burgers.  Have tried everything on the menu and like it all, with special recognition of the tejano and sunny side.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Review is for the service not the food. The food there is bomb, everybody knows that!

The friend I was with ordered the heritage burger. She forgot to ask with no cheese. They brought out the burger and we  were like "oh shit" there's cheese on it. So I take the burger to the gal and say "I'm really sorry, we messed up. We forgot to order this burger without cheese cuz the gal I'm w can't eat cheese." So I ask if can get another and tell her I can pay for the new burger since we didn't order correctly. 

They took the old burger, then brought me the new bill. Didn't tip this time around. Then they brought the new burger and we left.

Anyways, just felt like it was bad form of them to charge me for a new burger because we messed up by forgetting to say no cheese.

Word to the wise, make sure your order is exactly right!! If you make a mistake, it'll cost you!
author: Kirk G.

description: Holy wow! This place was at the top of the list to try while in San Fran, and it did not disappoint. The service was outstanding--friendly staff, prompt delivery of food. I ordered a house made meyer lemon soda, and I wanted to drink a gallon of it. Seriously one of the best drinks I've had in a long time. For food, I ordered the winter burger and truffle Parmesan fries...both were exquisite. My only regret was not trying one of their house made sauces. If you like a good burger, you must go to Roam.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
The zucchini haystack fries are the BOMBBBB! I need them in my life at least once a month.

The burgers here are top notch, and being from Buffalo NY, I appreciate the REAL blue cheese they offer as a topping. They have tons of delicious toppings and burger options!

I also enjoy their salads! They're fairly cheap for a solid amount of salad/toppings and dressing, so I'd definitely recommend trying them.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Must have visited on a bad day because I can't imagine how they have 4 stars!

First of all the burgers are fried! Not using a grill is an Auto 3 star rating especially when you use less flavor low fat meats like these. My Turkey burger was tiny (like an oversized slider), dry and came on a bun even though I asked for lettuce wrapped. They returned it with lettuce but it was now cold and came on some wilted lettuce. My salad was from a bag and was clearly a few days old as there was lots of crumpled dry leaves underneath. My guest also was not a big fan of the fried burger and says the bun was low quality and seems like it was just generic grocery store quality. Her sweet potatoes fries were good. All in all severely overpriced for the quality and extremely disappointing based on our expectations from the previous reviews.
author: Eric B.

description: Yummmm!!!! I come to roam for lunch with my girlfriend about once a week. We always share the French and fries burger with a turkey patty, the delicious market salad, and the Parmesan truffle fries! It's always such a delicious treat!
author: Carly M.

description:
I had the Sunny Side in a lettuce wrap which has the following: Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce.  Maybe it's because I was sick, maybe it's because my tongue was coated and numb from eating only cough drops all day, but I found my burger to be too sweet and cooked a little too rare.  They didn't ask how I wanted it cooked, which was my fault.  It was also extremely wet from the sauces, onions, and abundant wraps of lettuce, so it was really messy to eat.  The fries were small in portion and had too much parmesan and parsley, but not enough truffle flavor.  I wish I could love you, Roam Burger!

I'll try again as the real me and go for the Tejano Burger, my first instinct.
author: Terry K.

description:
They must have changed their customer service, because my most recent visits to this location have been great (read precious review for old customer service review). And I come here quite a bit. Yeah, I'll admit to that. Whatever.

But, tonight, my review was updated to reveal to you the GREATEST BURGER EVER. 

Have you seen that episode of How I Met Your Mother where Marshall is going on a search through New York City in search of the greatest burger that he ever had? Yes? Well, my reaction to the burger I had tonight is probably what Marshall was looking for in that episode.

I give to you: "The Heritage" (beef) w/ an Organic Free-Range Egg ($10)

First off, "The Heritage" ($8.50) has Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina cheese, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions and Herb Mayo. I don't even like mayonnaise (at least I don't think I do), but Roam knows how to do it. 

Then, add an Organic Free-Range Egg (additional $1.50) to it. Or not... But, you'll regret it. Because who doesn't want breakfast on their burger? I mean, ask anyone. Breakfast. Burger. That b-power alliteration, man.

Best food decision that I ever made. You're welcome.
author: Gabriela K.

description:
Had high expectations but was disappointed: it was not a "sit down" restaurant, but instead an "order when you walk in, get a number and sit down" kind of place, which I didn't like. I felt rushed and didn't have a chance to read and know exactly what I wanted before I had to order.

Also, the menu didn't contain as many items as I would have liked. I would think for a speciality burger place they would have more created options, but was disappointed with only 7-8 or so.

Ordered the French and fries burger and was disappointed. I heard it was one of their most popular but wasn't sure why. The saltiness from the fries plus the mustard and whatever else was on it was a very weird combo I did not enough.

The bathrooms were not very clean either.

Overall, probably would not come back.
author: Christy M.

description: Hearty Burgers & delicious milk shakes. Make sure you get the bruleed marshmallow for an extra buck. Thumbs up SF!
author: Horacio V.

description: So it was chill no line on a Thursday afternoon. Had a burger and something didn't taste right. I can't put my finger on it but I was really put off by it. The portions are OK loved the zucchini fries. And the price was steep for a burger fries and a soda 25$. It wasn't horrible def not all the rage tho.
author: nancy w.

description:
I'm a fan. Great burgers, fresh ingredients, you can literally taste the difference. 

There's plenty of interesting flavorful burger creations that bring out the juices in the burger. And it's all fairly priced in a quick casual atmosphere. Beer on tap is a plus. 

If you want to be adventurous or healthy, there's elk & bison options available. But c'mon if you're fiending for a burger on your off day, you might as well get the "french and fries" burger loaded with truffle parmesan fries & gruyere cheese. Trust.  Don't forget the zucchini haystack, that thing is full of deliciousness.

Seating at peak times can appear daunting but the turn around is fairly quick, relax & enjoy!
author: Steven C.

description: So to keep it short, these burgers are tasty but the fries really stole the show for me. I went with a group of 5 and we each ordered different burgers and 3 orders of fries. We loved our experience and the food but for some reason we left with the impression that the burgers didn't live up to the hype on Yelp.
author: Reina C.

description: I came back again to show my friend, and yes, it was still as amazing. That sunny side burger is so ridiculously good, it's ridiculous.
author: Melina N.

description:
Roam burgers aren't cheap, but they are juicy, flavorful and very filling. I recommend the buffalo burger (one of the few places that offers that meat) as it's leaner and less fatty tasting than beef. They also offer other types of meat for your burgers and toppings such as egg. 

Now, being that I am not the biggest meat eater and usually only go to places like this for the hubby, my favorite thing to get here which is their shake, made with organic Strauss milk with the option to add a toasted marshmallow on top- is HANDS DOWN the best shake I've ever gotten in the city!! I usually get the coconut, Tahitian vanilla or strawberry but you can't really go wrong either way! =D
author: Petra S.

description: $10 Burgers?  Pretty tasty but small patties. I had the Tejano, pepper jack, jalapeño relish, avocado, white corn chips and herb ranch.  With a side of thin zucchini onion fries. $6 pints and good conversation with a view of busy Fillmore Street. We got there right at 11:30,  first in line,  but 1.5 hours later it was packed,  loud and a line to the door. If I go back I'll allow some time to get a table.
author: Jordan K.

description:
Dang it! Why do I keep trying this place? The grill was messed up when I came here yesterday! I'm really going to leave you alone! UGH!!!!!!!!

It's like a bad relationship. I want out and I know it's not right for me, but I just keep on..... trying.
author: Sweets N.

description:
Solid fresh and filling burgers and homemade sodas make this restaurant a must. It's surprisingly affordable with plentiful portion sizes, always busy with families and groups, and a great place to watch a soccer game or sit on a patio to people watch.

Try the classic, chalet (mushrooms!), bbq burgers with the Fry-Fecta and an artisan soda. YUMMM!
author: Regina D.

description:
This is actually a really good place and deserves at least a 4-star(+) for their burgers .. BUT they just can't get their phone orders right.  This is now the 3rd time in a row (I swear ..) that I ordered on the phone for pickup and they managed to get it wrong.  The breakdown is either at the register or kitchen (or combo), so no consistency there either.  

I hope management read this so they can straighten this out once and for all.  I hope you read it this so that next time you order by phone, make sure to inspect the goods thoroughly before you walk out the door :)

8/25 update: the owner reached out and promised to fix this.  As such, I emphasize the first sentence in my review: "This is actually a really good place and deserves at least a 4-star(+) for their burgers".
author: Philip I.

description:
It is laughable that people write Roam has the best burger in SF. I have been there 3x.
I do enjoy the burger but it's not remarkable. Last time I just ordered the Classic Burger.
There were very few customers, but it took a long time to get my food. The burger was good
and I did mostly enjoy it, however the fries were crap. They were stringy, greasy, soggy and
I had to stop eating them. If you are going to have  an expensive gourmet burger restaurant you need to have at least decent fries. I probably will not return.
author: Ken J.

description: One of our favorite places to eat while on the city. Sustainable options. Salads, burgers and shakes are delicious. Don't forget the kombucha and zucchini fries!
author: Fabi P.

description: If you want a tasty burger this is it, so tasty.  The market fresh salad is so delicious, filled with thinly sliced radish, carrots, farm fresh lettuces, pumpkin seeds, cherry tomatoes, Avacado, just great ingredients.  Love their dressings, great salad.  The burger is made with the best combinations.  Fun place to stop while shopping Filmore street.  Reasonable prices too.
author: Carole W.

description: Food is great, however, I was in recently to purchase veggies to go. I spent $9.00 for 12 microscopic pieces of cauliflower. I went back to complain and the gal at the register shook her head and said sorry. I am never eating here again -- total ripoff.
author: J V.

description: Yes, just yes.  This place just saved my life when I realized hotel Kabuki no longer had room service and I really did not want Japanese food anyway.  First of all anyone who has something called a "fryfecta" is a friend of mine.  I was super in the mood for a chicken sandwich, apparently impossible to obtain in Japantown, so tried the Turkey Burger.  Delicious.  House made pickles - To. Die. For.  If I had known I would have gotten a place of pickles as a side.  Forgot my drink (to go order) and woman chased me down the street.  So nice.  Anyway haven't even finished eating and needed to review!
author: Jenny C.

description: This is definitely a must try for everyone who comes to San Francisco! It's extremely delicious and fresh. The burgers are grass fed beef and the turkey burgers are free range which is great for the price. Highly recommend this joint!!
author: Shereen M.

description:
The burgers were great.  We stumbled upon this gem while driving down the street and was very impressed.  I got the heritage and also had half of my finances French and fry.  Both knocked my socks of.... Literally off.  I had to go grab them off the street.  This was the only mistake I made today.  The reason it was a mistake was because I had to go back and grab my socks when I tried the truffle oil fries. 

All in all this joint is worth a drive and your money.  I think the burger was a great price but the fries were kind of expensive.
author: Mike S.

description: Food was very tasty, even for us vegetarians. The service was quick and quite good. The restaurant is cramped and not great for a group of 10 like us. We all did have fun. Though the vegetarian options are limited, the veggie burger was really excellent.
author: Ashish D.

description:
S: A friendly, fun vibe with good mix of 80s, 90s, and contemporary music playing over a diverse crowd of teens, twenty-somethings, and young families with kids (high chairs are tucked away in the corner). A bit loud with music and conversation, but not unexpected for a boppin' place at dinner, even for a Wednesday evening. When I first walked into here, I had high hopes that I may have found my Bare Burger equivalent in SF.

O: Two burgers ($10.49 each), a side of fries, and two draft beers (Allagash White and Boont Amber, $6 each) isn't too bad. The Tejano jalapeño relish was superb and the fries good, but nothing special. The ingredients used were definitely fresh and satisfying. However, upon inspection of our beef burgers, I was quite surprised and disappointed by the relative lack of burger. It immediately made me think it was a McDonald's patty... Thin, tasteless, not a man's burger. If I'm at a place that has "burger" in the name, I expect a real burger patty in my burger.

A/P: A relatively nice place to bring friends for drinks and some food, but given the immense thinness of the burger, I could not bring myself to have friends here if they are hankering for a burger. These are more like sandwiches (albeit good ones), and the burgers have so little meat, they may as well be vegetarian burgers. For the price, not worth a second trip if I had the choice. I'll stick to my Bare Burger for good burgers and beers.

Overall rating: 3.0, mostly for the scarcity of burger in my "burger."
author: Chris B.

description: This place is great. Fantastic burgers, really top notch, with a bun toasted crispy. I had some truffle fries which were just right. It's also excellent for kids, they've got crayons and a little activity sheet and everything. And to top it all off, the shakes are great (and there's even a small size shake if you don't want a giant calorie bomb). I had the pumpkin pie shake and they totally nailed it - it was like pumpkin pie in a cup. I will be back.
author: Marco C.

description:
Yeeeeah, this place has some tasty burgers for sure! My friends and I were walking around the neighborhood searching for a good place to eat lunch on a Sunday after church service. It wasn't noon yet, and thank goodness because the place wasn't yet full. (Different story when we left though! I'd like to say we brought the crowd in ;)). 

FOOD
-Tejano Burger. Anything that has 1. Avocado, 2. Pepper Jack cheese, and 3. Jalapenos = my perfect combination. It wasn't even a question, as soon as I laid eyes on this off the giant menu on the wall, I knew this was what I was having for lunch. Hmmhmm yes. It was DELISH! The traditional bun was soft. Tomato slices were thick and juicy. Also had chips inside.  Everything else was flavorful, overflowing goodness. Get it, you won't regret!
-The Fry-fecta. All three fry options into one platter for just $2.50 more! regular, sweet potato fries, and the zucchini onion haystack. All of them were crispy, salty, and tasty. Yum. If you want something different, go for the Zucchini Onion Haystack fries - they're thinner than your standard fry, but REALLY good!
-Shakes!! I can't remember if we got plain chocolate or had a mix of them.... it was GOOD. They have a ton of flavors. If you're lucky they also have seasonal flavors :) 

TIPS
-Water station + condiments to the side across from the cashier. Be sure to grab lots of napkins, 'cause you'll need them.
-Come before popular meal times, this place is popular and fills up fast!!

5/5 stars for sure :9
author: Grace J.

description: Wow. All I have to say for this place is wowwww! If you love burgers, then you'll know and taste the quality of the burgers made here. It is truly amazing and full of quality. I love everything that is offered in the Fry-Fecta, which comes with sweet potato fries, regular fries, and zucchini haystack. It's the perfect side and appetizer to share! Their hamburger buns are so soft and tastes soooo good. I usually get my burgers with beef, well done, but if you want to try something a bit more extravagant, I would definitely recommend trying Bison because OH MY GOD IT IS SO SOFT. MmmmMm. I can still remember how soft the bison burger tasted when I first tried it!!!!! Honestly the key to Roam Artisan Burgers is to just be creative. You can have it allllll in your burger~~~~(almost). And last but not least, please do not forget to try their milkshake, IT IS DIVINE, SMOOTH, & CREAMY. Definitely worth every penny in my opinion. You really get what you pay here compared to buying burgers at a fast food franchise, it's truly quality food!
author: Jane N.

description:
We are burger fans but with so many great places to chow down in the City it's taken this long to try Roam.  But better late than never.  Read the yelp reviews prior to coming so had an idea of what to try. 

Hubby and I both went with the Tejano burger.  We each chose the bison patty. And side order of the fry-fecta.  Hubby had an IPA and I had the bottled root beer.  The order taker asked did we want it cut?  We asked cut what??  I'm thinking how can you cut a beverage.  She said the burger.  We said we wanted two burgers.  

Patties are fairly thin which I like.  The Tejano style burger includes pepper Jack cheese, jalapeño relish, avocado slices, tomato, and strips of tortilla chips.  You need big hands to hold on to the burger.  Bison was somewhat too gamey for me but overall a very good burger.  Next time I'll try either the beef patty or the turkey patty.

The fry-fecta came in a round metal skillet.  Plenty to share for two.  Russet fries, sweet potato fries, and shredded zucchini and white onions.  

Self service flatware, paper napkins, ketchup, and water. 

You also have a choice of designing your own burger.  

$39.00 for lunch for two.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Casual burger joint that was recommended to us by a friend, after failing to get our ramen fix from the ramen festival :(

The line was out the door when we arrived. You order and grab a number and find your own seats. So if you see somebody get up, snag those seats so you have somewhere to sit once your food is ready! On crowded days, you'll be waiting with your number stalking tables just to get a seat. Lots of people were waiting outside trying to find a spot to sit.

I ordered the Tejano burger which did not disappoint! When the server brought my burger out it had fallen apart, he just took it upon himself to say hang on and brought me a new one. Good service! Also ordered the fry-fecta fries...the regular fries were the only thing I liked. =/ Not a huge fan of the other two types so I would probably avoid that my next time. Will definitely be back if I'm in the area again!
author: Emily C.

description:
My dad who is a health nut on a plant based diet watched some show on the food network that featured this place, and it is our go to place when he comes and visits from the East Coast. Everything here is amazing, for herbivores and carnivores alike.

I love that you can get the burgers as a salad, it's perfect for paleo and lower carb based dieting!
author: Meaghan H.

description:
you better come here hungry!

Veggie burger with mushrooms and ranch
- the bun was crispy, and i appreciated that the patty was home made.  this was a good guilt-free burger i would order again

Truffle Parmesan Fries
- they sure don't skimp on the parmesan! there was so much excess topping that i had to grab it like chopsticks with my fries, YUM!

Chocolate hazelnut milkshake
- NUTELLA ICE CREAM are you kidding me?? and it was smooth good quality ice cream! non of that icy stuff

Excellent phone and customer service by the enthusiastic blonde girl at the register was like the cherry on top

Although not the most unique of meals, Roam would certainly will be safe/good choice for your fatty food cravings!
author: Tina A.

description: If you're reading this review you're missing out on valuable time ordering your food while you smell the aroma of pure deliciousness. This was my first time trying a bison burger and I am glad I did. It was grilled medium and was served with some specialty sauce. I went ahead and ordered all the spreads they had available on the side and made my own concoction. The result: Magic. I enjoyed my burger which was partnered with a generous amount of fries. The fries were thin, crispy, addicting, and plentiful. Overall a 5/5 experience from the beginning to end.
author: Jorge C.

description:
The bison burger with BBQ was a little mushy for my taste. The coleslaw was sparse and not crunchy, and the bun was deflated even before I took my first bite (presumably from all the liquids from the coleslaw and bbq sauce absorbing into the bun itself). The truffle parmesan french fries did not have any truffle taste to them, so that was also a miss. 

However, the milkshake was a good custardy texture! I got the Blue Bottle Coffee flavor and loved it. If you want just a little taste of milkshake (this stuff is RICH!), I would recommend the kids size.
author: Marilynn L.

description:
If I had to rate Roam Artisan based on food only, it's a 5-star joint. The burgers are bomb, especially the elk - they're cooked just right and the components (including the bun) are flat out heaven in yo' mouth. Ingredients are super fresh since they're of the farm-to-table kind and you can really taste it. Great meat to bun ratio, well constructed and packaged so it doesn't break apart when you eat it. It's awesome how after you eat it, you don't need a wet wipe the size of a beach towel to clean yourself off. 

The only con is how much of a wallet burner a meal is. Beef burgers are $8 to $10 bucks, elk burgers are an extra $2. Fries can tack on another $4-$6 and a 12 oz shake  is $5.50. So if you want all three, that's easily $20+. On top of that there's a 4.5% "surcharge," which I'm assuming is an SF mandated tax. So if you end up getting a burger, fries and a drink, you'll wind up w/ a tab in the upper $20s...and that's before tip if you dine in. I love a good burger, but I ain't 'bout that $30 burger meal life. These burgers are the real deal though (I would rank them in the top of 3 of SF), just don't eat here everyday.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Pretty good burgers with lots of customization options. A little more expensive than Super Duper, but more toppings you can choose from. Less refined and "interesting" than Umami Burger but you don't have to deal with the wait.

I suggest gruyere, grilled onions, and mushrooms. And if you don't mind the mess, get a fried egg too.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Great Burgers! There is a simple menu of Burgers, ranging from regular Angus to buffalo and turkey, and a variety of toppings. 

The burgers are served in paper - which is great because the burgers are so moist and juicy that it avoids getting juice all over our shirt. 

Very good fries as well- regular, sweet potato and truffle fries too. 

You can have  salads too if you feel like a healthier option :-)
author: JJ B.

description:
OMG SO GOOD! 

I built my own burger. I got a beef burger with gruyere cheese, caramelized onions, avocado, lettuce, tomato, herb mayo and mushrooms. May sound pretty simple but still was quite the burger. The beef was tender and juicy and I savored every bite. The truffle fries were good too! They come in a small silver dish...I just wish it was a bigger portion. 

The restaurant is small. There are a lot of tables for parties of 2 along the left side, and just a couple of bigger tables that would seat a party of 4 towards the front. There's a bar and there's a long family style dining table in the center of the restaurant. Cool atmosphere, cool music, good vibes. Rustic environment.
author: Annie C.

description:
Roam burgers are to die for, giving you sweet over sized patties that melt in the mouth with a large assortment of spices and sauces to enjoy as see. A rich patry bun holds the magic together/ and you may want to save space for their extreme milkshakes ( mint chocolate is a winner for me).

This is quick easy AND Affordable. Food that fills you up without the hate ... There are lettuces and tomatoes in it, ok? Sunday staples!
author: Zara S.

description:
Great burger place! Always busy so expect to wait 15-20 minutes to get your burger after you have ordered. You must get the Sweet Potato fries with the Truffle Parmesan AMAZING! Make sure you get atleast 2-3 orders of the herb ranch sauce it's the best sauce they have and it goes with your burger and fries. The tejano burger is is really good i like the spicy kick to it with the jalapeno relish!

On the dessert side the salted caramel milkshake is really good if you can handle the extra sugar in it. Def recommend it and comparable to Umami burger but cheaper!
author: Kunal T.

description:
I've been to Roam many times, and usually have a great experience.  I love the Sweet Potato Fries with Truffle Parmesan Seasoning and that the burgers are pretty customizable.  There are a couple tables outside that are perfect for dining with your dog or enjoying Fillmore Street on a nice day.  You can help yourself to water, and the beer selection is pretty decent.  

One of the times I came here I had a pretty awful customer service experience - basically the reason for the one star deduction.  But since it was more of a one off, I'm not counting it too much against Roam.  I went to order and it became clear that the guy wasn't listening to anything I was saying to him.  He wasn't even looking at me, but was distracted by something in the distance.  He would repeat the items I was ordering back to me, and each time it was totally wrong.  It seemed like he finally got it right, so I paid for my meal and waited.  I was pleasantly surprised when the food showed up and it was what I wanted.  I've been back since this incident, and actually been helped by the same person with no issue, so perhaps he was just having a bad day?
author: Stephanie V.

description:
3.5 stars. Tasty but pricey sums up the burgers at Roam. With a variety of meats -- beef, turkey, bison, veggies, and elk -- coupled with half-a-dozen styles, Roam gets points for having a lot of choices. For my first time at  Roam I ordered the BBQ beef burger and the Tejano turkey burger per the recommendation of the cashier. 

After ordering for dine-in, you are given a number and the opportunity to hunt down seating. Be nimble and be quick, because you will need to jump of a few chair (and people) to stake your claim. I joke; getting a seat just requires a little patience. Water, utensils, and condiments are available at a side station.

Both the BBQ beef burger and Tejano turkey were delicious and thankfully not dry. The BBQ come with aged white cheddar, BBQ sauce, caramelized onions, jalapeño relish, and oil and vinegar slaw. Truthfully, I mostly recognized the flavors of the BBQ sauce, cheese, and onions. The Tejano had pepper jack cheese, jalapeño relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, and herb ranch. The white corn strips reminded me of lighter colored Fritos and added a nice crunch to the burger. 

Although trying all combinations at Roam will be an expensive endeavor, I intend to complete that quest one day. Overall, Roam is a great place for a late night burger bite.
author: Andrew W.

description: AMAZING! The veggie burger was the closest tasting to meat I've ever tried- in a good way. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating too! Definitely will be going back to try more! Great prices for the quality of the burger~
author: Michelle B.

description:
I loved their "fry fecta" includes all 3 fries that they have 
 1) russet fries
 2) sweet potato fries 
 3) zucchini onion haystack
You can eat it alone without ketchup or any sauce . But the only thing was when I was half way down I found a piece of hair & I got goosebumps & just stopped eating it .


I also got the heritage burger . Which included applewood smoked bacon ; can't go wrong with bacon . But the thing about this burger is that the beef & bacon is alrdy greasy n fat today but they added butter lettuce which I think they can switch up to a different lettuce instead . Overall the service was alrdy as well . The cashier wasn't helpful with choosing burgers , he got my friend confused when my friend asked him about the French & fries burger to see if the fries are separately .
author: Sandy L.

description:
This Roam location is LEGIT. Double the fries, double the shake... I'm SOLD!

Not only are they friendly with their portion sizes, they are speedy as hell. Even on a packed night, you'll wait no longer than 5-10 minutes for your burger and fries. 

Order the:
1) Heritage. I'm normally a beef sorta girl but at Roam I always go for the turkey
2) Frifecta: normal fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini strings all in one
3) Hazelnut-choco milkshake.

BOOM! Now that's $20 well spent.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Best burgers in San Francisco!
Try also the sweet potato fries and, when it is in season, the hazelnut milkshake is amazing!
author: Micol R.

description: This is a great place for a burger. I enjoy building your own burger and getting bison as the protein. The veggie burgers are also great. I also love the fries. It is pricey but worth the cost. I hope to return. Good job Roam!!!!
author: Will D.

description: Fresh tasting burgers. Ordered the mushroom Swiss and truffle Parmesan fries. Decent sized portions. Nice decor and location right on Fillmore street. Fairly expensive though. I've certainly had better burgers before. Tax for employee health insurance mandated.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
We came here this past weekend to try a new burger place, plus it was in the area of the Cherry Blossom Festival, which is where we were headed for the afternoon. The menu online looked great, and I was excited to try a new burger place and maybe add it to my list of "awesome burger places to go". The housemade sodas also looked great, as do the milkshakes (although I usually forgo the latter since they're a meal all by themselves).

We showed up at 1:30 pm, after the expected lunch rush, to find the place *packed*. This shouldn't be a surprise given the location (Lower Pac Heights / Fillmore). Tables were clearing out pretty quick though so we decided to stay and placed our order. We managed to grab a small two-seater table in a corner near the window.

While this place is packed, I'll say this... it's *not* good for bringing kids into, when you're hauling in the extra large size stroller and big baby carriers. It really is that jammed up, there's not a lot of room to move your chair around and if you're pushing a stroller, good luck getting through the masses of people and squashed aisles. One guy came in with a baby carrier that took up an entire two-seater table. I have no idea where he expected him and his companion to sit with the baby on the table.  Keep this in mind if you're looking to find a place for you and your little ones, this place is a hazard to navigate.

Finally, our food came out! We had two classic burgers (regular and veggie), a side of fries, and the housemade raspberry soda of the day. 

First off, the fries were really good. Unlike most fries I've had over the past few years, these were *really* potatoey in flavour. We ordered them plain and they were good as is or with ketchup. Yum.

My veggie burger was housemade and appeared to have beets as the primary ingredient (given the colour of the pattie). It was juicy and moist, but I found that I couldn't actually detect a pattie flavour... between the pickles, tomatoes and lettuce, it was just "extra filling" that I couldn't really discern out of the rest of it. It was a good burger overall but it didn't jump out at me. My companion agreed about his burger as well. We both felt that our meal was decent, but once you look at the price ($30 for two burgers, a side of fries and one drink) and the Artisan claim, you'd be expecting so much more.

Ultimately, that's all I can say about this place. It was adequate and decent, there was some pros to it, but between it just being an ok burger and how packed and squishy it is inside, I can't really rate it higher than two stars, not with there being so many other outstanding burger places in the city for a fraction of the price.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I love roam! I've gone to different roams in SF, every spots are good. My husband loves their bison burger. I love their sunny side burger, truffle fries and salty caramel shake. The price is a bit pricey but they are so worth it.
author: Raina J.

description: Busy place sometimes,  a testament to their delicious burgers. I'm not a fan of the ordering at door and getting a number cuz people are constantly slacking while they figure out what they want and then if you want another beer you must get back in line. However,  I deal with it because I really love the burgers, I just have one beer tho ;) I recommend the Tejano...and  add a fried egg!
author: Orion D.

description: i was so excited to try this place.  i have heard great things about it and decided to try it today.  it was terrible.  it was completely, totally flavorless.  the burger was not seasoned at all, as in NO salt, pepper or any other seasoning.  the "house sauce" was totally flavorless and the vegetables in the burger (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles) were not fresh.  so disappointed.
author: Samantha B.

description:
This place was good and the burgers were huge!

The zucchini onion haystack is way better then the regular and sweet fries. I could eat a whole bowl to myself. We ordered the fry-fecta but I honestly just wanted the haystack.

Small amount of seating there, so it was a little awkward to be standing in the middle of the room hoping for a seat to open up. (You pay first then sit down, which is nice for those who hate doing the awkward bill splitting) Around 8pm on a wednesday it started to die down a bit with some empty tables, so maybe head there around then.
author: Samantha D.

description: This place is absolutely delicious! I love their burgers and their Parmesan fries. Their shakes are also amazing. You've gotta try this place. It's so damn good.
author: Julia W.

description: Really good traditional burgers. Absolutely amazing shakes. Hits just right when that's what you want. Fries in my experience have always been cold and only okay, I'd skip them to save on what is already a little pricey for a burger, but totally worth it.
author: Julia M.

description: Once you enter these doors, you know they mean business. I know my burgers and these are at the pinnacle of burger perfection. 100% grass fed beef patties bison, turkey, and vegetarian options to best suit your burger fancy. I recommend adding an egg with the jalapeno relish...truly delish!
author: John S.

description: Delicious food, smart decor, easy ordering, delivery to the table is quick, romantic lunch companion. Oh sorry, you can't get the latter as my exquisite girlfriend stays with me. That said, you can have all the rest if you choose Roam for lunch as we did with out of town guests. They loved it, we loved it, you'll love it. Now go! Go eat!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Fancy birthday dinners are overrated. All I need is a good burger in my belly!

Came here around 6pm with my best friends and the line went out the door! But no worries, the line shortened down really fast though. I ordered a turkey french and fries burger (with no watercress and dijon mustard), truffle parmesan russet fries (extra .75 cents for  truff parm) and a prickly pear soda.

Seating was packed indoors so we settled for outside seating by the heat lamp. The food came out in less than 10 minutes and I started digging in. The burger was P-E-R-F-E-C-T at the time because it was my first meal of the day (yes, at 6pm). The bun was soft, the turkey patty was super juicy and tender, the caramelized onions were on point, gruyere cheese added a nice salty taste to it and the sliced avocado was so buttery! 

The truffle parmesan russet fries had a nice balance of crunch and soft texture to it but it lacked a balance of flavors. The fries were overly seasoned with salt and parmesan in which made it really hard to eat (so salty!) My friend on the other hand got the truffle parmesan sweet potato fries and it made me regret my choice. The sweet potato balanced out the saltiness of the parmesan. Definitely recommended!

The prickly pear soda was definitely an interesting item that I got here. If you're not familiar with what a prickly pear is, it's basically an egg sized fuchsia colored fruit found on cacti. The soda is made from scratch here and not from a bottle or can! The soda didn't actually taste like the fruit but rather a sour melon taste it. It was good so I'm not complaining!

I can't wait to come back here again! :)

Tips:
-Seats are limited here so make sure you keep an eye out for people who are leaving their tables! 
-Get sweet potato fries when you want to make them truffle parmesan.
-Try the house-made sodas! Prickly pear and caramelized pineapple sodas are *recommended*
author: Anna H.

description:
ROAM artisan burgers is an order-at-the-counter and seat yourself casual dining restaurants.  I'd 4.5 stars for the Tejano burger alone.  I've tried the BBQ burger and the Sunny Side burger and both were good (a solid 4 stars), but the Tejano has a mix of juicy beef and added avocado and crispy tortilla strips gives it a texture and taste satisfying to the last bite.

The sunny side burger was good but the runny egg causes the bottom layer to get soggy pretty fast, making it messy to eat with your hands.

Fry-fecta fries is a nice touch if you want to try all 3 side fries dishes (russet potato, sweet potato, and onion strings).  I would only order this to share with 2-3 people.  Fries are nice and crispy, just the way I like 'em!
author: Bryan L.

description:
I go here every time I visit SF because it's hard to top Roam's burgers. Honestly, best burgers for the price. I always get the French and Fries, which probably suits more sophisticated palates but it's freaking bomb. I've also had bites of the Tejano and the Heritage - both are fantastic as well. Burgers come out fast and the minute you take a bite of them, you're in heaven. Their fries are also great, as well - it's necessary that you order some with your burger!

At Roam, you order at a cashier and then you have to find your own table, so seating can be a bit of a pain, especially when it's super crowded. Just make sure you keep an eye on people that are finishing up their meals - the minute they get up, claim your spot because otherwise somebody else will snatch it from you.

Besides that though, this is still one of my go-to places in SF and the quality of the burgers is so overwhelmingly good that I don't mind waiting for a table at all.
author: Trisha V.

description: Holy Toledo! 10-star coconut shake. Bison burger was 4 stars. So even those out and we're well over 5 stars. Medium rare well done
author: J. N.

description:
Burgers are delicious and have their own special rating system in my book. You want to see if someone's cool and "hang out" with them/possibly make it your first date? You want Super Duper, because that's a quick lunch. Once you have assessed that they are second-date material, you take them to Roam, because it is a step above Super Duper, it's more intimate, and it's the place where everyone else seems to be having some kind of second-date conversation. There's a lot of two-seaters. You can kind of tell what's going on here.

Roam is actually my favorite burger place. Now, Umami is definitely a "keeper" kind of burger place, because some people, like myself, cry when they take a bite (and then get sick because the burger was too good, too delicious, and much too rich for my poor stomach to handle). But when it comes to a burger place that I prefer, it's Roam. I can order online, I can have the boyfriend tuck and roll to pick up the food, and BAM, burgers and fries, done.

The Tejano is my go-to burger. I had the turkey burger version of it, mainly because I was feeling extra lazy and knew that a delicious, beautiful, wonderful beef burger would have been too much for that day. Surprisingly, it was pretty good. I'm definitely happy to have a burger that can be successfully turkey'd without sacrificing too much flavor or making me feel like "but I could have had a beef burger ugh".

We always get one order of fries to share between us both - it's almost always pushing the limit with the burger and the single order of fries. And also we get a kid's milkshake to share, which sounds dumb, but those milkshakes are densely delicious and could get overly sweet with anything larger. This combination of food is always perfect, and we leave feeling satisfied and just roly-poly enough that we can walk it off for the most part, and not so rotund that we feel like we'll be rolled into the street by accident.

Definitely my go-to burger place in terms of places close to the apartment. Grabbing a table can be hard despite the quick turnaround, so we usually pick it up and take it to go unless a table is open. Don't bring kids as the crowd is generally not kid-friendly...not on purpose, but I think it's just by principal. Too many second dates going on, you know?
author: Robbin A.

description:
I got the French and Fries, then couldn't help myself and got a strawberry shake as well. The shake was deliciously milky and strawberry-y (though pricey)! It was so thick I could barely drink it through the straw, I had to drink the melty bits first. But so good! My friend had the blood orange soda which was fizzy, tart, and delicious! 

The burger buns were nicely toasted, but the fries inside were not particularly truffled (I picked them out to eat). The burger tasted good as a whole, until halfway through when I realized how overwhelming the Dijon mustard got. All I could taste was horseradish. I ended up taking out the bottom bun and it was much better. My friend did the same. Next time I'll ask them to leave it out, or try another burger.
author: Anna P.

description:
Went here with some friends to grab a bite to eat on a Friday night. The place was pretty crowded, so one of us grabbed a table while the others ordered.

I decided to go with the BBQ burger and split the fry-fecta with a friend.

The burger was well-cooked and the flavors were decent. Wasn't super impressed by the ingredients added on to my burger so I might try a different one next time, but the quality of food was high.

Also the fry-fecta was pretty delicious and was plenty of food to share with my friend. 

Overall, this place has great burgers and fries and has a nice look and ambiance. Just be prepared to wait in line if you go during high-traffic times. Definitely worth checking out as an affordable, quality burger place in SF.
author: Ryan R.

description: I had the heritage burger with beef and it was excellent. I also really enjoyed the sweet potato fries. This is a great place to get a quality burger. Hope to be back someday.
author: Erin Y.

description:
Just about one of the best burgers I've tried. Had the heritage burger (for bacon lovers), fry fecta with Parmesan seasoning (fries, sweet potato fries, &onion strings combo) with a hazelnut milkshake. Yumm!!!

Only thing I didn't like was the burger was a bit greasy... When I picked up the burger my bottom bun was soaked. Other than that, DEFINITELY a place to recommend !!
author: Kristel S.

description:
Bite size burgers for $10 plus fries at $3.50 and anything extra if needed...not really a great deal because by the time you're done ordering what you really want ie:a burger and fries, plus drink its close to $20!
The staff is luke warm to deal with.
I guess its the sign of the times when you're hungry an hour after having a burger meaning you got ripped off in broad daylight!
Skip it
author: Scott L.

description:
I love their fry fecta. The burger that I had (with an egg fry) was pretty awesome too.

Reasonable price and kind staffs!!!

hope that I can go back more often
author: Sujung S.

description: Great market salad w/meat trio and lime dressing! The staff really listens to your order and gets it right! No surprises when you get home and open your To Go bag!
author: E H.

description:
My wife and I have eaten at the Roam in the Marina and loved it, so one day when we were having a craving for some burgers, we headed over to this location.  The idea of a "farm to table" place is a great concept, although some places use this idea to justify higher prices.  I think that Roam does an awesome job of providing great high quality, local, tasty, fresh food at a reasonable price.  

This time I ordered the Heritage burger and my wife ordered the Sunny Side.  We got a Fry-Fecta and my wife ordered a Prickly Pear soda.  I loved my burger, the bacon gave it a nice smoky flavor and I love the buns they use!  It was a little messy with juices running everywhere and required the use of about 10 napkins, but shouldn't good, juicy burgers be messy?  The Sunny Side was awesome as well, I'd have to say I liked it a little better than mine.  The egg on the burger was a nice touch, but I loved how the sweet chili sauce gave it a bit of a tangy flavor.  The Fry Fecta was awesome as usual.  The sweet potato fries are the best, but I love all three!  Prickly Pear soda was good, nice to have a unique flavor to mix things up.

The place can get a little crowded, especially around meal time, but the tables turn over quick.  This can be a tough place for a large group, but there are communal type tables/benches where a group can sit as well.  Overall, a great meal at a great price.  High end burger of good size with quality "farm to table" ingredients for $8.25?  We'll be back for sure!
author: Jeff C.

description: We had a "service snafu" with Roam and left a negative review (since deleted). This is the update. We are beyond impressed with the speed and attention that Roam paid to our issue, the concerns addressed, and resolution. I think it says a lot about any establishment dealing in customer service when the owner himself contacts you and hears you out. Besides, we've been coming here for years and really like the food. We look forward to returning and trying again.
author: Convict T.

description:
Roam burger is our family favorite! I have been coming here since 2013 and still fall more in love .. Every single time! 

My top favs are : vegetarian burger (great for vegetarians!!), the Tejano  burger, the BBQ burger, sunny side and French and fries. Basically I love every burger at roam burger.

I love their mint chocolate chip shake as well.SO GOOD! 

Definitely not a cheap place, but worth going to once in a while every 6 months or so. I used to visit it more often when I lived in pac heights, but every time I have a visitor in town I always bring them back to ROAM!
author: Reet R.

description:
Pros:
- solid bison burger
- fries are pretty good (russet, sweet potato, zucchini onion haystack)
- shakes (fun flavors like Blue Bottle and salted caramel)

Cons:
- difficult to find seating

Bottom line: the burger was tasty, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here
author: Jiann M.

description: Super yum. All the ingredients were super fresh and I love that they have gluten free buns. And lots of delicious milkshake flavors!
author: Turi F.

description: Best. Burgers. Ever. And gotta love their Joel Salatin-esque philosophy: "We source flavorful, nutrient-rich meats from animals that are humanely-raised on open pastures. Sustainable just tastes better." Moreover, this minimizes soil erosion and restores natural grasslands.
author: John F.

description:
Very much below my expectations. First downer was the service. I approached the cashier guy with a smile - he gazed back at me with a "I hate you" look. That really completely ruined the experience for me. If you are going to be the first point of contact, you need to have a better attitude. Then he has the nerve to shoot me a mean look in the middle of my meal - it's like, what's your problem jackass?

The guys that clean the bar are also extremely rude. I asked one if we could get some water. He didn't even look up at me and mumbled "you get it yourself over there." Just very unprofessional workers.

To the meal - the burger was very underwhelming for me. I got the buffalo burger with egg - BIG mistake. They charge $3 extra for the buffalo burger and it just was so blah and not worth it. The sweet potato fries were good. 

This place does get very crowded, and I don't get why. The service completely ruined it for me. And the burgers, though they are supposed to be "fancy" are so overrated. I ran out of burger before I ran out of bun - a HUGE NO NO for burgers.

& hey, just because they are free-range, natural-fed or whatever the hell you wanna say to make yourself feel better about eating an animal - they still get butchered. So it's a complete contradiction to praise this place for killing well-fed animals.

THUMBS DOWN.
author: Junel S.

description: Everything about it---food/menu, service and the cleanliness! Amazing! Oh yeah, the price is very doable!
author: Florian C.

description:
This review is for Nick.  Nick cares and seems to be enjoying his time at the restaurant. He always remembers me....and even manages to remember my order!!! 

Nick is the kind of employee that genuinely provides customer service.
author: Ellen M.

description: Really good burger and deliciius trifecta of fries. The service and location are excellent. The burgers were tasty.
author: Karena H.

description:
I am amazed at how great some of these reviews made the place out to be, and how badly it turned out. The food was average and the service was horrible. 

I ordered a classic burger, and my girlfriend ordered a Bison BBQ burger, with maple covered sweet potato fries and some veggies on the side -- total cost $35..

I received my burger when it was near to room temperature, thirty minutes later. The fries, however, were covered (and I mean drenched), in maple syrup and blazing hot. Molten sugar fries and a cold burger.. that's how it went.. When I tried to flag down the steely looking anxious waiters, they raced by you. There were so many numbers on the tables, that they couldn't keep up. I just gave up, ate my near to cold burger, left the sugar fries to fuse into a plasticky mold and walked out never to return. 

If you decide to give it a try (as many of these appear to love it), my advice is to NEVER come here when its busy; management just doesn't have it together. You would be far better heading down the street to Unami, where you could expect more of a consistent experience..
author: Stewart A.

description:
Food is always good, but the service is uneven. Today my burger came out quickly, but ten minutes later, still no sign of the drinks. Finally, with one bite left, the server shows up, mumbles "Sorry", and rushes off.

The Marina location is consistently better.
author: David F.

description:
This place had a huge line out the door practically!? Ordered the 'French and Fries' burger which consisted of truffle parmesan fries Gruyere, Avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, Dijon mustard.  I also ordered russet fries with truffle parmesan added on russet fries, and a plain side of russet fries for the hubby. Our friend, ordered the "Sunny Side' burger which consisted of organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, sweet chili sauce and  side order of sweet potato fries. They also featured organic shakes like  hazelnut chocolate (seasonal) and mint chip shakes if you're a shake fan. The beef burgers are 100% grass fed...and SO DELICIOUS!!! I would definitely go back and try some of their other burgers. 

It was also walking distance from the Fillmore concert hall...which I went to afterwards for a concert. If you're craving some nice tasty burgers this is a place to go!
author: Susan W.

description:
I ordered the French and Fries without mustard. Never in my life have I had such an amazingly delicious burger! It was like it was homemade, but way better.

Their shake special was chocolate hazelnut, which is my favorite flavor ever, so I had to have it. I didn't give any instructions on how I wanted it, but it came out perfectly. So thick, creamy, and exquisite. I just wish I had ordered a large!

Totally impressed. We'll definitely come back next time we're in the city.
author: Jenna R.

description: Excellent, excellent burger. Unfortunately, my visit was during get-off-work/pick-up-the-kids time so things were a bit chaotic. Space is also a little cramped, but worth the negatives.
author: Robert M.

description: Best veggie burger (veggie tejano) in the city. Hands down. I've done both take out and stayed in for a full meal. They are super accommodating and have a good selection of both milkshakes and beer.
author: Veena T.

description: This is definitely an SF burger place. I got a burger, fries, and a beer, and it cost me $20! The burger itself was decent, if a bit on the smaller side. I got the French and Fries turkey burger. While it was juicy, it wasn't anything to write home about. And all of the french fries fell out too easily.
