The russet french fries were kind of boring, and I wish that they had ranch dressing. My beer was good though. Seating is communal, and can get crowded inside at popular dining hours. They also have seating outside for when the weather cooperates.
author: Leslie H.

description: I really think this place is amazing! Their burger is so good tasting and they have amazing sides like french fries and chopped onions! I also like their variety of milkshakes like chocolate, vanilla, and mint. Not only that, but they also have a kids menu with kids sized and styled items on the menu! I really recommend that you guys  go here sometime because it is very great quality and you could also check out their other location in the city in Union Street as well!
author: Asher D.

description: My husband and I got veggie burgers with avacado and swiss cheese topping and russet fries and thought it was pretty good. Price point, portion size were perfect. The place was quite full on Saturday lunch, but we managed to find a place for the two of us in less than a minute. Service was quick and efficient.
author: Sharanya A.

description:
It's friendly, casual, busy, but not overwhelming.  On a Sunday eve I had no problem grabbing a spot solo  at the long countertop.  

Veggie burger was awesome- quinoa, brown rice, black beans, and beets.  (I couldn't taste the black beans in it, but that's perfect for me).  I got it French and Fries style- truffle Parmesan fries (on top of burger), Gruyere, avocado, caramelized onion, and watercress. I asked for it with no Dijon mustard.  It was delish.  And a kids size pumpkin spice shake, which was the perfect size to enjoy.  

Great spot to unwind after a busy weekend with a low key delicious dinner.  And Fillmore Street is fun to walk around before, too.
author: Aneesha B.

description:
Best burger place. Ever. Totally dethroned Umami for me.

When it comes to a burger we all have our preferences. I think the McDonald's cheeseburger rocks even. When it comes to gourmet like burgers, I've always been a fan of Umami Burger and The Counter and less so Father's Office in LA.

When I first came to this place, it just rocked the house. I've been about three times and have never been disappointed. The shakes are divine as well (recommend getting one each time you go).

What's better than a good burger, an Anchor Steam, and a dessert shake?
author: Julia P.

description: Why do restaurants charge extra when you add items (i.e. cheese) but when you take items off (i.e. cheese) they don't take $ off? This is not a complain to just Roam but to all restaurants. :(  Anyway, I appreciated their grass fed beef. I just got a plain beef patty (pricey) to put on my salad. Their sweet potato fries were amazing. Sweet and crispy and well priced.
author: S Z.

description: We ate at both SF locations during our stay in SF. Delicious burgers and fries. Loved the salad and miso ginger dressing. A little pricey but worth it.
author: Mindy S.

description:
So, Greg and I ventured up to Roam after hearing from a variety of people how incredible it was, how it could be compared (or even better) than Umami Burger, and how this was a must-visit place on Fillmore.  Being that Greg and I both loved Umami, have a deep sentiment for Super Duper, and will always have a soft spot for In N Out, this was obviously a place we needed to visit.

We stopped by on a Saturday night, and didn't do too much research leading up to this in terms of what to expect or what to order.  We called ahead of time to ask what the wait would be (this becomes more important later on in my review), and was pleased to hear that there was no wait.  When we walked into Roam, there was a line that ended right as you walked through the door.  The place was busy, and I think I was the most overdressed person there since most people were there in their jeans, North Face jackets, and yoga pants.  As we moved up towards the registers, it occurred to Greg and I that you had to order at the register, ala Super Duper style.  I won't lie, I panicked when it was our turn to order, so I sided with Greg and got the Heritage burger with bison meat.  I also ordered the Blood Orange soda that's made in house, and Greg and I split the Fry-Fecta.  Not a huge deal, but I mistakenly called the bison meat "buffalo", and was corrected by the girl at the register who said, "It's BISON, not buffalo".  OK. Cool. Thanks...rude.

We got our table number and sort of stood around not really knowing what to do.  Greg and I were sort of confused on what we should be doing, and finally realized that there wasn't going to be any wait service here.  Luckily we were able to snag a table in the back corner, and sat down immediately.  Our drinks came out almost right away, and just a few 15 minutes later, the food showed up.  The Fry Fecta was AMAZING.  This was probably my favorite part of dinner.  The burger, in my opinion, left a lot to be desired.  The burger was SOAKED in grease, where the bottom bun was completely soggy.  I resorted to trying to eat it with a fork since holding the burger was too messy and too greasy.  The blood orange soda was sweet, but I usually never order soda.  That being said, I drank the whole thing :)  The whole meal from start to finish was about 20 minutes.  It started to get busier after we were done, so there was the underlying pressure of needing to leave as soon as we were done.  If you wanted to order another drink, you had to go back to the register and order.

I guess the part that both Greg and I determined was that for $40, we would have expected something a little better than a no wait service, help yourself type place.  The feeling of feeling somewhat rushed to get out of the restaurant left a lot to be desired.  I guess this is the part where doing some research on the place probably would have been critical, but this wasn't really what we had in mind.  I think next time if we're looking for a quick, great tasting burger with no wait service, we'll go to Super Duper.  If we're looking for the gourmet experience and willing to pay the premium for it, we'll head back to Umami.  In my opinion, Roam sort of fell in the gray space of in between the two, and I'm not really sure if it totally works in my mind.
author: Lisa I.

description: Me and my boyfriend were staying in a hotel on Lombard Street, and I was happy to find that Roam was within walking distance!! I'd seen it on the Food Network in Canada and the turkey burger looked SO good! I knew I had to try it when I visited San Francisco, so that is EXACTLY what we ordered. The turkey burger done French and fries style. The restaurant is casual. You walk up to the counter and order your burger, they give you a number and you pick your table and they bring your food. We sat outside on the street. It wasn't too busy or loud. We got our burgers pretty quick, and they DID NOT disappoint. The turkey burger done French and fries style comes with Parmesan truffle fries, watercress, caramelized onions, Gruyere cheese, and last but not least, avocado! It was huge but so worth it! Best turkey burger EVER! If you're visiting San Francisco, try and visit this restaurant!!
author: Melissa L.

description: The burgers here are amazing. I ordered the sunny side burger because I'm a sucker for anything with  an over easy egg. Honestly, one of the most well put together burger which also included my favorite, aged cheddar and carmelized onion. I also has the ginger lime soda and it was one of the best sodas I've had. It wasn't too sweet and the ginger wasn't too overpowering. I heard the fries are worth trying so I defiantly will come back for it. The price is a tad bit high for one burger, but it's worth it if you ever want to treat yourself to a really good burger.
author: Jen Q.

description:
I had the classic with gruyere cheese added.

Bun- good
Toppings- good
Beef patty- ehhhhhhh


First, the patty is so wimpy. It's barely thick enough to call itself a patty... might as well be made of cardboard because it then became so dry after being cooked. It also tasted old, on the verge of going bad. No good, Roam, this is not what I wanted to eat.
House-made pickles were fresh and crispy. Not too sour and a tad on the sweeter side, so although it offered a difference in texture, it didn't even offer a break from the heavy meat tastes like a pickle is suppose to do.
author: Chia L.

description: Yum! Everything is super delicious here--even their hamburger bun, which they toast, is amazing. My mom was raving about how delicious her burger was and my husband said it was one of the best he has ever had. The fry fecta was delicious as well--crispy and not greasy. I especially liked the zucchini, which surprised me. I would highly recommend this place to anyone
author: Grace L.

description: Soooooo good! Go when you're really hungry. And I suggest getting one of their house made sodas.
author: Lauren D.

description:
These burgers are my favorite in the Bay Area, ooberly delicious!
This place has a fun atmosphere, yummy food, and a friendly staff. I always have a great time when I bring family and friends here.
I continue to recommend it to all my burger lovin friends, it's a hit every time.
author: Maggie L.

description: Loved this place because there were so many gluten free options. The burgers are grass fed which is a huge plus too! What could have made the burgers better is if they were flame broiled. That would have put them over the top! The french fries are perfectly fried and crispy texture. The milkshakes are divine! The people working here are really friendly. Oh and I love love love that they have Real Salt salt packets. I can't wait to come back here again.
author: Wendy M.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for a while since it is only a few blocks from my apartment. I finally got to check it out when my family came to visit this past weekend. However, I only stopped by for shakes. My sister (Arlene C.) saw the Blue Bottle Coffee shake and wanted to try it, so we walked over after having dinner at Fat Angel (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fat-angel-san-francisco#hrid:i9DYpNzadet02PmckzCSoQ). 

The shakes were very yummy. My sister got the Blue Bottle Cofee and I had the Salted Caramel. Both were good, but I preferred the Salted Caramel. Make sure to get the Brûléed Marshmallow on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/4eaK2-Q0dEXWMr5SOoV_Sg?select=_B-bV4GSo9fMhIo-i989kw#_B-bV4GSo9fMhIo-i989kw)! It's worth the extra $1. It was the best part of the shake.

I definitely have to come back and check out the burgers. Everything looked so good.
author: Richard P.

description: Been there a few times. Never get disappointed with their combo of burgers, sweet potato fries and milkshake. Definitely try toast marshmallow with coconut milkshake!!! Hazelnut chocolate milkshake also steals my heart [heart] for burger I always go for their French and Fries bison option :) heheee can't wait to go back!
author: Alice Y.

description:
I shared the sunny side and heritage burgers with beef patties. While both were very flavorful, I can't get over how soaked the buns were when the burgers were brought out to our table. The mushy, wet texture just wasn't very pleasant. 

Dos thumbs up for the fry-fecta and the milkshakes. With the fry-fecta, I found myself grabbing handfuls of the trio of fried veggies and just stuffing it all in my mouth. This meal called for several napkins. As for the milkshakes, whatever flavor you get, add the bruleed marshmallow. It's quite special. 

Service was pretty much non-existent when I came on a busy Saturday night. The staff seemed pretty much robotic in their actions and didn't really care to extend any friendliness, in my experience at least.
author: Maya S.

description:
I am a burger kinda gal and a picky one at that.

I've come here twice now and on my first visit I had:
FRENCH AND FRY BURGER ( added egg)
FRI FECTA
PRICKLY PEAR SODA

This was just under $20

I LOVED the burger! Flavors were wonderful and I approve of their choice of buns! It's so hard to find burger places that serves up their patties in great tasting buns. 

Not all "brioche" buns are created equal.

I passed on the FRI FECTA on my second visit and opted for just the fries. The reason was because I did not care for their shoestring onions at all. Texture and flavor didn't work for me. Their fries and sweet potato fries were great though.

The PRICKLY PEAR soda was ok, wouldn't order it again. I had the seasonal BLOOD ORANGE soda the second time and I like that one better :)

HOW IT WORKS:
Menu is on the wall (or printed at the front)
You order up front with the cashier and grab a table number
Find and take a seat (small tables, long community table, or bar)
And then you wait!
author: Sunny W.

description: Quality place! I had a great burger with pastured meat and great truffle flies! It looks kinda hip but they do serve honest and classic burgers - I loved it a lot.
author: Takahiro K.

description:
I am (often unfortunately) a creature of habit.  But my Thursday night Roam outings are different.  I usually get the same thing each time (although I have tried almost everything on the menu), but look forward to it every single Thursday nonetheless. And here is why - 

The veggie lettuce-wrapped Tejano burger is a fiesta in your mouth.  With fresh avocado, tomato, tortilla strips and jalapeno relish, it is the equivalent of a taco salad in a burger.  If that's your cup of tea, then try it, and you will not be disappointed.  It is also relatively guilt-free, so go ahead, grab that milkshake you've been thinking about.

Other burgers are just as good. I cannot attest to any of the meat options, but my friends seem to enjoy them (especially the bison).  My other personal favorites are the BBQ (the caramelized onions are oh so good) and the Chalet (mushroom perfection).  I enjoy the Sunny side (w/ egg and cheddar) but do not enjoy it running down my hands. 

Other offerings: the seasonal salads are great! Personally, I think the tri-fecta is a little on the heavy side, but great for sharing.  I like the side of the sweet potato fries or the russet fires with the parmesan toss, although the amount I get tends to vary each and every time (and not by a little).   Bonus points for the prickly pear soda!!!

Staff is nice but can be "off" some nights.

Note: you can call your order in and then pick-up.  But (and especially if you get them lettuce wrapped), be sure not to let them sit since the burgers tend to be sauce heavy, and can get really soggy, really quickly.
author: Gev M.

description: Again, the food here is good. People in the kitchen, you're doing it right. People at the counter: take a class in customer service or find a new job. Particularly "Wendy"-- try speaking to your customers with a modicum of friendliness. The absence of a smile, sense of urgency, or any hint of warmth is a clear indicator that you should not be on the front lines of retail. Does management review Yelp ever?
author: James S.

description: Pretty good, but very thin patty. I was hoping for a bigger burger. Bun was fresh and it was tasty but the bread to meat ratio was off since it was a pretty small burger.
author: Therese M.

description:
Starving and tired of throwing our coins into the over priced parking meters my sister and I headed off on a very short trip up and down Fillmore to find some food. We walked past Roam and saw a few weird stringy things in a bowl and thought wtf is that. We kept walking. After going a few blocks each way didn't prove fruitful we decided to check out those weird things in a bowl.  

Best decision ever!

You order at the counter and grab a number.  You have a few different choices for your burger meat: Beef, Turkey, Bison and Veggie.  I am not going to name all of the toppings that would be ridiculous, but lets just say you wont be disappointed.

They have what they call a fry-fecta which includes all three options: Russet, Sweet Potato and zucchini Onion haystacks (weird looking things in a bowl) Also are some toppings like: Truffle Parm, Fresh Herbs or Chipotle Maple....

They also offer a farmers salad and seasonal veggies.  

We ordered:
Heritage Burger: Applewood smoked bacon, Fontina, butter lettuce, Tomatoe, carmelized onions and herb mayo.  AMAZING!  Cooked perfectly with a little pink in the middle. HUGE! So glad we split it.

Fry-Fecta - a MUST order if you are sharing! VERY large serving and all perfectly cooked! 

Seasonal veggies: This trip the veggies were butternut squash and kale sauteed topped with parmesean and pesto on the side.  KILLER veggies! Cooked perfectly.

I am glad we shared everything because they give you a ton of food.

I also washed it down with an Allagash White Ale.  Total not including tip was $28.25 including tax and SF surcharge.
author: Tarra R.

description: There burgers are delicious and I always get there zucchini fries instead of the regular ones. But it is quite pricey and there are tons of other good burger places that are less. There service is oaky considering they have messed up my order a couple times. My favorite part of the meal every time I go is there homemade artisan sodas if you are gonna go then definitely get one.
author: Gigi G.

description: Great burgers and service in a casual environment -- with some good beers on tap and creative non-alcoholic options.  Kudos for the fries as well.
author: Don N.

description: Roam has a really interesting menu. There are a plethora of meat options, so I'm sure it's delightful for non-vegetarians. There are a number of interesting milkshakes and sides (fries, etc.). As a vegetarian, I got the traditional veggie burger with provolone cheese and was sorely disappointed! I'm not sure what was in the veggie burger but it wasn't the usual black bean style, and what was used left the patty mushy and pink on the inside. I was not a big fan. I will likely not be returning to Roam due to its limited set of options for me. Roam earns 3 stars due to its nice interior, variety of interesting milkshakes and sides (which my friends enjoyed), and the potential for its meat options to be interesting.
author: Vishnu R.

description:
Sadly, this the second time I've had reason to write a poor review for Roam on Fillmore. We'd had a few experiences with the burgers not being cooked properly before I wrote the first review. After I wrote the review, the owner contacted me, apologized and gave us a gift card to try Roam again. I was really impressed with how he handled the situation and that he cared enough to read reviews and contact customers. Unfortunately, our experience tonight indicates any measures taken to address the issues were ineffective. 

Tonight's burgers (requested "no pink") were raw inside again. I pulled apart and cooked my own burger. I'm completely over spending $40 for meals for 2 to find the food isn't even cooked. 

Unless you like your burgers rare, stay away.
author: Whitney T.

description:
Unique, fresh, delicious. Simply the best I've had in the city by far!

VEGGIE BURGER: No Morningstar patties, no dry veggies-compact burger. Hello fresh, house-made ORGANIC patty. Not gonna lie, it was a bit weird at first because 1)  the patty was a squishy, 2) it was PINK, and 3) it didn't have the same texture or structure as a regular patty. But the more you eat it, the more hooked you get! The patty consists of quinoa, brown rice, black beans, dates, and...beets (hence the pink patty). But with the fresh tomatoes, lectture, and whole grain wheat bun, everything was extremely tasty! 

SUNNY SIDE BURGER: Burger with cheddar, caramelized onions, tomatoes, egg on top, and sweet chili sauce. Upon first bite, I thought the burger was also very tasty -- the sweet chili sauce reminded me of the sweet sauce you get with the fried Vietnamese spring rolls. But after eating more and more, the burger got a tad too sweet for my taste.  

BRUSSEL SPROUTS: It was their "special greens" of the day, and OH MY GOSH I'm so glad I got it! It was probably THE BEST dish at Roam. The brussel sprouts was fried and tossed in olive oil, herbs, salt, and the best part...lemon! The acidicity really came out and distinguished the otherwise weird brussel sprouts taste. I could still taste that lemon-salt flavor in my mouth....

Definitely the best burger joint I've been to the city...even better than Umami if I must say! :X (Don't kill me, I still love my LA)
author: Evelyn S.

description: Delish bison burgers. Dunno if bison is juicier than regular cow beef, or if its just all their beef is luscious, but it was righteous. I love that I can have them add 4 condiments to my burger so I don't have to do it. Love the create your own burger concept...pick yer bun, pick yer meat, pick yer toppings, you get the picture. I've had the tri-fecta before, it was just OK, looks better than it is. Good sweet potato fries. We will enjoy another visit at some point!
author: Chris C.

description:
Just being in this restaurant makes me feel like I'm in the Marina, at some Sigma Pi frat graduates party. The customers here are pretty much all beautiful and in their early 30s. The energy is great, the place is buzzing, similar to Nopa on Divisidero. Difficult to talk to someone across the table though since it's so incredibly loud inside!

My bf and I managed to arrive before the line did. However, the food still took a while to arrive. My French and Fry burger was awesome. It has french fries in the middle, with avacado, Gruyer cheese, carmelized onions, watercress, and dijon mustard.  I really loved the avacado inside... and Sometimes you just feel like french fries....and sometimes eating them as a side dish isn't enough.  But we also ordered the Fry Fecta (sweet potato, russet and veggies mix) with Truffle Parmesan on top. So delish!

Great burgers I can depend on. Will return. I know this place is pretty new, so hopefully their service gets a little quicker soon. Also, the bathrooms are kinda stinky. Hopefully they can clean them up!  But I know I will return...this place is a great alternative to their Union Street one since it's closer to my neighborhood.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Soooo I've been kind of on a Yelp hiatus. Is sleeping a legitimate excuse as to why I haven't been updating? No? Okay sorry, please don't hate me members of Yelp. Love me again please?!

Anyway, my boyfriend had been dying to go here for a looong time but was sweet enough to wait until I got back to town so that we could try it together. We showed up at around 8 pm on a Thursday night and it was PACKED. Tons of people didn't have seats and we had to wait about 20 minutes after ordering before we were able to steal a chair from family who had just finished their meal. I seriously felt horrible, like those creepy guys at clubs eyeing girls to creep on. Except I was a hungry girl eyeing a family hoping to steal a chair from them. Sorry, maybe too weird of an analogy.

I ended up getting the Allegash beer and the beet and quinoa burger (GREAT FOR VEGETARIANS!) with the "Sunny Side" style with the fried egg. So the way you order here is you choose a style and then a meat to go with that style.

BY THE WAY, if you're into the whole paleo/low carb thing, they do lettuce wraps here instead of the bun! 

My boyfriend and I shared the trio of sweet potato fries, zucchini onion strings, and regular fries also known as "The Fry-Fecta" Clever huh?

We waited QUITE a while for our orders to come (especially since they forgot our fries order and had to RUSH it at the end). Anyway, it was well worth it. Boy is that the best homemade veggie burger I've ever had. The beets add the perfect sweet taste and the quinoa adds your healthy carbs. The egg was perfectly cooked and they have this amazing sauce in which God knows WHAT they put inside but WHO CARES IT WAS SO GOOD. 

Our fries were perfectly cooked and delicious (though I could have done without the regular fries and the zucchini and onion strings which just kind of tasted like fried.....something). My favorite was the sweet potato fries.

Lastly, the beer. What is a burger without beer?! The Allegash was their most popular beer apparently and is a lighter beer perfect to go along with a lighter burger! Great!

Pros: AWESOME BURGERS! They have grass-fed meat everything including BISON! They have turkey instead of chicken which comes from the Dietsel Farms. Great way to get a healthy-ish burger that still tastes great! 

Cons: Can be crowded so you should be willing to wait. Very VERY dim lighting. But maybe this isn't so much of a con, especially if you're on a special date ;)

Anyway, can't WAIT to come back. My palate has been CRAVING that burger like no other. I plan to try their Blue Bottle Coffee Shake thing next. God I've seen pictures and my mouth is watering right now gaaahhh
author: Vicki L.

description: The burgers were good.The salads looked amazing. A bit expensive but then I come from NY . The food seemed fresh and the atmosphere was fine
author: Laurie I.

description:
Don't drink any apple juice. This review is about their unsanitary practices. Ordered an apple juice took a sip and didnt like the taste with ice. Got a new one without ice. The old glass is still on the table. Wonder what they're going to do with that?!  Guy named Dillan removed the ice and poured in back into the juice container to serve to someone else. The woman working in front watched the whole thing without a problem. I was disgusted. I just drank from that and they're going to reserve it!!!
I'll be contacting the manager tomorrow. I was told she's not in today.
author: chari b.

description:
This is the best tastiest burger I've ever had living in SF. There's a lot that are good. But Roam "gets it "and the milkshakes are the shitz!
delicious and can't wait to eat another one :)
author: Tracy B.

description: I've been here like a year ago with my friends. Place was really crowded . Burger was beautiful. However not really five star place. It was way expensive for that quality and crowd.
author: Jay M.

description: Tasty grass fed burgers at a reasonable price, truffles fries. Didn't have beer but the selection looked good.
author: Enrique C.

description: Go down the street to Burger King and you will get the same burger for a third of the price.  Tasted like a frozen patty that was warmed up on a grill.  Disappointing!
author: Amin K.

description: My favorite burger joint to date! I've taken dates here, family, and friends and everyone loves it!! I usually stick with the classic because I go so frequently but the Tejano, o papi!!
author: Omid T.

description: Best veggie burger in town! The vegan patty french and fries style is amazing. Also would recommend the brussel sprouts!
author: Campbell R.

description: I really want to like this place because it is around the corner from my house, and who doesn't like Union Street and burgers? They've pretty much gotten my order wrong the last three times I've gone there and so I have given up. I'm surprised they can maintain the business in such a prime spot in SF with such poor service.
author: Selen A.

description: These burgers were very good! They weren't amazing but I love how the juices of the meat complimented the bun. I got the classic and it tasted a bit plain because there wasn't enough "house sauce," but after I added ketchup and mustard it tasted fine. My friend got the Tejano and loved it mostly because of the jalapeños. I'd have to admit that the Pacific Blue burger was the most unique burger out of the three we got. At first, we disliked the burger because of the blue cheese, but later, it grew on us. I would have to say the most delicious thing we ordered were the sweet potato fries!!
author: Hannah L.

description:
Roam might be my favorite burger place in the city. It was my first time trying a bison burger, and I had no idea it would be SO juicy and flavorful! Is it the herb butter? Who knows, but it's amazing! Add an egg on top and prepare to taste burger heaven. 

Their sweet potato fries are perfectly crispy and sweet, and their shakes come in mini sizes if you're looking for a cute indulgence. 

You can order at the counter and the waiters will bring it to your table. It feels like a simple burger place that went organic and upscale, without a huge price jump. They also have other exotic meats that I want to try, and of course the beef standby, grassfed of course.
author: Kate M.

description:
You know, this was a good burger! 
I had the bison burger with some arrangement they had on the menu. Very good.
I met Alex who is a cook in the back and he rocks! We chatted about culinary stuff! 
Kombucha on tap - can't beat that! 
Very cool vibe inside. 
Good job to the staff as well
author: Mercedes R.

description: One of the best burger places around! I had the Pacific Blue and the patty was cooked perfectly (medium). The sweet potato fries are yummy. The prices are decent for a place in the city, and in the Fillmore!
author: Jen A.

description: Solid burgers and fries. Like the various options. Service is fairly good although I usually get orders to go. It's a standby for a quick, tasty burger. Also love that they have different meat/non-meat option. Need to try the bison...
author: Melanie N.

description:
This review is for the ordering online and picking it up at the restaurant experience. Which I highly recommend! It's quick, convenient, pain-free, and delicious. Yes, you really can have it all!
The ordering website is easy to navigate, complete with a box to write in any special instructions (pickles on the side? hold the tomatos? your pickiest friends will not have any problems here!!). You can build your own burger, or try some of their artfully crafted combinations, adding as many extras as you please. Then, they will give you an estimated time when your order is ready for pick up! 

The burgers themselves are fairly substantial. And rightly so, for almost $10 a pop. The buns were thick, untoasted, and had quite a bit of chew to them. I personally prefer my buns a bit more light and fluffy, but to each their own. 

and get the Fri-fecta! hahahah so clever. This included regular fries, sweet potato fries, and zuccini fries (thin strips of crispy perfection!).
author: Tuwie N.

description: their burgers are amazing!!! I've ordered so many of the different options and never had a bad one yet. their garlic fries are unbelievable.
author: michael m.

description: $20 for burger, fries and soft drink.  It was very good but not "oh wow, that's truly superior to..."   3.5 - 4 star taste, but dinged for the cost.   Yes I know this is the San Francisco.
author: Christopher L.

description: Loved this place! Great place to grab a bite, no matter what the occasion, since it has a nice friendly, ambience, beer, wine, and great food. Pleases all dietary restrictions. We split two vegetarian burgers and both were really great. The house made patty is awesome. I feel like I'm eating out at a restaurant but I like that I don't have to wait for a table like at other restaurants in the area.
author: San D.

description: the interior is beautiful, the wine goes really well with the burgers, and overall great burger place. cool place to stop by if you're walking anywhere near fillmore. keep in mind, it will be a tad bit more pricey
author: Marcos B.

description:
We had been meaning to check this place out for awhile, and finally made it there a few weekends ago.

Due to doctor's orders, I'm trying to eat more red meat, (it's harder than you'd think!) I ordered the bison burger,no cheese, on a wheat bun.
I've had ground bison many times, i cook it at home quite frequently, and my husband makes a better bison burger than the one I had at Roam.

It was overcooked, and totally flavorless. A little salt would have gone a long way.

We shared fries, and those were delicious. My husband ordered a shake, but ended up tossing it since it wasn't very good.

When we ordered ,the woman taking the order forgot my wine, (she admitted it and apologized) Didn't love having to go back up and reorder it.

Also, when we found a table that was being cleared, the busser said he'd be right back to wipe it off, and then forgot to return.

Love the concept, the food...not so much.
author: Amanda G.

description:
The folks at Roam Artisan Burgers make a tasty burger; there's no denying that. Heck, the place gets bonus points for having such unique items on the menu. Jalapeno relish? Awesome.

However, just because you can put everything on a burger doesn't mean you should. I thought each individual ingredient on the specialty burger I got was stellar, but cramming five or six together created something in which I couldn't pinpoint any specific flavor. I guess I need to pace myself next time!
author: Casey S.

description:
Super good! Everything is good. The Gluten Free buns are amazing. The fry's are gluten free too... meaning they do not fry anything with gluten in the same oil. 

It's grass fed, I think it's an amazing value overall. If you haven't been here, try it.
author: S...... p.

description:
My friend raved about this joint so I had to check it out

No doubt some tasty burgers, fries, and Shakes were on point!!!

I'd recommend the Tejano burger..did not disappoint and quality of beef was oh so good. Jus writing about it is making me hungry. lol. 

Staff was very friendly and employees were constantly going throughout store to clean off tables, constantly. Very cool. 

I know this is a burger establishment but their shakes are to die for!! 

Everything is a little pricier than I'd like but you def get the quality you pay for. A shake i believe was $7, jesus. 

Place is on a great location on Fillmore st. The size of the store is fairly small and can get packed quickly making it difficult for a party of 5+ some difficulty finding a table. 

Some extras were that the Gigantes were playing and sure enough on TV. Bueno. 

Although I didn't get it, pretty sweet you can order Elk meat if desired. Don't know of too many establishments that offer this. Especially burger joints. 

If you're ordering a burger, fries, and a drink you're looking at $15ish. 

All in all, I'd def return here for a meal. 
Cool atmosphere. 
Friendly staff.  
tasty burgers.
Pub feel to it-serves brew and bar sitting layout.

Just prolly couldn't come as often bc of price. But i'd def come by for shakes pretty often if I was a local.
author: Bryan G.

description:
Meh.

My daughter suggested we have dinner at Roam.  She eats here frequently with friends after they have drinks at a nearby bar.  That should have been a clue, but I wasn't listening carefully to the drinking part.  Apparently the burgers are tastier when in a slightly inebriated state.  

My turkey burger, original style was tasteless.  Turkey isn't that flavorful but nothing was added to spice it up a bit and it was very over cooked.  Bland and over cooked is not a good combination.  All I tasted was bread and sauce.  My daughter ordered the elk, French style and found it dry and lacking in the usual hangry, tipsy state flavor.  The asparagus were excellent as well as the plain sweet potato fries but need catchup which they don't serve.  Just hot sauce.  The customer service was excellent but not enough for me to return.
author: Donna P.

description:
YAAASSSS!!  

I absolutely loved this place.  Probably the best burger I've ever had.  If not definitely in my top 3. I kept it pretty simple and got a beef burger with aged cheddar,  raw onion,  bacon,  tomato and herb mayo and it was just so so good.  It's not anything crazy,  but it was just the exceptional quality of each ingredient that made it awesome.  The herb mayo seemed to be homemade with chunks of garlic cloves,  the bun was perfectly grilled,  the grass fed burger perfectly cooked.... It was just simple and exactly what I think about when I day dream of a good burger. The truffle parmesan haystack was delicious and the Meyer lemon soda was Perfect!  I don't normally drink sodas cause I don't like really sweet sugary drinks,  but it was the perfect balance of sweet and tartness!  So so good.  I could drink that everyday.  Next time I'm in Sanfransico I will definitely be coming back and probably craving it until then!
author: Emily G.

description:
Solid place! 

Recommend the zucchini straws for sure! 2 burgers, 2 drinks 2 fries was roughly $30 = a very solid SF meal! 

Bar staff was super friendly as well - they also have coat hooks under the bar!
author: Mike M.

description: Ordered delivery and pretty much got screwed. Burger was extremely under cooked and the patty was still pretty cold from the center. Could not eat it. Very disappointed.
author: Josely C.

description:
Stopped by this spot for a casual dinner; an hour later, we walked out satisfied and impressed. My aunt and I shared the Sunny Side Burger, french fries and sweet potato fries, and a salted caramel milkshake. Finding a seat was a challenge at the busy time of dinner (around 7:30ish), but we slipped into a vacated spot after a few minutes of lingering. The line out the door comes and goes - don't get discouraged if it looks long, just give it 15 minutes!

Our burger was delicious. I only have good things to say about it:) We shared because we wanted to try multiple menu items,  but I could have easily eaten a whole one...I just would've been uncomfortably stuffed! 

Both fries initially came out lukewarm which is a pet peeve for my aunt. We sent those back and a few minutes later got a piping hot sleeve of regular fries. For some reason the sweet potato fries were never quite hot - I guess they just didn't have a fresh batch available. Regardless, they were nicely salted, thin fries.

The salted milkshake was pretty good. Not orgasmic, but still a good dessert. The guy behind the counter was no help at all when I was deciding which milkshake was the best...so I had to take a blind shot in the dark from his "they're all good" response. When everything sounds good, it's hard to be decisive!

For a casual dinner, this spot is great. We loved our time here and would definitely come back next time we're in SF!
author: Joy W.

description:
I went to Roam on a Friday afternoon so of course it was packed; but the nice cashiers moved the line along quickly. I ordered the Tejono burger, sweet potato fries, and russet fries with the truffle parmesan. 

The sweet potato fries and truffle parmesan fries were definitely yummy; but the truffle parmesan fries just made me crave the truffle fries from Umami Burger haha. As for the burger, it was bland. Despite the pepper jack cheese, avocado, and tortilla chip toppings, the burger was really underwhelming. And the beef patty itself is small, thin, and lacks seasoning.

Overall it was fine and I would return if a friend wanted to go, but I think there are better burger joints out there.
author: Belle M.

description:
Fantastic burger. Get the truffle fries!

The atmosphere of this place is great, and they have some of the best hamburgers in San Francisco. You're going to have to wait to order and get a table, but it's totally worth it.
author: Derek J.

description:
Writing this review after my second visit. At my first, I was quite happy with the quality of the burgers and had this place bookmarked as one of my favourite burger joint in the city. After my second, I have different opinion. Service was not so pleasant, the chic counter girl was not too keen on whatever she was doing. I ordered to-go and the burgers and salad came on the plates, I wasn't happy so was the server guy. 

I ordered a cheeseburger with tomatoes and lettuce and it was okay but as the 2 star phase says, 'Meh. I've experienced better'. 

The farmer's salad always looked good but it was on the little too salty side so I didn't enjoy it. Although the local veggies were good quality but I think this should be expected given the price. 

Not sure I'll be back. There are tons of nicer burger places in the city, including my quintessential favourite - In-N-Out.
author: Bomin K.

description: Only been here once and I've been wanting to go back.  It just sucks that getting here isn't always easy for me.  Had their burger in a lettuce wrap, good.  I don't remember if we got fries, we came here during the time we were doing Whole30 Challenge.  It's a good place to go to if you eat paleo.  Will come back to try their kombucha and shake next time.
author: Claire J.

description: Yummy beet burger that is comparable to source mini if not better! It has quinoa and baby kale in it and it's super filling. Get the sunny side toppings. This is my friend Sagars favorite veggie burger place in SF. Want to try their fries and their regular burger and bison burger. :)
author: Kristin C.

description: Awesome burgers for a reasonable prize, we always get the french fries burger, and I recommend a "tri fecta" as a side, their sweet potato fries are really good!
author: Inés E.

description: Delicious! Burgers are always tasty and juicy - my fave is the heritage. Fries are awesome, especially the truffle Parmesan, and the milkshakes are to die for. Roam is my go to place for burgers and have never had a bad experience. They do take out too which is handy.
author: Olivia C.

description: We've had the elk burger and the regular beef burger, with sides of zucchini strings and sweet potato fries. Honestly, people rave about this place but I'm not sure I like it more than Super Duper or Five Guys. That said, it's very vegan and vegetarian friendly, so if you can get in (it's a neighborhood favorite), I'd say you stay and grab a juicy burger to check it out for yourself and see where it stacks in your local burger ranking. Skip the zucchini strings, they're all crisp, no veggie.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Been to the one on Union and liked their regular burgers and fried goodies, so excited to see a closer one open up.

Saw *ostrich* on the menu so had to go for it, deciding to pair with the 'Chalet' toppings. Sadly, while the flavor is ok, the patty was more like a drier well done beef burger than a juicy variant of red meat. This was a big let down, given that you are paying $3 for the privilege of eating a not-so-good burger. Stick with the regular stuff and be happy.
author: Linus W.

description: It's been a while since I have been to this place because I turned vegetarian. First craving for meat today made me go and get the vegetarian burger on a bed of lettuce . It was delicious . Thank you
author: Nedim P.

description:
I am admittedly a creature of habit when it comes to restaurants. I used to frequent this location -- it's in my neighborhood -- when it was a Japanese restaurant, and I've joined the crowds there since it became Roam.

About being a creature of habit, at a burger place that means for me a hamburger with the usual fixings, minus cheese, and French fries and a chocolate shake. Just like the beloved old 1950s malt shops, right? Well, no.

The staff is very friendly. The wait for food can be extended due to the crowded conditions. Roam is noisy and you'll find yourself cheek-by-jowl with other diners. The burgers are not so exceptional, but good. The fries just about perfectly crispy, and the shakes, belched forth from a machine rather than scooped and assembled the old-fashioned way, are actually sinfully good.

But here's my problem. This is, after all, a burger, fries and a shake. But with a recent price hike, the tab for that simple meal now exceeds $20. Which probably will be the cut-off point for me to eat elsewhere. Plain and simple, it's too expensive for me.
author: John C.

description: Amazing flavor combinations for all of the burgers, and often have rare meats on special (see what I did there?). Today I got an elk burger with avocado, caramelized onions, avocado, mustard greens and it was amazing. My only complaint is that the space has been planned poorly so if you sit at the bar you will constantly get bumped into by staff and patrons alike with little to no apology.
author: Brandon M.

description: My brother and I love good burger and beer. If you're like us, then this place offers the best. To spoil yourself, i recommend Sunny Side burger and the fry-fecta ! For drinks, they have a good selection of craft beer so whatever suits you..We stayed in San Francisco for 10 days, and i can honestly say that they served me the best burger i ate in San Francisco !
author: Cagri S.

description:
Went here with my mom and boyfriend because it had great reviews on Yelp and we were in the area. I was very happy with the food and service. 

I ordered the Tejano bison burger and my mom went with the market salad I believed it was called. Upon getting my burger I was surprised with the tortilla chips in the burger! It was very different than your average burger, crunchy in the middle and the meat was tender as ever! It was noticeable that the meat was quality. Definitely a burger I would recommend ordering. My mom said the salad had great flavor and was a perfect size. For fries we ordered the sweet potato fries and they were great. Not too crunchy and a little soft, just how I like it! 

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick bite to eat that has good quality food!
author: Katina K.

description:
Great burgers! Fries were ok+ and no standard sodas available :( Too "artisan" for me in that regard. 

My French burger is in my top 5 if I had a top 5 burger list with its perfect marriage of avocado, grilled onions, watercress, and greens. The truffle fries were a tad salty for me but works - highly recommend.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Food is good but horrible cyber service. I placed an online order, walked down from work only to be told the system was down and my order did not go through. No time to order something else so I'll head back to work and eat dinner from the vending machines.
author: Paul W.

description: Love love love Roam Burger!!! My favorite patty is the bison, and my favorite burger is the Tejano! Also do yourself a favor, and get an order of Russet Fries and a Mint Chip shake!
author: Clay P.

description:
I don't know why I waited so long to come here. I guess it's because I didn't want to be part of the chaotic crowds that I see whenever I pass by.  Well, today was a different story. I had no choice. This lunch was planned a week ahead by a couple of my co-workers who had eaten here already and could not stop raving about it since. 

Now mind you, I'm pregnant and the sterotype of my people is that we'll eat anything that comes our way. I was NOT in the mood for burgers but as a good teamplayer, I joined in on the party. My mood changed as soon as I bit into my burger. 

I, personally, ordered the French and Fries, which consisted of turkey, avocado, gruyere cheese, spinach or argula (I forget), and fries. No drink, just water, and no sides. My total was $9.22. The meat at Roam are 100% grass fed and is their #1 selling point. 

The flavor was fresh, the texture, perfect. I was caught off guard with the fries inside the burger (I forgot that it was part of it), but was pleasantly surprised with how it blended nicely with the gruyere cheese. With each bite, I was impressed. My mood switched from not wanting a burger to loving what I was eating. I think I kept nodding with every 10 bites I took. My plan was to wrap half of it up and take it home to the hubbs, but that didn't pan out, I finished that whole thing. 

My co-workers ordered a "Trifecta" for appetizers before I arrived. The Trifecta consisted of french fries, fried zucchini strips and fried sweet potato fries. Delish. It was fun to eat the zucchini strips.

Afterwards, when you eat something heavy, you feel nasty and need to take a trip to the restroom STAT, but not this place. Everything was fresh it seemed and my body seems to take to it nicely; I'm full, but not feeling like I have to go to sleep or guilty about the crap I ate.  

What I like about this place is that you first have to order your burger at the register and choose your choice of meat (beef, turkey, bison and vegetarian (tofu??) and then choose your style of burger. There's no rush to pay the bill at the end and leave. You've paid your dues and can converse until you receive a text from your boss looking for you.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Nice! The Roam establishment is expanding! I have yet to try a meat burger here (or at most burger joints) & instead stuck with my veggie patty done in the "Sunny Side" fashion: egg, white cheddar, arugula, caramelized onions, & sauce (I asked for the house, a less flavorful version of thousand island dressing, in place of sweet chili.) Solid 3 stars, no more & definitely no less. I wish the veggie patty had more body & firmness; it's a little mushy. 

We shared sweet potato fries (yum) & their special, asparagus with shallots & manchego (oily to the max.) 

We were tempted by the chocolate hazelnut shake, but thank goodness we talked each other out of that diet disaster! 

I do prefer Umami's veggie burger, but BFF liked Roam's burger better, so I can see us returning, but not in the near future...
author: Fancypants X.

description: One of the best vegetarian burgers I have had! Trio of fries was also very yummy.
author: Betty C.

description: This is an average burger spot. I would recommend going to a nicer place instead. Cheese wasn't fully melted. Patty was thin and unseasoned. The bun was very fluffy and nice. The fries were average and were a little too soft and too close for comfort.
author: Paul I.

description: We had 2 burgers with fries, my chalet was delicious, also the fries were yummy! Highly recommended
author: Viviana D.

description: DELICIOUS!! And healthy with great options for gluten free. I will definitely be going back for this burger!!
author: Sarah M.

description:
Please keep in mind I am only addressing the Fillmore location.

I am mixed about this place. Based on the food, the Roam would be getting 4 stars. But based on the service, I would be giving it 2. 

It is clear these guys know how to make a burger. The patties are a little rare for my taste, but it is delicious. It is not overly greasy. The ingredients are fresh. Not the best burgers I have had in the bay area, but enough for me to come back for a second time. And the shakes...arguably the best shake-and-burger combination I have ever had. I had a sunny side up burger with house sauce (which is thousand island) and a chocolate shake with the toasted marshmallow. The total was a little over $16 with tax. No fries (if you don't get them you're not missing out on much). My girlfriend had the elk burger. It was all right; I'd prefer the beef.

There are some things you should know, however, if you plan on going to the Fillmore location.
1. Try to avoid peak hours. And if you are the interior designer of this location, take your right hand and smack yourself. Claustrophobic people here during peak hours will LITERALLY go mentally insane. We sat at a bar because we could not get a table. EVERY person walking by either swiped my back and just downright shouldered me. The aisles are practically nonexistent unless you're ok playing bumper chairs with people around you. At peak capacity, I am sure this place violates every fire rule in the books. 

Also, if you are here at peak hours, sit outside or sit near the open window. There is absolutely no air flow towards the back. And if the kitchen explodes, you're the first one out.

Keeping this in mind, we came in at 2pm on a Sat. and the place was packed. At 3pm, it cleared out significantly.

2. Service is $hit. Because it was so hot I took off my sweater, and I ended up misplacing it by the end of our meal. Somebody stole it. I went to the bar/ordering area and a baboon could have given me a better attitude with the whole ordeal. The woman who was my cashier before we ate; you are the exception.

Personally, I won't come back to this location. The burgers are good enough for the price for possibly a return visit, but the roll-my-eyes-back attitude would make any food connoisseur cringe a bit.
author: Justin L.

description: Great tasting burger with a good selection of toppings and meat options. I've had the Bison burger a couple times but so far the elks been my favorite. Ate the beef tejano today and really enjoyed it. Also the zucchini onion haystack fries are a must! Definitely will be coming back again.
author: Josue V.

description: A really good place if you want to try vegetarian. Vegetarian patties are very good. They have a nice relaxed ambience. I absolutely loved their fries. Our friends had classic beef burger & they were very flavorful & juicy. Big thumbs up to chefs there. Will definitely come here more often whenever we are in that part of city.
author: Vipul Z.

description:
I have been staying in SF for a few weeks and have eaten here three seperate times. I LOVE their Bison Heritage burger!!!! I ordered it the first and third time... delicious! The patty is thick, juicy and cooked to perfection which is packed with incredible flavor. All of the veggies are fresh and crisp. I would recommend trying their shakes too! Thick, creamy and yummy even though they are a little pricey for their size. Over all I can't imagine why I wouldn't eat here again. 

Expect about $25.00 per person (est prices: $12.50 - burger, $4.00 - fries & $7.00 shake)
author: John S.

description:
If I commit myself to a lifetime ban on fast food burgers except In-N-Out Burger, then I eat at Roam Artisan Burgers.  Their burgers are 100% grass-fed beef.  Customers can create your own burger like The Counter.

There's no waiter service.  Customers look at a menu on the wall.  Next, they walk to the cashier to order their meal.  The cashier gives the customers a metal stand with a number.  Finally, they find a place to sit in an open free seating area.  A worker delivers your order from the kitchen by finding your number on your table.

There are no brand name sodas.  The drinks are made in-house.  +1 star.  However, they serve bottled sodas.
author: Raymond M.

description:
Very good, if a bit pricing, burger chain in San Francisco.

A stalwart go to place for a nice, casual meal any time of the week or day.

Love the Tijano burger.
author: Jason H.

description:
Want a side of the old ultra violence and beatings with your burger, then go to ROAM.

We were just there and a guy who acted like the front of the house manager was mainly sitting at the bar watching a kick boxing match on the TV.  Yum, a couple of guys beating each other.  Just what I want to see when I eat.

The burgers are ok but are fried, not broiled.  2 burgers & fries and drinks will set you back almost $50.

The place is cramped, noisy, and crowded most of the time.  

So, in review, if you are up for an expensive, self service experience with cramped seating, really loud noise level, and bloody boxing on the TV, then by all means go.
author: Alan B.

description:
Finally a awesome burger joint within walking distance!

They have have GREAT BURGERS and I love their sunny side burger!  

As for their sides... Both sweet potato and regular fries are friggin awesome!
author: Derek Y.

description: Lovely delicious burgers. Quality ingredients. Grass fed meat. Fast service. Btw, This is not a full service restaurant- you order at the cashier and they will bring you your food but that's it. You take your glass up to the bar if you want a refill, you get your own silverware, napkins, etc. Like a fancy Smashburger. Everything we had there was good. Highly recommend the veggie or salad of the day too. Milkshakes made from Strauss family farm ice cream. Seating is not abundant but there is a long community table and a few 2 tops and fewer 4 tops. Also has 3 outdoor tables.
author: Piper W.

description:
This was the first suggestion a friend had for my friends and I to go to when we told him we were craving burgers and it's a damn good suggestion too!

The place had a cool hipster vibe to it. The servers were chill and friendly as well as the couple we sat right next to. 

As for the food--- AWESOME-ness!!! I ordered the Bison Chalet burger and I enjoyed it to the max! I love the watercress (now I know what it is...haha), the mushrooms, and the house sauce. I also ordered a side of he zucchini onion haystack which is just zucchinis and onions very thinly sliced and it was dee-licious! According to my friends, the French & Fries and Sunny Side burgers were also really good, so I might have to try those next time. 

I would most definitely come back here and most definitely recommend this place to everyone.
author: Jorgess M.

description: We are very familiar with the gourmet burger craze here in VA and are opinionated about our favorites.  I thought that Roam was pretty solid - good flavors, not too long a wait, and actually a few bucks cheaper than DMV area places.  I got the French and Fries burger with Gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, dijon mustard, and topped with truffle Parmesan fries - messy (avocado is slippery), but very good.  The fries (sweet potato with herbs and more truffle Parmesan fries) were also good.  I was torn between the fancy shakes and the fancy sodas, and ended up trying the caramelized pineapple soda.  It was good, but not quite sweet enough, and I wished I had gotten a shake instead.
author: Sarah C.

description:
This review is based on the milkshakes alone. I think the milkshakes merit their very own review.

On girl's day Friday we brunched, we shopped, we snapped blog pics and we strolled the streets of Pacific Heights- right on over to the best mint chocolate chip shake I have had in as long as I can remember. Kathleen got a caramel shake which was also divine- but naturally, on such a lovely and perfect San Francisco day we needed sweet potato fries to top it off. Sweet potato anything is perfection in my book.  Anyway, the shakes had chocolate scrapings on top and were absolutely delicious as we savored our high calorie drink delights at our window seat. 

We probably walked 2-3 miles that day (being very optimistic here) and burned off the shakes as fast as we consumed them. Again, being very optimistic. Go to Roam.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Roam is convenient to me; and better yet Roam is good and also inexpensive.  A great combination.  Service, such as it is, consists of your ordering at the entrance, being given a number so that your food will find you, and your finding a place to sit.  At 5 PM on Saturday evening finding a place to sit was not a problem.  They bring the food and when you are finished they take away the empty plates.  

The farmers market salad is fresh and immense.  It is easily well suited for sharing by two or three people.  As I worked my way through the mountainous salad it occurred to me that the only way to improve on this would have been to have had a some black olives in the mix. 

The heritage burger was very good with bacon and fontina cheese that nicely balanced the beef.  I ordered it medium rare and it came cooked just a bit beyond that. 

A burger and that immense salad left me happy and happily full.
author: David D.

description:
I first saw their Union St resto on the Food Network and ate there once. Why didn't I go back? Because I couldn't find parking along Union St everytime I tried to go there! 

All I can say is that they've opened a resto along Fillmore! The food is just as phenomenal and consistent as their Union St resto, but definitely more convenient for me since it's just a 10 minute walk from my place. 

Anyway, about the food. Tried a few burger varieties and they were all good! I'm pretty much happy keeping my burger simple "The Classic" with White Cheddar, good meat and cooked to a juicy perfection! 

I also tried their Brussel sprouts with chili flakes, lemon and parmesan, it was delicious!
  
Also, don't leave without grabbing a shake.... with bruleed marshmallow, you'll be in heaven after this meal!
author: Gordon O.

description:
Come to Roam for a satisfying burger. I ordered the Pacific Blue and all the flavors were outstanding - blue cheese (great if you like a strong cheese), watercress (brought freshness to the burger), caramelized onions, tomato, and a really delicious sauce. And of course the patty was cooked a perfect medium rare. The burger size is perfect too. You feel full after you finish it but not overly so. It really hit the spot. All the other combos sound super appealing. My sister ordered the Tejano - the slight kick of pepper jack and southwest flavors left me unable to decide which burger I enjoyed more.

The russet fries are run-of-the mill and the herb topping (you get to choose from 3 different ones) was unevenly spread. The burgers totally steal the show here!!

I also appreciated that it's order-at-the-counter, take your number and have a seat casual, but cozy and intimate enough for a date or friend. They also have quite a few alcohol (beer and wine options). Trendy without being stuffy!
author: Brandy A.

description:
Excellent burger, salad, beer and shake (for dessert) tonight with my son. Great time.

Watched at least six members and a manager at the bar working hard to take care of each and every order. Did not see any error in the busy hour!
author: R G.

description: Gluten free bread was great! Milkshakes are amazing! Seasonal veggie platter was delicious. Staff is helpful. Cool ambiance!!
author: Bettina L.

description:
Options options options! Roam takes the pretty basic concept of burgers + fries and makes it feel a little classier and a little healthier. We had the French + Fries with a beef burger, the Classic with bison, and the Heritage with bison. The burgers on the first two were a little under-done, but a few days later when we got the Heritage it was perfect, tender bison. The French + Fries is topped with truffle-Parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, and watercress. It's a whole meal packed into one burger! I added fontina to the classic and it came with a basic bun, Bibb lettuce, and the special house sauce. The Heritage with bison has bacon, fontina, and caramelized onions, in addition to some seasoned mayo sauce and a hint of rosemary. 

The burgers are deliciously flavorful and all meat is free-range and locally raised. They even list what farm your protein comes from! You can choose from beef, turkey, bison, house-made organic veggie, or a seasonal meat (elk right now. There's an up-charge for bison and elk.). The only problem with the burgers is that the sauces are so creamy that they make the buns soggy and the burgers fall apart for the last 1/2 or 1/3. They do have gluten-free options, including a lettuce wrap. Yum!


They also have awesome veggie options. The house salad has mixed greens, pomegranate seeds, pepitas, rainbow carrots, and a choice of vinaigrette or herbed ranch. It's so delicious! The Fillmore location also is doing Brussels sprouts with Parmesan, chili flakes, and lemon - and lots and lots of butter. They are tasty and delicious, but definitely on the greasy side. 

Roam is a great spot for a casual meal or snack, and the conscientious consumers out there will appreciate their dedication to buying food that is grown and/or raised humanely to the earth and the animals. Everything is a la carte, so your bill can add up quickly, but we found it to be totally worth it. 

A couple of tips:
* if you like your bacon on the crispier side, ask for we-ll-done bacon on the heritage. It basically melts in your mouth. 

* the milk shakes are made with locally raised milk and have amazing flavors like blue-bottle coffee and salted caramel. Stop counting calories and just do it!

* you can request your burger bun a little crispier. I'd recommend it.
author: Marianna G.

description: Great ambiance, I loved the staff at the bar. The meal was good, the staff was good, nothing too spectacular though! Came for the giants game :)
author: Tessa S.

description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QAlmEUFRaEA

This is used to be Fillmore chapter of the VFW, but now, it became VFB these days. I remember in early 80's, there was a bbq place, black people's bbq place on Fillmore around the same area. I went there few times to have the bbq, it was not plastic plate, I mean they did not serve the bbq on a plastic plate. It was a regular ceramic plate. Just wondering why and when black people started using plastic plate to have bbq? I understand if it's a bbq truck, but at a restaurant, I'd like my bbq on a ceramic plate.

Fillmore in early 80's was very different. 

About the Roam Artisan Burgers.
I got to have the Sunny Side $8.25, AGAIN!
Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce.

I'd like to mention that their customer service was excellent, efficient and friendly, I think that the space is special because knowing how to take care of customers is very important especially times we are having.
Also it's comfortable and certainly kid friendly that I don't really care, I don't dislike kids, but when I am eating, I want be in peace, so, I'll be like, "Shutit! Shutthe FxxxUP!!!". 
Just bothers me as hell.  
So, every time when I see a stroller, I'll go some where else.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Sustainable just tastes better. Yes. Yes I'll have a grass-fed burger with Fry-fecta (potato fries, sweet potato fries with chipotle and maple, and zucchini-onion haystack) and an organic apple juice to wash it down with please. 

This is my happy place in Frisco. Tip: defo buy your luon yoga pants from lululemon Cow Hollow before the fries.
author: Jiahui Y.

description:
best burger i ever had. Also very affordable considering its in SF lol. also another big plus is that i found parking very nearby and easily at both locations.

other contenders for best burger have also been my prior favorites.
*Black Bear Diner- bbq burger
*Honolulus Teddys Bigger Burgers- any burger from this place.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Newly opened and working on some customer services deficiencies I hope.  How about a silverware set up with your clearly silverware dependent order(salad)? I get it; self serve...but for near $70 bucks for two glasses of pinot, two burgers ONE order of herb fries and a dinner salad...I would like my fork rolled in a napkin pigs-in-a-blanket style.  C'mon now....also...miss hostess...give a tiny bit less attitude (super cool you're working in a hip burger joint) and maybe a hint..."Hi; welcome...what can I get you? Okay great! Btw, ketchup, mustard, silverware and napkins are behind you! Help yourselves!"

I'm jus sayin'....

And the burger was a 7.5-8....fries awesome; wine selection=decent.  Just don't fool yourself; pricey burger place....it is San Franscisco.
author: Darby W.

description:
Been here multiple times, my top choices are the veggie and the bison. After a good workout, bison feeds my protein craving and it's leaner and healthier than beef. Higher in iron too!

My two favorite styles are the French & Fries and the Chalet because they both have the super-food watercress (peppery). The F & F bison is a mouthful of cheesy contentment. I'm not a big fan of potato (fillers!), but in small doses with truffle oil and Parmesan cheese inserted in a burger and they're tastier. The Chalet pairs well with the veggie burger as I love the meatiness of the mushrooms!

Love the space with 4 seating options (bar, communal, private and outdoor). Dim lighting, chill atmosphere with a friendly crowd. Peak time is around 8pm.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Delicious burgers, fries, and milkshakes!

Burgers:
We had a Bison "Heritage" (Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo) which was absolutely excellent! I could not get over how juicy this burger was without feeling like it was sloppy. 
We had a Turkey "Sunny Side" (Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce) which was equally as delicious and juicy. I felt the addition of the greens was really great and will definitely order again. Don't be afraid of the turkey, it is just as good!

Fries:
I cannot get over how good the "Fry-fecta" was! My favorite was definitely the haystack (thinly shredded zucchini and onions fried) but was happy to have the russet and sweet potatoes as well.

Milkshakes:
We asked to blend the Salted Caramel with Chocolate ice creams which was delicious!

Beers:
They have a small selection but they are all well selected and I found the IPA paired well with the burgers.

Although the interior is somewhat small and waiting for a table seems like a downer we found a nice spot before our food was ready and enjoyed the comfortable, yet cozy experience.
author: Joseph S.

description:
There is barely a time I am happy about a meal I have had, this I would say Is one of those times. 

So let's start with our main course. I got a burger, my dad's got burgers And our special dinner guest got a burger. My burger was really good and really filling that I did not have much room for fries. My dad got the gejana burger which was super juicy. My other dad got the almost like everything burger. As for our guest chalet burger which was the best of them all apperantly. Our drinks were beer and wine and I got some homemade lemonade which was super sweet and good. 

We got no dessert but I loved my experience . The service however was good and we got multiple servers (all were good) 

Next time I am in the area I will be back.
author: Ford W.

description:
There's definitely a "unique" factor to Roam. I like the idea that they have several versions of meat, vegan, toppings, etc. The menu and ordering system are pretty easy to navigate. So that's all good. But I really have experienced better. Here's the feedback:

-  My bison burger was a little bisony (may be good or bad - don't know. Honestly I'm not a bison connoisseur - but I wouldn't get it again.)
- The bacon on it was a little chewy.
- The burger was a bit too big and a little cumbersome to handle
- The fries were fine - sweet potato and regular but again, I've experienced better.
- It seemed a little pricy - maybe not. San Francisco, twitter down the street, etc. You decide:

2 bison burgers (one with bacon)
2 fries
2 bottled soft drinks. 
2 small shakes (8, maybe 10 oz.)
===============
$46 not including tip

Note: I ate every bit of my burger.
author: J T.

description:
Great service and meat patty options. I tried the Elk burger which was very tasty and not too gamey. The Buffalo burger was 9 out of 10.
This place is well priced at a good location and the food is fresh And tasty, don't miss it.
author: M R.

description: I love this place. Quick service and delicious fresh food. It's also usually easy to get a seat. You get to choose your type of burger: veggie, beef, bison, turkey, elk.  Then you choose your style (amazing topping combos) or build your own. They have a good selection of beer, and I personally love the ginger lime artisanal soda. It can be a bit pricey; we spent $45 on lunch but I think it's worth it.
author: Brandi D.

description:
Great for a casual dinner.  Emphasis on the "casual" though.  You order as soon as you walk in the door, get a number, and seat yourself wherever you can.  The lighting is dark, with dim ambiance lighting along the walls and near the "bar" area.  

I'm usually not impressed by burgers, but their Tejano burger was deliciosisimo!  The grass fed burger was sooo tasty, and the crunch corn tortilla strips added an extra special texture to the burger.  

I also shared their tri-frio combo, which was super tasty too. 

I would come back to try their salads, which seemed to be in a very generous proportion and filled with lots of fresh veggies.

Come here if you're looking for a casual yet swanky dinner, but be prepared to hover awkwardly around other diners while you're waiting to find a seat because there is limited seating available during prime time dinner hours on the weekend.
author: Samantha L.

description: So unfortunately is it weren't for the employees that work here this place would have had a better rating from me cause the food was pretty good . I'm giving this a bad review because I was waiting for the restroom for like 5 mins and finally when someone did come out , someone from the kitchen quickly ran in before I could go in . That is just UNEXEPTABLE. And when he came out he made sure to run out and not make any eye contact . Also a lady sitting next to me had a clearly number and had a table and they gave her a to-go order . That made no sense since she had gotten a number . Some of the worst employees I have ever witnessed in my life
author: Slavic D.

description:
Was not impressed.
Took some recommended burger (had avocado and crispy onion strings)
Poorly assembled... some avocado over here but not there, same with strings, etc.
Not that it really matters, but bus boys were jerky.
Ingredients are good though and intention seems good... just not good quality control on what goes out to the customers nor attention to floor staff.
Will give it one more shot, but, not going out of my way to do so.
author: Dan M.

description:
I can't say enough great things about Roam - this coming from a non burger enthusiast. 

I had their veggie burger with grilled onions and avocado and I'm still drooling over this masterpiece. 

Their customer service is efficient and friendly, the space isn't anything special but it's comfortable and certainly kid friendly. 

I will absolutely be back!
author: Kristy M.

description:
Horrible takeout experience.  My Turkey Tejano burger was raw (see below for picture).  No response from management on follow-ups.  Stay away!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/roam-artisan-burgers-san-francisco-3?select=-4bQvSeovhUKWoyLfbE_AA#Sn6tO7jpE9KEH3743etxVw
author: Jag R.

description:
I had been waiting in anticipation for Roam to open on Fillmore for a couple of months, I was so excited there was finally going to be a good burger joint in my neighborhood. (Johnny Rockets was not cutting the mustard.) 

I stopped by for a late dinner last weekend and ordered The Fry-Fecta to start,  which is all three of their sides in one bowl. Including russet fries, sweet potato fries, and fried onion and zucchini straws. Everything in the bowl was great, my favorite being the onion and zucchini, they were cut really thin and fried perfectly. I totally failed to order dipping sauce though, next time. 

For my burger I ordered the BBQ, which came with  Aged White Cheddar, BBQ Sauce, Caramelized Onions, Jalapeño Relish, Oil & Vinegar Slaw. The burger was good, but I was expecting more flavor from the Jalapeno relish and slaw. They didn't really stand out, over the bbq sauce. 

I defiantly am looking forward to coming back to Roam to try their other burger options.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
The operative word here is "Roam".  If you're looking for a delicious burger, this isn't necessarily the place to find it; I'd recommend searching elsewhere.  

Granted Roam does have quality meat and produce, I'm just not convinced that this place is worth all the hype or the amount of money they charge for their food.  The burgers are just good enough, and not what I would expect for "artisan", unless artisan means you're the artisan because you pick your meat, size of burger and condiments, etc.

I wouldn't necessarily come back, but if I had to recommend a place for burgers in this neighborhood, I suppose this would be it by default.
author: Anna V.

description:
Tried the bison and the elk burger aaaaand I've eaten better bison and elk burgers in other places before. 

The place was crowded and its got a bit of an inconvenient "first come first served" seating system.. 

you buy a burger before you have a seat.. and have to wait for a spot standing between other tables..

After all the hype and great reviews we saw here, we all were expecting better (we were a group of 6). 

Conclusion: we've had better burgers in more comfortable places.
author: Antonio S.

description:
One of my college friends was visiting from the east coast, so I took him here to have a good start in SF. Roam has a great veggie burger for me, and plenty of other proteins for carnivores. You basically go in, pick your protein, and then choose you're style - this includes toppings, sauces, etc. I got the sunnyside, which includes an egg and cheddar. It was pretty good, I wish the bread was a little firmer (it's pretty soft and gets softer as it soaks up the sauces they put on it) and the portions here are a little small. I knew this coming in, so I got the fry-fecta to split. It has their russet fries, sweet potato fries, and onion hay. I got the russet fries with their truffle topping, which is fantastic. The onion hay was great too, and the sweet potato fries are a decent option.

Some notes on the different burgers styles (there are a lot to choose from):

The french and fried sounds really good, but they only add a few fries as a burger topping, so you don't really get to taste them as you eat it. If you want fries, get the truffle russet ones on the side.

The tejano comes with tortilla strips as a burger topping as well. It's kind of a strange experience, so if you're in the mood for that then go for it (but don't be surprised when you see them under the top bun!)

I am personally a fan of the tejano and the sunny side, they're just a good combination of flavors.

On the whole, my friend was pretty happy we came here so I'd definitely recommend it!
author: Amaresh S.

description:
I am a fan of the quality ingredients they use in making their burger, and the perspective and approach they take with their food.  The have different meat options (turkey, bison, beef, and ostrich).  They have a selection of different set fixing and make your own burger option, and you get to choose your bun as well.

They also have homemade sodas.  The only let down for me here was the burger as great as the ingredients were did make a complete complementary burger for me.  I got the BBQ burger, and I think next time I'll go with what some other Yelpers or SF Weekly recommended: the Heritage burger.

The service was a bit slow, but good things come to those who wait, and I wasn't in any rush.  I would come here again to try different burgers.
author: Matthew W.

description: This is my favorite veggie burger in the city. I love how all the ingredients are fresh and the food never disappoints. Also love the portions of the milk shakes, the hand crafted sodas, and truffle fries! I crave ROAM every week...
author: Debbie L.

description:
I was really surprised and impressed by Roam Artisan Burgers. Seeing Artisan in the name of any restaurant immediately summons visions of pomposity. And while Roam has a hipster crowd, it wasn't off putting.

The highlight is clearly the food. The burgers are big, messy, & tasty fare. My buffalo burger had egg and avocado. My partner had a beet & quinoa burger stuffed with veggies. While we didn't try them, the fried onions & zucchini looked pretty awesome as well.
author: Ivan L.

description:
SO INCREDIBLE.

Have never been a big burger person, however, my heart has been won over.  

The French and Fry is my favourite pick.  I highly suggest pairing it with the Vanilla milkshake, kids size if you only want a little one!  Goes together as well as a Chardonnay and a white truffle beurre blanc sauce. 

Gluten free buns are available -- being Gluten intolerant myself, yes, legitimately intolerant not some bullshit diet choice, this is a big plus.
