Turkey, bison, and vegetarian quinoa burgers are available as well as beef. 

It gets super busy, but the line moves fast and it is definitely worth the wait.  

So. Good.
author: Jee W.

description: My family and I had a late lunch here, and it was packed. My hubby had the Pacific Blue burger with blue cheese, watercress, tomato, caramelized onions & steak sauce with a side of fries. My daughter and I shared the Heritage burger with applewood smoked bacon, fontina, butter lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions & herb mayo with a side of sweet potato fries. My daughter had the salted caramel milkshake with bruleed marshmallow on top, and my hubby and I shared the blue bottle coffee milkshake with bruleed marshmallow on top too. The burgers were juicy and delicious. Hubby wished their beef patties were thicker. The milkshakes were yummy, but melt fast. Overall our lunch was satisfying.
author: Racquel E.

description: It makes me the happiest panda to know that I can get a delicious bison burger here. The Bison Heritage has been my order twice in a row and I have been super pleased both times. Flavor is incredible and it tastes fresh. I got the side salad last time and ate every last bit of it. The first time I was here I got sweet potato fries and french fries but I wasn't that impressed. Pricing here is typical for SF and service is okay. Atmosphere is casual but nice. I'll definitely be back for the food!
author: Alessandra S.

description:
Roam had been on my burger list for some time now and I finally got an opportunity to check it out tonight. The burgers are in one word: satisfying. Not enough to dethrone Nopa as the king, but worth a visit for any burger aficionado.

I still haven't been to the Union St. location but I figured the parking on Fillmore would be more agreeable and it was; plenty of spots on Pine on Monday evening.

I got the Heritage burger (applewood bacon, fontina, lettuce, tomato, caramelized onion, herb mayo) and I had mushrooms added. Delicious to the last bite. The grass fed beef had good flavor and was cooked perfectly medium rare. The other sounded intriguing; I'm curious to try to bison and ostrich. A plain beef burger runs around $7 and a fully loaded one will come out to about $10 after tax.

The space is nice, a little cold with the door open, but you quickly forget about that after throwing back an Allegash White Ale (on tap). The sweet potato fries were solid but the regular fries were probably even better. The salted caramel Strauss Creamery shake was delicious but it probably wouldn't have hurt if there was more salted caramel flavor.

Definitely coming back.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
This place was OK.  I had never heard of it before so i had no expectations.  Here's what I got:

Sunny Side $8.25
Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce

between the egg and the onions and the sweet chili sauce, it was kind of wet and sticky and messy.. which I guess some people like, but I don't... I don't know why I got this burger.. I'm not a big fan of egg or caramelized onions on burgers... I think I thought the sweet chili sauce would be interesting.. it really wasn't a good fit on a burger. Having said that. it was still a good burger.. good size.. good proportion of stuff... assembled well.. bun was nice before it got sogged up... i'd like to come back and try a different burger next time.... 

it was kind of hectic inside... the napkin dispenser was out and the floor was really slick at one place...... minor details I guess.
author: Easter E.

description: Came again with my boyfriend on at 5pm on a Sunday. Pretty packed. Yet again, I was pleased with the food. We ordered a fry-fecta which comes with zuchinni fries, sweet potato fries, and regular fries. I could definitely not finish this if I ordered one for myself with my burger. I had the Tejano beef burger, and I liked it much more than the french fries burger I had last time. I added the free buttered lettuce too. I don't like that the avocado would be on one side of my burger and the corn chips on another side, I wish it was spread more evenly around the burger. It's messy to eat, but delicious! And to top it off, the mint chocolate chip shake I ordered was the best thing I had that evening. Perfectly tasting with small mint chips that was delicious to crunch on when drinking it. Will definitely order shakes next time I come :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Time to roam to roam burger joint, a burger and fries with a difference "artisan burgers", overall impression of this place is good however some minor issues, with plenty of choice of burgers, different meats to choose from including elk, bison, beef and chicken creating the "artisan" comes from the unusual selection of meats I think? There are a few "pre-designed" burgers to choose from or you can create your own however be aware don't get carried away with things on the burger otherwise you will loose the flavor of the meat under ingredients. Burger size is certainly small for the money you pay but the flavor does make up a bit for the size. We had a sunny side up burger and the heritage burger. The sunny side egg was well cooked with yellow yolk oozing out, I suggest to eat this one with knife and fork or plenty of napkins. The beef was grilled well but just an average beef patty, nothing amazing. The heritage burger was good with crispy bacon topping an elk patty and molten cheese, elk was good but not as gamey taste as the staff make out it is. Also excessive that you have to pay extra for elk or bison. The bacon made the heritage burger without that it would just be another burger. The milkshakes here are great with organic ingredients and nice smooth flavor. The truffle and Parmesan fries are a bit of a joke, couldn't taste any truffle and the Parmesan was grated onto the fries after cooking but didn't melt and stick so they ended up just being fries. I think roam has a great concept and some brilliant possibilities for burgers but the execution falls short of the mark. If the staff were friendlier, product was bigger for the money, the "game" meat tastes like game meat and the truffle fries actually had truffle, cooked in truffle oil or even just tasted like truffle, it would be five stars but due to these minor issues only 3/5. Roam and enjoy, but remember to be quick about it otherwise staff will get more abrupt.
author: Marcus B.

description:
Huge fan of burgers with unusual animals in between the pieces of bread. Considered going for the bison, but at the end of the day bison is really too close to cow to be considered exotic. Only option was the elk. Was not disappointed in any way. It was different enough to be interesting but not so different as to be uncomfortable. An ostrich option would have been preferable, but alas, no luck there.

The sweet potato fries were on the limp side. If they had been crispier it really would have set the meal on fire.
author: Michael S.

description: Really yummy burgers! Even getting it to go, it was still delicious at home 20 minutes later. I got a classic burger with lettuce wrap, and even without the bun, it was still so good. Patty was tender and juicy, and the fixin's were simple and clean. I can just imagine how much better it'd be with a bun! I like that you can customize your burger, with different patties, buns, and toppings. I'm sad to have just discovered them as I'm about to move out of the Bay Area!
author: Kathy L.

description:
This is now my favorite burger joint in SF! So much better than those sad soggy tiny little bitsy Umami burgers that so so disappointed me after hearing rave reviews. I ordered the French and Fry Burger (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard) with an egg and some herb butter. Yes, it's as ridiculously decadent and delicious as it sounds!   

I also tried their seasonal veggies. It was some type of butternut squash with kale and pesto mixture that I wasn't a big fan of. Their zucchini onion haystack was interesting though - an onion and zucchini ran through the grater and deep fried - the result was some light fluffy stuff that was savory and sweet, but so light it almost tasted like flavored air. Not my kinda thing as I like some substance to my fries, but my friends love it.

I usually don't actively seek out burger joints (I'm more of an Asian comfort food type of person), but I would definitely come back!!!
author: Catherine C.

description: We loved this place, kind of last minute and we found it on yelp. The burgers were sooooo good, I had the sunnyside, totally got in a mess with is but was totally worth it. One of the best burgers I have had. My only complaint was the fresh vegetable plate, it was so small I though they had bought a side dish by mistake to the table, it amounted to about 6 small asparagus. Cannot wait to go back and try more items from this place. It was busy all the time we were there and I love the long shared table concept.
author: Steven H.

description:
Delicious sunny side veggie burger and blood orange house soda ($14).
The burger immediately disintegrated, so probably not good to eat on the go, but grab a fork and enjoy inside the clean and cool interior.
author: Jon W.

description: One of the best burgers I've had in a while. Went with the Heritage and it didn't disappoint. Liked the layout and the walk-up ordering Also, the fries were tastefully seasoned. Wish they had a location in WA!
author: Grant S.

description:
I loved Roam. It was my go to place for a consistently good turkey burger or a Farmer's Market salad. But something has gone terribly wrong with Roam lately.

Three times I have received orders with rotten lettuce and even aphids. Aphids really? I would not have minded if this had happened once, but three times was enough for me to tell the staff that I could no longer eat here. They did not seem to care at all, which made me want to return even less.
author: Carly A.

description: Sublime.  Be sure to ask for a sunny side egg with your burger!! Only downside is the burger comes out cold a lot of the times.
author: Alee Z.

description:
Roam Artisan Burgers is not the place to go if you want an cheap burger, but if you care about flavor and quality, this is the place.

I love their classic burger and the choice of cheeses and eclectic toppings. The sweet potato fries are amazing and very filling. I made the mistake of getting a burger and fries when I wasn't starving and was so. very. full.

Their custom sodas are delicious and a must. I'm rather hooked on their blackberry soda. Even with the long lines, service has been great and I can usually find a small table or a seat at the counter.

The only problem with Roam is that I want to go there all the time when there are other restaurants that I've never been to yet. Such a first-world problem.
author: Kevin H.

description:
If I ever hear these overused modifiers--"artisan" or "gourmet"--thrown casually next to the word "burger" again, one can be sure I'll run away as far as I can possible to the closest ma-and-pa grease joint to quell my cravings for the metonymical sandwich of American culture. I can care less that pretentiously overpriced burgers have been in vogue for the past decade. What's more nauseating than the gut-churning effects of eating a Big Mac is how the bourgeoisie burger hides its mediocrity beneath a veneer of superfluous, highfalutin ingredients, e.g., opting for Double Gloucester with Stilton in lieu of standard cheddar, thus casting aside intrinsic taste and substance. For anyone who thinks I'm a raving mad man for this diatribe, he or she can attribute it to my experience at Roam Artisan Burgers last week. 

Although this place easily deserves four to five stars for decor and ambience, the burgers at Roam were a major letdown: They did not live up to the hype or its ratings on Yelp. More importantly, Roam violates the three unwritten rules that prescribe burger perfection: adequate meat, meat-to-bun ratio and bun texture. 

First, a gourmet restaurant charging exorbitant prices for a burger should offer an ample portion of meat--at least a juicy 1/3 lb. meat disk to mitigate the pain of wallet deflation. The size of a Roam patty disappointingly weighs somewhere between an In & Out patty and a Five Guys patty. Second, when the bun is two times the size of the meat, every bite leaves a dissonant aftertaste wherein the mouth regrets having to chew through disproportionate chunks of bread in order to taste the meat. The silver lining to this unsatisfactory meat-to-bun ratio, perhaps, is sandwich integrity (although it's not commendable if the burger's integrity can only be attributed to scanty ingredients). Third, the bun looks and tastes ordinary, lacking in the subtlety of a multi-grain bun or the buttery richness of a brioche. This bread simply resembles a prototypical sesame seed bun used for a 4th of July backyard outing. 

Amid the burgeoning rate of burger bastardization in the land of the free and home of the burgers, let's hope this same virus doesn't spread to other American classics like apple pie anytime soon.
author: Samuel M.

description:
Roam can be a little pricey and overrated if you come too often, but if you pace yourself and come once in a while, it's worth it. :) For someone with a small-to-moderate lunch time appetite, the burger sizes can be a little overwhelming when I want a light lunch, but then again, a filling meal is never a bad thing.

It can get a little crowded with a bit of a line at lunch, but you should be able to find a seat while waiting for your food. They're very accommodating to large groups, helping to seat around twenty people on my friend's birthday, but I wouldn't recommend doing that on the regular. The tables are more suited to fit smaller groups of four or less. 

All the burgers are solid with my favorites being the french and fries and the sunny side. The fry-fecta is good, but I suggest sharing it among friends. The burgers are filling so you might not be able to finish everything yourself.

The shakes are pricey considering the size but so delicious. Definitely try the tahitian vanilla bean and the mint chip. Their seasonal milkshakes are also good. That pumpkin spice, mmmm. :) The bruleed marshmallow is melt-in-your-mouth tasty and fun to try once on your shake.
author: Grace T.

description:
It's just really, really solid. 

I've tried a number of items here: bison, turkey, and veggie burgers made in the following styles: Classic, Tejano, Heritage, and Sunny Side. I've also enjoyed their Farmer's Market Salad (with and without burgers on top), and the Fry-Fecta (because when you can get three types of fries in dish, why would ever only get one?). 

I've had beer and wine from the taps. 

Like I said, it's really solid. The burgers are tasty, with the right amount of grease and mess. Portions are, shall we say, hefty--you won't leave hungry. The salad is gigantic! And actually pretty healthy if you don't mess around with adding extra burgers and you get the dressing on the side. 

Ambiance is basically what you'd expect for an order-at-the-counter-eat-a-table kind of place: A bit loud, a bit cramped, and you're always a little anxious that you won't get a table. Turn over is fast though, so I've never had a problem getting a table, even when I have to eat outside with my dog. 

Anyways, you can't beat this place for a quick dinner on Fillmore St. Bonus points for not being overly pricey.
author: Allison S.

description:
Roam makes it possible to have a quality gluten-free burger! One thing that dissuades me from ordering a gluten-free bun is the preconceived notion I have that gluten-free breads (and buns specifically) are dry and crumble as you eat them. I have no idea of what brand Roam uses, but it was amazing. I almost forgot that it was gluten-free. 

Roam is definitely one of the best quality burgers I've had in San Francisco. 

Tip: Get the Truffle Russet Potato Fries! It's a big enough portion for two to share!
author: Juliette R.

description: Good, tasty burgers, but service somewhat lacking. Want napkins? Have to get up and get them at the water tap. Want ketchup? Same deal. For the price they charge, I'd expect these things at the table.
author: Jim P.

description: I do not eat many burgers, but when I do, I eat them from ROAM.  Buffalo burger in a lettuce wrap is my fav.  The patty is cooked perfectly, I mean really, perfectly, every time.  They have the most amazing order on line pick up system.  Heritage minus the bacon is also awesome.
author: Chelsey G.

description: No complaints! Line wasn't that long when I got here around 12. Food was pretty good, loved the sweet potato fries!
author: Karen Z.

description:
Came here on a Friday night, craving some greasy, meaty goodness.  patience, my friends, is the key.  parking in the area = a nightmare. to get a seat, even at the bar, you have stay alert & be ready to poach a spot.

I decided to make my own burger, with a reg beef patty, gruyere cheese (my all time fav), herb mayo, mustard & all the veggies.  The meat was juicy, had lots of flavor, and their pickles were awesome! pretty sure they make em in house...  i wanted to give 4 stars but their portion on fries is SO small! for $3 i was expecting to get more than a handful... the milkshakes are really good, too, but also a rip!
author: Jen D.

description: The best veggie burgers in town!  Great atmosphere, great service & great food!  They have they own kombucha as well!
author: Randy W.

description:
Don't go here - because the line is already too long as it is!  

This is the BEST burger I have ever had.  I love that they use grass fed beef, free-range turkey and natural bison.  I got the Beef French & Fries burger - I will dream about this burger.  The others in my group got the Beef Pacific Blue, Elk BBQ & Elk Heritage burgers.  We got an order of regular fries (perfectly fine) and an order of Sweet Potato Fries with Truffle Parmesan topping - amazing!     

I will be thinking of how to get back to Roam Burger as soon as possible.
author: Colleen L.

description:
Likes: delicious juicy burger with bison patty and tejano style (jalapeño relish, avocados, white corn chips, tomatoes, herb ranch, etc). Fry-fecta's sweet potato fries were good

Dislikes: may have to wait for an open table
author: Karen M.

description:
If you're a vegetarian, avoid this restaurant!!!

Yes, it seems convenient enough for a restaurant to offer anything on their menu as a vegetarian option, as you just order any kind of burger and ask for their fresh and organic veggie patty. The place was PACKED for a Wednesday night. It was cramped, dimly lit, and crowded -- a hipster's dream come true. I hate when restaurants have that feel. The menu is plastered on the wall as you walk in, but there were people in line covering a few of the options. On a whim, I chose the "Sunny Side Up" burger with a veggie patty. After about a 20 minute wait, I received my meal. And the taste.... YUUUUUCCK!!! 

While I appreciate a restaurant that offers a freshly made veggie patty as opposed to a Boca or Garden Burger, if their interpretation of a veggie patty is awful, I'd just rather have the aforementioned frozen options because their freshly made patty was a disgusting disaster. I've personally made veggie patties. They are not hard to execute well. At first I didn't even think it existed! It was way too wet and soggy and mushy to even be considered a "patty" - more like a mushy spread. In turn, this made the bun super soggy and wet as well. One thing I didn't notice while ordering was this particular menu item offered sweet chili sauce as a condiment. Really!!! Sweet chili sauce on a burger?!?! Mixed in with tomatoes and cheese left an utterly disgusting flavor in my mouth.

If you want to be a pretentious artisan burger joint, you're not going to win people (or me) over by just randomly tossing ingredients into a burger and calling it gourmet.

This was by far the worst veggie burger I've ever had. Period. Absolutely disgusting. Denny's... I kid you not... Denny's offers a better veggie burger.

So to close with how I started, IF YOU'RE A VEGETARIAN, AVOID THIS RESTAURANT!!!
author: Jared O.

description:
I would give 3 stars for a decent burger, fast service and friendly staff.... But their were problems.

I came in on a cold day. Yelp reviews looked good, I was cold and hungry and ready to eat. I ordered a blue cheese burger, fries (extra$) and a Scrimshaw Pilsner. Total bill $18 and change + tip.  Not expensive but not cheap for a burger beer dinner.

I went deep into the restaurant away from the door to be warm.  Then I sat down on a freezing cold steel chair (all chairs and bar stools are metal without cushions.  

Ok, well I already paid and ordered and tipped, so I asked if the could please turn up the heater.  I noted that one barman was wearing a flannel shirt with a down vest while another was wearing a beanie hat and a hoodie.  Then the politely came over and informed me that the owner sees no reason for heat, therefore there is no heater to turn on!  The staff were cold and the kitchen staff were all bundled up in jackets! I guess the owner is not really a detail person.

Come here on a day when you are warm and you can handle sitting in a cool to cold atmosphere on cold metal chairs.

A good warm atmosphere would have brought me back.  But no.
author: Chris C.

description:
Roam is right in my hood and I am oh-so grateful for it. It's a pretty hard-knock life being a vegetarian and trying to find a decent veggie patty anywhere. Roam offers an exceptionally delicious house-made version that can be substituted right into almost any of their epic burger creations (there's only one burger that comes with meat- bacon).

My favorites are the Tejano, the Chalet (mushrooms+cheese. classic.) and the French and Fries (no need to order a side of fries with this baby). When I'm there with at least one other person, the Fry-Fecta is a must order. Potatoes, sweet potatoes, and deep fried stuff. Whoever said vegetarians had to be healthy?

Milkshakes here are delicious as well. I always find the normal size to be too much (so heavy) but here's a cheat for you: ORDER THE KID'S SIZE. It's small but perfect if you just want a taste.
author: Amanda C.

description:
This is my new fave burger place.  

Compared to Super Duper & Umami, both of which I love, this is how they compare:

Roam:  Better overall selection.  4 different kinds of meat, a variety of fried goodies and shake flavors.  Local & Organic.  Lots of great beers.  Classic hearty burger, not greasy, fresh crisp veggies.  Chopped onions like in a McDonald's burger (which I stopped eating but still slightly miss).

Super Duper is great if you want a smaller cheap meal.  I usually get the mini and it is the perfect size for someone like me.  Umami is good if you are in a sweet savory mood.  The bun at Umami is slightly sweet and too soft.  The bun at Super Duper is crispy and light.  The bun at Roam is substantial and just the right density.

I had the bison burger (classic style) with whole wheat bun and white cheddar.  My friend had the same but with beef.  We shared an order of sweet potato fries - I wish they cut these thicker -  dipped in their organic ketchup.  Total was about $25. 

For a healthier dessert option, have froyo at Fraiche across the street.  :)
author: Josie M.

description:
Apparently they make their own soda. 

That's pretty cool, I also make my own cola. That's another story, however.

The pineapple soda tasted like canned pineapples, though, maybe a little bit more caramelization or even grilling it would give it a nice compliment?

I rather liked the prickley pear, however, with a nice rich acid to cut through the sweetness, without the overly syrupy feel.

Ginger lime could stand to be a little punchier. I like my ginger to kick me in the mouth and hold me hostage. If I'm having a nice meaty burger, I need that ginger-y lime-y taste to obliterate my palate and refresh my taste buds!

The zucchini-onion haystack seemed the only thing noteworthy out of the fry-fecta, but who cares, you're going to shove all three in your burger anyway, like all of my heathen friends and I. 

Service is a bit slow, but adequate when noticed.
author: Ben T.

description: Heritage burger...I love you.  Your caramelized onion goodness, your juicy beef patty, thick bacon and bun that doesn't get soggy too soon.  The fries, awesome.  Nice employees and reasonable prices which is SO rare!  We'll be back for sure!
author: A. S.

description: Delicious, affordable, 100% grass-fed burger. Great topping combos or make-your-own. Can also get turkey, bison, or house-made veggie burger. Delicious kombucha on tap or artisan sodas. Quick service, friendly staff, good vibes. Salads, shakes, outdoor seating, beers on tap too I think, didn't get fries his time but they looked good.
author: Bertha O.

description:
Burgers are the best in SF and the farmer's market salad is the best salad on Fillmore. 

And, a huge huge thank you to the folks on Fillmore who made me a second burger trio when my skewer fell on the ground tonight -- free of charge and without a second thought.

If you're the manager, the folks on staff tonight were awesome tonight and treated people right even when they were at their busiest. Thanks for bringing your burgers to my neighborhood and being all-around amazing!
author: Elaine W.

description:
I would give six stars if I could. I deal with major food issues - I can't eat nightshades, gluten or dairy. This has made eating out, especially burgers, a serious challenge and unpleasantly embarrassing at best. 

Then I found Roam. They have amazing gluten free bread, grass-fed beef, tons of fresh toppings, sweet potato fries AND kombucha. When I asked for my burger rare it actually was served rare (finally!) To top it all off the meal was off the charts amazingly delicious!!!

So thank you Roam for giving me back the ability to go out for burgers. I could just kiss you.
author: Kara S.

description:
Veggie burger lovers rejoice-this burger makes a delicious, although purple hued, veggie patty. It tastes amazing! 
I was skeptical at first to try since so many places offer limited choices for vegetarians, but after my coworker kept raving about it, I decided to give it a go. 
It is expensive (9$ for a burger) however, you are in Pac Heights which is an expensive neighborhood. 
I got the French and Fries veggie burger and it was amazing! The patty was cooked just right and the caramelized onions really hit the spot. Of course, putting french fries on a burger makes it even better. 
If you aren't on a budget, go to Roam's.
author: Vince D.

description: You would think that some place this expensive would be 100% customer focused. On a cold rainy Saturday with few customers, everyone at Roam is bundled up inside the cold interior made frigid by the open front door that the staff refused to close for the obviously freezing clientele. All they could say is that it is the owner'a policy. Not cool.
author: Christopher D.

description:
I've eaten at this place many times as I am a neighbor. This is the story of the last time  I ever go there. Around 2:30pm, on a sunday, I ordered through their online service for pick up. 

I ordered 2 burgers with pink meat and one burger without.  As soon as I looked at the burger, I was pretty shocked. The meat was completely uncooked. Upon closer inspection, the meat looked like it was on for maybe only a couple seconds. It was brown on both sides, but tartare throughout. I know I checked the option for pink, but this was ridiculous. 

Naturally we called and the lady on the phone argued with us about how pink or not pink it was. Clearly very unprofessional attitudes all around, as I was the one holding the damn meat. They finally offered to redo our two burgers, but when we got there we were not met with apologies or other components of service. Instead a bag was shoved in our faces, without a word from the counter lady. 

Don't spend your money on this place. You'll only get bad service.
author: Michael C.

description:
Best all around burger in SF. Great ingredients, delicious, good price.

I've been there a ton of times. I was there today. I love their hot sauce and asked if I could buy a bottle. They gave me one for free. Customer for life.
author: Max C.

description:
Roam rocks. I've eaten there twice. The first time I was by myself and they made me feel really welcome. The second time I was with a friend but the staff was just as helpful and warm.

I had the veggie burger both times, with different toppings. It was delish. The side of veggies were way too oily though (sweet potato and kale the first time, asparagus on the second visit). The hazelnut chocolate milkshake was amazing. Get one. Seriously.

Roam would get five stars except for the oily veggies... and they're always packed. (Good for them, not for people trying to find a table.) I'll be back though!
author: Jenny V.

description: For 12 bucks you get a tiny burger loaded with stuff. My stuff consisted of fries and avocado. The beef here is lean and therefore bland. It's also cooked to Medium so it was also dry. The parmesan and truffle fries lacked parmesan and truffle flavor. It also lacked crunch. So everything was mushy and bland. The service was good and so was the decor. These are the things you expect from a corporate chain. Sadly, SF is filling up with places that look nice but serve food that's blah. It's attempting to be gourmet, but ends up being nothing special. I would gladly sacrifice creative toppings for a really great beef burger. The search continues.
author: William B.

description:
I was on a hunt for the best burger in San Francisco for about 2 months. I went to a number of different burger joints all over the city and tried many different burgers.

Roam Artisan Burger was the clear winner at the end. 

The meat was Juicy and cooked to perfection. 
The toppings were all fresh and crisp. I liked the variety of options to add to the burgers. The cheese was delicious. 
The house sauce is what pulls it all together. 
I scarfed it down within minutes and licked my fingers clean. It was really that good. 
Best of all, It didn't leave a pool of grease on my napkins like other burgers I've tried. 
I left the restaurant feeling very satisfied but not heavy in my stomach. 
Their burger is reasonably priced and worth every penny.
The staff was friendly, the ambiance was relaxed and everything was clean.

This is officially my new favorite burger joint! A+ from me!
author: Daisy F.

description:
I'll start off by breaking this review in two parts Food and Service.  The food was good  on the that front they are 4 stars.  

The service was another story which I would rate at a -1 star if I could.  I called to order ahead and they told me 15 minutes.  When we got there we waited for another 30 minutes for our food because they forgot about it and the whole time seem put off by our asking where our food was.  The service staff seemed to think it wasn't their problem and I should be grateful they are even making my burger.

I'll be going to Super Duper instead.
author: John C.

description: Tried Roam this past weekend. Really enjoyed the free range turkey burger with the Chalet (swiss, cremini mushrooms, watercress, house sauce and tomatoes). Really liked the bun. The burger had really fresh ingredients and I definitely wanted more after trying half of burger. We also got butternut squash that was roasted with kale and a pesto which was delicious! The mini shake size for their Strauss Creamery shakes look very cute and yummy. Will definitely want to come back and try their other burgers.
author: Ellin C.

description: Ordered the heritage and tejano burger. Both burgers were very tasty. A great combo of flavored. We also ordered the fry fekta which had sweet potato fries regular fries and the zucchini fries. I would return again . One of the best burgers.
author: Masha G.

description:
I a burger crass extremist. Give me a $5 greasy-spoon burger served on a dirty plate by a beehive-haired, fake fingernailed ex-lot lizard or give me a ground lamb and grass-fed bison burger with melted bone marrow and duck-fat fries for $30, because in between the two there's nothing much other than disappointment, which Roam does perfectly.

There are several places in the city that have extraordinary burgers, but Roam is not one of them. Think upscale In-N-Out (with just as many kids and thrice as many strollers blocking access to tables) and you've got Roam, only the burgers aren't quite as good.
author: Nobody M.

description:
Deeeelicious burgers! Came on a saturday afternoon n it was a bit crowded but after getting through the line the food didnt take long to come out.

Ordered the bbq burger n it was perfectly juicy and big! My friend got the veggie patty n it was like nothing i've ever seen- kinda reddish in color perhaps beets and looked like it had quinoa in it? Nevertheless my friend said it was great!

The fryfecta- yum! Russet, sweet potato, and onion/zucchini. Between the burgers and fries we were stuffed n couldnt even finish the fries. 

Pretty pricey tho: $8.25 for a burger and another $5-6 for the fryfecta. Great food and a pleasant environment. Also some good beers on tap.
author: Siobhan T.

description: Got a grass fed beef burger Heritage style (Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo).  It was good but not amazing.  Not sure exactly why you would spend that much more money on getting grass fed beef if you plan to cover up the beef flavor with tons of toppings.  The fry-fecta was good as well, but really only the sweet potato fries were worth getting.  The zucchini onion haystack was actually just annoying to eat-too small eat with your hands, but difficult to eat with a fork).  Overall the meal was good but nothing special.
author: Paul W.

description:
Yes - great burgers, but what about the beer?

Roam earns a top rating for using it's 3 taps to serve outstanding beer that's a step above the standard.  Stone Brewing's IPA is recommended with any burger!  The second two taps are friendly offerings - but if you told me that they were serving an amber and a belgian wheat -- i wouldn't have guessed  Anderson Valley's Boont Amber and Allagash White from Maine!

Have a burger.  Drink the beer.
author: Mark S.

description: Delicious food! Friendly service! Fun atmosphere. A great laid back neighborhood spot.
author: S Q.

description: Delicious burgers and amazing sweet potato fries. Beware, the salad is HUGE and you won't be able to finish it but it is fresh and flavorful. The burgers all come Medium unless you specify as to what temperature you prefer. Its a casual environment where you grab a number and the food comes to your table however it can still be a great date spot or a place where you can catch up with friends.
author: B T.

description:
I don't know what annoys me more, when a spot can't get medium rare right or a burger is overly greasy or overly dry.  

I've had two burgers here, both cooked perfectly medium rare.  Both juicy, but not greasy. Totally delicious burgers.
author: Click C.

description: I stopped in with a few of my coworkers, who all ordered some type of burger or french fry hash. I only ordered the Passion Fruit Shake - but man! Just THAT got me hooked. The 5th star is TBD by my burger experience in the near future :)
author: Mel B.

description:
Went here twice on our six day vacay in SF.  The burgers are as good as they can be.  Had bison both times.  One was Sunny Side and the other was Heritage.  AMAZING!!!  Fries are insane and one night we split the Nutella shake.  HEAVEN!  The fresh made sodas are great, too!  

Best Burger Place on Planet EARTH!!
author: Angie T.

description:
The first time I came I had the Tejano Burger and it was excellent (4 stars).

The second time I tried the French and Fries with Truffle Parmesan, Fries, Avocado, Gruyere and Dijon but it was insanely salty and not appealing (2 stars). I should have sent it back but I was starving. I would not recommend that one so try something else. 

The onion strings and fries were good but average. I didn't try the Truffle Parmesan Fries. 

Also this place is crazy expensive at $10 (tax included) for a 5 Oz Burger. The meat is high quality but still the value is low. 

I prefer the Traditional Burgers with quality ingredients at Barney's. It's a huge burger for the same price with a mountain of thick bacon and ripe avocado (or whatever your preference).
author: Mike L.

description:
As they say, you get what you pay for. I know folks who would complain about a $10 burger (here it's $8.50), and I would likely be one of them, but I'm also a person who likes quality ingredients that are well prepared and not totally processed. I got the "sunny side" which has a fried egg on top. The burger was excellently prepared and very delicious. I also got the "fry-fecta" which is a combo of the three types of fries (including "zucchini onion haystack") which were very good. Several choices of meats, including turkey and bison, but I stuck with the traditional "beef".

Overall a very good experience and nice to know this is in the neighborhood in case I want to grab a quick bite before a show at the Fillmore or Kabuki. The only downside is the place can get mobbed and the second time I tried to order there I didn't because the line was so long.
author: David H.

description: I have had the food before. I love the Tejano, so I tried to get one.  My girlfriend ordered while I held the table. After the second mistake burger being delivered I decided to get my money back. They tried to blame my girlfriend for the mistake. When we were delivered four different burgers.
author: Parker J.

description: Some of the best burgers we've had, yep! Gluten-free buns are available and actually tasty. The fry-fecta was a real treat. It was all gluten-free as well and the truffle Parmesan on the russet fries and the chipotle maple on the sweet potato fires was outta dis fricken world! Just, OMG! Yummmmmmmm! We'll be back for sure!
author: Holly L.

description:
I had a life-changing experience when I ate here. The burgers are THAT good.

I had the Tejano burger and shared a platter of fries with my bf. I chose the Tejano because it includes avocado, which I love. The burger was neatly crafted and presented half-wrapped. It really tasted perfect. The beef seemed of good quality. I think I was supposed to taste some jalapeno sauce, but I didn't. It was delicious nonetheless.

The fries were also good, especially the sweet potato. The regular fries weren't that memorable.

I'm definitely coming back here if I'm in the mood for a solid burger.
author: Kristina N.

description:
Definitely a good burger, and too many types to try! I prefer the sweet potato fries over the regular french fries. 

This is definitely a return to place as so many other menu items were enticing. The meat options - bison and ostrich (if my memory serves me right). The salads also looked worthy. Plus there's a few beers on tap. I'll be back.
author: Leona Z.

description:
Roam was awesome. We got two burgers and fries:

The French and Fries Beef burger (Truffle Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard) was delicious. We opted to skip the french fries on the burger, seeming a bit excessive with the three types of french fries in the Fry Fecta (three types of fries: truffle, sweet potato, zucchini). The burger was juicy and flavorful, just as it should be. The bun was solid - not the best bun ever, but it held its own. The three types of fries were all awesome as well, and great to be able to switch between them. 

Second, we got the Chalet Veggie burger (Swiss, Cremini Mushrooms, Watercress, Tomato, House Sauce). Probably the best veggie burger we've had. It is made from beet, portobello mushroom, and quinoa; it was also juicy and flavorful, which is not always a given with a veggie burger. Even if you aren't a vegetarian, the veggie burger is highly recommended - maybe even more so than the beef burger.

We were able to walk right in at 7pm on a weeknight, order for takeout, and leave within 15 minutes. The inside of the Fillmore St. location is nothing special but takeout ended up being a sweet deal.
author: Alden Q.

description: Their Tahitian Vanilla Bean with marshmallow brullé Milk Shake is like making out with Ryan Gosling in Tahiti in a bed of marshmallows while he nibbles your ears and whispers seductively: "hey girl, this has zero calories..."
author: Melanie D.

description:
My to go Brunch Sunday Burger~

Not a place filled with too much tourist or hype. Thank god about that. 

They serve you quick, efficient, and line is never that long. Burger's good, Fries good, drinks good. What more do you need?
author: Cavin T.

description:
Really nice little joint, I liked the design and look of the place, seemed very clean and hip. After order at the counter, we managed to grab a table outside on the street, which was awesome because it waaaay noisy and kind of crowded inside (and luckily it was a very and unusually warm San Francisco evening). 

I got the classic burger with bison meet and gruyere cheese, along with the russet fries. I thought it was fantastic, the bun was perfectly toasted, meet cooked very juicy and tender, nothing felt dry or tough. Fries were very good too. I finished the milkshake off another form our group, they thought it was too sweet, but I liked it anyways. Somebody else ordered the Fry-Fecta I guess its called? The zucchini strings were ok, I guess it was fun to try.

The area is pretty nice, service was good, and the food was great. Its popular on a weekend evening. Definitely recommend.
author: David B.

description: Really tasty burgers, and my local joint.  A bit on the pricier side for a burger
author: Alden S.

description:
Food Craving:  Italian, Mexican, Chinese?  No! American...

We were starving after a long day of appointments.  After we passed by Roam Artisan Burger's, we decided to make a quick U-turn and stick with Burgers for lunch. We got lucky with close street parking.

As we walked in, the first thing one notices is the tree bark table / bar area.  The menu was nicely posted on the right -- easy to read and understand.  There was a wonderful variety of burgers to choose from (as well as salads) and everything looked so appealing.  After placing our orders, we received the burgers in 10 minutes.

I ordered the French & Fries burger. My burger was tender and juicy. It was almost perfect. My patty lacked a tad bit of seasoning but the availability of the sauces (ranch, honey mustard,...), perfected the ingredients. I love the concept of fries INSIDE my burger.  The burger was pretty thick, resulting me in using utensils, and yet somewhat messy. But, I DID scarf down every bite. Defiantly the best burger I've had. We also ordered a side of Fry-Fecta. It was the perfect combination of regular fries, sweet potatoe fries, and onion fries.  VERY delicious and the highlight of this establishment  - and I didn't even need ranch as my side topping. 

I also ordered a strawberry shake. The shake was really thick, just the way I like it! Very fulfilling. A 16 oz shake can easily take care of 2 people. The shake came out after our burgers, a little late, but not complaining. It is hand-made and made with real fresh strawberries. One of the best strawberry shakes that I have ever tasted! 

I would definitely recommend Roam Burgers. On my next stop here, I'll be trying the Sunnyside (with Fries!).
author: Aman G.

description: I adore Roam.  The burgers are always perfect.  I have never had a bad experience here.  The market salad is delicious and great if you are needing something lighter.  I eat at both locations fairly regularly and just wish one would go in closer to my home. (Come on over to the Inner Sunset!)
author: Christy L.

description:
As I've been on a "fancy burger" bender I can compare it to some of the other shops I've been to (Umami, Counter, Habit--not really fancy but the taste level makes it fancy IMO, etc.). I was not utterly won over by the burger. I thought the portion sizes were a bit big and a little sloppy (not in a good way). The beef and elk burger meats were very good and I liked the combo I had with the egg the most (I think it was the Heritage). However, I don't feel it has the complexity and balance of flavors like a Habit burger with bacon and swiss, for example, or the normal Umami burger at Umami burger (though I wish Umami burger had bigger portions...). 

If anything, I'd compare this place with the Counter except with better quality meat. I'd only eat here if I lived nearby.
author: Tina M.

description: Almost 5 stars had my sunny side up burger had the egg cooked right! Otherwise fantastic. Blue Bottle shake is the best thing ever.
author: Emily M.

description:
Have you ever ate a burger that was so good that you literally started to get sad as it was ending?

Yeah. That's how I felt while eating the Tejano burger. This place is pretty cool and stands out in an already cool area. My friend took us because it's a good burger that's under $10...something he has never seen in SF before.

Roam delivers! I don't know how many times I can say that the Tejano burger was the best burger I've ever had, but...just to clarify...I really like the Tejano burger. (I got regular beef.)
author: Gregg H.

description:
I'm not sure what the big deal about this place is.  It's OK, I would not complain if one of my friends wanted to grab burgers here, but I certainly wouldn't personally promote it or go there by myself (after having gone twice).

The burgers are fine.  It's pretty cool that you can get different meats (e.g. elk and bison), though they're a little pricy relative to beef.  But I have bought these meats at the store for making my burgers at home, and they ARE expensive, so it's probably a legit mark-up.

I absolutely do not, DO NOT, recommend the Zucchini Onion Haystack.  It is a pile of grease.  I have no qualms about eating unhealthy things, but this was beyond unhealthy, it really was a pile of grease and breading with some mush in it.  I actually threw 80% of it away.

Overall, if I lived near here, I'd probably go every month or two... just like I do for my local burger place.  But since I live in the Castro, I wouldn't drive up here just to go.
author: Jon E.

description:
LIFE. CHANGING. BURGERS!

Seriously... Have you ever had a burger before...?  NO, No you haven't because you haven't had a Roam Burger!!!

I dare thee to challenge their flavor combos.  Please get the Tejano.  Your welcome in advance.

Oh, get a house sauce and pickles on the side.  You're welcome again.

My dad's quote (who is old I might add) "probably the best burger I've ever had".  
My best friend's quote (separate occasion) "probably the best burger I've ever had... I can't think of a better one, but I'm leaving the probably in there just in case"
My friend Jessica (a true foodie indeed), the second she took a bite she goes "OMG... OMG.  This is soo good".
They all had the Tejano.

I've taken more than 50 people here (I live and go to school close ok...), and not one of them was not thoroughly impressed by their burger (not always the Tejano).  

They have many burgs, I've tried them all, and in different combos.  The heritage is a good standard burger if you're afraid to let your taste buds run completely wild.  The sunny side is pretty amazeee.  Ummmm I'm too ADHD to keep typing and you're probably done reading this anyway.  But if you are still reading then you get an extra-special second life-altering gem from this location.  THEIR SHAKES ARE THE BOOOMMMBBB!!! Specifically anyone that they make there...   but more specifically get the Hazelnut Chocolate Shake.  It is the best shake you are about to have.  Close your eyes, enjoy.  It's basically nutella, but again... life-changing.

Happy Roamin'

PS The animals are all fed grass before you eat them so that makes them more delicious... not sure why.  :)
author: Jesse M.

description:
The burger was decent, but the wait and trying to find a table wasn't. Your system sucks, unfortunately and you guys should really do something about it. We were in line on a busy night and I saw a table open up. I thought that it may be etiquette to allow the two that were in front of us to grab the table, since they ordered first - right?? WRONG! While we were polite and didn't snake the table from them, as soon as we ordered, there were no tables left. So we stood around watching group by group order their meals. 

All of a sudden, I was on a battle field and an empty table would be my safe haven. People were splitting up their groups so that they could try and snag the first available table! So, after having several people who ordered AFTER us, get tables before us, we learned our lesson in being the "nice guys." We were given our drinks while we were standing and waiting (which was our choice to have them instead of wait until we finally beat someone out for a seat), but holding my purse, our number sign, my drink and the water I poured waiting for my drink, sure made for an awkward time. 

Get a rope, put up a sign and have people wait in line for a table. I think that's the right thing to do in a place like this. I'm just glad that I wasn't starving when I arrived because I would've beaten asses of those who cut us off and took tableS before us when we were there LONG before them.
author: Noneya B.

description: The sunny side burger here is delicious. The beef, cooked medium rare, is perfect. This place has it where it counts.
author: Vlad T.

description:
This place is legit! Aside from the fact that a complete meal of burger, fries, and a drink will cost you as much as a price of a decent meal (approx. $15), they know how to make good hamburgers.

Pros:
- Juicy burgers
- Fresh vegetables
- Fry-fecta (sweet potato, regular fries, and fried zucchini)
- Mexican coke (they don't sell the original one, but their coke uses sugar cane instead of high-fructose corn syrup)
- Outdoor seating

Cons:
- lack of parking
- lack of seating
- Pricey for a burger joint
author: JD K.

description: I gambled with the Autumn Burger but it definitely paid off! Pumpkin and carmelized onions lend a mild sweetness that is well balanced with the salty burger and bacon. My husband had the French and Fries which was also amazing but a little saltier than mine. Perfect little spot for a date night or to grab a burger and beer with friends! Highly recommend
author: Marina M.

description: Good burger. Super juicy. Perfectly cooked. Good price. Great little strolling location.That is all.
author: R C.

description:
Really great juicy burger with many customizable options that aren't too weird. I got a bison burger with BBQ sauce and bacon with a side if truffle Parmesan sweet potato fires. The boyfriend got burger with truffle fries on them. They have a great selection of homemade and non-mainstream soda. It can be a hassle to find a table when they are busy but the atmosphere is great. It was noisy but could still carry on a conversation. The staff was very friendly. 

We had a issue where they forgot out food and I had to go ask about it after 30 minutes. Things happen. But they went out of their way to apologize. Gave us a gift card for our next visit and new drinks. Way more than I would have expected for a relatively minor thing. They are overly dedicated to making you happy which means a lot to me.  Makes me wonder what they would do if something actually bad happened. 

Great for small groups. Love that they have wine and beer. Would definitely go again.
author: Pierre C.

description:
Whoa. This place is awesome. 

We ordered the Tejano and Sunny Side burgers, a fri-fecta (combo of sweet potato fries, regular fries and fried zucchini strings), and a chocolate shake to really round out the calorie intake. I have no regrets.

The ingredients are as fresh as they get -- whole chunks of buttery avocado, farm-fresh egg, deliciously grilled beef. not to mention, prices are reasonable.

Now my biggest problem is figuring out the next time I can justify gorging here. Because gorge we did!
author: Amanda E.

description:
This place is clean, well appointed, friendly good mix of crowd.  I LOVED my salad (yes I got a salad at burger place but that's because I'm eating salads for lunch this month) and I got beef slider trio...so good with my salad.  

So I went with a coworker, she got the seasonal veggies which just happen to be brussel sprouts (yuK) and she got the turkey mini burger trio AND a lemonade soda.  I WAS going to get the BBQ burger (Aged white cheddar, BBQ sauce, Caramelized Onions, Jalapeno Relish, Oil and vinegar slaw) but ...I went with the Farmers Market Salad and a mini burger trio minZ was beef baby! and I got the blood orange soda. 

The brussel sprouts, I took a forkful at the insistence of my co-worker SCREAMIN' very very tasty not brussely sprouty at ALL.  

My salad was so good, there were so many things in it, like pomegrante and lots of other things so nice and fresh and so good.  I loved it. Smackeroo.  Loved it. 

The vibe in there is just right and so clean and fresh.  Looking forward to going back and getting my burger on.  

I like the way they have it so you can actually design your own burger, bun and toppings too.  Noticed that there are some regulars who have the ordering process down pat, they know what they want, I aspire to that.  

As luck would have it that day, two other co-workers were looking for a burger place and I sent them right over to Roam, they are still talking about it and they both had the BBQ burger.   I shoulda got that one ...next time I will. 

Oh and they don't have coffee, not a criticism just note in case you are looking for a cuppa (as I was that day we went) no problem though I got one somewhere else. 

Love the place, going back hope to see YOU there! Two thumbs up and tic-tac.
author: BellaLissa B.

description: Absolutely delicious burgers!  Must have on every trip to San Francisco...in fact I may need to make my way up for a visit.
author: Zachary Z.

description: Really good burgers and I love that they have yummy gluten free buns and fries.  Only downside was that the kids milkshake is over $4 and the regular was around $5 but you get twice as much in the regular vs. the kids.  I would definitely recommend getting the regular size and share.
author: Nadia C.

description:
Great veggie burgers. I know, I know, you're supposed to have a "real" burger at a burger joint. The patty was flavorful and juicy. 

All items are inexpensive, making Roam a great choice for a casual dinner.
author: Lee H.

description:
After starting my blog, my good friend Mischa was  going on about Roam Artisan Burgers. Last night, he treated me to dinner there. Business was booming, and the line was out the front door, but it didn't take long for it to move along.

Roam's menu consists of many different kinds of burgers. The first thing you need to decide is whether you want beef, turkey, bison, veggie, or their special (last night it was elk). Then, you choose from one of eight styles. Classic, French and Fries, Tejano, Sunny Side, Heritage, Chalet, Pacific Blue, and BBQ. Classic costs $6, but $7 with cheese. The others are $8. They also have a variety of fries including Russet, Sweet Potato, and Zucchini Onion.

A meal with a Classic-style burger, fries, and a drink comes to around $13.

Once you order at the counter, you'll receive a number and they'll bring it to your table when it's ready. It was really busy last night, so it took roughly 20 minutes for our food to arrive. Burgers were on plates and fries were in a metal basket.

I took one bite and was in love. Died and went to Burger Heaven. The white corn strips on my burger added a great crunchy texture. The ranch sauce was yummy and the pepper jack with jalepeño relish added a nice kick.

The thing I was most surprised about was that the burger stayed completely intact the whole time. It first seemed a little messy, but it was easy to eat. Mischa's had fries on the burger. Next time I'm going to have to try that. The fries were super tasty and had just the right consistency. They were perfect. Also: sesame seeds on both buns!

Roam was super awesome, and can't wait to go here again. Be sure to get yourself a Dagoba Chocolate Shake. It's great to have while you wait for your food.
author: Louie M.

description: SO GOOD! Stopped by Roam for lunch and ordered the Tejano with beef and loved ever bit of it. The Tejano is topped with pepper jack cheese, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, jalapeno relish and herb ranch. All of the toppings were fresh and the beef patty was cooked well. This place was not too packed for lunch on a Monday - I'm guessing it gets more busy in the evening. I will definitely be back to try some of the other burgers on their menu. If you're ever in Lower Pac Heights and craving a good burger, I definitely recommend stopping by Roam.
author: Nikitha R.

description: We were in a rush to grab a quick bite to eat, and since we're gluten free it can always be a bit of an ordeal finding something tasty when under a time crunch.  When we got here there was a line up which didn't bode well, but the line went very quickly and we managed to snag a couple of stools at the bar.  We placed out order and in less than 10 minutes were sinking our teeth into delicious bison burgers.  We were pleasantly surprised with the taste and quality of the food, will definitely go back here when we're in the area.
author: Geoff W.

description:
Call me crazy, but I'm not really a huge fan of burgers. I feel like everyone thinks they can make a good one and I've had all kinds my entire life. Everyone likes burgers so I kept trying them because I liked them, but never loved them. I have never been blown away by a burger before, that is until I tried Umami Burger and Roam Burger.

When I tried Roam Burger I thought, oh my god, this is why people love burgers. The different burger recipes are genius with truly unique ingredients. Even the fries have an abundance of flavor. On top of that, the presentation of all the dishes are elegantly rustic. 

The atmosphere is also very clean, modern and stylish. The servers are in the know and very professional. Just all around fantastic.

Four stars because I've only been there once and I need to know if this experience will be consistent. Pretty sure it will be.
author: Dexter H.

description:
Roam is always pretty busy, but we've never had a problem finding a spot to sit.  

Like the many options on the protein sources and GF option for the burgers as well as the kid options.  The sodas of the day are always yummy.  Can't go wrong with the fry fecta.  

Not really a great place for groups or kids with the noise level and tight quarters, but fine for a burger hit with a friend.  And while I like the burgers  (I've tried the bison, beer and turkey), they aren't phenomenal.   Safe, but not extraordinary.
author: Mimi L.

description:
These burgers are glorious.  They go beyond burgerness into a new realm of food artistry and juicy deliciousness.  Now I can't eat at my neighborhood Super Duper without wishing I'd jumped in the car and driven to Roam to order a Sunny Side.

Also, their Chipotle Maple Sweet Potato Fries are like french fry candy, and their homemade sodas are an unfairly delicious addition.
author: David M.

description:
The food is tasty. They can improve on the selection of sides. 
Great place to watch people.
Coffee and Hot Tea are not on the menu.
author: Diana R.

description: Meh! Over cooked burger, soggy bun with  grease and minimal flavor.  Wasted calories.  Good pickles though.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Really enjoyed my veggie burger and caramelized pineapple soda. I had the classic version, and it was excellent.

Prices are ok.
author: Jane D.

description: It's 4:15 on 1/16/15, and the creme puff bro cashier totally killed my vibe. I angrily ate my burger while staring him and the only reason I stayed was to get the taste of spite out of my mouth while this pre madonna ran his hands through hair and couldn't of cared less about my experience. I wish I could of ordered a side of customer service. Food is bomb though. That guy sucks.
author: George Z.

description:
12.22.12 || bookmarked 10.04.12

Sunny side turkey burger: organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, and sweet chili sauce.

It's a fork and knife kind of burger because of its sheer size.

$9.22 out the door.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Roam Burger...  Solid food.  The meat is salted heavily, and they cook the meat a little bit rare.  Not bloody or mooing, but next time, I would probably ask for the meat to be cooked medium.

Good pickles.  Good fries.

Lots of fancy toppings.  I'll try them next time.
author: Needles K.

description:
Great neighborhood burger spot.  I very much enjoyed my tejano burger.  The burger was cooked to my specification and not over-cooked like a lot of places tend to do.  Fresh ingredients.  Shared a side of french fries and seasonal vegetables which were both delicious.  Lots of options for customizing your burger and a small, but good, beer selection.

Noise level is such that you can have a decent conversation with someone.  Definitely a casual vibe and a place that I look forward to patronizing again.
author: Marcin M.

description:
Bison is absolutely exquisite! We shared the bison burger on sesame bread, Tejano style with Fry-fecta fries and were absolutely ecstatic. 

I never rave about burgers but this burger was not your average burger! Definitely a must eat if you are looking for a casual burger joint. 

Fries are also super delicious, not your typical grease soaked potatoes.
author: Naty P.

description: I LOVE their sunny side burger!!! It is soo juicy, very very delicious!!! It's the best burger I've had. And their shakes are very good too!! I always go here whenever I visit San Francisco.
author: Dianne P.

description:
Not a huge burger fan generally speaking, but had a chance to check this place out with my ex and was pleasantly surprised.

Kind of like a Barney's gone slightly, but not really, upscale.

I had the salad with trio burgers (more like a burger skewer) and it turned out reasonably well.  Portions seem huge here.  My salad was easily enough for two.  It was well seasoned and did not have too much dressing.  For $10, I felt that was a pretty good deal for the Fillmore.

It looks like they'll prepare different styles of burgers as well.  Kind of like In-N-Out that way.  They had elk and bison.  Looks like they'll even rotate (I heard Ostrich).

The space is a little on the tight side, but it seems to work.

Good crowd, if perhaps a little loud.

I think it's worth a shot if on a budget and on upper Fillmore looking for a bite.
author: Patrick K.

description:
I was skeptical of Roam at first. I thought perhaps dressing up a burger joint might be something akin to designer fashion. 

Then I took home the French and Fries burger, which to my disappointment (initially) did not include a side of fries but instead added a few (of the truffle variety) as an ingredient. Despite getting off on the wrong foot, I can objectively say the burger was delicious. My pescatarian girlfriend, who will occasionally dabble in omnivorous tastings, was equally impressed. 

I'm dinging them a star because they don't offer "meal deals" of any sort. I know this is common place for high-end burger joints, but it's a practice I'd like to encourage eateries such as Roam to adopt...especially when you are charging over $5 for a side of fries.
author: Adam S.

description: Gourmet burgers are on the rise, and although In-N-Out will always be a California staple, there's always room for artisan burgers in the SF restaurant scene. Roam Artisan Burgers fits perfectly in the Pac Heights neighborhood, boasting organic and local ingredients. They offer a number of signature burgers, as well as the option to customize your own. I had the Sunny-Side burger with a turkey patty, and was surprised at how moist the patty was, as opposed to the typically dry burger you get for any beef alternative. The fried egg added a little extra protein, and the white cheddar was extremely flavorful. Although the sweet chili sauce was slightly too sweet for me, the burger as a whole was one of the best burgers that I've had in awhile. The fry-fecta is also a good way to get a sampling of their three types of fries - sweet potato, regular, and zucchini and onion shoestring. Their fries aren't too greasy, and stay crispy throughout the meal. The shoestring fries are more unique, but they do end up feeling a little heavier because the you get more fried breading than zucchini or onion. They also have an extensive milkshake menu, and the meal was finished off perfectly with a Blue Bottle coffee milkshake. The distinct Blue Bottle taste brought local flavor, and had me slurping my straw at the end for more. Roam has definitely become my go-to spot for burgers in the city!
author: Ashley T.

description: OH MY GOSH! Best burger that has ever touched my tastebuds! 10/10 this place is amazing! Tried the pacific blue and it was to die for. Incredibly polite staff and super cool ambiance
author: Savanah M.

description: Ah Roam! Yum as always. I still can't get over this place. Veggie burgers are bomb! Regular burgers are so tasty and juicy! I crave the Parm Truffle fries when I'm not there! You have to go here with a significant other, because you have to order the Parm Truffle fries and the sweet potato fries...or just go hungry! YUM!
author: Natalia H.

description:
First time here and it was fucking delicious!

Had the sunny side up and that's what I'll continue to get. Toasted bun with meat and an egg. The coconut milk shake just hit the spot.
author: James N.

description: The beef burger didn't taste like fresh or good beef. It had a very bad taste. Am very disappointed. I've tasted much better.
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
Sunny Side Burger is the best. Runny egg and sweet chili sauce, what a great combo. 

I wonder if you can request to just have the zucchini fries? They are the best out of all of the fries that they offer.  

I haven't ordered a shake for myself, but I wouldn't mind the Blue Bottle Coffee shake. The seasonal shakes look good too.

The mood and atmosphere is very chill. They also have a TV if you want to watch a sports game and have a beer.
author: Leanne K.

description:
I recommend getting food to go here.  
The food is delicious, the house made soda is super yummy, and the ranch dressing for fries is out of this world.  They have gluten free buns, and offer a lettuce wrap for those folks not eating gluten or grains.  Food gets 5 out of 5 stars.
It seems to always be very crowded and loud, and the ordering system with the line and cashier are a bit annoying and clog up the entrance/exit, also this place seems to be a popular spot for people to bring kids, so that can quadruple the insanity and noise, hence the recommendation for taking food to go.  Ambience gets 3 out of 5 stars.
Finally, in my experience the cashiers here can be REALLY RUDE.  Last night my cashier literally did not say a single word to me except for when she handed me my credit card receipt and said, "Sign this."  And she rolled her eyes at me.  But, on the plus side the cluster-eff walk up cashier situation ensures you do not have a very long interaction, so that's a plus.
author: Erika P.

description: The brussel sprouts are amazing!!! I really love this place. The bison burger chalet style is super juicy, probably one of the top 10 burgers I've ever had. They have great sweet potato fries, and they serve beer too!
author: Joanna S.

description:
There's nothing better than finding a great burger place...especially one with beer/wine and fabulous shakes. Bonus - they also have Blue Bottle coffee. Score!

Food is delicious, service is fast and friendly and prices are right. 

Highlights -
*Bison burger with Herb Mayo, Butter Lettuce, House-Made Pickles, Onion (all of their specialty burgers look awesome too)
*Brussel sprouts with chili flakes, lemon and Parmigiano Reggiano (AWESOME!)
*Zucchini Onion Haystack (Imagine fried onion strings, but better!)
*Salted Caramel milkshake (YUM!)

Other shake options that I want to try - 
Dagoba Chocolate
Blue Bottle Coffee
Tahitian Vanilla Bean
Coconut
Strawberry
Mint Chip

Overall...perfect for brunch, lunch or dinner. Highly recommend you give them a try...NOW!
author: Dru M.

description: Ate here with my lady for the first time. Had the Tejajo Burger and Russet Fries with truffle. Sooo good. Girl at the counter could have been a little more friendly and smiled more but the good food makes up for it.
author: Tony P.

description: Excellent every time. Love the elk. Pleasant staff. Thumbs UP.
author: Richardson M.

description: Wow. One of the best burgers I've had in my life! The mixed fries were also a hit, and we both enjoyed the milkshakes, though we both decided that while my passion fruit was good, her mint chip was notably better. Still, it was fairly spendy for a burger dinner, especially given how tightly packed the tables were - moving in and out was challenging.
author: Bill B.

description:
The burgers are pretty good.  The homemade pickles are a little bit too sweet for my tastes but this is made up by the fries.  The service is great and so is the location.

Four stars only because while I definitely would visit here if in the neighborhood, it is not the five star worth the trip sort of place that other places are.  A solid, safe bet for Pacific Heights.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
So delish! My faves are: truffle fries with parmesan cheese (to DIE for, it's so rich in truffle oil flavor and the herbs/parmesan cheese topping makes this perfect), sweet potato fries, heritage burger (comes with applewood smoked bacon *drool*) , and the sunny side (comes in this sweet/spicy spread - works well with the egg!) 

I like the open seating as well. It's casual and a great place to catch up with friends. 

Highly recommend this! I like this more than umami in the marina.
author: Keara C.

description: Excellent food.  Great service.   Fun atmosphere and prices was good.  I'll eat here again.
author: Jeff C.

description: Just came back after trying the French and Fries with the veggie patty. It was very good. The patty was "juicy" but not "fake-meaty". The flavors worked together while some of them stood out - the avocado, the truffle fries, the dijon mustard. The cheese and the watercress got lost in there though. I had a couple of small bites of the patty just by itself and it was nice - felt like it was made from beets. Texture was good - soft and moist, not a lot of chew, but just enough. Will be back!
author: Manjesh N.

description:
Family expansion.

Second location of Roam has opened on Fillmore. Already packed. Two possible reasons:

1. Ostrich burger is amazing.

Taste and texture of beef. Healthy like chicken and turkey. It's a few bucks extra but so worth it. One of the best burgers in recent memory. 

Best with house BBQ sauce and house pickles on a whole grain bun.

2. Roam isn't the only family expanding.

I've never seen so many pregnant customers in my life. Perhaps this kind of thing comes with a craving for ostrich.

Can't speak for having kids. But I can speak for having food. Enjoy the burger.
author: Jason B.

description:
Tejano Beef Burger with the works and a frosty root beer to wash it down.
Their ground patty of beef is really flavorful (beefy lol), and they definitely have the lean:fat ratio working on the juicy side. The burger gets your bunz wet fast, so dive in when you get your order.  The corn strips is a nice touch, and the jalapeno relish is a bit tame. For all of you Halloween freaks, they are serving up Pumpkin Spice Milkshakes. Worth a visit!
author: Derek N.

description:
I came here with my best friend the other day with such excitement and enthusiasm since she's never been to this place, only to be treated by both cashiers with disrespect.  The old guy behind the cash register (who's probably in his late thirties maybe even a manager) told me to "hurry up" even when I wasn't ordering from him. The blonde cashier who's probably in her late teens to early twenties didn't even greet me. Not even a smile. (Hey a smile is free and necessary when u work in the food and beverage industry!  I should know coz I work at one too). It's frustrating at times when u deal with different kinds of people but hey you either suck it up and deal with it or change Ur line of career. 

Anyways, I placed my order and specifically told the blonde girl that I want "gluten free bun" with my customized burger THREE times only to receive it with a SESAME bun!  I came back to show her that I asked for gluten free bread and then she responded with " Oh, did u asked for gluten free bread?" Even though I was already quite irritated with how I was treated by both of the cashiers attitude, plus messing up my order and not even apologizing for her error, I still managed to give her a friendly response and said "yes, I told you three times for gluten free bread". She took it back and said "ok. We'll fix it up for you". A few minutes later I received the burger but this time it didn't have the complete ingredients I asked for.  (I asked for butter lettuce and they didn't have it) so rather than asked for it again. I just ate it coz like I said I understand the food and beverage industry.  And to top it off, I tipped them too!! Sometimes I can understand why some people just won't tip because of the unacceptable treatment u get from this kind of service.  Shame shame shame...

Will I come back again? Probably not,  even though it's one of the few places I can eat at and they do have good food but because of the service they provided to me AND my best friend I'll have to look elsewhere. 

To the owner of this place, you might want to consider replacing some of the employees or managers in this place coz service here SUCKS!! There's this 80/20 principle that your staff should be aware of.
author: Chris Z.

description: Had the fry fecta and a regular turkey burger on a wheat bun. Wow, delicious. Their diet cola is like no other too. I usually like less trendy looking places, but this is a perfect hole in the wall right in the middle of Fillmore. Will most definitely be returning! :)
author: Crystal C.

description:
The burger's here are just as good as the Union Street location. Roam is officially a good chain restaurant.
I got the Tejano (Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch) Everything was just the way i wanted on it.
The fires were a bit off, maybe they sat out too long, I don't know. They were a bit too greasy.
My shake was lovely and the service was as good as I would expect from a burger joint.

WARNING: there were a lot of kids here and while they were behaving normally their parents were all neurotic on the verge of not being able to handle the person they spawned.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Let's give it a chance.  

The waitstaff here looks so enthusiastic!  And the room is spacious, and the menu tells you where all the meat and vegetables come from.  It's like Marin County in San Francisco.  Inside the cavernous space, just inside, by the open window, it's just like sitting outdoors without the sun in your eyes.  

I ordered a classic beef burger with cheddar on a sesame seed bun (yes, you get to specify the meat and the bread), with french fries and a Boylan diet cola.  Yes, frou-frou cola from New Jersey.  My Lady ordered the Heritage beef burger with bacon, and with lettuce instead of bread, sweet potato fries, with a sauvignon blanc.  Yes, she is more frou-frou than I.  The bill was $34.90 + tip.  

We sat in a window seat, hence my impression of sitting outdoors without the sun in my eyes.  The waiters were prompt with the food, but all comments had to be directed to the chefs in the back.  There was simple flatware and condiment bar which held glasses and water, sugar, salt. pepper. ketchup and mustard.  The burgers more than made up for it, though.  They were covered with pickles and sauce, so they were very juicy.  So juicy they threatened to breach their paper wrappers, yet somehow it all held together.  

I wouldn't say Roam is better than Gott's, but it reminds me of Gott's, and the location is more convenient.  I will definitely be back.
author: David D.

description: This place is sooo good. The bison burger is my favorite. The meat is always moist,cooked and seasoned well, the buns are delicious, fries are good, oh and straus milkshakes are amazing. I would recommend getting a reservation if they offer them? (Can't remember) but this place is always very busy. We usually call in our order. The only thing I wasn't fond of is the elk burger.
author: Milla K.

description:
This place has some really good burgers- definitely the best I've had in a long time.
I started with half of a double bison burger chalet-style. Bison was definitely gamier than beef and lamb, and seemed to be somewhat lean judging by the texture of the meat. I liked the mushrooms and the watercress but overall, the chalet-style needed a tad more flavor. They did, however, have a zesty hot sauce that was perfect with the burger. I then had half a double elk burger made sunny side-style. The sunny side egg was made to perfection and yolk ran down onto the party after the first bite. They also had carmelized onions and a sweet chili sauce to give it a bold flavor. I think I liked the bison meat more than elk, but that aside, sunny side is the way to go. 
The burger coupled with a side salad and an Allagash white came out to be $30. Oh and metered parking in that area is 4.25 an hour- no joke. Pricey meal but I was happy.
author: Alfred L.

description:
Roam's probably one of my favorite burger bars and as much as I liked the one in the Marina, this one is perhaps the exact same.

I tried the Bison burger this time in the Tejano flavor with Jalapeno Relish.  While the corn strips were interesting, it's too much and takes away from the flavor of the rest of the burger.  I should have gone with the option to leave it on the side, but overall, I enjoyed the meal.  

This plus beer was $19, so not bad, but not great.
author: Vincent K.

description:
This could have been a good burger except I ordered my burger medium rare and it came out med well. The meat wasn't seasoned either. So my burger was dry and bland. 

The salad was good with greens and persimmons and a variety of other ingredients.
author: ibby m.

description:
Very good veggie burger.  Might need to ask for extra condiments because they are light with those, but very good.  Lots of things to choose from!

Fries are pretty good.  

Beers, shakes, sodas, etc.
author: Suzie R.

description:
All my burger dreams come true in this joint. The burgers are very juicy, so don't dilly dally and get straight to business when your order comes. Otherwise you'll have to work through a tasty mess of soggy bun. 

Their milkshakes are pretty good too, but it's the toasted marshmallow on top that really makes them.
