The service was good one time, lame one time (forgot our drinks!). I'm willing to overlook that though since really, you're just placing the order and don't interact with the waitstaff much.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
First time tonight, coming straight after work and empty on a 5:30 on a Tuesday night, no wait, food came fast (the classic, the pacific blue burger/a caramelized pineapple soda, the french and fries burger), and it was YUMMYYYYYYY.

Get your bang for your buck, take me again and again and again!

Looking to go back to try their milkshake with a bruléed marshmallow for an extra $1!  Going to get my nom on that ish.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Stfu this place is affordable and delicious. Fillmore's best kept "secret" for sure.

My personal favorite is the French and Fries - $8.25. It has Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, and Dijon Mustard. It's freaking goshdarn amazing. I also recommend getting a side of fries (any type) w/ truffle oil.

For a quality burger in a clean location, this is the spot. This is the type of place I'd bring my friends for a weekday dinner. Nothing too fancy, nothing too ghetto. It's perfect and quaint for the neighborhood.
author: Paul B.

description: The burgers here are sooo good, and HUGE. Hard to finish a whole one to my self. Very flavorful and served in a nice establishment.
author: Michael M.

description:
They have wine on tap, seasonal milkshakes, and great interior. That's it. 


Just kidding. Their burgers have got it going on. If restaurants were buildings, Roam would be the Playboy Mansion. You can be a bit overwhelmed with the different combination of amazing ingredients, but you can't really go wrong with them. I loved the one with the tortilla chips in them though. I forget the name, but it's amazing. They also have Parmesan Truffle Fries, sweet potato fries, Bison meat, Veggie, and I think Ostrich meat. You can also build your own burger. The seasonal milkshake they had tasted like Ferrero Rocher in the finest liquid form.
author: Becca I.

description:
I've been here a couple times and I definitely recommend trying it out!  I was starving after work yesterday and a burger from Roam was just what I needed.  I had the Tejano burger with a beef patty, you also have the option for elk, bison, veggie, or turkey though.  I also had the russet fries with the truffle parmesan seasoning, which was fantastic.  I also had a blood orange soda, which was also really good.  They also have a variety of options for milkshakes, I really wanted to get one, but I was scared it would make me too full.  The special for the shake was chocolate hazlenut, which sounds really fantastic.

I wish I could go more often, it's pretty expensive though.  My meal yesterday was a little over $16.  Well worth going to once in a while though because you are definitely paying for great quality.
author: Annette E.

description:
I was blown away by their veggie burger!  Normally, I would have gone for the meat options since they are free-range and grass-fed, but I had to try their house veggie burger recipe. Now I think it may be one of my favorite veggie burgers by far. So glad this place is right down the street from our house! With such reasonable prices for great quality, I'm sure we're going to be regulars. 

It was unlike any veggie burger patty I've seen. It's not like Boca or Gardenburgers ... or the flour-y concoctions I've seen either. It sort of smells like a falafel. The color is between a bright pink and red (I felt manlier than my boyfriend eating his beef burger w/bacon because it looked like I had a super rare burger patty!) ... the texture is really unique, resembles ground beef in a creative way without feeling artificial. I had mine as a build-your-own, all the free topping veggies with ketchup and mustard on a *whole wheat bun* (yay! There are options!). Next time, I'll try the house sauce. Just wasn't feeling like a thousand island-type sauce today. 

My boyfriend got a beef burger with cheese and bacon. He wanted to go here in the first place because he walked by and noticed that the bacon in the burgers looked really impressive. In his words, "the bacon brought me here, it got me to stay here, it will bring me back!" They did look like good, thick pieces of bacon with a lot of red and very little fat. He loved his burger too. 

We also tried the "Fri-fecta" - the fry trio sample, which comes with regular fries with garlic and herbs, sweet potato fries, and very thin, curly shavings of zucchini and onion. All of them were amazing. I like to make a concoction of ketchup, black pepper, and hot sauce ... the hot sauce Roam has was amazing! It will be hard to pass up getting the Fri-fecta again next time we're there. 

Also had a side salad, which was decent. It was just mixed greens and tomatoes ... a bit of carrot shavings would have been perfect ... maybe some onion too ... but for $2.99? $3.99? (don't remember), I'm just happy to have gotten some greens with my meal. 

Their beer selection is impressive. 

The service was great. 

Love that the inside has this cool saloon-type feel to it. The lighting is cool. I got a splinter trying to find a trash can near where the condiments are, but it's cool, the quality of the meal was worth it. 

While we were waiting for our burgers to arrive, we noticed it's right across the street from Johnny Rocket's, another burger place. So we thought, wow, this place is pretty ballsy, opening up right across from the other main burger place in the area ... nope. They've got us hooked. We've never been to Johnny Rocket's, but we'll be coming back here a lot.
author: Dyne S.

description:
I ordered the Tejano Burger: Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch. Pretty damn good!  The fresh Avocado definitely made the burger. I liked the fact that it wasn't an overwhelmingly  huge burger, that just puts you into an automatic food coma. It's perfect for brunch/lunch if you want to still get stuff done during the rest of the day. But don't get me wrong, definitely a substantial amount of burger, just not tooo big.
I also washed it down w/ their Blood Orange soda which they make for you at the bar and definitely hit the spot.

Cool place w/ plenty of seating.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I had a great lunch at Roam this weekend. There was a lot to choice from between the different kind of patties (beef, bison, ostrich, turkey & veggie) and styles. I went with the Bison French and Fries ($10.25) - Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard. The truffle fires were perfectly seasoned and there was plenty of avocado. It was probably the second best burger I've had, second only to Umami Burger. 

I also ordered the fry-fecta ($5.49) which included russet fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini onion haystack. I was excited by the idea of zucchini onion haystack but found then rather salty. 

Overall it was a great meal and pretty reasonable priced for a gourmet burger in SF.
author: Marika M.

description:
WOW - Roam is absolutely FAN.TAS.TIC! 
The French & Fries was one of my favorite burgers and quite possibly one of the best I've ever had. Juicy, oozy gruyere, medium rare thick patty, slightly sweet bun, carmelized onions, the perfect dijon. Oddly, the fries in the burger were okay, but the other stuff made it amazing. I tried a bite of the BF's Heritage burger, but the French & Fries beats it hands down!

We also ordered the Fry Fecta - SO YUM.MY! Truffled parm, strings, and sweet potato fries - my mouth is watering as I type this. And finally, topped it off with a Blue Bottle Coffee shake - heavenly...

We called in our order and picked it up in 10 minutes, so no waiting! But the drive home was torture as I smelled the fries wafting from the bag. I cannot wait to come back to Roam!
author: Veronica H.

description:
Roam makes a great addition to any neighborhood. Roam has natural burgers including grass-fed beef, bison, free-range turkey, veggie, or salads. I always order the classic turkey or beef that has lettuce, tomatoes, special house sauce, aged white cheddar, avocado, and sweet potato. The milkshakes are very good. 

Despite the delicious organic shakes, microbrews, wines on tap, and fresh sodas, I'm sorry Roam, but you need Coca Cola. Roam never disappoints. 

Burgers are delicious, 'nough said! Go have one!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Good, solid lunch spot. It's not a cheap burger, and I wasn't blown away, but there's plenty more to try on the menu. I'd go back for a lunch!
author: Dimple B.

description:
After trying Umami Burger (I reviewed the place), I went on YELP to search for another gourmet burger restaurant and Roam appeared. I have been wanting to try Roam for ~ a year now and I have finally tried it and I like it! 

I've been pressuring my boyfriend to try Roam with me because he just loves Umami Burger and now he is a fan of Roam and so am I!

The downside: the restaurant is a order first, find your table second type of place. We did not like that idea very much because it's a hassle of staring people down and trying to make them eat faster so you can sit down.

Heritage: bacon in a burger, you can't go wrong with that. Delicious! I love the buns, I think they might toast it on fat to make it flavorful, but I'm not entirely sure, but it is delicious!

Sunny side: delicious burger with an egg.  

Sweet Potato Fries: he loved the sweet potato fries but I thought they were a bit salty, but I'm not a salt type of person so what is salty to me might be fine for others.

Strawberry Shake: We both love love love the shake because it wasn't very sweet and it's organic! I love milkshakes even though I am lactose intolerant but I hate milkshakes that feel like a lot of syrup was involved but Roam's strawberry milkshake was just perfect!

We will definitely be coming back for our burger fix!
author: Mona L.

description:
I love this place! The farmer's market salad is delicious because it isn't just lettuce - there's also pumpkin seeds, carrots, and avocado on it and other tasty things! Also, I get the turkey burger trio on the side which is where they put three mini turkey burger patties on a skewer. 

If you don't like salads and prefer to get a traditional burger, the burgers here are amazing. They also have other options such as gluten free buns or lettuce buns (where they just put the burger between large pieces of lettuce)!
author: Brianna L.

description:
Great fries, a cool atmosphere, good drinks and great burgers. First place I went to get a bison burger after getting in from abroad. Not as good as my favorite burger spot in Chicago though. They serve happy meat. Service was nice. They have an open front to the restaurant area. Great for lunch. Nice bar as well with great beer on tap.

A little expensive, I think it was around $14 for my burger and I had to buy fries separately.
author: Brad G.

description: One of our favorite lunch spots while in the city! Great grass fed burgers, tasty shakes, friendly service! Really like the decor as well.
author: Michael M.

description:
The classic burger is tasty and juicy. Who could pass up the sweet potato fries? Milk shakes are thick and yummy.

You have to order at the register and take a number. There is no table service.

The portions could be a bit bigger given the price point.
author: Trang H.

description:
A friend told me that Roam was opening on Fillmore.  For the past few weeks, I've been stalking the location, watching the progress, and so excited that it's finally here.

Roam has high quality meat (grass fed, free range, all natural, etc).  Even their ketchup is organic.

My favorite burgers are the Classic, Sunnyside, and French and Fries.  

On the Classic, it's only lettuce, tomato, onions, and pickles but all the ingredients are so fresh.  I never eat pickles in my burger but their homemade pickles are my favorite.  After eating this burger, I never feel bad about wolfing down a burger.

The Sunnyside has a fried egg, cheese, chili sauce, etc.  The egg is cooked over easy/medium so the yolk is oozing over your burger, in a good way.  It's probably the messiest burger I've eaten but so worth it.  If you are on a date...not a good idea to order.  If you are alone or with friends, a must try.  It's delicious.

French and Fries.  Honestly, truffle fries in a burger doesn't sound that great to me.  But, my husband ordered this.  Now, I crave it.  I love the taste of truffles.  All the ingredients in the burger bring out the truffle flavor and compliment each other.  Who ever created this burger is a genius!

The russet fries are also good.  They always come out super hot and fresh.  The shakes are also very good.  Love all the flavors and the seasonal flavor options.

Just want to thank the owner of Roam for opening a Fillmore location.  I'll be frequenting this location and getting fat.  My trainer won't be happy but I will :)
author: Shelly W.

description:
Ordered: Tejano bison burger with bacon, truffle parmesan fries.

The food was okay. I prefer Super Duper Burger.
author: S N.

description:
Double elk sunny side burger and "fri-fecta": 

The egg on the "sunny side" burger was anything but (yolk cooked solid). 

The default temp for the burgers seems to be well-done which made for an elk patty that was indistinguishable from the beef variety. If you want another temperature make sure to ask for it up front. 

Fries were very good but didn't make up for the poorly cooked burger.

Overall this place is just OK
author: Brian S.

description:
Didn't eat a burger 'cuz my friend wanted fries.  The russet fries were grease bombs,
they tasted manufactured with tons of solid fat that came to be on first bite....a veritable
bomb of grease that exploded in my mouth.....UGGGGGGGGGly

The fries were served in a.smalllllllllll double handled metal baking pan.  There was no way it would have served more than a pygmy who wasn't hungry.

Their milk shake is wonderful, unfortunately my COCONUT shake was A VANILLA SHAKE, they made another. It was also a thick, luscious and creamy VANIILA SHAKE.
Bummer.

The counter people are very nice and the surroundings hard edge minimalist that suits today's idea of hip.

I'd for back for a flavored shake as I know it would be great and LOADED WITH DELICIOUS CALORIES.  What the heck.  I can't remember when I had a shale last, let alone a fabulous Vanilla Shake!
author: ELINOR H.

description:
I got the bison burger, sunny side. The patty was oddly wider than the buns and on the thin side. I feel that making the patty thinner instead of thicker was a detriment because you couldn't taste the meat as well. The egg left the burger a lot mushier than I had intended. I would suggest forgoing the egg.

The fries were amazing. That's what pulls this review up to 4 stars. Very crispy! Also- all three kinds of fries were delicious in their own way. I would recommend trying them all. 

Went for dinner. Although the place was crowded, we were able to get a table quickly.
author: Gee H.

description:
Hooray for the addition of a somewhat reasonably priced eatery on Fillmore Street! It's all relative in this part of SF...

Anyway, this place ROCKS. Their burgers are amazing. 

I've tried the beef and bison burgers and am a fan of both. And my friends are obsessed with the beet / quinoa veggie burger.  As for burger styles, the Heritage burger is simply delicious--so far this is my favorite.  I've also tried the Sunny Side (great as a "brunch" burger...ha!) and BBQ, both of which were extremely satisfying.  My coworkers have raved about the Tejano burger as well, which is next on my list to try.  As for sides, the Fry-Fecta is a great way to sample their crispy and tasty fries, but I think their sweet potato fries are the best.  For the health conscious, it's also nice to have the option to get a whole grain bun, turkey burger, or a fresh, green side salad.  Not that burgers are health food...but you get the point.  This place has options.

Speaking of non-health food, when I'm ready to indulge, I can't wait to try one of their shakes with bruleed marshmallow! The Straus Family Creamery flavors they carry look insanely delicious!!!

Check this place out!
author: Amy B.

description:
I tried their vegeterian burger with a lettuce wrap (instead of the usual bun) and I honestly couldn't stop eating it.
The burger itself (with beets as the main ingredient) was to die for and the idea to substitute the bun with lettuce and make it a really healthy meal deserves thumbs up!

I wish they would include a list of the ingredients used in their vegeterian burger but this is such a great spot to hang-out with friends.

Dining area is very informal and casual but for a burger place it's just perfect!
I'll be back!
author: MT M.

description: Why one star.... because a hamburger without flavor cany be covered with special sauce and good toppings and buns.   Nice atmosphere clean bathroom... but tasteless burger meat....ummm... no ... that means the main premise is fool you into not notixing your eating a non satisfiying burger... I means its a friggin hamburger... they should always satisfy!  Id rather eat in and out quite honest... besides all the dbags in pac heights lite/ j town side make the place full of ugly people with things... kinda like the fraud here at roam. You people and burgers are made for each other... if you like this place... you know who you are.
author: Adam O.

description: The Roam resturants food is very nice. There survive is fast and there decor is very suitable for there food. But the bathrooms should be cleaner and they should ask how you want your hamburger prepared.
author: Jim S.

description:
Wife and I went to Roam burger to try out their Bison Burger....  honestly, it was just ok.... 

I had the Bison Burger Sunny Side Style.... it looked good but I couldn't get to the Bison patty before finishing the egg first.. they plated it by putting the eggs, veggies, etc in the front end of the burger (possibly to show off the contents and make it look bigger than it is)  while the actual burger patty was all way in the back.  They obviously focus more on being Artisans than a Burger joint. 


My suggestion is for you to walk across the street to Umami Burger and have the best burger experience EVER.
author: Earl Q.

description:
Best burgers I've had in SF. I usually order the Tejano, which has pepper jack, jalapeño relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, and herb ranch dressing. Seriously.... little white corn strips in a burger. It is a great addition to the burger. 

The kid's menu is not very diverse, and I wish the kid's burger was smaller - like a slider, or a couple of sliders. Our 2.5 and 4 year olds had a hard time getting their mouths around the burgers. Also, while it is great that they provide crayons and paper for kids to draw on, the paper is pretty inked up and not a lot of area for kids to draw. However, the older kids would probably love it. 

As far as crowds and seating, I don't know how they do it - but it has never been a problem for us. We've even been there on a Saturday afternoon and a Saturday night, and while there were always people in line ordering, we did not have a problem finding a place to sit for 4. The food also came fairly quickly, which is good when you have kids. You can also sit outside on Fillmore. 

Overall, a great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: William R.

description:
when in Roam, do as the Roamans do. has anybody done this in their review yet? i'm sure i'm not the first cheesy person to try to pull this off.....

anyhow, i got the sunny side burger (egg, aged white cheddar, carmelized onions, lettuce, tomato and sweet chili sauce), which seemed to be their most stand out burger. it was really good, however personally i could have done without such sweetness from the sweet chili sauce. you know the sauce they serve at thai restaurants with the bbq chicken? it's that sauce. too sweet for a burger. but i understand the concept and could see people liking it. next time i'm going with something completely savory.

oh, but the blue bottle coffee milkshake was excellent! especially topped with a bruleed marshmallow ($1)!!

you can find great burgers all over SF, but you know what i like about Roam? they've got huge windows that open up so that you can sit indoors but feel like you're outside. perfect for a nice (rare) San Francisco day.
author: Regina C.

description: Great economical option in the affluent Pacific Heights. Impressed by the burgers here. Beef quality is great - crusted beef, toasted bun, and fresh ingredients. For a casual place, the atmosphere is beautiful with street seating lining the Pacific Heights streets, wooden panels, hipster lighting, and minimalist vibe. Great for a family lunch in Pac Heights. The prices are reasonable, given the area. Before tax and tip, you can try a classic for 5.99, which is fair.
author: Jay C.

description: I love that the veggie patty isn't black beans. It's beets and quinoa and oh so flavorful, especially french and fries style or the classic lettuce and tomato. A little expensive for burgers, but always high quality.
author: Sarah V.

description: Hooray! They have a homemade vegetarian patty, so you can make any sort of burger with that. They also have artisan sodas. With great shakes & fries, this is a fun place to eat! It can be busy, as with other popular prime time places in SF so consider take out through the web or phone. I have had several vegetarian burger combos & have loved them all.
author: Mihir M.

description:
This place was really good.

It's a hopping joint, and the food was delicious, and decently priced for the area. 

- Pacific Blue: Rich and indulgent.  The blue cheese had a nice kick to it, but the subtle watercress balanced the sandwich well.
- Sunnside: It was a bit intense.  I'm not the biggest fan of an egg on a burger, only because it ends up being a big mess. But my friend seemed to enjoy it.
- Fry-Fecta: Definitely the best thing to do, as you need the sampling of all good fried things.

Overall, this place was good and definitely is a great alternative to the loved Umami Burger.
author: Natalie G.

description:
A good burger with some good options (bison/elk). 

I had a burger with fries and a blood orange soda. Burger was good, a little overdone for my tastes. Fries were solid. And soda was just ok. 

Decor is great, but the place gets crowded pretty quickly on the weekend.
author: George T.

description: Thin burger patty, soggy burger bun, oily fries... I've had better food. Service was horrible and I would not return.
author: Pauline H.

description:
Went here for lunch on a Friday. I don't eat burgers very often, but I try to make sure it's worth the trip if I do (sorry golden arches & the like, i've never stepped foot in your establishment since I left sd and wasn't a broke college student anymore).

You walk in, order, they give you a number, and find a bar seat or table in the restaurant. It wasn't too bad finding seats for 7 people when we came here at peak lunch time hours. The staff were really friendly.

Food:
-Tejano burger (w/ pepper jack, generous slices of avocado pieces, jalapeno relish, tomato, and corn strips) - got this with a turkey patty (you choose from: beef, turkey, bison, veggie, or special - when I came here it was ostrich). Huge, delicious, flavorful burger. SO GOOD.

Didn't order anything else, but the rest of my group enjoyed their burgers and fries. Other than burgers, this place also serves a simple selection of sides, salads, shakes, beer, tea, soda. 

Overall: 4. I'd definitely come back and try other things on the menu. Worth a trip to check it out and get that burger craving satisfied!
author: Loriel L.

description:
Came on Wednesday night after work with friends -- 

Food ~ I ordered  the  Sunny Side burger which was amazing and delicious. The egg and sweet chili sauce really added to the overall experience of eating the burger. I enjoyed every bite and can't wait to try the other burgers offered. Also, I ordered a kids size Vanilla Bean shake which was good and would like to try the Blue Bottle shake (coffee-flavored). I was very impressed! 

Location/Atmosphere ~ Even though we went on a Wednesday night, the place was crowded that we were lucky to find enough seats. The atmosphere was modern and a fun place to grab food with friends after work. 

Bottom line ~ I highly recommend this restaurant to those who are looking for a REALLY good burger. I would recommend on trying the specialty burgers before customizing yours because they all sound really good. Also, shakes are a must try!
author: Aimee W.

description: My daughter and I have enjoyed eating here for quite some time. However, on our last visit they messed up her order not only once but twice. Yes, twice! On their behalf, we were given a refund on the whole order. Still, she walked away starving and we had to get her food at another restaurant.
author: Cecilia C.

description:
Nice casual burger joint with bar and communal seating. Like the dark wood and upscale feel but without the pretentiousness.

Came rather early for a Friday (7p) but it was packed. We were lucky to score a table for the 3 of us.

Hubs and I shared:
- Chalet burger ($8.25) w/ beef patty (you choose your meat) - Swiss, Cremini Mushrooms, Watercress, Tomato, House Sauce. Pretty good but not outstanding.
- Sweet potato fries ($3.49). Tasty. Nice crisp outside.
- Milk shake ($4.99). Delish! Made w/ Strauss Creamery milk this was yum. I had a vanilla chocolate mix.
- Roasted veggies ($5.49). Simple roasted veggies. Mine was butternut squash and some brussels.
author: Cindy W.

description: I love this place! This restaurant makes me feel like burger is no longer fast food.
author: Evander J.

description: Splurge on the Bison! I guess I didn't try the regular beef burger, but the bison was phenomenal! The fries were ok, I wish I had gotten the truffle/Parmesan, but maybe next time. Also had the homemade soda, (special was blood orange) which was good, but probably not necessary. Lucked out and got seats, but looks pretty packed so be sure to go in a group and have someone snag one while you're waiting in line. Anyways, overall great experience and I would highly recommend grabbing a burger here!
author: Cody M.

description: Tried this place yesterday and it was great! I had the french and fry burger and my boyfriend had the tejano. Both were delicious. The staff was also nice and attentive. There are plenty of places to sit, even during the busy lunch hour. Would definitely come back here again, the burgers and fries were tasty and I left feeling satisfied and full!
author: Sarah K.

description:
Heritage burger, lettuce wrapped with a side salad, that's me!

I like the fryfecta but haven't tried their shakes yet, though I hear they're amazing. 

One thing that is strange about Roam is their floors: the mixture of wood with the inevitable oil from a burger and fry place makes their floors VERY slippery, so watch out! I really like their community table and the beam chandelier that they have over it. 

This place can get pretty crowded for dinner time, FYI.
author: Clara N.

description:
Unfortunately, I was super disappointed in Roam Burgers food. The biggest complaint I have is with the burger. I ordered a classic medium rare, mint chip milk shake and the triple fry. For two burgers, and two shakes and the one fry our bill was over $40.

The burger was thin (like fast food chain thin) and dry, totally overpowered by the bready bun, and they use butter lettuce which was a bummer because there is no crisp crunch like with iceberg lettuce.  
The fried sweet potatoes, french fries and onion rings were cold mostly flavorless. 

The atmosphere is fun, the service was friendly and pretty fast and the milk shakes were yummy. 

BUT really, I won't go back because if I'm going to a burger joint, the burger better be the best: dripping, hot, and delicious!
author: Daydra B.

description: This place is great! I always bring my friends here when they visit and they love it. Their burger options are versatile, I love the turkey burger it's sooo juicy. Their shakes are a must-try and the fry-fecta is great for two!
author: Victoria G.

description: Mediocre at best, a soggy lower bun and a bland taste seem to be their trademark. I've eaten at this location and at the one in the marina. Today I ate at the Fillmore one about an hour and a half ago and I feel like vomiting. Their shakes are pretty tasty, that's about all I have to say about them. Not worth the money. Nice people though.
author: Pablo K.

description:
Just ate here about an hour ago and was really impressed with it.  Boyfriend and I each got a burger, we shared truffle fries, and I got a shake for a grand total of $35 (with tip).  I think that's pretty reasonable these days for a great lunch for two in San Francisco.  BF had the french & fries burger, which he devoured.  I had the turkey burger "sunny side" and added avo.  It. Was. So. Delicious.  

I agree with the reviews that say the patties are really small.  It's true.  If I had gotten a burger and the patty was the size of my turkey burger, I wouldn't have been very pleased.  However, with the egg, amazingly sauteed onions, and avo, my turkey burger really hit the spot.  The shake was also awesome and the truffle fries were divine.  I'll go back for sure.  I'll probably stick to the turkey burger, but we'll see.
author: Shannon B.

description: nice choices of high quality meats including bison and elk. haven't tried the elk yet, but I'm into it. their themed burgers are usually what we get. I like the tejano and the sunny side. the salads look big and tasty but we can't help but go for the burgers. got a coconut kombucha last time, too. props for the gluten free buns and ketchup cups.
author: Matt J.

description:
I was at work and craving sweet potato fries so I browsed through yelp until I found Roam. I ordered online - it was pretty easy and they accept AmEx (which happened to be the only credit card I could find in my bag today. They allow you to customize your burger pretty much however you want. I opted for the Pacific Blue burger with a few customizations.

When I arrived, there was a line of about 5 people. There was one guy working the phones and register and this place was completely packed. My food was ready for me when I got to the register 10 minutes later. 

The sweet potato fries were gone before I got back to work. The burger was good, but it wasn't to-die-for-amazing like the other reviews make it seem. If given the choice, I'd rather go to Red Robin. 

Something i was not happy about -- I asked for no onions and I got a lot of onions. I would've understood if I had called or ordered at the register because maybe they didn't hear me, but I ordered online, which meant my order was in writing. They should've caught that. 

Verdict: I'd go back for the sweet potato fries.
author: Christy Y.

description: The Pac Height crowd and ambience, the simply stupendous grass-fed burgers, the barely functional ketchup dispensers. Fast and friendly service, knowledgeable counter service. Not the best burger in town, but among the best, and I enjoy eating here every so often.
author: josh a.

description:
From our 5 year old:

I love the turkey burger. I loved my milkshake. I really love the salted carmel one. I really loved the french fries.  Thats all that I had at Roam.  I like that they give me stickers and have things to draw on
author: Ben S.

description: I had been having a craving for a nice juicy burger that would just burst with flavor when I bit into it... and I found it! Roam's Heritage (Applewood smoked bacon, fontina, Butter Lettuce, Greens, Tomato, and Sweet Chilli Sauce) was about the best thing I have had in ages! We also order a Fry-fecta for sharing (Russet fries, sweet potato fries, zucchini onion haystack) which was also deeeeelicious. And to wash all that down we ordered shakes. I had the mint chip which was also soooo good.  My bf ended getting the passion fruit one, which was good, but he kept looking at my shake like he was waiting for me to say..."honey, would you like to switch?" But that never happened.  Oops!  Hey, to my defense, I shared and I had just left the hospital and was in pain. A couple of days later, we went back for shakes. This time I got the passion fruit. I say try this place is you are interested in it, but aren't to sure.  Tab for two was $40.
author: Amelia M.

description:
Egg burger! I've always heard and dreamt about it, and Roam made my dreams come true! Every flavor came together so nicely, grilled onions, seasoned quality meat, fluffy (non-dense) bun, and a perfectly cooked runny egg....I couldn't have been a happier carnivore!

Shakes are great, sweet potato fries rock, seating sucks but I guess that's what happens when your food is good. I noticed lots of families with kids just hanging out, well after done eating. I know it's awkward but, if Roam could somehow encourage their guests to be more aware of those waiting for a table, then 5 stars are deserved. I ate standing up!
author: Meredith M.

description:
Summary: Nice place for a quick meal. Friendly bus boy.

I ordered the kids size milk shake, perfect for a girl my size. My bison classic burger was cooked perfectly. The meat was juicy and flavorful. The only con was that our trio of fries was too greasy. There was no paper liner to absorb extra oil. Grease literally dripped off our fries.
author: Jeanne C.

description: WOW! If you are looking for the perfect, juicy, melt-in-your-mouth burger - this is it!! Bonus points: the beef is grass-fed and hormone free! A truly delicious and reasonably priced burger...and the fries, omg! We went late on Saturday night. The line wasn't bad and the service was quick. I'll definitely be back!!!
author: Rach M.

description:
Overall, the place was extremely crowded and loud. I could not figure out why people were piling into this place. you had to stand in a cramped line right in front of the door to order before you could even take a seat. the service was alright, nothing really special.

Heritage Burger - 

Decent burger but definitely not worth the $10. I would recommend going to Umami burger instead, the burgers are about the same price but they are much better. 

Fri-Fecta with truffle and parmesan on the regular fries- 

Why did the cashier recommend me to only get the truffle parmesan add on to the regular fries??? The haystack and sweet potato fries were extremely bland and needed the add on. Also the Fries were $7 for an underwhelming amount of fries. I would compare the size to a Medium fries at Mcdonalds. 

Overall pretty underwhelming experience but go for the hype if you want...
author: Bryan C.

description: Best Burgers (bison and elk) and milkshakes ever! And Just nice place to eat while you in San Francisco.
author: Olesya M.

description: This is the official burger date night spot for my boyfriend and I. The sweet potato fries are amazing!!!! We got the parmesan and chipotle maple seasonings. I got the homemade veggie burger, wheat bun, & Tejano style and its the perfect blend of flavors. My boyfriend got the bison burger BBQ style and he devoured it. He also ordered the plain russet fries that were really fresh. The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because I was not a can of the homemade soda. If you are looking for a good burger then this is the spot!!!!
author: Raquel G.

description: I cannot believe it has taken me this long to give Roam Artisan Burgers a try! This is now one of my favorite burger places, and I have definitely tried a few. Came here with a friend and we ordered the Sunnyside and the Tejano, both beef and both absolutely delicious. The burgers are a great size and you definitely get what you pay for. The meat was cooked perfectly medium and juicy! The restaurant is clean and spacious. There are bottles of delicious and seriously spicy habanero hot sauce and the staff is so friendly. Never disappoints! Burgers are moist, toppings are great, and atmosphere unique! Love it.
author: Billy T.

description:
Perfectly cooked burger with awesome toppings.  The truffle fries and herb mayo were amazing.  Delicious beer.

We loved the atmosphere.  Packed with people and outdoor seating with a heater.  We sat outside each night because it was beautiful and warm with the heater above.

It was pretty easy to get there from the Wharf via the Muni.  We went here twice in 5 days and can't wait to come back!
author: Cassie W.

description: Love this place! Gluten free buns that are really good. The meat is fresh. Have had beef, turkey, veggie and all are great. Great salads and love the sweet potato fries. Service is usually great from the servers and a hit or miss from the people ringing up your order at the front. Love the online ordering.
author: karen h.

description:
Burgers, french fries, and beer; what's not to like?

Roam has a great atmosphere and even better food. It's quick and a great place to meet up with a friend.

If you are in the area it is worth stopping by.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I have been to Roam's Union street location and I've been accused of eating like I'm enjoying my last meal before going to Alcatraz. 

This time at the Fillmore location, I ordered the the Tatanka. This Bison looked as good as the woman behind the counter that made me a Shake with Bruléed Marshmallow (Lynn?) - and dare I imagine - as delicious. 

I took one bite into that Tatanka, took a deep breath and suddenly felt like Hannibel Lector - that is,  I needed some Fava beans. 

You see, I'm a recovering Vegetarian and have recently done a 360 and can't turn back.

It's all ROAM's fault - and thanks to the Tatanka they serve, I'm officially a Meataterian.

I have not had a Bison Burger this fresh since I was at camp Dunmore and we turned an unfortunate accident between a pick-up truck and a Bison into dinner for the week.
author: JW U.

description:
- Veggie Burger Review-

Roam has the BEST veggie burgers in the city!  They are hearty and delicious, not fried or greasy.  I also love that the food is consistently good, we go almost every week now.  The truffle fries are also pretty amazing!
author: Liz Y.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night to order some take out burgers. The place was totally packed! Glad I didn't have to try to jockey for a place to sit.

The 2 elk burgers (1 Chalet, 1 Heritage with added egg) I ordered were delicious, as was the fry-fecta with a little added truffle parmesan. I also added a Blue Bottle Coffee milk shake which was AWESOME. Overall, food was great! The bill adds up on you pretty quickly though. My total came out to be about $40, which was probably a little more than I had intended to spend on burgers, but the food quality was very good.
author: Mel M.

description:
Listen up people, you'll want to try this place.  I've never had a burger that was this good!!! I got the Sunnyside and it comes with a Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce.

DELICIOUS!!! :)
author: Kathleen M.

description: This burger was aight! 2 if 5 people in my party raved. They need to add more salt and step up their sauce. The trifecta fries were pretty good, but nothing special. I enjoyed but won't return. Coffee shake was bomb! We got a second! Servers were very cool.
author: Jackie M.

description: What's not to love - local, sustainable ingredients, seasonal meats and special (vegetarian) dishes, earthy modern space, bustling indoor and outdoor tables for families, and a bar if you want to feel like you're an adult.  Love it.  :)
author: Melanie C.

description:
Roam on over to this joint!

the "Artisan" part of this place's name is such an understatement. The food here is clearly skillfully crafted.

As soon as you walk in you are greeted with a large display of the menu. Very clear and concise, and the ingredients are organic and whole....no crap included.

You order at the cashier, and you are handed a number and then you hunt for a place to sit down. The only downer is the small and tight space all the tables are in. It makes me feel bad for the servers who have to maneuver through tight aisles and customers who are fighting for seats. 

What I ordered:
-farmer's market salad: avocado, cheese (this is what makes the dish), mixed greens, carrots, radishes (I didn't include this in my salad), toasted pumpkin seed and your choice of herb ranch or red wine vinaigrette. Please choose the red wine vinaigrette, it adds a more warm flavor and allows you to taste the farm market veggies more. I regret that i forget the name of the cheese, but this is what makes the salad. The toasted pumpkin seed creates a nutty flavor, which blends well with the greens and cheese! This was fantastic! I will definitely get this again. And avocados are rich in Good fat!
-Sunnyside burger: farm raised beef with lettuce tomato, cheese and caramelized onions, and for the shining ingredient: the sunny side up egg! the meat is very tender, and the egg completes the meat! Definitely a winner...and also suggests that the other burgers on the menu must be as good!
-Fries with herb and parmesan! Very tasty! my kind of fries with just enough sea salt and parmesan! I wish they had garlic fries!

And my Favorite of all: Blue bottle coffee milkshake!!! OMG sooooo good, does not compare to any type of frappuccino! I don't drink coffee much, but this is too yummy to pass up! I haven't tried it with the torched marshmallow, but i will soon!

Friendly service, nice casual ambience, and yummy food, how much more do you want! oh wait, if only SF parking was easy
author: Monica G.

description:
Went at 1:30 for lunch which was a great idea. Lots of seating.

I found the staff to be so sweet. I made a mistake in my order and they happily brought me a new burger. I ordered the French and Fry Turkey Burger- it was really, really, really good. Like, I want to go back tonight for dinner good.

I also noticed that the portion size is perfect. I left pleasantly sated and not overly full.

Oh, and the fries with parmasan are yummy! You will not regret ordering them if you like crunchy, tasty fries.
author: Paige B.

description:
It's been a long time, and this update is WAY overdue. This place is great now. Whatever kinks they had, they worked out. The staff that is there now is friendly and the place is a great staple in our neighborhood. 

I was there a few weeks ago, waiting for my to-go order. I was trying to give my son a sip of water from a glass, but he's a baby and he was having a tough time (which means I was having a tough time). There was a group of employees at the counter, eating and hanging out, and one guy must have seen me because he got up, came over to me and asked if I'd like a cup with a lid & a straw for the little guy. Seems pretty basic, but it meant a lot to me. 

The food is SO GOOD, and the service is too. :)
author: Mrs. J.

description:
A and I had an early dinner here Friday night.  It was pretty empty at 5pm, but I did try to come here around 12:00pm once during the week and it was absolutely hoppin'.

You stand in line, order your food and pay, take your number to a table, and wait for your food to be brought to your table.

I ordered the Turkey French and Fries, mainly because I've been on a truffle oil fries kick and this burger has truffle parmesan fries in it.  A had the Tejano Beef Burger.  He liked it so much that he didn't even let me have a bite.  We both also got the Blood Orange Soda, which really tasted like blood orange.

They have different choices of meat for your burger - beef, turkey, bison...

Definitely not cheap, but the burgers are super yum!  

For two of us - two burgers, two sodas, and a side of fries - it was almost $30.00.
author: Kris L.

description:
I love this place! My cousin lives in SF, and brought us here to eat we were all fans of the food. As far as the food goes no complaints!

However we had a TERRIBLE experience with some other customers that were there. The place was over crowded and there was no where to sit. Patiently we waited to get a table until after we ordered our food (common courtesy) We finally got a table with only 5 chairs so we figured we would wait for a table to clear and we would pull in another chair. Finally a table cleared and as I got up to get the chair from the now empty table next to us 2 girls who were still in the back of the line and no where near ordering set their purses down. When the busser explained to them that by the time they were done eating we would give them the chair back they threw fits and called management. Our poor busser I hope didn't get in trouble. So they got their way and well my brother ate his meal standing up. My reason for the 3 stars the manager totally accommodated to them and apologized. We on the other hand never heard an apology! Ive been to restaurants that are packed like this and they have signs that say that you cant sit until you've ordered! that only seems fair.
author: Adriana R.

description: This place is pretty consistent and has a great selection for meat eaters and veggie eaters alike.  The sweet potato fries are great and they even have a gluten free bun option for those that prefer it.
author: Karlito S.

description: Came here today because the BF was craving a burger and some friends recommended it. We ordered the fry-fecta (sweet potatoes and regular fries with zucchini and onion haystack) which was pretty good for $5.99. We ordered all burgers medium rare: beef sunnyside burger, beef heritage burger and a bison classic burger....so ALL burgers came well done...we couldn't tell if they messed up all orders or they just do all burgers well done because I clearly said medium rare a couple times and the cashier said "ok" but it didn't say medium rare anywhere on the receipt...we also ordered the ginger lime soda (which I liked) and the bf got the prickly pear soda (which he did not like)....all in all the burgers didn't wow us at all. My sunnyside burger didn't really have any flavor mainly only the ketchup I put on it. I wasn't even sure they put the sweet chili sauce in the sunnyside burger ...I asked for it on the side but the only thing I had on the side  tasted and looked like straight up ketchup and there was no other sauce or flavor in my burger to be sweet chili sauce?!....But their pickled on the classic burger were good....don't think we will be back. Def would not crave anything from here....guess we will have to keep searching for another burger place cause I would rather eat in n out then roam burgers...this meal was not worth $50 for even three people...
author: Linda L.

description: Family and I came here over the weekend and had a great time. I had a tejano style elk burger and a side of their fries topped with a Boont Amber Ale. Perfect combo and it was a delicious meal. I always compare burgers and sides to my favorite burger spot Burgers and Brew in Sac, this place ties it in taste. Check it out next time you're on Fillmore.
author: Joe C.

description:
I was really excited to finally try Roam after hearing so much about it. Plus, its focus on grass fed, high quality meats, and GF/paleo options was very enticing. I perhaps had too high of expectations for this place, so maybe that was my mistake, but Roam didn't live up to the hype. The food was just okay, nothing especially memorable, and the service was subpar. One thing I really appreciated was the knowledgeable staff re: gluten and other ingredients/allergens in food.

Husband and I came in on a Sunday afternoon, and there was a short line but it moved very quickly. We got our order # sign and found a seat in the bar area. While we were waiting for food, a girl behind the bar spilled an entire glass of iced tea on my husband (the whole thing landed squarely on him), the glass broke all over him and the floor. The people behind the bar barely seemed to care, asking casually, just once if we were okay. Well yeah, minus the fact that he's soaking wet with sweet tea and standing in a pile of glass, sure...The milkshake we ordered was sitting in the middle of the destruction and my husband asked if he could get a new one since there might be glass shards in it. The guy behind the bar looked at it skeptically and said 'eh, there probably isn't'...really? You really wanna risk that? and then finally made us a new one after we looked a little incredulous. If this had happened in a different restaurant, where you don't pay ahead of time, we would have received a comped bill, but no compensation here. Something - side of extra fries, a discount for next time, etc. would have been nice! 

Shortly after that, we got our food - I got the heritage burger in a lettuce wrap, no mayo, with aged cheddar, he got the classic on a GF bun, we split the fries and the vanilla milkshake. The burger patty was very thin, wrapped in a monstrous amount of lettuce so that all you could really taste was the lettuce. The burger was a little on the dry side, not very well seasoned or juicy at all, The caramelized onions were sparse. Husband said his burger was just 'okay' and the GF bun paled in comparison to others, was on the soggy side. The fries were good, cooked in rice bran oil and no gluten contaminants in the fryer which was nice - but the portion was TINY for one serving. The milkshake was great, but hard to screw that one up.

Overall, we decided we far prefer Umami burger for flavor, quantity, and service but would come to Roam only if it was conveniently en route.
author: Piyali F.

description:
I hate to write this review, because I think Roam is a great neighborhood burger spot.  Sustainable food, nice servers, fun drinks. Good interior decor. I think Roam burgers are A-OK, not amazing, but good enough to come here 3 times. I like their meat a lot.

Sooo I was strolling near Roam one night with my dog and when we were right outside Roam, he all of a sudden ran toward the 2 trashcans that were set out. The second he did this, at least 5-6 (large and fat) mice came scurrying from the trash and ran underneath the Roam building crevices... 

I wouldn't be surprised if there were mice in their kitchen. I'm sorry. I just can't come here anymore. Thinking about that scene makes me shudder. SF buildings are old and neighborhoods like Chinatown or Nobhill will sometimes have mice pop up here and there, but to see that many mice run beneath that building makes me think there is a bigger issue at hand...
author: A Y.

description: Sunny side with elk. Elk was overcooked so it just tasted like beef cardboard. Sweet Chili sauce is really just an absurd amount if ketchup which does not go well with a runny egg. It's an ok burger. Too bad I couldn't skip that 4hour ramen line.
author: Bollu P.

description: Burgers weren't all that great or filling at all. Disappointed because I came on an empty stomach. Bathroom was pretty nasty. The rest of the restaurant had a nice vibe. I ate at the outdoor seating area and it was pretty nice. But I definitely think super duper sells a much meaner burger. Won't be coming back here, and I'm still hungry.
author: Hannah W.

description: With the proliferation of artisan burger places, it's hard to remember which places are the best, which are pretty good, and which aren't worth going to. Well Roam is one of the better ones that I'd gladly go to for a cheeseburger fix.
author: Philip L.

description:
THE FRY-FECTA is a MUST TRY. French fries are my addiction. Everyone likes french fries! ESP little kids ;)

The fry-fecta is a selection of three delicious and different french fries. One sweet potato chipotle mayo (MY FAV) Parmesan truffle garlic fries, and the veggie zucchini fries (perfect for putting into your burger!)

As for the burgers, they were large, juicy, messy and pretty good. 

I hear they have great sodas! Will def have to try them next time! And their smoothies...and beers. Mmm can't wait to come back!
author: Teresa W.

description: Awesome burger! One of the best in the city! The shakes and fries keep this stellar burger place at 4 stars for me.
author: Michael S.

description: Best burgers. Period. The french fries are soo good, especially their specialty ones (parmesan truffle fries and sweet potato). I love how you also have the option of customizing your burger because it allows you to truly eat the burger you're craving. The ambiance is really great too, it's warm and inviting which is hard to find in a fast food joint. It is the perfect blend of aesthetic and product.
author: Adriana A.

description:
The best way to enjoy a burger is with a glass (or two) of Boont ale, which is available on tap here. However... I was underwhelmed by the basic burger here. Perhaps I should try one their special ones next time. We also had the try-fecta for the side.

Also, I just could not get that B-52's song out of my head the whole time...
author: Maximillian M.

description: This is by far my favorite burger joint. They have the most delicious and juicy burgers made with local meat. I always build my own with aged white cheddar, lettuce, tomato, herb mayo, and avocado. Oh so tasty. Always always order the fryfecta which has russet fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini strings. Also get the toppings which include chipotle maple (on the sweet potatoes), Parmesan truffle (russets) and fresh herbs (on the strings). You will not regret it. And don't forget to sip on one of their seasonal artisan sodas. My favorites are lemon and blood orange. And if you make some room...get a milkshake with toasted marshmallow!! Ahhh. I think I need this right now. Everyone is friendly and tables turn pretty quick even though they're really busy.
author: Kristin K.

description: Amazing burgers! I recommend getting The Heritage with an egg added in. The condiment count has glasses for water, which I thought was pretty cool.
author: Wailan M.

description:
Roam is in my neighborhood, closer than my local grocery store and I have only just discovered it.  

What is wrong with me?

With the most banging burgers, you can make your own or choose from one of their unique creations.  I had planned to take half home with me.  As soon as I took a bite I knew I was going to devour the whole burger in about 4.54 minutes.  The kombucha was delightful and just giving thought to the juicy burger punctuated with blue cheese and perfect fries, I know exactly what I want for dinner tomorrow.
author: Allyson D.

description: The food and service is amazing here! The managers are on top of their game, and even when it's busy, like it was yesterday, they still take time to walk around and make sure you have everything you need. You get full sit-down quality service but within a casual and affordable setting. Did I mention the food is amazing! The burgers are mouth watering, completely customizable, and there are gluten-free options, hooray! The shakes are mouth watering. There are wines and beers on tap. What else could you ask for in a neighborhood burger joint?!
author: Adry R.

description:
The short version: I stumbled on this little gem while wandering SF looking for a quick bite on a late night. This might be one of the best burgers I have had in recent memory. And the salted caramel shakes? To die for

The basics: After spending all day in a car driving up to San Fran I was ready to just be out of it so after checking into my hotel I started wandering on foot looking for somewhere quick to eat that didn't require a reservation and wasn't a chain. I came on Roam and there was a lively crowd inside and a decent group outside eating so I figured I would check it out. Am I ever glad I did because this may be one of the best burgers I can remember having in a long time. The line to get my order in was a little extensive but it gave me a few minutes to decide what I was going to get. I placed my order and found a table and waiting. My burger came out relatively quick minus my side of fries I ordered (the cashier didn't hear me ask for them, but the food runner brought some when I asked about them) I bit into my burger and it was juicy, seasoned, and properly cooked. Everything I asked for was prepared and balanced wonderfully. I also ordered the salted caramel shake and it took every ounce of restrain I had not to suck it all down or go back for another one. This is going to be a must have on all my trips to San Fran from now on. Tip: Don't go during peak hours because the line gets out the door or order your food ahead of time to go and pick it up.

What works: The options on the menu, the flavors, and the shakes!

What to improve: Work on getting orders right the first time and keeping people from standing over people eating.
author: Patrick M.

description:
The best burger restaurant of its kind!  I've been coming to this restaurant (a few times at Union street) a little over half a dozen times, now.  However, this review will pertain to the one on Fillmore as it was this location I last visited.  This restaurant offers quality free-range livestock meat, including bison.  But my indulgence is the elk meat (I usually double it, because I have a humungous appetite).  I proudly drag my friends to experience it at least once in their lifetime, however, my previous visit was sadly below satisfactory.

My last dine-in was sorely disappointing, because I didn't even dine-in but ordered to go.  It's safe to say I waited 30+ minutes for my order only to get a burger I didn't ask for.  Aside from that, the cashier obviously didn't know how to ring me up properly as I paid more than I usually did for my burger.  Refusing to accept my wrong order, I waited an additional 10-15 minutes, which should've been the reasonable length of time in the first place, for the correct order.

Now, in their defense, it was a busy day, and I understood having to wait 30 minutes, however, the overcharging and mistaking of the order was reproachable.  And if it was up to me, this review would be 4.5 stars.  Don't get me wrong, this place is unrivaled when it comes to burgers, just beware of eating here on a busy day.
author: Eric C.

description: Good to great burgers, nice atmosphere, hip in all the ways that seem to be important right now.  Artisan is important, right?  How about handmade sodas?
author: Jeff P.

description: Good burgers, but service is a hit or miss. Usually they are friendly, the girl at the cashier was having a sh*tty day and decided to take it out on the people in line. I know, we all have bad days, but please don't take it out on your customers. It really sucks to be on the receiving end for no reason.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Finally a good burger joint in my 'hood!  This place really does a good business.  Their burgers are cooked to perfection, using the freshest ingredients.  I've only tried their plain burger, "The Classic."  I'm a classic kind of girl... :)  I love their homemade pickles!  My husband really likes their BBQ burger.  Also, their sweet potato fries are the best we've ever had!  

There's also a couple of cute boys working there... not that I'm looking, considering I'm a married woman!  

Bottom line:  I will return and I highly recommend this place.
author: Jade F.

description:
Just left Roam Artisan Burger and was quite impressed.

When you enter - to the right side on the wall is the detailed menu listing all of the burgers, sides and beverages. Otherwise, straight ahead is the cashier - where you order and are handed a number where your food will be delivered after finding a place to sit. I sat at the bar - with the large flat screen tv showing ESPN.

Overall I had the Pacific Blue Burger for $8.25 with Blue Cheese, Watercress, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Steak Sauce on a house made veggie patty. The burger was spot on and an exceptional value!

I had the: Sweet Potato Fries $3.49 also which were tasty - and a Boylan Bottling Co. Diet Cola for $2.49. Overall out the door for a burger, fries and a coke it was $15.90 - however the burger was everything I was hoping for!
author: Brian D.

description:
Delicious burgers (huge).  Definitely have to come before the lunch or dinner rush as it is first-come-first-serve seating.  It's helpful to come in pairs so your dining partner or you can snag a table the minute it becomes available (or stalk people paying their tabs).  

I had the French and Fries burger on beef and would recommend it to anyone that goes.  Like other reviews suggest, ordering the burger medium (at least when ordering beef) is the way to go.

Outdoor seating is great, especially if you can grab a table that is not leaning or otherwise has your food sliding off of it.  

Just noticed that online ordering and pickup is available so will have to try that out the next time I have a hankering for a delicious burger.
author: Natalie G.

description:
This is a very good Roam--especially compared to the one on Union which is just a tiny bit too crazy and busy for its own good.

Both sweet potato and regular fries are killer, and their salad is pretty good also.

They have a side-veggie which works if you don't think you are getting in enough. (The menu is a little fried-heavy when it comes to the veggies though, walk in with expectations managed.)

Their veggie burger is definitely killer--reminds me of the quinoa-beet mixture you used to get at the old Houston's on the Embarcadero. Tasty!

It's also cool how in the warmer months they keep the window open so you can just stare out on Fillmore street and see what's going on.
author: Paul C.

description: Wow. One of the best burgers I've had in SF.  I usually order the Pacific Blue with the sweet potato fries with truffle Parmesan and it never disappoints!! The beef for the burgers are 100% grass fed, so you can scarf down a whole burger and not feel like complete crap afterwards ---- SCOOOOORE!!
author: Kathleene E.

description:
Always a great food experience.  
The turkey burgers and veggies burgers are delicious.

Their seasonal veggie sides are always off the charts.

Casual and quick.  Highly recommend!
author: Paul H.

description: I've heard tons of hype about Roam and finally decided to try it. Look, I'm from Texas and I KNOW good burgers.. And although this burger wasn't bad it definitely wasn't worth the long wait. Sweet potatoe fries were also overly salted, which is a sin because it's the sweetness I adore, not the added handfuls of salt. Last note, please don't call a burger "Tejano" when there is no spice factor. Very misleading.
author: May G.

description:
Incredible decoration. Incredible service. The prices are perfect.

Above all of these factors, the hamburgers they sell, along with their fries and shakes are nothing less than unbelievable. 

Nothing beats a burger, and in burgers nothing beats this place.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Checked out this place tonight based on Yelp reviews and I'm so glad we did! Ordered the Tejano burger, which has pepper jack cheese, jalapeno relish, avocado and tortilla strips. Husband ordered the Sunny Side burger which came with a fried egg, cheddar,  caramelized onions and sweet Chili Sauce was fantastic! We also split the Fry-Fecta, which is a combo platter of their regular fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini onion haystack. The haystack was our favorite of the bunch. 

The place has a very cool vibe and the staff is super friendly. I could totally see this becoming one of our top local hangouts.

Can't wait to go back and try all the other burgers on the menu, not to mention their fabulous-sounding shakes with a toasted marshmallow on the top!
author: Tara M.

description: We loved this place! helped to make out trip to SF a hit. I had 3 teenagers with us and they all asked to go back the next day.
author: Autumn T.

description:
Great grass-fed burgers with organic ingredients and reasonably priced are really hard to find in the City. Roam was overall a pretty good burger and dining experience!

Hubby and I were craving burgers but not in the mood for the hour long wait at for our favorite burger and fries at NOPA.  He had driven by Roam before so we decided to give it a try.  He had the Tejano burger and I had the BBQ burger...both beef.  We also ordered the sweet potato fries, regular fries and brussel spouts...yes we are serious pigs and finished every last bite.

The burgers were both cooked perfectly and juicy.  The fries were served hot and crispy on the outside.  The highlight of the meal was honestly the brussel sprouts.  They were a perfect lemony flavor and had a nice kick of heat from the red pepper chili flakes and nice and salty from the Parmesan...delicious...a must try!

It was crowded when we went but since there is no table service, the turn over is pretty quick and we didn't have any problems getting a table.  If you have a large party, that could be an issue but this is perfect casual date night spot!

A week later, we were craving burgers again and called ahead and ordered burgers to take home on our way home from work.  This time I had the Tejano and my hubby had the Heritage...hubby said the Heritage was his favorite so far.  The fact that we have gone back again says a lot.

Good job Roam, definitely worth the try!
author: Susan P.

description: So I had the sunny side up with a veggie patty and the fry fecta. So. Damn. Good. Get a brew to match and you'll wonder why you hadn't had it sooner.
author: Richard M.

description:
other than at hillstone/los altos grill, this is the best veg burger i've had.  it's actually similar to the one at hillstone restaurants, b/c it has rice in it, but the roam burger also has beets, which is similar to the one at plant organic.  however, it's much better than the one at plant (which everyone seems to love), b/c it's not as mushy and doesn't fall apart as easily.

i got the tejano w/ veg patty, and the toppings are all great.  to drink, i got a housemade meyer lemon soda, which tasted like the lemon sodas you get at vietnamese restaurants.  

i can't wait to eat here again.
author: Helen T.

description:
Decided to try something new in SF, very happy with this place for sure!! Love the layout, how you order the food and they bring it to your table...casual but still awesome. The drinks are amazing, great start to the meal. Got the french and fries burger and it was great, LOVE the caramelized onions...can't get any better than that. Also tried the turkey burger & added cremini mushrooms, also DELICIOUS.  You know that feeling when you finish your meal and you're satisfied but not overly full? This place will give you that, and much  much more. 

Gave it 4 stars, I really think the burgers should come with fries. Aslo, the brussel sprout dish was amazing but the dish lacked actual brussel sprouts...about 5 or 6 brussel halves and a plate full of  leaves...delicious though. 

Overall, such a great SF place. Love the atmosphere, workers, patrons, location and most of all food. Definitely going back.
author: Julia B.

description: Yummy homemade veggie burger patty - beet + quinoa. Tasted very healthy but good at the same time. Had it in the Tejano style - the corn strips gave it a nice crunchy texture and the avocado is always a tasty addition to a burger. Also tried the fry-fecta: enjoyed the potato fries and sweet potato fries, but the onion and zucchini strings seemed a bit oily to me. The blue bottle coffee milkshake was a good complimentary sweet pairing with the otherwise savory meal. Will be back again to try the other styles of burgers!
author: Malika R.

description: Overrated. My $6 strawberry milkshake was too sweet and too artificial tasting. The burger was WAY too salty, so was the potato fries. The place was dirty with napkins on the floor while no one bother to clean up. Waitress had attitude, she spilled beer on the floor and didn't even bother to apologize. Go to Super Duper burger instead if you want a good burger.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Great place to grab a quick bite to eat! The veggie burgers here are yum and I love the fries!! If you want something light the salad is delicious and they have the option to add 3 mini patties for protein, but beware the salad is HUGE!!! So bring your appetite! Also , what really makes this place special is the hipster menu very classic to San Francisco, including kombucha, the option for bison beef, artisan soda, and of course blue bottle coffee!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Tried the sunny side beef burger and fry-fecta.  Given the name, I was expecting the egg to be cooked sunny side up and the yolk to be runny, but it turned out to be fully cooked.  The burger was good but it got really greasy and mushy towards the end.  Also wasn't a fan of the zucchini onion haystack.  They were too too thin and didn't taste like much.  If I ever get it again, I'll probably try throwing it into my burger.
author: Tina L.

description: Classic place to go when you feel like some unhealthy food on a Sunday while not having to get all cute to go out...at least thats how I roll when I come here! Great burgers, amazing truffle fries, fair prices. I also really love the open windows and decor inside, but, beware, bathrooms were gross. Plain or herb fries are OK - definitely upgrade to truffle. Wish they had more dipping sauce choices for fries like pesto or garlic aioli.
author: Alexis T.

description:
Went here on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving with 2 friends. Given it was a holiday and this city generally clears out for holidays, I thought it would be pretty empty. Not to be, place was packed. Probably folks trying to get their eat on before they get their drink on.

Food: Barbeque style Bison burger. Bison burger is definitely worth the extra $2.75? Just to give it a shot, and, after all, this isn't your average quick-fix burger spot, so why not splurge. Thought the burger was really, really good if not a little small. Then again, I am large, so that probably had something to do with it.

Truffle parmesan fries are really, really good as well. Not worth getting more than an order of them for the table as the taste will wear on you after a bit, you're best off getting a mix of fries for the table (recommend the sweet potato as well).

Drink was a cola, they have a bottled cola, I didn't read or recognize the brand. Solid.

This place blows most burger spots in SF out of the water. 

Gave it 4 stars because I've been to Roam a few times and getting seating has always been a bit troublesome, and I'm not a huge fan of long-table seating (when smaller individual tables are taken); plus it's kind of a clusterfuck, given some people seem to not be sure who has been waiting the longest.
author: Dev S.

description: A pretty damn good burger. For those of who have tried My Father's Office and Umami burger in LA, that's what I would say rates as a five star burger. This isn't quite that, but it's close enough. The selection is pretty fun and the fries were solid. Next time I may try a milkshake.
author: Baron C.

description: Kid friendly environment with yummy melt in your mouth burgers. If you love blue cheese the Pacific Blue burgers amazing! Was a lil pricey but my tummy had no complaints.
author: MB H.

description:
Glad Johnny Rocket's is gone across the street- probably due to this place (though Johnny Rocket's had good milkshakes and atmosphere was fun).

The fries here are good- crunchy/crispy how you want them to be, and the burgers are pretty good also.  Nice that the options are a little healthier; turkey burger, bison, beef, and i think they had Ostrich as well.

I had the heritage on a whole wheat bun w a turkey burger - can't quite remember what was on it, other than bacon, but it was pretty good.

Give it a try.
author: Dan S.

description:
A must try burger place!  Drove up here from san jose on a weekday just to try it.
I don't recall the burger I had, but it had a fried egg and sweet chili sauce.  Simply delicious! Also had the fry trifecta, the sweet potato fries were the best I've had anywhere.  The Portions were perfectly sized, and the service was fast.  Can't wait to get back here again.
author: Ram R.

description: Lovely Bison double burger! Keeps you full whole day:)
author: Ali E.

description: Very good burger, but I have had better (see 7X7's list of top 10 SF burgers). The most amazing thing here was actually not the burger, but the milkshake. Delicious. They have different flavors and you can get a burnt caramel on top. The problem is, you might be too stuffed after your burger and fries for the milkshake, so you may have to choose just one - burger or milkshake. I would argue for the milkshake.
author: Jason B.

description: I am a very picky burger eater and I actually really liked this place.  My burger was great and I also ordered the gluten free bun. I always worry if the buns aren't made by Mariposa which in my opinion is the best, but it was still pretty good.  The prices are great for what you get and love that they have Kombucha.  The staff was great, the place is really nice, and conveniently located.
author: Coraly S.

description: I've given Roam burger plenty of tries so this is not a one time, one experience review.  For myself a good buger consists of well seasoned meat (I can attest to this, one time I just ate the meat and it tasted like cardboard), a sturdy bun, good toppings, and being able to take a bite without everything inside spilling onto the plate.  Roam burger consists of one of these, good toppings.  The staff is also not very friendly as mentioned in other posts.
author: Brandon A.

description: Elk Burger and Sweet Potato Fries = Amazing!
author: Mark K.

description: Not happy with the management. They were in such a hurry to clean tables, that they splattered ketchup on my new tennis shoes. Didn't offer anything. So I asked to see the manager.At which time he said he would give me a gift card. Come to find out, he said, there was ten dollars on it. When in fact there was only five. Totally, lied to me. Any nice restaurant would pay for your meal or compinsate you in some way.  Beside, to expensive. They were jerks. I won't go back.
author: Karen G.

description:
I biked here to meet a friend for lunch.  While the extensive options from meats to sauces to condiments intriques a hamburger enthusiast,  I was underwhelmed by their other offerings.  I ordered an elk burger sunny side,  where my only gripe was a slightly dry ( though expected)  patty that was otherwose very well seasoned. The friea were perfectly fried,  but was spoiled by over seasoning,  leaving me thirsting for water.  

Lastly I had a Blue Bottle Coffee Shake.  It tasted like coffee,  though it lacked strong flavor. And I cannot say 14oz was justified for the price.
author: Jason N.

description: I've been here twice, both times when I've been really in the mood for a burger. First time I got French and Fries, and the second time I just got the class (both times had a Turkey patty).. Thought they were both great, really filling. Service was nice, wasn't too crowded either time I went (Wed/Thurs evening).. def worth checking out at least once!
author: Sam U.

description: Roam is my ish... Order the classic double turkey with aged cheddar and fryfecta on the side. Wash it all down with an Allagash White and eat like a baws!
author: Marky E.

description: I ordered 2 classic burgers, 2 fries, and 2 side salads to go.  They were ready w/in 15 min which was great.  But by the time I got home( 5 min away ), it was a sloppy mess! The burgers were soggy and raw! GROSS. French fries and side salad were both good. $35 seemed like a waste. I wish they would pack-up their burgers appropriately and ask you how you would like your burger cooked!!!
author: Honest Y.

description: My family and I agree, this is THE BEST burger in SF. Always consistent, always tasty, Roam Burger does a great job, and I find I have yet to tire of it week after week.
author: Elena B.

description:
I can't recommend this place enough!

I've been to the Union location but prefer the one on Fillmore because it's less busy and the burgers don't look as messy in my opinion. You order at the counter and receive a table number and a waiter brings out the food to your table. The hardest part is finding a table and I found myself hovering over people who are about to leave, waiting to snag their table. The ambiance is relaxed but loud and I felt like I had to strain my voice to talk with my friend. The napkins, fork and knife, and water are at a condiment bar off to the side of the restaurant.

The first time I went I ordered a Bison (add $2.99) Sunny Side burger (organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, and sweet chili sauce). There was a lot going on in the burger so I couldn't really taste the difference of a Bison patty but the burger as a whole was really good. I had to use a fork and knife after a few bites though because it got super messy with the egg yolk. I also ordered the sweet potato fries but the waiter seemed to have forgotten so after waiting until about halfway into my burger, I reminded the waiter and he promptly brought it out. My friend ordered the Blue Bottle Coffee shake and declared it the best thing he's ever had.

My second time here I got the Beef French and Fries burger (truffle parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, and dijon mustard) with no gruyere cheese. French fries inside a burger? Best idea ever. Since I already had fries, I ordered the "seasonal veggies" which was Brussels sprouts with chili flakes, lemon, and Parmigiano Reggiano and it was DELICIOUS. It was hot, salty, crispy, lemony, spicy, and definitely exceeded my expectations. It was so good I'm going to try and recreate it at home. My friend ordered the sweet potato fries and I had some of hers yum.

The burgers are the prefect size and fill you up without weighing you down. Although a bit pricey, the food is so worth it. It's also unique to have patty options such as turkey, bison, and elk.
author: Bommy C.

description: Lacey talked me into an awesome bbq burger.  100% grass fed beef.  The shake was absolutely amazing as well.  If I had a complaint which is very minor it would be that everyone in the place wasn't as dedicated to service as Lacey and the buns were sesame seed.  A dry attitude makes a dry burger. Nobody likes a dry burger... Lol
author: Derrick C.

description: Easily the best veggie burger I ever had. The Classic. I wish I could have eaten two of them. Very fast service, friendly. Delicious.
author: Tim D.

description:
Out of all the burger places I've tried, this would definitely have to be my favorite. It hurts my wallet but I'm always satisfied. No matter what it's almost always packed. It's difficult to get seating (or even find a place to stand while waiting for your take out order) unless you come during slightly slower times. (Typical of most Filmore restaurants though). 

Everything that I've tried on their menu is DELICIOUS: 
- The Classic: You can't go wrong. (Though I highly suggest trying one of their more unique burgers the first time).
- French and Fries: Had this one after my dental appointment...still devoured the whole thing. Their truffle fries are really good, so having it in their burger too = A+
- Sunny Side: Definitely heavy, but this was the first burger I tried here. Love at first bite. "Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce"
