- Heritage: Bacon + their herb mayo sauce! My second favorite. 
- Sweet Potato Fries: Just your typical SPF. Would recommend sticking with the truffle fries or get the Fry-Fecta to get more bang for your buck.
- Zucchini Onion Haystack: Most of the time I just want classic fries as a side, but these are really addicting. 
Hazelnut shake: This was a special the day I went so it's not on their regular menu. I was deciding whether or not to get it since I'm not a huge shake person and it was pretty pricey. But so worth it! The portion is a lot smaller, but you can definitely taste the quality difference. I'm excited to try their other flavors.
author: Jenny C.

description: Great gourmet burgers, including bisen and elk, in comfy environment.  Salad is fresh and delicious. Fries are good but a little salty for me. Their vegetable dish is seasonal ..my favorite is the Brussels sprouts! Even their sodas are unique! Friendly and efficient service. I take out of towners there (foreigners) for their American burger fix and they love it.
author: Maggie M.

description:
Good Burgers, Good Atmosphere, and Polite Staff. 

Get the Tejas Burger. Soo Good. 

Love the look of the place.
author: Daniqua J.

description:
12.11.18    2nd Visit
12.10.00     1st Visit

Food           3 1/2 - 4 Stars




1st  Elk Burger w extra patty
      - patty are already thick ... extra patty is overkill ... ending up 6+ inches tall!
      - wanted medium rare ... sigh ... did not see any red part ...
                   lean meat cooks fast
      - buns have nice grilled residue pickup
      
Blood orange soda was pretty good

Trifrica ... I would pass ... too much oily products ... the too skinny 
                  zucchini and onions that you cannot taste the product except the
                  batter


2nd visit

Original w everything and white cheddar.
         - Damn it .... medium rare came slightly past that point.
                     could be that they are swamped every Sunday I visit the place.

The pineapple soda was good
author: S.K. Y.

description: This place is easy, tasty and solidly gets the job done. I have now eaten their veggie burger several times (at 2 different locations) and it has not disappointed. The meat (turkey, bison and beef) for their burgers is sourced with better than average standards in mind and the remainder of their ingredients are touted to be local and sustainably sourced. It's packed on weekends and during the lunch hour b/c it's yummy and the price point is fair. It's a casual and fun environment.
author: Sandy G.

description:
Really impressed with these burgers! Very tasty ingredients, even the tomatoes!
Amazing sweet potatoe fries. I only wished they had a better value, pity they don't have menus...
author: Exalt V.

description: I've come to the conclusion that you are paying for an expensive zip code and the word Artisan in the name of the restaurant. The last time I was there, I walked away with a $23 lunch by myself that was just ok. I've given this place a few tries and every time walk away feeling the same.  Lets face it you came here for the burgers, so how are they you might ask? They are alright. Not great, not amazing, not incredible. There are fancy meats, great selection of burger types, several different kinds of fries and a good selection of drink options. But in the end the burgers are just decent, nothing more. Definitely not worth $23 for lunch for just me and all I had was a burger, fries and a beer.
author: C F.

description: The buffalo burger is a little on the dry side,  or maybe its suppose to be like that.  The sweet potato or yam fries is just way over cooked,  almost burnt.
author: Erik Y.

description: I love a good burger! And Roam burger definitely delivers. It was kind of expensive because you had to order any extras (fries, etc) separate. But their sweet potato fries were amazing! Came here on a Saturday evening and it was pretty busy. We luckily found a table right away but it was a little tight and on the louder side. Besides all that, the burger was delicious! It's pretty cool that they have different types of meat/patties to choose from. I would definitely recommend it and can't wait to go back again!
author: Rikki B.

description: I was surprised by these burgers. I ordered the tejan, and wow between the mild spicy flavor, tortilla chips, and the packed burger I devoured the burger without a moment to waste. The place is amazing, and the beer selection matches the burgers pretty well. Also, tried the parmesan cheese fries and sweet potato fries, they were pretty good but I would recommend to stick with the burgers.
author: Sasan J.

description:
What's with me and Burgers? How did I get like this? Will my Burger fascination ever subside and dissipate? Or will I always be a self proclaimed Burger Connoisseur and Burgermeister? Burger Joint, Burger Shack, Burger Stand, Burger Truck, Burger Barn I shall try them all with no second guessing and hesitation. I shall make a u-turn if I stumble across a worthwhile intriguing Burger restaurant. Which is exactly what happened as I was cruising through the Fillmore/Lower Pacific Heights neighborhood of San Francisco one beautiful sunny day.

Roam Artisan Burgers is what I saw driving down Fillmore and that's what enticed me to make a u-turn and find parking. As I'm walking up it's getting better and better. While reading it's Mission Statement and researching Roam Artisan Burgers I find out.....100% grass-fed beef which is rich in omega 3's, freshly ground never frozen. Beef, Bison,Turkey are on the menu. Pickles are made in-house. House-made veggie burgers are organic, gluten free and vegan. Artisan Burger Buns made fresh daily and delivered by a local bakery. Fries cooked in Rice Bran Oil. House-made sodas are sweetened with low-glycemic agave nectar, Shakes are made with organic ice cream or organic non-fat frozen yogurt. Wine on tap eliminates waste and allows for a barrel to glass experience. Various beers on tap and bottle. Their menu items contain no corn syrup, no hormones, no antibiotics, and no added trans fat.  Wow. That's pretty awesome!!

As we enter this beautiful, clean, sleek, modern Burger establishment I glance at the menu on the wall, place our orders, get a number and seat ourselves. Since we came at such a good time, the place was not packed at all. Fast forward fifteen minutes there's a line starting to form while tables are being occupied one by one. Being that I was in the midst of a quality burger restaurant I stepped my game up and ordered the "Heritage Burger", which consists of Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, and Herb Mayo with the option of a traditional sesame seed bun, whole grain bun, gluten-free bun, or lettuce wrap. I opted for the traditional sesame seed bun and a organic strawberry shake. The Heritage burger was fantastic. Big burger with big flavor. Savory and succulent with no overkill on the lettuce and tomatoes. Caramelized onions and herb mayo just took the burger to another level. The organic strawberry shake paired with the heritage burger was like a match made in heaven. One of the best strawberry shakes I've ever had. Hard to explain the shake other than it just taste super fresh with an aftertaste that had you craving for more. Ordered the trio of fries a.k.a the  Fry-Fecta  "Traditional, Sweet Potato, and Onion fries". All fries were Delicious.

Roam Artisan Burgers has their original location over on Union St. which I'm sure is just as awesome as their Fillmore location. Without a doubt a solid quality "Burger Joint" that will rival any top Burger restaurant with an outstanding price point.  Fresh organic ingredients, innovative burger combinations with a welcoming inviting atmosphere in a hip cool neighborhood. You can not go wrong while dining at Roam.
author: Alastair G.

description: I came here with my cousin when she was in town visiting.  Roam serves great burgers, however I think that the wait to sit down is like a game of survival.  You have to hover around unsuspecting people in order to get a table otherwise your best bet is to eat at home.  I was turned off because not only was it hard to find parking, but it was hard to find a table to sit down at!  I was also told that they have an unwritten rule where I cannot hover and claim a table until after I receive an order number...
author: Mary N.

description: Delicious through & through I've only had several visits but I've been hooked from the start. Unique style of burgers that you can't get anywhere else. Can get very pricey but worth every dollar spent
author: Joe L.

description: Quite the popular spot! I wanted to try a burger here for a while and was not disappointed. We walked in around 7 and the place was packed (usually a good sign). I made my own burger (avacado, bacon, and other amazing stuff). For two burgers, a beer and one of their house made sodas (delicious), the bill came to just under $35. A little expensive for a burger place, but I think it was worth it. Will definitely be back
author: Tyler L.

description: My friends and I came here on a saturday night around 7pm. Needless to say this place was packed! We decided to grab a drink nearby before we decided to partake. I got the elk burger sunny side style. The elk meat was juicy, kinda sweet and just a tad bit gamey which made it even better if you ask me. We also got the Fry Fecta which was ok I guess. I only liked the zucchini and onion haystack and the sweet potato fries. The place is kind of a zoo though. The seating is first come first served and some people aren't the most... considerate. There's a giant communal table in the middle and with such a space, you generally have to take up every spot as to skip a seat for a bit of personal space. I guess that concept escapes a lot of people. Anyways, the burgers are great and I definitely will come back and try the BISON burger mmmmm.
author: edward k.

description: Two words: Fry Fecta. It's a combo of all three fries: russet, sweet potato, and zucchini onion. And then there are the burgers, which are all juicy and full of flavor. We had to be firm about holding our spot in line for a table because it got a little crowded and confusing, but it wasn't a big deal. I would recommend this place.
author: Ashley E.

description: 2 stars for having gluten free options. Minus 1 star for employees displaying bad attitudes during both of my visits, minus 2 stars because both the veggie patty and the bison patty just plain taste bad. Overpriced.
author: janis t.

description: It was ok, but nothing special at all. I would much prefer Five Guys or better yet Umami Burger. The space is nice and I really wanted to like the food, but sadly the burger was just not delicious. Ok if you are in the neighborhood and craving quick american food, but I would not suggest making a special trek out here.
author: Natasha F.

description: After hearing my daughter and her French boyfriend rave about this place, I decided to try it last night.  I found a parking space out front and did not have to wait in line to order - probably because it was near closing time.  I ordered the classic turkey burger, zucchini onion haystack, and salted caramel milkshake.  The burger was one of the best that I have had, but the zucchini onion haystack was kind of greasy.  The salted caramel milkshake was so delicious that I can't wait to go back for another one, however, it is pretty pricey ($6.99), especially for the size.
author: Louise H.

description: Decent burger. I loved the bacon on my heritage. Nice flavor. The burger was almost worth the terrible service. Even when only three quarters full, the staff buckles under pressure. Orders slow down and staff gets snippy. I'll give them time to setting into a better routine and try again.
author: Bob R.

description: Super good, organic burgers made the way you want. I chose the free range turkey burger option with applewood smoked bacon. Also had their house fries and added a truffle parmesan topping...rounded it off with an amazing chocolate coconut milkshake and I am now a happy man.  Had to dock a star because I feel like the girls that work here could be a little more welcoming. All in all, a great experience.
author: Chris C.

description: My favorite burger place in the city. Tejano burger with bison is my go to burger there. Hazelnut shake is also amazing as well as the truffle fries.
author: Jay G.

description: I totally love this place. The burgers are amazing. It's my goal to try them all. I'm almost there. The black currant kombucha is  divine!! Go there. Get the sweet potatoes fries with the chipotle maple glaze and the sunny side buffalo burger. So yummy. I take all my friends when they are visiting me in SF.
author: Melissa T.

description: Mmmmm this place is so perfectly ridiculous amazing. Burgers that taste like pretty and won't make you question if you'll instantly die from grease. And the shakes don't have crazy amounts of sugar in them so you don't feel sick after. The fryfecta is a perfect combo. Yum. I'm craving it all while I type..
author: Kristina B.

description: I really like this place.  They took a while to bring out the food which told me that they were actually putting care into preparing it, which was clear from the freshness and crispness of the ingredients.  It was surprisingly filling.  I've been to many burger joints and many often don't do the trick.  This one does.  The staff is very professional.  I've also had their low-carb burger on lettuce in addition to their classic.  Excellent.  I can't wait to try their buffalo and elk (the elk might be a temp special).
author: Marc M.

description: You can never go wrong with Roam. The beef tejano burger is my favorite in town. Also love the sweet potato fries.
author: Eric R.

description: Sub-par burger but really excellent regular fries and super awesome milkshakes and drinks. Both my burger and my date's burger were meh, I had the BBQ burger, the oil and vinegar slaw was excellent but the bbq sauce was not. Date had the heritage burger and he shrugged when I asked him what he thought of it, not impressed. So as far as burgers go, I'd take a super duper or an umami burger over roam any day. But now the fries and the drinks are another story, especially the drinks. We had the Fry-fecta and the sweet potato fries were ok, not crisp enough in my opinion. The onion-zuke string fries were a great textural addition to the burgers, but on their own they fell flat in terms of flavor. The regular french fries were amazing though, we got them parmasan-truffled, so good! But honestly if I'm not impressed with the burger I probably won't come back for fries either, but I could very easily see myself stopping by for a hazelnut shake or a carmelized pineapple soda which were both amaaaaazing. I'd definitely give this place another shot, but maybe i'll just build my own burger next time and just order regular fries.
author: Alison T.

description: I keep trying new places in my quest for the ever better burger, but in the end I come back to Roam. I get the classic with LT, perfect pickles and special sauce, husband gets the spicy, crispy Tejano. The fries are spectacular with just the right crunch and salt. But skip the French and Fries burger - as appealing as truffle parmesan fries in your burger may sound, this mustardy, overtopped burg has too much going on.
author: Cecilia L.

description: This is a really great place! I'm always skeptical of the "fancy burger joints," but their food is the real deal. They have some quality meats, their sides are inventive, and their combinations are endless. For sure get the bison burger...it will blow your damn mind. I really wish more place had bison meat as an option, so kudos to Roam for figuring this out. I also highly recommend their zucchini onion haystack.
author: M G.

description: Yummy juicy customizable burger. The bad thing about the options is your burger can get pretty pricey pretty fast. My cost $9.25 pre-tax.  Go for the bison meat, there is an interesting indescribable flavor compared to beef. However, there is an $2.99 extra charge. The truffle parmesan fries was delish. My friend got the Nocciola, which was like drinking Nutella. Yummy, but a bit too rich for me. Just skip the caramelized pineapple soda, there was no taste to it.
author: Erica B.

description: I absolutely adore Roam. The milkshakes are incredible, but they have hands down the best fries in town.
author: C B.

description:
Probably my favorite burger in San Francisco. And they make the BEST milkshakes. Try the Nutella one, and you can order it in a kid's size which I find to be plenty enough. Such good truffle fries too. But I went through a phase where I was calling them about 2-3 times a week to place a pickup order for the brussels sprouts. I was ordering two sides of brussels sprouts and eating it like it was in fact, a juicy burger...

Then I found out those spicy, lemony roasted brussels sprouts were merely a SEASONAL MENU ITEM. And they switched it to another vegetable. It felt like someone had ripped out my heart and replaced my heart with sub-par squash. It's okay though bc I taught myself how to make those brussels sprouts at home and they taste pretty close to the Roam burger ones. 

Oh yeah, burgers. I recommend the bacon burger with pepper jack .
author: Ashley T.

description: What originally caught my eye about Roam Artisan Burgers was that they serve Elk. I was also very interested in their Fry-Fecta too. We came here on a Thursday night. Parking was a bit hard to find so we circled around the blocks for 10-15 minutes at least. :( We shared the Fry-Fecta fries. Unfortunately, I did not try the Elk Burger that night and instead had the Heritage Burger. The Heritage Burger came with applewood smoked bacon, fontina, butter lettuce, tomato, caramelized onions, and herb mayo. It was such a huge burger! Burger was cooked just right and the bacon was crunchy and delicious! Burger was really juicy. What I didn't really like was that it was pretty oily and greasy... I felt very messy. :( Anyways, the Fry-Fecta comes with Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and Zucchini Onion Haystack. Definitely sharable. I loved the Zucchini Onion Haystack! (But I had to eat that with a fork.) Fries were all crispy and not too salty. Overall, I think Roam Artisan Burger is a pretty good burger place in San Francisco. I do want to come back to try their Blue Bottle Coffee Shake and the Elk Burger one day.
author: Philana C.

description: not bad but...not the place to come if you have a MAN SIZED hunger for a burger. Kinda pricey too. Ive had better but I think they deserve better than 2 stars.
author: Mario W.

description:
Had their classic burger and veggie burger. The classic burger was "meh". Kinda small and not satisfying. It was definitely not a "gourmet" burger. The veggie burger was interesting, had a pleasant kick to it, but it was way too soggy. Half way through the burger I realized my entire bread bun was soaked. Maybe there is too much oil in it. The taste was good though.

The try-fecta was so-so. The sweet potato fries were good, so were the regular fries, but the zucchini part was too greasy. They are cut too small (skinny), so you end up with just the fried stuff.
author: CatsPjs Z.

description: Best burger place in San Francisco. only place where I can say medium rare and I will actually get medium rare. The fries are crispy and salty and just perfect. The pacific blue and the French and fry are the best burgers but all of them are delicious. Besides having amazing food the service and staff are wonderful. Fast service and he staff are all really friendly and start to remember you after going their a couple of times. Will defiantly return and recommend this place if you want delicious food and fast friendly service.
author: Anastasia R.

description: Good food, good atmosphere, good drinks. Only drawback is trying to find seating and typically dealing with a long line to order food. The wait is worth it though for a inexpensive, quick burger.
author: JP N.

description:
Finally.... a GREAT burger spot in the Cow Hollow/Union Street area!!! Service is friendly and quick! Try the turkey burger with anything, it will not disappoint! Also, the fries are perfect - not too greasy! Try their shakes too - they are creamy and tasty!
I love Roam! I could eat here every day if I could!  :)
author: Lisa F.

description: I've been here three times and my experience has gotten worse with each return. I probably will not return. I've had the bison burger and elk burger which were both unfortunately overcooked to well done. It might as well have been beef considering. They did not  ask how I wanted them cooked and had to ask. I did love the plant burger, fries, and shake with bruleed marshmallow though. The customer service in my opinion has also gotten worse. A hispanic guy who served us our food the last time I was there was rude when asked a question and unfriendly. No thanks.
author: C B.

description: This is a really cool place, actually. You order at a counter like a fast food restaurant, but you are seated and get served like a regular sit-down restaurant. I love that there's a station where you can get water and napkins yourself. I prefer the build-your-own burger option on their menu. You should probably know what you want before you reach the counter to order because the line literally goes out the door.
author: Courtney H.

description: I wanted to like this place, but it just sums up what I don't like about a lot of SF dining, people rave about it, but in the end you pay "a lot" and leave hungry. Our meal came to $35.00 and we got 2 kids hamburgers with about 10 fries and a drink. For a dollar more my husband and I each got a hamburger. NO FRIES!!! What the hell??!! Throw a few fries on my plate, man!!!!! So we had no drink and no fries and the hamburgers where decent, but not drop the plate good. I have had better hamburgers, try bills burgers. I will say that the vegetarian patty was one of the best I had. Add more to the plate and I would come again!!!!! Girl likes to eat!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had.  Egg on top is key.
author: Michael G.

description: Hands down the best veggie burger I've ever had! I work near here so I frequent this place and it never fails. A little pricey but you definitely get what you pay for!
author: Brooke W.

description: I have changed my mind a little bit because I got 'food poisoning' here and I'm not trying to say anything bad, but i am kind of afraid of getting sick and I don't go here too much anymore. The food is still good and all, but I am very cautious.
author: Alexandra A.

description:
Visited Roam tonight and got a veggie burger on a whole wheat bun with herb mayo and the regular fixins + egg and fries (in the burger). 

And it was DELICIOUS! My friend got the russet fries and I tried some and they were really good; I wish I'd gotten a full order for myself - well next time! 

The housemade ginger lime soda was okay - but I came for the burger and that was five-star!
author: Rahul A.

description: The Tejano burger was the bomb! White corn chips made it crunchy, lettuce was differently good and there's avocado to top it all off. Don't forget to get their sweet chili sauce to compliment the meat. You have an option to pick your meat but elk and bison are additional charge. Fries are good too. They mixed it with herbs. They look like garlic fries but they're regular. Overall, a lil pricey but it's worth it. Move over five guys. I'm goin to this one now.
author: Gino P.

description:
Best gluten free bun.  I thought maybe they made a mistake & give me a real bun.  Wow!  It was light & buttery. Not the typical gluten free dense & dry bun shaped eatable food stuff usually surrounding a burger I'm used to.

As far as the burger ... It was small, grass fed beef that was undercooked and just fine.  I didn't eat about 1/4 - 1/2 of it because it was undercooked for my taste.  Nothing special about the meat when compared to other great places in SF to get grass fed beef burgers. Not really tasty or flavorful.  And not a good price for what you get.  

You would think they would be really good at THE ONE THING THEY DO. I guess not.

Also had the brussell sprouts - they were good. 

The only thing that would have me go back is that gluten free bun. I would try some other meat to give it a chance- maybe the bison is better??
author: N A.

description: Fantastic burgers! Fantastic artisan sodas! Average fries. But let's talk about how there's nowhere to sit in there, so watch tables like a hawk for any sign of movement, or else they'll end up serving you your food while you're standing in the middle of the room.
author: Megan W.

description: Roam serves up excellent burgers & fries at reasonable prices in a pleasant, artfully lighted order-at-the-counter restaurant. They get crowded at times, but table turnover is generally fairly brisk. Try the trifecta fries and any burger - the default is a perfectly cooked medium-rare from sustainably raised, grass-fed beef, bison or elk. They offer artisan sodas, shakes, wine and other beverages as well as beer on tap; hard to beat the Boont Amber.
author: Jack And Barbra D.

description: First the douchebag at the counter yesterday in the plaid shirt greeted us with "Ready?" The restaurant was beyond filthy and the hamburger was overcooked. From my seat I was plaid boy was at the bar with a girl picking something out of her hand then helping customers. The salad was delicious but could not make up for the insanely rude first impression and beyond dirty tables and floor.  NEVER AGAIN!
author: William S.

description: The Heritage Burger was absolutely amazing.  I also recommend the sweet potato fries.  And the fact that all of the ingredients are locally sources you can't beat this, especially for the price.  Nice decor and speedy service too.  I wish Roam existed in Miami...
author: Jose Alberto F.

description: The Sunny Side burger with the housemade veggie patty is possibly the best thing I have ever eaten. I probably give out too many 5-star reviews and wish there was a special 6-star category that you could only use once a year. I would give it to Roam.
author: A O.

description: Feels bigger than the Union St location with the same great menu! Love the French and Fries topping on my burgers.
author: Natalie S.

description: Im always looking for a good burger. After hearing about it and seeing it on a cooking channel profile, I had to check it out. On our way to the Presidio, I decided to try calling. On hold for over 5 minutes. Call gets dropped while in the call, tried calling back, auto vmail. Argh! So I try using both and Iphone and Blackberry to order online and it's nearly as frustrating. We get there a few minutes before it's supposed to be done and then we wait. and wait. I see an order hit the back of the bar and sits there. Could that be mine? finally someone notices and brings it over. Problem is are drinks arent ready. So they have to make the shake and get the iced tea. Double argh. By the time we get to eat our food it's cold. Sigh. Now I guess if we were eating there it may have been a whole different experience but it doesnt seem like they have all their shite together. At least not the day I decided on a to go order.
author: Kim N.

description: the vegan burger is nice but not as good as the plant burger.  artisan sodas have great flavors but i always ask for extra syrup because otherwise it just tastes like sparkling water.  the zucchini haystacks are amazing and something i've never had anywhere else--super crispy and delicious!  the place is cute but kinda loud.
author: kate s.

description: Great burger and good service. A very pleasant experience. I had the French and Fries and it was great. The caramelized onions really are a nice touch.
author: Jason C.

description:
- food: underwhelming burgers (and a lot of bun)
- atmosphere: casual communal
- staff: adequate 
- price: expected

additional info:
- this place makes us miss Greenburgers
author: J. B.

description: I always get the sunny side burger with turkey meat and lettuce wrap. I found with the red meat it's too heavy. my hubby likes the buffalo burgers. their chocolate milkshakes are great too.
author: Win H.

description: Great Place! Friendly Staff.  Quick Service. Had a Sunnyside burger.  It was amazing the egg could have been cooked a little more. First bite I was covered in egg yolk.  :-/
author: Robert F.

description: We went to Roam on Union street a while back and I remember it being one of the best burgers I've ever had.  Today was a different story.  Maybe I came on an off day but my French and fries burger was really salty, my salted caramel shake tasted like vanilla, and the sweet potato fries were just alright.  My friend and bf seemed to enjoy their burger tho.  I'm gonna have to try it again on another day.
author: Christy A.

description: I haven't felt compelled to write a yelp review in years. My order was wrong on multiple levels (dangerously undercooked, wrong condiments, additions paid for not provided) and was slapped down in front of me by someone who was literally running to move on to something else. I'm sympathetic because this place is so busy and crowded that the employees have no choice but to rush - and as a result mistakes can get made. As far as the actual burger, it was solid, but not much better than my work cafeteria. The space is nice and the selection of craft beers is also good. Maybe it's better when it's slower.
author: Jason S.

description: Really good stuff. Very similar to umami burger except it looks like they're more creative. I got the elk burger with bacon. It wasn't a bad choice but I have trouble seeing much of a difference between the 2 restaurants.
author: Dirk C.

description: This place is awesome, especially being in close proximity to my apartment. The veggie burger is so damn delicious and perfectly portioned for me; I crave it constantly. It's an uncomplicated concept that executes burgers really well. The fries are great too. The milkshakes are not the best, but try one of their house-made sodas.
author: Sally S.

description: All my co-workers told me about this place. I must say it gets pretty packed! I got the Beef Tejano Burger, I took it to go since it was very pack in there barely anywhere to sit. I give it 3 stars because first the lady at the register seen there was 5 people behind me & they didn't have a 2nd person ringing up people .. when there was a PERSON BEHIND HER NEAR THE HALL ON THE PHONE.  2nd fail, I like my meat WELL-DONE, i did not know that this place gives it to you medium rare.. YUCKK. apparently this happen to my co-worker. I think they should of asked you at the register how we like our meat..right? Anywho there fries are delicious.. I will give this place a 2nd chance because there pretty good but this time i'm letting them know well done.
author: D M.

description: Decent burgers (I got elk) but nothing to write home about especially given the price....sheesh.... also got the zucchini and onion fried things.... that was a blah.... All you could taste was grease.
author: Lev E.

description: Ah yes, the food is awesome!  However, the hipster robots working the order stand are only programed for 60% accuracy.  And since they just _stare_ at you and then ask for money I would suggest that you ask them for a read back just to make sure things are correct.
author: Oliver T.

description: I had the Tejano burger and boy was it a party of flavors in my mouth! The meat was cooked the way a burger should be cooked ~ moist, slightly pink and gushing with flavor. The corn strips offered a nice crunchy bite and the herb ranch just enhanced every ingredient stacked within.  To jazz things up, I had the Fry-Fecta on the side which allows you to try all three different fries. Talk about delicious! I would definitely come back to Roam to try their other burgers.
author: Lynnie T.

description:
Burgers are delicious! They are cooked the way I like them (rare) and served pretty quickly. I haven't had a bad burger yet. The "fry-fecta" is really a great treat to share, with fries, sweet potatoes, and zucchini. But when I dine solo I go with the fries with the truffle parmesan. 

It can get crowded and loud during peck hours. A table can be hard to nab. The nice staff and good food make it all worth it.
author: Chanthi L.

description:
I had the fry and French turkey burger. The Carmelized onion and gruyere combo reminded me of French onion soup, avocado always makes everything better, and the truffle parm fries were surprisingly delicious on the burger. Yum. 

The triple fry thing was meh. It is crowded so peer pressure makes you want to eat and run. But great decor and yum food.
author: Nors P.

description: I had the turkey burger and my wife had the vegi burger, the vegi burger according to her was a 10+ best she has had she said.  The turkey burger was decent not bad not great if have it again though.  The fries with truffles on top were very good!!
author: Peter G.

description: Great burgers and great service !!! Totally recommend.  Very laxed and cool place for good food and great company.
author: Lanie D.

description:
I was in the area and I couldn't decide on a place to eat! Every other place I tried closed at 3! Finally I stumbled upon Roam Burger and I'm so glad that I did. 

I ordered the Pacific Blue, Hazelnut Smoothie, and the fry frecta. The pacific blue came with blue cheese and I have never tried blue cheese before so I thought I'd give it a shot. Apparently, I don't like it haha so I didn't like the blue pacific but that's my fault and I'm positive that their other burgers are amazing so I gotta come back and try the others. 

The hazelnut smoothie was AMAZING! It basically is a nuetella smoothie, you have to try it. It is a seasonal smoothie so hurry before they change it. 

The fry fecta was great. I couldn't decide on what fries to get so I thought I'd try them all. It was sweet potato fries, regular fries, and thin strings of fried onions. All of them were great! Definitely recommend getting the fry frecta.
author: Justin M.

description: Excellent burger! The bun had a crispness to it and just about had me in heaven! My friend tried the "French" styled burger (name of which escapes me) with the Bison.  It was served with spinach and truffled fries-DEE-LISH!  I had the BBQ styled burger-also quite good.  The sauce was not overbearing and just a small smathering of onions in it.  Seriously good burgers and though it is a pricier burger at about $10, it definitely is worth it's value!  Great beers on tap and the salad menu looks appealing, too. Casual atmosphere-walk up to the counter, sit down, and it is whipped up and served to you fairly shortly thereafter.  Apparently they have made a name for themselves since a coworker of mine had heard of it and attempted to try the one in the Marina, but the line kept him at bay.  I'm glad I stumbled upon this early on a weeknight-perfect eats!
author: Leslie W.

description: YUM! What a great addition to the neighborhood. Not only is the food excellent, the atmosphere is "classy rustic," the service is friendly, and the prices aren't annoying. I had a "create your own" burger with beef, the usual fixings, and house sauce on the side. It was delish. My husband had the "Tejano" with a veggie burger (choices are beef, turkey, bison, veggie and a special -- ostrich!) and he was licking his fingers. We shared the Fryfecta of all three types of fries -- a fun way to sample them all. Next time I'll be trying one of the Strauss Creamery ice cream shakes! An enthusiastic 5 stars - go try this great new spot! (It's also kid friendly -- there's a kiddie menu as well as crayons).
author: Molly P.

description: Great food excellent service BUT a little bit overpriced. I had the turkey burger with a side salad for $15
author: Trev C.

description: OMG try the battered air!!! Aka zucchini onion haystack... meh. Everything else was good enough.
author: Erin S.

description: best burger in the Filmore area...
author: Martin C.

description:
I dreamt of having a beet burger today when i was so hungry and i was almost going to plant organic caffe to get that. However, suddenly i remembered i always want to visit Roam burger at fillmore st. where i always passed by but i never had a chance to stop by. So finally today i ordered the classic veggie burger with gluten free vegan bun without knowing what's in it at all. So when it arrived at my table, WOW it's a beet burger! So my wish came true!! :D
It tasted pretty good, it's a just a lil' different than the one in plant organics cafe because the grilled beet patty was a lil easy to separate but it's still quite tasty. i was in emergency hungry so i ate it pretty messy. Sometimes a lil mess is what is all about right, it's the companion of pleasure i guess..:p
i ordered also sweet potato fries, and also onion zucchini haystack as sides. the sweet potato is pretty good, but i'm not a fave of the onion zucchini haystack, it's just too much flour and tasted pretty weird, i don't know it's just 3 dollar something but try it for yourself, see if you like it. I mean, what i don't like maybe it's a heaven to you who knows...
it's a casual place where there are a lot of communal table and you sit very close to other table. typical sf type.
it was always people when i was here, nonstop but i was lucky to gt a table with no hassle where my partner has to be in line paying the burger :) nice life eh...
i have a good experience here, the staff are normal and good. ambiance is casual. noise level is normal kind to loud noise.
the only minus experience here is, i forgot to ask since i was starving if they have really pure vegan/vegetarian oil when they cook it, where they cooked it. Was it the same grill with the meat? They have beef, chicken, elk, oh no, i might...:o Because they're not specialized vegan/vegetarian burger place, but they said in the menu that the bun is vegan. So after i got out from this place i got really skeptical if i'm going again or not because my palate was itchy afterwards. Usually if some food i ate has touched w/ oil or animal products, it will right away itchin'. I mean i'm a pretty flexible veggie person when it comes to eat, but i prefer my food not to be mixed with oil or grill from the meat before. So veg folks, i'm still unsure if i should recommend you to go here, unless the business make it clear that it's safe/pure method for vegetarian/vegan peeps.
author: Ms C.

description: Great burgers all the time I come here. Today I had Pacific w/ beef and I am giving 5 starts for it with no doubt.
author: Sergey A.

description: My wife and I enjoyed the French and fry turkey burger and BBQ beef burger. It's great you have the choice of meats and customize your burgers. Enjoyed the fry-fecta that comes with sweet potato fry, regular fries and fried zucchini and onions. Definitely come back to try the rest. Thumbs up!
author: Anthony C.

description:
Walked by this joint and decided to try it out base on awesome Yelp reviews.
Unfortunately, it was just ALRIGHT!
Got the Tejano burger and it was a bit dry and alright.. 
I think the picture looks way better than it tastes. 
The chick next to us ordered the salad and damn it looked tasty. I'll come back for the salad. 
Skip this joint and head over to Joe's Cable Car for a GOOD tasty burger.

What is up with these joints on Yelp with great reviews and mediocre food?????
author: tina M.

description: I was personally contacted by Roam to thank me for the constructive criticism of their BBQ burger, and asked to come back for a meal on them to make up for not meeting my expectations.  I was amazed by their customer service and genuine desire to make sure that they are staying on top of the burger world in SF.  I haven't spent my gift card yet, but I have been back since the first review.  I am looking forward to my third trip soon.  I tried the turkey ranch burger- super unique corn tortilla crisps on it.  Flavorful, not too rich.  Once again, salted carmel milkshake-brilliant.  I will give my original order a second try next time.  Thank you Roam for being so attentive to your patrons!
author: Veronica D.

description:
Excellent.  They could write The Book on how to do outstanding burgers in a Metropolitan setting.  If you're hungry and don't want anything fussy or slow, this is your place to stop.

Healthy, affordable, and good.
author: Emma G.

description:
had the sunny side burger and it was the best burger with egg I've ever had

it doesn't look big, but I could almost finish it, with my side of fries..almost...

it was so good..just the right amount of juice, flavour..
author: Whitne Y.

description: Pretty damn tasty. Order the Heritage
author: Dilly M.

description: My wife and I were looking for a place to get a burger when we stumbled upon this place. Overall we both really liked our burgers and the Fry-Fecta. The staff was also super friendly and helpful. Next time I visit San Francisco I would definitely go back.
author: Ryan B.

description: This place does burgers right! I got a Sunny Side with a beef patty, and it was amazingly delicious! A bit messy to eat as the bun was pretty soggy and add a result made the burger difficult to pick up, but it was more than worth the trouble (you can judge me for eating a burger with a knife and fork; I don't care). If only I had more time in SF... I would definitely come back to try more of their burgers!
author: Sarah B.

description: Finally tried Roam last night, excited to find a good burger place so close to home. And extra excited that they have a burger with a fried egg on top.  But after reading all of these rave reviews I was surprised at how average the burger was.  It had no flavor, was kind of mealy and ultimately the messiness just wasn't worth it.
author: Darren B.

description: Beef burger and fries were greasy. While the burger meat was well cooked, the greasy after taste was too much. Salted caramel shake was excellent. The caramel sweetly finished at the end if the sip.
author: Mei H.

description: This is our go-to easy dinner/pickup spot.  They can be a bit slow on take-out, so be prepared for that, but the food is good and consistent.  The veggie burger is pretty awesome, made with beets - I would say that's their star.  The salad is also surprisingly good.  Weirdly, the beers cost almost as much (or maybe the same?) as the burgers!
author: Nicole D H.

description: I have been to Roam's Union street location many times and have been eagerly awaiting their arrival on Fillmore street for months! I worked from home today specifically so that I could try the new location on their first official day. I have to say the burger was better than any burger I have ever had, including their Union street location. I would almost describe the experience as MAGICAL! Thank you for opening this location! It is a welcome addition to Fillmore street!
author: Wendy W.

description: Ridiculously good burgers and great value for money...... An SF staple, highly recommend
author: Craig T.

description: My friends took me to Roam Burgers because they said they loved their vegetarian patty even though they both eat meat.  I ended up getting a grass feed beef burger as I love beef burgers - I'm pretty loyal to In-N-Out, and I also got the parmesan truffle fries.  My friend got the maple fries and everything was great.  I totally forgot to get cheese, but even so the burger was juicy and delicious. - and I love cheese.  I was so surprised and impressed, and definitely look forward to the next time I come here...in fact I am craving one right now...
author: Sophia D.

description:
my friend freaking loves this place. and i think if i happened in i would have been pretty impressed. but seriously i listened to her talk about roam burger for two months, so maybe my expectations were unrealistically high.  and lets be real, its a burger place.  

it was super crowded for a sunday evening.  but went in and ordered the turkey burger and we split sweet potato fries.  i think my burger was undercooked.  it was so pink in the middle.  but the sweet potato fries were pretty freaking amazing.  seating was a little tight and tough to find.  and at one point we looked around, and we commented to each other that almost everyone in that joint looked exactly the same.  which sometimes happens anyway on fillmore.  

but, i would be back.  next time i will get the regular burger.  and ill even throw an egg on top.,..because apparently that is the thing to do.
author: Kierstan G.

description:
I don't want to give Roam a bad review, however, with all the competition out their in the burger world in SF, I was expecting better. I ordered the beef burger BBQ style and the russet fries with the Parmesan truffle seasoning. Fries were really good. Burger was not that great. The meat was good, but it was a skinny little burger. If you are real hungry get the double patty. it was cooked over medium, so if you like your burgers medium or under, I'm thinking you can ask, but they certainly didn't ask me when I ordered. The thing was overly-sauced, and it also had cole slaw on it, which was tasty, but I felt like the toppings almost took over the taste of the burger. By the time I got halfway through my burger, my bun was soggy from all the sauce. That was the deal breaker for me. 
I'm going to give Roam 3 stars instead of 2 for the seating. They have a open window in the front with a patio. Real great if it's sunny outside, and there are heaters, if you want to sit in the window, but it's cold. You are still good to go.
Roam isn't a terrible place to go, but with other burger places around that are killing it in my opinion, I will probably make a different decision next time I crave me a juicy burger.
author: Melanie L.

description:
Fast, friendly service, even though the place was packed, but you're not reading this for that.

I had been wanting to come here for a long time now. I got the lettuce-wrapped sunny side beef burger with steak sauce instead of the sweet chili, specifically cause I didn't want sweet stuff in my burger...Which was too bad cause the steak sauce was actually really sweet. But other than that it was pretty good! Not the best I've had, but for the price and quality, more than worth it. Definitely coming back to try the other burgers.

Oh, and the fries. If you're not a meat eater, I promise it'll be worth it to stop by just for the fries. I got the "Fry-Fecta" and split it with a friend. She said that usually one out of those 3-in-1 things is usually lackluster/meh compared to the other things, but with this, all three varieties were equally delicious in their own special way, and I completely agree.

The milkshakes and sodas also sounded really good...but I didn't have it in me to get it on top of fries and a burger.
author: Janice Y.

description:
Looking for the BEST burger joint in SF?  After a long walk over and around the Golden Gate bridge, we were....  I think we found it.

Try the truffle fries.
author: Matt P.

description: Awesome burgers! Took a gamble and tried my first #buffalo burger! All kinda of amazing. Very juicy and flavorful. They many burger styles that you can choose from or design your own. Def worth checking out! Also be sure to try the blue bottle coffee milkshake! Freakin delicious. :)
author: AJ R.

description: Love all their burgers but especially the tejano!!! And sweet potato fries are to die for!
author: Cindy K.

description: Variety of burger options, including different meats, so there is a taste to please everyone. The sweet potato fries are delicious. My favorite thing about Roam- the milkshakes. I absolutely love the salted carmel one.
author: Misha Z.

description: So so good. The burger had a lot of great flavors and interesting ingredients. Their truffle fries are great (especially as a burger topping!)
author: Steph B.

description: Tasty burgers, although the Tejano burger doesn't have the kick I expected from jalapeño relish and pepper jack cheese. I could have lived with that, but the fries were kind of bland. Overall, the meal was solid but not as interesting as the trendy decor suggested.
author: Brett B.

description: Yay for fry-fecta trio of fries.  Burger here is nothing special.  Too much bun, too thin on the meat patty.  In 'n Out cheeseburger tastes better and is a third of the price.
author: david l.

description: Was underwhelmed with burgers fries ok but needed more seasoning. Would not return. Plus - they have gluten free hamburger buns.
author: Greg B.

description: Split a bison heritage and parmesan truffle sweet potato fries. If you're still hungry polish it off with a kids shake.
author: R R.

description: Phenomenal food.  Good variety of burgers with nice and crispy fries.  We'd been having hit or miss meals while visiting SF but this was perfect for quality, taste, and price.
author: Lauren C.

description: Very good burgers for a great price. Right in the heart of SF you don't really expect to save $$ but we were glad to have experienced this place.
author: Rachel T.

description: Great burger joint, with one of the best vegan burgers in the city. Beer selection is small but the few that they do offer are goodies (Boont Amber Ale and Allagash White on tap currently). Burgers always feel fresh and the buns they use are always perfectly grilled and fresh. I have not tried anything here really other then the vegan burger, but it is a good one.
author: David H.

description:
hey roam, where have you been all my life?? this might be one of the best burgers i've ever had. had no idea what i was getting myself into. 

came here one night while trolling Filmore St. for a casual bite. sis and i went inside and ordered cheeseburgers to go. when we got back to her place and started eating we realized this was burger heaven on earth. the flavors were spot on and the burger size was just right. i always give props to a burger that tastes great without being overly greasy. definite plus.

washed it down with a glass of red wine...perfect dinner :)
author: Jill L.

description: Roam is awesome. The food is super high quality and not exorbitantly expensive. The Tejano burger with the fry fecta is my favorite. Lines can be long so I prefer to order ahead of time over the phone.
author: Cameron M.

description: Great burgers, fries, and beer. Very customizable. There are several styles of burger and you can put any type of patty on it (beef, turkey, veg). Pllus, they have 3 types of fries. Went as a party of 2 and split the "Fryfecta" to try all 3 kinds of fries and that was perfect. Definitely a little crowded, but super fun.
author: Jo S.

description: This is exactly what the neighborhood needed: great food, served quick and for a great price.  Get the Sunnyside.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Hungry D.

description: pretty, pretty, pretty, pretty good.  The bacon is spot on!  Burger (patties) are a little thin, but all-in-all, good food, good service, cool vibe.  We went on a Sunday for lunch and didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes for a table.  $35 for a family of three - I'll be back
author: Scott L.

description: Surprisingly, I didn't try the burgers at Roam. I ordered a beautiful farmers market salad. My girlfriend and I also shared a side of asparagus with parmasian cheese shavings on top. Both made my belly and taste buds happy. I enjoyed my experience. We sat outside on a beautiful day and the serving staff was good too. All in all we had a great time!
author: Ally V.

description: I've eaten at Roam dozens of times and regardless of what I order I always have a delicious experience. The burgers, the salad, the fries, the shakes, everything is very tasty! My girlfriend is gluten free and along with offering gluten free buns, they are well educated and aware of cross contamination, and other concerns she has. The staff is also top notch, my parents and I stopped in today for a quick bite around 4pm, we ordered, sat down and preceded to wait. We waited over half an hour and finally asked one of the busboys / food runners if they could check on our order. He promptly returned, apologized profusely and assured us that our food was being made that instant. A moment later the manager came to the table and also expressed deep apologies and explained that our ticket had been either misplaced or hadn't printed; he also assured us that out food would be out shortly and handed us a gift card. I understand that I'm gushing and sorry for the long review but Roam's costumer service is always excellent and deserves the praise. Once again, great food and excellent costumer service.
author: Alberto H.

description: Looking for a good burger on Fillmore, then look no more.  Lots to choose from.  Pretty friendly and speedy service.
author: Kevin M.

description: This was my 2nd time at Roam, but first at this location.  Amazing burgers, got the BBQ beef burger, instead of the bison BBQ like last time.  I loved it, but I think I like the bison even better (after trying bison meat for the first time at their other location). My husband got the sunny side up burger, which was fantastic as well.  We tried the sweet potato fries again, and they are just superb, and I'm not even a fan of sweet potato all too much. I got a chocolate milkshake which was organic and amazing, but my fave so far among the shakes is the chocolate hazelnut which I added marshmallow to.  The choc hazelnut was the special last time, so I didn't think to even ask for it this time.  Anyway this is the place to go for organic burger goodness!  And u don't feel disgustingly full afterwards, just satisfying full.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Overall: So-So. Okay food, nice location. My first time here. And this is a vegetarian's perspective only. 

Food: Went there for the vegetarian burger and it was average. Got the burger Tejano style. The flavors were lacking. Uninspiring. Got the Truffle Parmesan Fries and they were good. The milkshake was decent. 

If I go there again (the location & area is nice) then I think I will give the custom toppings a shot.
author: Avinash S.

description: I am not much of a beef eater, but I went here on doctor's orders to get more red meat into my diet. I tried the French and fries. It was OK, a bit salty and just weird that the fries are put into the bun--I would have preferred it on the side so the fries wouldn't get so mushy! However, I expected more out of the burger with all the foodie lingo--artisan! grass fed! I will go back to Choice Yakiniku, a modest little place next to the Diamond Heights Safeway where they make a much better tasting burger (best in the city, IMHO). I also tried their prickly pear soda, since I am a big fan of anything prickly pear. Also disappointed because it was both too sweet and too sour. A few stars, though, for nicely appointed place and decent service from the busboy.
author: 和子

description: "Okay" burger, don't do the flavor soda...it taste like crystal geyser's flavor carbonated water. :/
author: Chi L.

description: Had to go to this location and see how it compared to its original and their burgers are just as good!  Roam should be the official Burger of San Francisco...just saying...
author: Joseph C.

description:
i had a craving for a burger so i decided to give roam another shot with take-out. nothings changed. food good, service bad. for that im down-grading them to a 1 star. 

its just so obvious the owner or management havent properly trained the staff and dont have systems in place. the cashiers are constantly walking away from the registers, leaving customers waiting. it took 45 min to get a burger! its a burger!
author: CaliGirl X.

description: Just go.  I don't even need to tell you.  Umph.
author: Robert C.

description: This is my favorite burger place in San Francisco. Just about everything in this place is gluten free.  The fries (sweet potato, russet, or zucchini) are cooked in rice bran oil. I can have an elk, bison, beef or veggie burger. The salads are colorful. The shakes are organic soft serve. I'll just sum it up: "yum!"
author: Amy H.

description: Great food, but if you go when its crowded be prepared to wait. There was a woman next to me who ordered ahead 45 minutes before she arrived, I must waited  20-30 minutes before I got my order, and she was still waiting for her order to arrive when I left. I had a similar experience ordering ahead, but only had to wait 15 minutes or so (Marina location). Still these burgers are easily the top 3 in the city, so its been worth the wait.
author: Vernon W.

description: I came here with my friends from Chicago!  They as well as we loved it!  As for the burger, the bison burger is one of the best.  Cooked to perfection.  the fries are on point, and the drink i had the prickly pear.  Dizzam that is a good combo for a nice afternoon meal after or before the game or when you are out and about in the city on a weekend!
author: M C.

description: A friend who has been on a paleo diet on and off and on again was excited to try this place as she had seen or heard where it was paleo friendly and if they were friends of paleo then they were friends of hers.  I'm amicable.  I like meat.  So last night before a Spinners concert on the other side of Geary we agreed to give it a try.  With another friend in tow and it being the day after Christmas I decided this would be my treat to two friends whom don't traditionally exchange Christmas gifts.  I had cash in my pocket and was feeling a little flush as it seemed a bit warm if not quite burning a hole.  Once everything was ordered and my friends went looking (roaming) for a table I was left to pay with what I was told after a quick inspection was a counterfeit 50 dollar bill along with an explanation of how they were being passed around all over Fillmore street...an epidemic.  The bill had no watermarks.  Really?  Watermarks were on the 1993 series?  Really.  I was ready to leave but instead paid with a credit card and then Googled to find that watermarks on 50 dollar bills did not begin until 1996 and when showing it to the male cashier and the woman he was talking too they just kind of shrugged their shoulders and I was left wondering who trains these people on detecting counterfeit bills let alone their very poor customer service.  My suggestion is go to Super Duper it's every bit as paleo and the staff is friendly they don't give the impression that their job is beneath them while at roam they think they're with the fbi.  Oh, and by the way...the name Roam isn't for "roam on the range" it is in fact what you do after paying for your food and you're given a number.  That's right...you then roam around the room looking for an available table.  Good luck with that.  , )
author: tom l.

description:
Been wanting to try this as we've had our fair share of burgers in town.

Was pleasantly surprised.  Interesting flavor combinations offered here.  Some places like Unami does serve a bit higher end meat but this was still very enjoyable.

Hard to get seating though as you need to really fight for a seat at times.

I'll still be back though and to me, its one of the better burgers in the city and on an awesome street.
author: Andy W.

description:
these are the best beet burgers i've ever had! their sodas are amazing too (i haven't had a bad one yet) and sadly for me so are their fries. wah skin and waistline! 

anyway, get your butt over here and try one of the best veggie burgers in town :)
author: Elise H.

description: This place has really creative and elaborate burger combos, and they are really amazing. I've come here twice now, once for lunch and once for dinner. During lunch time, I would have given it a 5: relatively affordable for the Fillmore, easy to find a spot, and great tasting burgers and fries. When we came back for dinner however, we had to wait around a good amount of time, but the burgers were just as delicious and the atmosphere was great! WIll come back many times.
author: Basile S.

description:
I was a visitor to SF and happened into this bar for a beer or two. I was completely ignored for five minutes, even though it was 2:30 and after peak lunch hour. There were two bartenders and neither recognized me with "I'll be right with you" and a warm smile of WELCOME.
Yes, I had shoes and a shirt on. After three more minutes, one of the male bartenders prepared four drinks in front of me at the bar. I asked about the dark beer and he threw me the name with "Someone will tell ya about it." STILL NO RECOGNITION. I'm invisible.
I go to the rest room and then leave. 
If I owned the place I would fire both the male and female bartender immediately. I was there on October 2nd.
I recommend you go to Perry's on Union Street for beer. The senior bartender there knows how to make new visitor feel welcome.
author: Drew S.

description: My husband has taken me here twice, most recently last Friday.  Roam does not disappoint!  Possibly the best burger I've had in the city.  And the milkshakes are amazing!  Definitely coming back soon.
author: Michelle D.

description: Another great burger joint. Choose from Beef to bison, and many different styles of burgers. Maple chipotle fries were like crack, could not stop till they were gone.
author: Jeremiah K.

description: Seriously delicious burger. Boring Poppy prefers the classic but fancy girls can gussy up their burgers any number of ways.  Blood orange soda looked amazing and the counter has relatively comfortable seating.
author: Poppy C.

description: My friend recommended that I come here to try out the burgers. I was super excited when I ordered, but after my food arrived, I was a bit disappointed. My burger wasn't too bad, but the bun got a bit soggy after awhile. I am a slow eater, and after about 5 minutes or so, the bun got too soggy and cold to eat. I did enjoy the sweet potato fries though.
author: Mars F.

description: This place is perfect for a somewhat quick yet still delish burger in SF - whether at the Filmore or Union location. My burger has been cooked perfectly every time and the flavor is wonderful (sometimes a greasy mess, but oh so tasty). We always order the Fry-Fecta because you get a good sized portion of all three side options (Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries and the Zucchini Onion Haystack). Beers on tap. Specialty root beer by the bottle. Price is great for SF, totally reasonable and good value for the money.
author: Andria W.

description: It is the Burger place of Union Street in SF. People and service are really cool. The waiting time is that long and once you've been served you can enjoy four different kind of meat. Great, simple and tasty.
author: Gregor Z.

description: Veggie burger Tejano style... no need to say more!
author: Kristi E.

description: A great environment if you want to jockey for a seat after you turn in your food order. Came here on a Sunday afternoon,  and the place was so small, with a line out the door, and the noise level unbearable .It was so crowded in this small place our drinks that we had ordered had no table space to be set down when the server arrived with them We both looked at the waitress and she was stump in what to do next.While this was happening there continues to be a line of people placing their order of food, but nowhere to park their behinds. I guess somebody forgot to tell the cashier to stop taking orders until there's open table space with seats. Regardless, the food was tasty and plentiful but very expensive. You can have a couple of Burgers with fries and one shake for only twenty nine bucks not including tip. Typical San Francisco prices in a popular neighborhood. If you got time to kill, and want to experience not eating alone this is a place for you . But do not expect to carry a conversation with the person your with or meeting because the noise level will drown you.
author: Kurt C.

description: Ate healthy all week just to get my fat boy on here at Roam.... Made me feel mighty good!!! Parmesan truffle fries FTW.
author: Alexander M.

description: Great burger, I went with the elk burger with classic option. Fries were great too. I went on a Friday around lunch time- if u plan going order over the phone 20-30 prior to pick up. Seriously. It took 33 minutes for 1 burger. Popular and many people place large lunch orders
author: John P.

description: Not as good as Umami Burgers but still pretty damn good.  Also, do yourself the favor and get the Brother Thelonious Belgian beer, it's quite tasty.
author: Joshua H.

description:
nom nom!

ordered take-out - french & fries (truffle oil, avocado and gruyere) with sweet potato fries. all fresh ingredients and sooo yummy. 

great burger and fries for a good price. i need to go back and try another burger with a shake.
author: Lynee L.

description:
It's simple:
I'm from France, I tested a lot of burgers in SF and the Roam Burger is clearly my favorite!
I regularly go there and I'm never disappointed.

The only thing they can improve is their prices.
It's about ~$15 for a burger + french fries + soda.
author: Damien D.

description: Heaven! Love the burgers, choose your toppings, great organic sides. Forget the  Flopioi $16 burned bun down the street. It is awesome! Go to EAT!
author: anne c.

description:
My son and i go here every saturday after swim lessons. Absolutely love their heritage burger and sweet potato fries!! We went on a rainy day and it was packed!! Problem was all these people saving tables who hadn't ordered waiting on their friends who had no arrived yet. There were about four families who had bought food waiting for tables. I very nicely asked one of the twenty something table savers to allow some of us to sit and she just gave me the stink eye. OK. So i asked the dude working the cash register to do something about it and he said "i don't ask people to move." Really?!! A father with two kids(one of which was passed out on his shoulder) asked same woman to please move(his food had arrived and had no where to sit) and she got all huffy! She finally did leave and people who had food could finally sit. 
I love this place and will continue to go but really they need to do a better job controlling the flow of people and allowing people who have ordered priority to sit vs those who are just hanging out.
author: Simone H.

description:
Best burger in the city.  I've had all the specialty burgers, and they're all awesome.  You can also customize your burger as much as you'd like.  Seasonal veggies rotate, and the fry options (regular, sweet potato, zucchini and onion fries) are fantastic.

Staff are always super friendly, the decor is great, and the price point is very reasonable.  Go here if you're on Fillmore.
author: Jesse K.

description: The wait is long . They didn't say how big the burger is and its about a 1/4 pound of meat. The fries portions is small and was under cook. My bill came out to be 18$ with tax for an elk make your own burger with only 3 add on and fries. The hell is this craps. The counter in Santa row is league above this , save your money from ovepriced presentation.
author: Rais V.

description:
FInally went back.   Ordered regular mayo.  The burger was excellent. They use great bacon.  The fries are good and almost all crispy even without asking.
Catch with the 2nd trip was irritating stomach problems from both the wife and I.  Most likely the meat?  The only other thing we had in common were the fries and a blackberry soda.
3rd trip.   Gave it another go.  This time, the counter fellow very much ignored my "mayo" request when "Creating my own burger".   I saw him kind of shrug and not press anything, but I thought, 'maybe it defaults to regular may'.  Well I don't think so, because it was once again the house sauce or herb mayo... not sure which because of my first review.  But it was definitely the same sour cream + miracle whip flavor.  So horrible.  
So, assuming our stomachs survive this 3rd try, I'll give it another go and maybe ask for mayo on the side... can't risk having that nasty nasty flavor in my mouth.

Otherwise.  Gluten free bun still good (held together fine these last 2 times).  Great bacon.  Fun homemade sodas.  Decent prices for SF these days. Tasty fries.
author: howard t.

description: Solid burger and fries place.  Recommend the blood red orange soda.  7 bucks burger reasonable.
author: Serena V.

description: What a great find in the city! I had the classic burger and added bacon and it was delicious! Burger cooked perfectly and bun was good too. Tried the zucchini onion haystack and that was great. Place is pretty small, so we had to wait a bit for a table. Would definitely go back.
author: C B.

description: Great, magnificant burgers made of the finest ingredients at a fair price and served in a comfortable setting with quality and perfection as their standards of operation.  My 1st Roam was on Union Street and my most recent visit was to their location on Fillmore Street near Pine and Bush Streets in lower Pacific Heights.  The meats or veggie patties are superb, the bun is excellent, the fixings and condiments are also outstanding and the prices are fair.  The way they put it all together is where the magic lays, and it is magic from the first bite to the last.  They make great milkshakes, great fries in several varieties, healthy organic sodas and offer a couple outdoor tables for people watching in this expensive and high profile neighborhood.  They also offer an ostrich burger which I will try because everything the've served me and that I've observed them serve has been good to look at and better to ear.  This is a must try burger joint.
author: Stu S.

description: after trying several flavors, I've decided that the sunny side flavor is my favorite, with bison of course.  sunny side has white cheddar, an egg and sweet chili sauce.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Do you wanna try Real Artisan Burger? It could be the best burger all over the world!!!! I can't forget beef gravy. It feels like I become natural human in a ranch. 
   Most of all, you can choose your meat such as turkeys, beef and even for veggie. They have around 8 sorts of awesome burgers and you can order also your own burgers which are made to your choice. You will experience heaven, if you eat burger with French fries and health homemade soda. Please don't miss them! There are 3 kinds of French fries such as potato, onion and sweet potato. They produce their organic soda. Whenever I eat those, I can't decide one. They turn me into indecisive person!!!!
   Ambience is casual and not crowded. If it is crowded, you can take them out. I love their unique, chic ambience and wooden interior. And outdoor seats make you become a holly wood star! Lastly, cool and handsome staffs make me visit again and again! Don't' forget to bring your vegetarian friends because there are some fresh menus for them
   I halla recommend super awesome incredible amazing burgers in ROAM! It's not your mom's cooking. Don't misunderstand it
author: Jarmila H.

description: The quality of the food is good and the portions are decent.  Try the BBQ or Tejano, they both have Jalapeño Relish which adds an interesting flavor to the burger.  Don't pass up the Truffle Parmesan Fries they are great.  The salads looked appetizing even though I have yet to try one, they were a nice portion they don't just give you a small bowl of lettuce for $12.  It looks like you will be satiated, if you finish one of their salads.  The shakes are decent and they have a nice selection of beer and wine as well.  This is a great spot for an informal meal.  Not to mention the staff are always nice, even though they are always busy!  This definitely one of my regular spots.
author: Sheila L.

description: Awesome burgers! Great drinks. Friendly and efficient staff. And without the attitude problem of Umami!
author: Matt G.

description:
its a burger fan's review :-)
try it! absolutely delicious burger - tasty and juicy and special
author: Eva H.

description: I enjoyed the French and fries burger. I liked all that was on it the burger itself was ok just love everything they put on it
author: Melissa I.

description: Went here on Labor Day with my husband. So excited to have a new causal restaurant on Fillmore.  The hamburger was great and the truffle fries are to die for.   They had a great selection of beer on tap and next visit I will try the wine on tap.  They do need to work on service....it was taking 30-40 minutes to get your order, and some people walked out....hopefully they will get that resolved because the food is FANTASTIC.
author: Amy W.

description: Great addition to the Fillmore street scene.  Decadent burgers.  Can be a bit greasy but you don't eat this every day.  Hand made sodas are a great accompaniment.
author: Andrew C.

description: I am sure their regular burgers are great, but I love the fact that you can get a really decent vegetarian burger here with gluten free bread. They also have a really decent farm salad and a fairly decent selection of wine/beer. Hubby has their milkshake often. If you are going to have it, manage the guilt and just have a kid size. It is more than enough.
author: Molly S.

description: Definitely a quality burger. I got the Tejano burger and some fries with Parmesan truffle. Let's start with the pros: the consistency of the burger and roll was perfect. The roll was soft but had a nice crunch on the inside. The patty fit perfectly in the roll, which is very important to me. The burger was easy to eat... not sloppy. The cons: I don't think the Tajano tasted like what it's advertised as. Still, it was delicious. The French fries were just okay. They reminded me of McDonald's fries mixed with parsley and parm. I wouldn't get them again - I'd try a different kind of fry.
author: B B.

description: I got the Classic Burger with just beef. I didn't try the more obscure meats because they generally haven't tasted much different than beef for me. The burger was good, but didn't taste much different than any other gourmet burger place. I also got the Trifecta fries, which was unfortunately a disappointment.
author: Brian C.

description:
Place was packed, which I consider a good thing.
Staff was very nice and the food delicious ... Fresh and not greasy, all I want for a burger :). The amount of fries is small but big enough for me.
author: Linda S.

description: Love the burgers here!!  The best is the entire family is happy; vegetarian, elk, and delicious grass fed beef.  The sweet potato fries were delicious, as was the salted caramel milkshake.  The only negative was the line, but even that went pretty fast.
author: Misha P.

description: Consistent and delicious.  Roam never fails and the take out holds up well too.  Tejano (veggie and turkey) and French n fries are my favs.
author: a z.

description: RRm smelled like service station. Kitchen filthy. Burgers average, salad so-so. Loud...we had to yell across table to be heard. I ordered rare. They brought me well and couldn't understand my complaint for the noise level. Your money will go further elsewhere for a better meal.
author: rita b.

description: This place is awesome! Really great food, great service and reasonable prices. I've been here twice and am excited to go back!!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Absolutely loved this place! The buffalo burger was so good and I would go here all the time if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Amanda R.

description: Yummy! I've tried three of their burgers so far and wasn't disappointed. Always get a side of fries with it also. It just isn't complete without it. Only downside is they're not quick like a fast food chain cause my stomach starts to grumble once I step foot in. But the speed is still fairly quick compared to other burger joints.
author: Lucy T.

description: Love the quinoa veggie burger here. Cowboy style is an excellent addition. The featured shake flavor also changes and is unique but delicious. Russet fries are my favorite from their fry options.
author: Mike A.

description: I love this place. The French and fried burger is fantastic. Tastes strongly of mustard and cheese. The seasonal vegetable is usually delicious, even though (read: maybe because) it's usually covered with melted cheese. All of their fries are great too. I usually get the zucchini onion thing because my burger has fries in it. Milkshakes are delicious too. I'm not much of a marshmallow person, but people are pretty into the toasted marshmallow you can get in your milkshake. Pretty limited beer and wine selection, but varied and good enough that it's OK.
author: Francisco Z.

description: This is a great burger joint on Fillmore that still fits the personality of the neighborhood, while being more affordable than a lot of the restaurants. Their burgers are consistently good. I have has the veggie burger, which was delicious and the bison burger, which was even better. You can choose your own toppings or go with one of their set burgers. Someone next to me had the salad with burger skewers on top. It looked amazing and will definitely be making my way back to try that.  You can also order ahead online and get it to go.
author: Kelly M.

description:
After reading the review of this place in The New Fillmore I was sure I was going to like it, but after trying it I was less than thrilled. As they are new I'm hoping things will improve.  

I especially like being able to get a whole wheat bun and it was good.  The burger overall was good, but the bacon on it had no flavor and was limp.  The burger came out rare, which I didn't mind, but wasn't what I wanted.  Most of all it was a huge greasy mess to eat.  It fell apart as I tried to pick it up.  Guy at the next table had the same problem.  Also way more bun than burger covering up the taste of the burger.

The fries were good and not greasy.  Music was to loud.  Salad came out without the avocado.  Also for some reason several tables that sat down after we did got their food before we got ours.
author: Timothy S.

description: YUM YUM YUM! A burger and shake here is my official hangover remedy.   it's delish! The Tejano is SO good and their shakes are always perfectly thick.   The onllyyy thing I would change is maybe have bigger burgers.  Sometimes I'm still hungry after eating one...
author: Megha A.

description:
awful customer service and food was not ready on time after calling in a order a half hour earlier for take out...person who was behind the counter just shucked it off and said the computer was down... i was upset and said "screw it" and was leaving when the person behind the counter said "have a nice day" sarcastically... i live in the neighborhood and if that is ROAM'S idea of service...GOOD RIDDENS... you have lost a customer and will spread the word to stay away


Another bad experience.  Weird how my first review was eliminated
author: Philip A.

description: In my humble opinion, best burger joint in SF!  Plus nice selection of sides, beer and wine
author: B T.

description: Just okay. I've had better burgers in the city, but not for this price. Was a bit overhyped for me. Keep your expectations low and you'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: ross f.

description: Wow ! Finally a delicious burger place where I can get a gluten free bun !! A good one at that !
