If restaurant owners only knew how much this is appreciated.....I always wonder why more places do not offer this. Thank you Roam !! I will be back, and will send everyone I know....your food is awesome !!!!
author: Soul Surfer S.

description: nice ambiance. nice crisp home made soda, not too sugary, Burger is good but maybe because i got it to go the buns were a little soggy. sweet potato fries were awesome.
author: Ivy R.

description: Good food.  But the door handle at entry is heavy and sharp  (ouch!).  Wafts of bathroom air throughout the seating area. When sitting at bar there are usually left over crumbs, so you have to motivate the staff with an awkward request for them to do their own job to clean it.
author: Anon A.

description: Not a very good burger.  Much prefer Super Duper.  Roam doesn't compare.  Fries are even not as good.
author: Yella W.

description: This place is loud, crowded and fun! Awesome burgers, salads and sweet potato fries!!! And the milkshakes are absolutely amazing!!!!!! Salted caramel!
author: K F.

description: i had the french and fries burger today.  either i was really hungry, or it was one of the best burgers i've ever had.  i'll stick with the latter, and come back another time.
author: Andrew W.

description: Great burger, and you've gotta get the 'haystack' of onions
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Came on a whim after walking around trying to figure out what to eat. Got the ostrich burger with a wheat bun in the Sunny Side style with an order of the special for that day; brussels sprouts in olive oil topped with parmesan and red pepper flakes. All of it was amazing, although my egg was overcooked and was just a fried over easy egg (minus the one star). Boyfriend got a burger in the French and Fries style which was also fantastic and not too overpowering on the truffle. They have the source written on the board next to the meat options and also for the brussels sprouts which adds that feel good factor. Beef is 100% grassfed (which I take to mean the meat is not finished on corn to fatten it up at the end of its life - definitely a plus!). None of us felt that typical gross heavy feeling you usually get after eating a burger. i didn't get fries, but they do have sweet potato fries yum yum. Very reasonable prices, great bustling atmosphere, would love to go again and try a milkshake!
author: Metra H.

description: Best burger and fries in San Francisco.  Beats anything we've had in NYC! Came twice in one week! Staff including the owner were super friendly. All 7 people in our party were blown away, both times. Make sure to try the milkshakes and house made sodas. This was the only restaurant that we ate at twice on our week long food crawl.
author: Jill K.

description: I am revising my last review because the owner, Josh, reached out to me and apologized for the disappointing take-out. I really appreciate the effort he put forth and he just seems like a great guy who would be hard to stay mad at. And in the past 3.5yrs I've never been let down other than those couple takeout orders. I would still recommend eating IN the restaurant for the full experience though. There's obviously a reason I've been eating here for years now, so I can't not go back...
author: Andrea J.

description: In my opinion these are the freshest tasting burgers in the city.  Great food all around, burger options are great, shakes and fries are perfect, and the beer is cold and delicious.  We go here maybe once a week.  Haven't had a bad experience once yet.
author: Matt C.

description: The long line out of Roam scared me on a Sunday afternoon as all the church goers had already crowded every other restaurant. I thought I was going to wait hours for some typical veggie burger. We got in line and we were fooled. The ordering line moves pretty fast and people clear tables regularly so the turnover led to a short wait. We sat down and the shakes came out almost immediately. They were like ice cream in a cup. The burgers and fries came out later. I got the Veggie French and Fries with the try-fecta. Way too much food! It could have easily been shared by 2 people. The veggie burger was unlike any other I've had, made of beets and other tasty veggies. The try-fecta was good though the spirals were so small you couldn't really taste much out of them at that size. I'm tempted to minus one star because $25 for 2 burgers and fries just is way too expensive no matter how delicious it is to put bread and vegetables together, but then all you haters would be messaging me.
author: Crys L.

description: The burgers were delicious and the fried onions and zucchini were awesome. My issue with the place is only that given the burgers are SO messy, they don't have napkins/utensils easily available. If they just placed a few napkin boxes on the communal table it would decrease the issue of traffic trying to access the condiments/napkins/utensils location. The place is pretty small and anything to decrease the traffic would help.
author: Eliz M.

description: Burgers of all types can be amazing. Roam offers burgers of all types. Roam charges prices  and gives off the vibe that make you hope, almost against hope, you're going to get a great burger. I've tried the beef and bison. Both were so so so mediocre. This is generic, character-less fast food dressed up "artisan style".
author: Yana N.

description: Yum yum and yum!  Glad this join is now in the hood.  Great food last night and great vibe.  And did I say ... Yum!
author: Christin A.

description: I know Umami gets a lot of love in the neighborhood but I must admit, I actually like Roam's burgers more.  Plus, the wait is always far more tolerable and the staff is usually courteous and friendly.
author: VE D.

description: Ordered the burger with swiss cheese & mushrooms. Good, but the patty is kinda wimpy...wish it was twice the size. Next time will get a double.
author: Amy S.

description: Best burger joint I've found so far in the city. Allagash white on tap is a big plus.
author: Drew L.

description: Really good housemade veggie burger. Have had it Tejano, Sunny Side, and BBQ. Sunny Side is my favorite. Sweet potato fries were good. Easy ordering, fast service. Self-service for water, condiments, silverware. Nice setup overall. Reasonable beer and wine selection.
author: Tom H.

description: fantastic burgers and shakes. Without a doubt the best bite on Fillmore.
author: Soren K.

description: Roam Artisan has some of the best burgers in the city! My usual order consists of the Heritage Burger, with bison, and the Fry-Fecta. It's heavenly. The meat is cooked perfectly and all of the flavors blend in well together. This has become a new standard for me in terms of burgers.
author: Jamie P.

description: We went here last night based in part due to the great Yelp reviews. Although not perfect, this place was great! The dimly-lit wooden and tech interior was a pleasant change from some of the garish white-tile burger places that have recently become popular. Instead of that house-style club music that makes me want to drive a stake into my own heart, Roam was rockin' Hendrix and the Stones - awesome.  I thought the sweet potato fries were nearly perfect, and the regular fries were pretty damned decent as well.  And instead of that soggy slice of Wonder Bread other places claim is a bun, Roam brilliantly offered a real bun that actually held the burger.  The only thing that I might improve on was the not-so-special special sauce, which transmuted what might a have been a slightly crispy burger exterior (that's a good thing) into sort of a soggy, mayonnaise-y mess.  A couple of oddities: the floors were unusually slippery, something I've never experienced -- or even thought to notice -- in any other restaurant (note to insurance company), and the overly scented bathroom soap clung unpleasantly to my hands, mixing with and occasionally overpowering the aroma of the food while I ate.  Note to self:  Next time -- and there will be a next time -- lose the special sauce, wash hands in advance, and practice T-stop maneuver.
author: Richard A.

description: Great burgers and great sweet potato fries. I wish other burger joints followed their standard of pasture-raised beef. Besides this, I've walked in a number of times and stood their without any service. The guys behind the counter were chatting it up and it took them a while to get to me... it wasn't even busy at the time. I hope the management steps it up a bit! :)
author: Yuan T.

description: I went to Roam several times for the really good veggie burgers.  The last time I went they got my order wrong and I waited for them to correct it.  Drove home with the wrong order again.  Called them.  They said yes we remember your order and we did give you the wrong order twice.  Sorry.  Come in and we will have a gift cert waiting for you.  I said I won't be in for awhile.  No problem they said they would mail it to me.  Two weeks later no gift certificate.  I mailed them a letter.  Five days later to gift certificate.  Burgers are good but this is not acceptable.  I won't go back.  I work hard for my money.  If they had no intention of sending me a refund, why did they say they would.  There are a lot of other good restaurants with good customer service where I can go to spend my money.
author: Linda F.

description: Just my favorite place for a burger. The BEST. Creative, high-quality, delicious.  Love the Tejano. Love the atmosphere. Clean and inviting atmosphere, nothing pretentious. You can just relax and enjoy the burger. Super friendly staff too. You can count on this place to be really great every time you go. Love the veggie specials too.
author: Dalia S.

description: I agree with the reviews... good place to eat... but the staff is a bit lukewarm...
author: William W.

description: As a burger enthusiast, I have experienced a good number of establishments that offer a variety of distinct styles as well as the option to create a custom taste; however, Roam's commitment to using natural ingredients and offering unique combinations of food and drink put them a step ahead of most. I enjoyed the ability to choose from beef, turkey, bison, or veggie burgers, and chose the free range turkey with the "French and Fries" style. I also ordered a salted caramel shake, too enticed by the uncommon flavor and the bruleed marshmallow topping to pass up the chance. The restaurant was packed, so my girlfriend and I found the first open spot in the limited outdoor seating, happy to enjoy the atmosphere of lower Pacific Heights. I was very satisfied with the service, as we received our burgers within 10 minutes despite the restaurant being busy. The "French and Fries" met expectations, as the turkey was juicy while the caramelized onions complemented the saltiness of the truffle Parmesan fries and Gruyere cheese quite well. The inclusion of avocado made the burger extra rich but not too heavy to handle. I recommend trying this style, but also look forward to testing the others in visits to come. As for the shake, the salted caramel was creamy, sweet, and even better with the marshmallow; however, I thought the prices were a bit high as a 16 Oz. is $6.49. For the quality of burgers being served, I do think the prices are quite reasonable, especially given the high end location. I appreciated how Roam's burger menu catered to a variety of tastes and incorporated a number of condiments available in the create-your-own section. What I liked the most, though, was the restaurant's attention to detail. Buns purchased from a local vendor, vegetarian options, three types of fries with custom seasoning choices, artisan sodas, locally produced beer, and kid friendly meals showed the establishment's dedication to pleasing their customers and sustaining the local environment. Overall, I would highly recommend Roam to anyone who enjoys creating their own tastes and wants a delicious combination of naturally, creatively crafted burgers and shakes.
author: Alex R.

description: I found Roam on Yelp last night.  I was looking for a good organic rest for lunch today.  It was wonderful to eat at a place with good quality local, sustainable and organic food.
author: Auntie M.

description:
if you have invested in two registers to ring up customers, it's actually a good idea to use them both at peak hours, like lunchtime. when you have a line out the door, people will go elsewhere.
when are standing in line with everybody even thought you phoned in your order and and your meal is cold by the time you get it, you stop ordering lunch and go elsewhere.

just sayin'....a little attention to staffing goes a long way.
author: vladimir p.

description:
Roam is the latest in the former food desert of Fillmore street.  Really close to 4 stars at the time of this review.  Minus a star or so because of the lukewarm service--which I'm sure can change with good management, so 4 stars when service improves.  I stood in front of the cashier for 10 seconds--in front of her face--waiting for her to look up at me and I get a lukewarm "Hi" without a smile and kind of a "what do you want" attitude.  I know: 10 seconds, what am I complaining about?  But seriously, stand in front of a wall, count in your head 10 seconds and tell me that's not an awfully long time to stand in front of someone and wait to be acknowledged while the they aren't doing anything.  She might as well have been a wall since I kind of felt like I was speaking to one--no help with the menu and no "is that all for you?"--just a grim "$14.75" at the end of my order.  But I digress....

It's Sunday 2pm, a few weeks after Roam has opened and the place is crowded with a late lunch crowd.  The space is nice and open with large front windows, a medium sized tv at the bar, and a good selection of beers on tap.  I place my order at the cashier, grab my number and wait for one of the 3 or so empty tables to be cleared because they only seem to have one guy bussing and running the food.  I get my drink 3 minutes later, my burger 15 minutes later and dig in.  I got the beef classic with carmelized onions, side of sweet potato fries, and a soda.  Really good, fresh, meaty burger on a really good toasted sesame bun and pretty darn good sweet potato fries and house-made soda.  I like this a lot.  Roam will be in my neighborhood rotation from now on for sure.
author: Trinh N.

description: I had a burger with blue cheese, it was yummy. Loved the Russet potatoes. Place was very busy for a Sunday evening. Was a really good experience.
author: Debbie G.

description: The fries are really excellent, and this is important because a burger and fries is almost as much about the fries as the burger. The burgers are pretty good, too. They don't really knock my socks off, but they're solid burgers. Service has gotten better since the opening, and overall I'm very glad it's in the neighborhood, it's good to have a burger joint that uses quality ingredients nearby.
author: Jane D.

description: I would say this is the best burger place ever!  They have a relatively small menu, focusing on high quality burgers, using like 100 grass fed beef. I had a French & Fries beef burger. Parmesan Fries in the burger were delicious, though I ate them separately. My burger was perfectly cooked. My friend liked her veggie burger, too.
author: Foomin U.

description: Wow. Best burger I have ever eaten. Have eaten here half a dozen times. Will continue to come back.
author: Armand M.

description: Yummy, blackberry kambocha and sunny side burger with sunny side egg, caramelized onions and sweet chili sauce.  The patty had great crust and was very juicy not too thick.  Highly recommend!  BF loved Swiss chalet burger with mushrooms, Swiss cheese, and spinach, I think it was.  He said the Swiss cheese was delicious.
author: Tara W.

description: I couldn't wait for this place to open (I loved the Union Street location) and no disappointments.  Let me repeat:  No disappointments.  The place delivers on what it is -- if you want cocktails, table cloths, waiters, candlelights, hushed conversations -- than go someplace else and spend lots of money more, but if you want a world-class burger (get it absolutely plain so I can make my case!) than this is the place for you.  But surprise, you can get all kinds of imaginative toppings for your burger, and you can also get more than just great grassfed beef, but also bison,turkey, ostrich (of, yes), and even great vegatarian, along with a variety of buns.  And you can get real beverages, as in now old-fashioned but which have come back in style because they have real healthy ingredients, including the ice creams used in the milkshakes.  There's more I could say, but you get the idea -- get your butt over here (or better yet stay at Burger King and let the rest of us enjoy ourselves).
author: Barry P.

description: Food, great.  Service, zero.  I've been to the location on Union Street several times, and I like the burgers, so I always try to get there early before it's completely packed.  I was glad to hear about the Fillmore location, since it's significantly closer, so my wife and I went over at ten before noon on a weekend, thinking that by coming a little early we would avoid the crowds - I guess we also thought that since it was a new location, maybe not everyone had heard about it yet.  Well, the place was already fairly busy, but we placed our order and got a seat at the bar - where we sat - and sat - and sat.  It took 40 minutes for our food to come.  This is not a typo - 40 minutes, and that's a very long time to wait for your food - and there's not exactly anything to nibble on while you wait.  If you have a beer, you can get drunk, I guess.  By the time our food came, another guy at the bar complained to the manager and walked out.  My wife walked out as well, but it was just to go down the street and buy an energy bar to sustain her blood sugar during the long wait.  So - I would recommend waiting a few weeks before you visit to give them a chance to get their act together - or you could just find someplace else where they treat their customers better!
author: Paul M.

description: nothing too impressive, good ambiance if you are looking for friday night out spot.
author: Kate J.

description: best burgers in town ! try the ostrich its simply amazing !
author: Sulaiman B.
